response: Line an 8 inch square pan with foil and grease the foil with shortening. Set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the flour, sugar, butter and egg. Mix until crumbly. Stir in the instant coffee granules and sliced almonds. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan and bake for 20 minutes or until lightly golden. Cool completely then cut into small squares. In a small bowl combine the confectioners sugar, almond extract and enough milk to make a smooth icing. Spread the icing over the bars and garnish with whole sliced almonds. Store in an air tight container.

In a large bowl, combine the bread cubes and melted butter. Add the chopped mushrooms and chopped celery and onion and mix thoroughly. In a large heavy skillet cook the sausage over medium heat, stirring until browned and crumbled. Add to the mushroom mixture. In a small bowl combine the chicken broth and sage. Pour over the sausage mixture. Stir well and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased shallow baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine the dry bread cubes and turkey. Add the dry onion and mix well. Add eggs and milk and combine well. Add the cheese and mix well. Season with salt and pepper and poultry seasoning to taste and mix well. Form into a ring and place in a greased casserole dish or a bundt pan. Bake at 375 for about 45 minutes or until brown and crispy. Serve with cranberry sauce or gravy.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine the remaining ingredients for the sauce. Heat until thickened. Add the broccoli florets and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add cooked pasta and toss until evenly coated. Serve immediately with crushed red pepper if desired.

In a large pot of water, boil the macaroni for 8 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a medium sauce pan, warm up the vegan mayo and nutritional yeast over medium heat. Stir in the milk substitute and heat until warm. Add salt and pepper to taste and add the pasta. Toss well and pour into a large casserole dish. Top with bread crumbs and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Brown sausages and bacon in skillet. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add onion to drippingscook 5 minutes. Stir in vegetable soup mix, water and vegetables. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Coversimmer 10 minutes. Add cooked sausages and bacon. Sprinkle with parsley.

Toast 4 slices of white bread. Spread 1 slice of toasted bread with crunchy peanut butter and 1 slice of whole wheat bread with grape jelly. Cut the jelly sandwich into 4 squares and place the squares on top of the peanut butter sandwich. Sprinkle on 8 goldfish crackers of each color on the jelly squares of each sandwich. To serve, place the sandwiches on a platter.

Mix together 1/2 cup of flour with 1/4 cup of soy sauce and 1/4 cup of white sugar. In a large skillet, brown the chicken in 2 tablespoons of butter or cooking oil. When the chicken is done (no longer pink in the middle), remove it from the skillet. Put the 1 cup of white rice in the skillet. Cook the rice until it is done. Pour in the mixture of soy sauce, sugar and flour. Stir to combine well. Return the chicken to the skillet and add the 1 cup of pineapple juice. Stir. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve in bowls and top with chopped parsley. Serve with 1 parsley sprig.

Pre-heat oven to 375f. Combine the butter, light brown sugar and granulated sugar in a large bowl and mix well with a mixer until light and creamy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until well blended. Gradually add the dry ingredients and mix well. Stir in the water by hand. Fold in the chocolate chips by hand. Drop by rounded tablespoons full onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes until edges are light golden brown. Allow to cool on cookie sheet for about two minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Squeeze the grapefruit into a cocktail shaker. Add vodka, grapefruit juice, ice and 1/4 cup sugar. Shake well and strain into glass. Garnish with 1/2 slice grapefruit and 1 maraschino cherry.

Combine water and sugar in medium saucepan. Add frozen orange juice and stir over medium heat until melted. Add lemon juice and almond flavoring and stir. Add vanilla and spices and stir. Continue stirring until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Serve warm. Refrigerate any leftovers. Makes 3 to 4 servings.
Recipes and pictures from The Ultimate Cranberry Cookbook and The Ultimate Tea Cookbook by Karen Eich Drummond.

In a medium bowl, beat together eggs, milk and seasonings. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat butter. Pour egg mixture into skillet and stir gently. Stir in the green onions and jalapeno. Continue to stir until eggs are set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted.

Puree berries in blender or food processor. Add ginger ale, milk, sugar, vanilla, and lemon juice. Serve in chilled bowls. Garnish with sour cream and fresh berries.
name: frozen peaches and berriesingredients: peaches, sliced, sugar, water, fresh lemon juice, sugar, heavy whipping cream, vanilla extract, frozen strawberries, frozen blackberries, fresh mint sprigspreparation: Combine peaches, water, sugar and lemon juice in saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until peaches are tender. Cool. Combine peaches, cream, vanilla and mint sprigs. Freeze. Add berries. Freeze until solid. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
name: peaches & cream ice creamingredients: peaches, diced, sugar, water, heavy whipping cream, vanilla extractpreparation: Combine peaches, water, sugar and lemon juice in saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce

In a medium bowl combine the orange juice, honey, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, ginger root, cilantro and pepper. Marinate the salmon for 1 hour. Preheat the grill for high heat. Grill the salmon for 10 minutes per side. Baste with the marinade during the last 5 minutes of grilling.
I used a 12-inch stainless steel skewer for the kabobs.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Prepare pesto. Place peppers, cilantro leaves, vinegar, garlic, dry mustard, coriander, cinnamon and 1/2 cup oil in blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Thread chicken onto skewers. Brush chicken with remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Grill over medium-high heat. Brush chicken with pesto during the last 2 minutes of grilling. Serve with rice.

To make the dressing, place the blue cheese in a food processor and process until crumbled. Add the butter and lemon juice and process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the salt and pepper. Set aside.Preheat broiler. In a large bowl combine the vegetables with the dressing and toss to coat. Spoon vegetables onto a broiler pan. Broil 4-5 inches from the heat until lightly browned and tender crisp. Sprinkle with the basil. Serve immediately.
I will have to try the pesto. We eat a lot of pesto.
The pistachio and red potato dishes sound yummy too! I will have to try those soon.
I also love to make homemade pesto and basil is one of my favorite herbs. I also make a marinara sauce with basil instead of oregano.
We have a farmers market and I try to buy some of our produce there. We have a CSA that we purchase produce from each week too.
Thanks for the great recipes and for sharing with us at Full Plate Thursday. Have a great

Preheat oven to 350 degree F (175 degree C). Prepare a baking dish by spreading the butter on the bottom. Rub the tenderloin on both sides with the cut side of the garlic cloves. Sprinkle the tenderloin all over with the salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the tenderloin on all sides. Place the tenderloin in the baking dish. Place the onion in the skillet over medium heat. Cover the onion with the juices in the skillet. Cook until the onion is softened, about 10 minutes. Pour the onion over the tenderloin. Roast in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the tenderloin stand 10 minutes before slicing. Serve slices of the tenderloin over the onion and juices.

In a bowl stir together pumpkin puree, pears, figs, and brown sugar. Pour into crust. Bake at 350f for 1 hour or until filling is set. Cool completely. Cut into wedges. Prep time does not include making the pie crust.

Preheat oven to 375. In a small bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Cut the cold butter into the flour mixture with a pastry blender until the mixture is like coarse crumbs. Press into a greased 8x8 pan. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool completely. Combine the brown sugar, vanilla, and cream. Spread over the cooled crust. Sprinkle with the chocolate chips and walnuts. Bake for an additional 8 minutes. Allow the mixture to cool completely before cutting into squares.

Toast the oats in a large bowl in the oven for 1 hour at 300 degrees. Stir often. In a saucepan, mix the honey and spices. Add the nuts and fruit. Cook on medium heat for about 1 minute. Stir into the oats and stir until all ingredients are combined. Spread on wax paper and cool before storing in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 200C/400F/gas mark 6. Halve the oranges lengthways, cut out and discard any seeds. Cut each half into 3 wedges, then slice each wedge into thin slices about 1.5cm thick. Place the orange slices in a large roasting tin and sprinkle with the caster sugar. Roast in the oven for about 1 hour, until the sugar has melted and caramelised and the orange slices are tender but not burnt. When cool enough to handle, lift out the caramelised orange slices from the tin with a slotted spoon, placing them on a wire rack to cool completely. Combine the brandy and vanilla bean in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes until reduced to about a third of its original volume. Strain into a small jug, then leave to cool. To serve, spoon a little liqueur over each caramelised orange slice. Serve with cinnamon sticks for stirring. Makes 6-8 serves.name

Combine the margarine, sugar and eggs until well blended. Add vanilla and beat for a few minutes more. Sift together the dry ingredients and add to the wet mixture alternating with the milk. Fold in the nuts and chocolate chips. Spread the mixture into a greased 8x8 baking pan. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes or until the brownies are done to your liking. Cool before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together butter and sugar. Add egg substitute and pineapple, mix well. Add in flours, soda, and salt, blend together. Add vanilla. Pour into greased & floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 13x9x2-inch glass baking pan. In large microwaveable bowl, microwave butter on high for 1 minute or until meltedstir until smooth. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in dutch-processed cocoa powder and salt until blended. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in flour just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until edges are set. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into bars. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk until blended. Stir in broccoli, bacon, and onion.

Pour Bacardi Limon over the ice. Add lemonade. Add Lemon Concentrate. Add the Limes. Stir to mix. Serve.
name: lime and lemonade
ingredients: frozen lemonade concentrate, ice cubes, lime juice, limes, carbonated lemonade
preparation:Place ice cubes, lime juice and frozen lemonade concentrate in a blender, and blend until ice is very fine. Place this lemon slush in a freezer safe tray, cover and freeze for at least two hours. Slice the 8 limes very thin, reserve a few for glasses and the top of the pitcher. Put the remaining limes in a large pitcher. Layer the slush over the sliced limes. Just before serving add the carbonated lemonade.
name: watermelon lemonade
ingredients: watermelon, frozen lemonade concentrate, fresh lemon juice, lemon
preparation:Puree watermelon in food processor, in batches, until smooth. Transfer to a large

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally until thickened. Strain syrup. Reserve 1/2 cup for glaze. Combine fruit in a serving bowl. Drizzle with syrup. Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in mint. Sprinkle over fruit. Drizzle with reserved syrup.
Blend mangoes and orange juice until smooth. Strain through a sieve. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or until chilled. Stir in lime juice and club soda and serve over crushed ice.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Pour into a 13×9-inch greased baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool completely. Store in airtight container.

In a bowl combine the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. In another bowl whisk together the eggs and beer. Add the cornmeal mixture and mix until just combined. Fold in the jalapeño and onion. In a large skillet heat 1/2 inch of canola oil. Drop batter by rounded tablespoonful into the hot oil. Fry in batches until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve with dipping sauce.

Cut 16 thin rounds of challah. Spread each round with some softened butter and then add brie and basil. Top with sliced tomato and the other challah round. Broil for about 3 minutes or until the challah is toasted and the brie is melted. Serve immediately.

Marinade the cutlets or chops in the above 2 hours prior to grilling. Grill over medium high heat, turning once, about 8 minutes or until no longer pink in the center. Sprinkle with rosemary.
I made the lamb cutlets tonight for my husband and 2 teenage sons. They were delicious and I will make them again.

Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the zucchini, sprinkle with the salt and cook until tender crisp, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl. Add the chicken broth to the same pan and bring to a boil. Add the remaining 2 tbsp of the oil, the lime juice and the garlic. Simmer until reduced to about 1 cup, about 5 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tsp of the oregano to the broth. Stir in the zucchini and the parsley and toss well. Serve immediately.
In a blender container combine the sugar, mustards and mayonnaise. Blend until smooth. Add the other ingredients and blend just until combined. Chill and serve with pretzels.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut bacon into strips and wrap each pear with the bacon strips and secure with wooden toothpicks. Roast in a shallow baking pan for 30 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Meanwhile, combine the greens, pecans and parmesan cheese in a large serving bowl. Combine the vinaigrette ingredients and whisk until well blended. Pour the vinaigrette over the greens and toss to coat well. Remove the bacon and pears from the oven and cut the bacon into bite size pieces and dice the pears into small pieces. Add the bacon and pears to the salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Cube the bread. Alternate the cubes of bread and cheese in a well-greased 9x13 inch pan. In a bowl, mix together the remaining ingredients except the bacon and pour over the bread and cheese. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight or at least 8 hours. To bake, preheat the oven to 425°. Cover the strata pan with a baking dish filled with boiling water. Bake the strata for 25 minutes covered in the pre-heated oven. Uncover the strata and bake for another 25 minutes until the top is golden brown. Serve with additional bacon strips.

In a skillet, melt butter. Add fish fillet and cook until just done. Remove and keep warm. In the same pan saut green peppercorns and cook for 1 minute. Add water and bring to a boil. Add scallops and cook for 2 minutes or until just done. Add lemon rind and lemon juice. Simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in fish and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Beat together the butter and sugars for 5 minutes. Add the egg yolks and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes. Stir in the dry ingredients. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Let the cookies cool on the cookie sheets for 2 minutes and then transfer them to wire racks to cool completely.

Beat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with a mixer on high speed until smooth. Gently stir in frozen dessert topping. Pour into crust. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Top with chilled cherry pie filling. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Combine orzo, bouillon powder and 2 cups warm water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and add 1/2 cup rice and garlic. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1 cup of rice and continue cooking for another 20 minutes. Turn off heat and stir in lemon juice and onion powder. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Toss to coat. Refrigerate at least one hour to blend the flavors. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line baking sheet with foil. In large bowl, combine glaze ingredients and whisk until smooth. Add sweet potatoes and toss until coated. Spread in single layer on baking sheet. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.
P.S. I added some of the nori sheets to the glaze for color.

In a 10-inch saute pan over high heat, pour 1/4 cup of olive oil. When it is hot but not smoking, add the cherry tomatoes. Saute for 2 minutes or until skins are charred. Add clams to pan and cover with a lid. Shake pan once or twice to move clams around. Cook until clams just begin to open. Remove clams from pan and set aside. Add wine to pan and cook over high heat until reduced by half. Add garlic and lemon juice to pan and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add clams, parsley and butter to pan. Toss to combine. Serve immediately with crusty french bread.

Mix the dry ingredients together in a bowl. Add the oil and the buttermilk. Blend well. Dip the pieces of chicken in the batter and drop in the hot oil. Turn after the chicken has browned on one side. Cook until the chicken is done. Drain on paper towel. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut pears into quarters or wedges. Toss pears and raisins with butter and vanilla. Place pears in shallow dish. Bake for about one hour or until pears are tender. Serve warm. Great with ice cream.

Peel the carrots. Cut into large chunks. In a large heavy saucepan over medium heat, add the oil and the chopped garlic. Cook until the garlic is golden and lightly browned (this will take about 4-5 minutes). Pour in the stock, season with the thyme, cover and bring to the boil. Add the carrots, cover and cook for 5-8 minutes until the carrots are just tender. Remove from the heat, allow to cool slightly then transfer the mixture to a food processor or blender (or mash with a potato masher). Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serves 4-6

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Open the refrigerated biscuits and separate into 4 equal wedges. In a medium bowl, stir together the cream cheese, sugar and egg until well blended. Spoon the mixture onto the center of the 4 separated biscuitstop with the remaining 4 wedges of biscuit. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with the ground cinnamon and serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Place in pan. Sprinkle potatoes with taco seasoning and drizzle with 1/3 cup oil. Cover pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake potatoes for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender and are lightly browned. Remove from oven. Sprinkle potatoes with remaining 1/3 cup oil. Top potatoes with cheese and bake for 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
In a saucepan combine the oatmeal and milk. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add the banana and cinnamon. Serve with a sprinkling of the cereal.

Heat a little oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Saute the onions for 5 minutes. Add turkey, garlic and seasonings to the pot and cook until browned. Drain and rinse kidney beans, and add to pot with remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 2 hours. Serve with cornbread or tortillas.

Bake potatoes in oven at 375 degrees for 1 hour or until tender. Cut in half. Scoop out pulp into bowl. Mash pulpadd sour cream, milk, chives, salt and pepper. Stir in cheese. Spoon into skins. Sprinkle with cornflakes. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Combine the bay leaves, 3 cups of the water, and the lentils in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover the pan. Reduce the heat. Cook the lentils for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse the lentils. In a large bowl combine the lentils, orange pieces and juice, and onions. Drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and season with the salt and pepper. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13x9-inch pan. Mix together the flour, baking powder and saltset aside. Cream together the butter and sugars. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Add the peanut butter and mix well. Add the flour mixture to the peanut butter mixture and blend well. Stir in the walnuts and chocolate chips. Spread in the pan and bake for 25 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars. Cut into 16 bars.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat 1/8 inch of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes or until softened. In a large bowl combine the enchilada sauce and the beans. Spoon 1/3 cup of the sauce mixture down the center of each tortilla. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of the cheddar cheese over each tortilla. Roll up tortillas and place seam side down in a baking dish. Spoon remaining sauce mixture over the top of the enchiladas. Sprinkle evenly with remaining 1 cup cheddar cheese. Bake for 15 minutes or until heated through and sauce bubbles around the edges of the dish. Garnish with chopped cilantro if desired.

Heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat in skillet. Brown hamburger with onions. Drain. Add 2 cans of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan. Add 1 can of vegetable juice to pan.

Melt the butter in a 9-inch square baking dish. Cook the bacon over medium heat in the dish until it is crisp. Drain the bacon and pour off all but about 1 tablespoon of fat. Add the green onions and stir-fry until they are tender. Set aside. Beat the eggs with the light cream in a large bowl. Add the seasoning salt. Add the bacon mixture. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese over the top. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 40 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.

Prepare 8x8 pan by lining with foil or wax paper. Melt butter and sugar in saucepan over low heat until sugar is dissolved. Mix in eggs and vanilla. In separate bowl combine flour, cocoa powder and salt. Slowly add to butter mixture and mix well. Spread in prepared pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 20-25 minutes until edges are set but center is still soft. Remove from oven and spread with white chocolate chips. Allow to cool before cutting into squares.

Follow cooking instructions on package for cooking the pasta. While the pasta is cooking bring a large pot of water to a boil for the vegetables. Add the potatoes and boil for 5-6 minutes or until they are fork tender but not mushy. Add in the green beans and boil for 1 minute or until crisp tender. Remove from heat, drain and add to cooked pasta and toss well to mix all together. Add pesto sauce to your liking and toss well to mix all together. Serve immediately with grated parmesan cheese on top.

Bring water to boil in large stockpot. Add salt, macaroni and cook for 8 minutes until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water, drain again. Combine 4 eggs with 2 cups of whole milk in large bowladd macaroni and toss well. In medium bowl combine 3/4 cup whole milk with 1/2 cup flourstir well. Gradually add to macaroni mixturetoss well to blend. Pour into 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Top with shredded cheddar cheesebake for 5 more minutes or until cheese is golden brown on top. Serve immediately.
In a large soup pot brown ground beef. Add water & bouillon. Cook 20 minutes. Add tomato paste, garlic & remaining ingredients. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.

Soak the red kidney beans in boiling water for 2 hours. Drain the beans and add fresh water to cover by 2 inches. Add the onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat, reduce heat, cover and cook until the beans are tender, about 45 minutes. Mash the cooked beans. Cook the brown rice in boiling water. Drain the rice and add it to the beans along with the TVP. Stir to combine. Serve hot.

Cook the bacon until crisp in a heavy-based frying pan. Remove the bacon and set aside on kitchen paper to drain the fat from the pan. Dice the bacon and set aside. Cook the onion until softened in the bacon fat and then add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the peas to the pan and toss to coat with the onion and bacon fat. Drain the pasta and then add it to the pan along with the bacon, ricotta and the parsley. Toss everything together well and then add the cream, seasoning with the salt and pepper to taste, and then stirring until the sauce thickens. Serve immediately, sprinkled with the extra parmesan cheese if using.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat and saute the chicken for about 5 minutes. Then add the onions and cook for about 3 minutes. Stir in the broth, mustard and thyme and simmer 10 minutes. Add the potatoes and parsnips, bring to boil and simmer 10 minutes more. Add the honey and stir well. Serve immediately topped with the parsley.

In heavy 2-quart saucepan, combine first 5 ingredientsstir until smooth and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook and stir 1 minute or until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heatstir in peanut butter and vanilla until well mixed. Stir in oats until well combined. Drop by teaspoons 2 inches apart onto waxed paperlet cool. Store in airtight container. Makes 5 dozen.
 no bake chocolate chip cookiesingredients: sugar, milk, peanut butter, salt, butter, vanilla extract, rolled oatspreparation:In large heavy 3 quart saucepan, combine sugar, milk and salt over medium heat. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and butter until completely melted and well blended. Stir in oats thoroughly and drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool thoroughly before removing from paper.
In a highball glass filled with ice cubes, combine all ingredients and stir well. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice and serve.

In a 3-quart Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrot and celerysaute until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in the garlic. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heatcover and simmer for 20 minutes. Mash the vegetables and return the mixture to the Dutch oven. Stir in the apple. Add the brown sugar, mustard and cider. Bring the mixture to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Stir in the parsley. Serve over hot cooked rice. Makes 6 servings.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot or skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add the roasted red peppers to the pot and stir to combine. Add the pasta to the pot. Add the water and season the pasta with the seasoning. Cook until the pasta is cooked through but still firm to the bite. Toss with the cheese. Serve hot.

Cook sausage, ground beef and onion in large pan until brown. Add in worcestershire and garlic powder. Add in cheese and mix thoroughly. Spread on slices of rye bread. Place on a baking sheet with wax paper between layers and freeze. When frozen, put in a ziploc bag and store in freezer until ready to use. Bake at 325 for 15 - 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Rinse and cut the aubergine into 1-inch cubes and place them in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 1 tbsp. Olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss gently to coat with the oil and seasoning. Bake for 25 minutes or until tender and lightly browned. Meanwhile, rinse and slice the onions and roast them in a separate dish alongside the aubergine. In a medium bowl, combine roasted aubergine and onions with diced tomatoes and garlic and toss gently to combine. Add 1 tbsp. Olive oil and stir again to mix. Serve atop a toasted sandwich bread with slices of fresh mozzarella or goat cheese if desired.

Brown the chicken cubes and drain. Combine the cream cheese, mustard and lemon juicemix thoroughly with the cubes. Mix in the nuts and form into small ballsplace on wax paper-covered sheet and freeze until firm. Remove from freezer and thaw slightly before serving. Makes about 2 dozen balls.

Heat oven to 350. Spray 8x12 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Lay a flour tortilla on bottom. Spoon 1/2 cup beans and 1/2 cup meat mixture. Top with 2 tablespoons of taco sauce and 2 tablespoons of onion. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Cover with another flour tortilla. Repeat. Top with remaining meat mixture and remaining 1 cup beans. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup remaining cheese. Cover with final flour tortilla. Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes. Remove foil. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Bake 10 more minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with sour cream.

Cook carrots in boiling water until tender-crisp. Drain water & cool completely. Blend together carrots & mayonnaise. Stir in onions & horseradish, mix well. Add bread crumbs, pepper & cheese. Blend well. Shape into a loaf & wrap in foil. Chill. Bake 20-25 minutes at 425 in a preheated oven. Unwrap & serve warm.

In large bowl, combine butter and cheese. Cream until smooth. Add in flour. Stir in rice krispies and seasonings. Mix until thoroughly blended. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Cook the pasta according to package directions. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the cooking liquid. Drain the pasta and place in a large bowl. Add the olive oil, garlic, and basil. Toss until the pasta is coated. Add the avocado and tomato. Season with salt and pepper. Stir until the pasta is coated with the sauce. Add the reserved cooking liquid if the mixture becomes too dry. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 450 degrees. Sprinkle fillets with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Spread over fish. Bake 10-12 minutes until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with parsley and lemon wedge. Serve over rice or pasta.

To prepare glaze, combine lemon juice, zest, dark corn syrup, and cornstarch in a small bowlstir until smooth. Add hot water 1 tablespoon at a time, stirring constantly until glaze is pourable. Place frozen baby carrots in a large bowladd enough hot tap water to cover 1-inch above carrots (about 1 gallon). Cover and let stand 15 to 20 minutes. Drain well and return to bowl. Toss carrots with glaze to coat evenlylet stand 20 minutes or longer.

In a 1-quart saucepan combine the potato and 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain. In a small bowl combine the butter and herbs and blend well. In a 4-quart saucepan combine the peas and 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook until tender, about 2-3 minutes. Stir in the herbed butter and potatoes and cook for another minute or two. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Brown sausage in a skillet with a small amount of butter. Remove sausage from pan, drain fat, then add remaining butter. Mix in flour until brown, then add water, sour cream, salt and pepper. Simmer until thickened. Add sausage back in and heat through. Serve over omelets or biscuits or whatever!
name: pork chops with apple and cranberry sauceingredients: pork chops, apple cider, apple cider vinegar, sugar, cranberries, onion, thyme, rosemary, sage, cloves, ground cinnamonpreparation:In a large pot combine apple cider vinegar, apple cider, sugar, cranberries, onion, thyme, rosemary, sage and cinnamon and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until cranberries are softened. Remove from heat and add pork chops. Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes or until chops are tender and cooked through.

In a large bowl combine butter with the first 3 ingredients. Beat with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 1 minute. Add flour and salt. Beat on medium speed until well mixed. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Cool for 1 minute. Dip cookies into chocolate. Let excess chocolate drip off. Place on waxed paper. Let set. Makes 4 dozen.

In a large pot or saucepan, combine tea bags, cloves, and cinnamon sticks. Pour in boiling water. Steep for 5 to10 minutes. Remove tea bags and cloves. Add splenda sweetened cranberry juice, orange juice, lemon juice, and orange to the pot. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until heated through. Pour into a large bowl or a serving tray. Garnish with orange slices.

Scrub potatoes well with vegetable brush. Dry well. For crunchy skins, sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon garlic flavored olive oil, rubbing oil all over potato. Sprinkle with coarse salt and coarsely ground black pepper. For soft potato skins, do not sprinkle oil on potato. Pierce potato several times with fork. Wrap each tightly in foil. For crunchy skins, place wrapped potatoes on top of stove. For soft potato skins, place wrapped potatoes on lower rack of oven. Bake at 400f about one hour or until done. When potatoes are done, roll gently under hand to make mealy inside. Immediately cut crosswise in top of each potato, pushing up on ends to fluff up. Serve with sour cream dip, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil. Place asparagus spears in a single layer, cut side down, on the foil. Add the bacon. Brush the asparagus with the melted butter and sprinkle with the brown sugar and the garlic salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until tender. Remove from the oven and brush the asparagus with the worcestershire sauce. Garnish with parsley or green onions before serving.

Combine first four ingredients in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until a candy thermometer reads between 240 and 245 degrees. Remove from heat. Let stand until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir until smooth. Add the butter and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Use immediately or refrigerate in an air-tight container for up to 2 weeks. To use, beat at medium speed until smooth. Makes about 10 cups.

Plump raisins by soaking in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain well and pat dry. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add chard or spinach and cook for about 2 minutes or until just wilted. Add pine nuts, raisins and cook for another 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to plates.
Combine in blender and blend until smooth.

Peel and slice potatoes into a 13x9 casserole dish. Place half the potatoes on bottom, top with half the ham, repeat layers. Pour undiluted soup over all. Bake uncovered at 350 for 45 to 60 minutes. Check potatoes to see if done before taking out of oven. Do not overcook as they will continue to cook after removing from oven. Remove from oven, sprinkle with cheese and broil until cheese is lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine the first 5 ingredients in medium bowl. Combine egg, butter, bacon bits and jalapeno in a small bowl. Add to dry ingredientsstir just until moistened. Spoon batter into greased or paper lined 12 cup muffin tins 3/4 full. Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

Slice eggplant into rounds about a quarter inch thick. In a shallow bowl, combine bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, celery salt and pepper. Dip the rounds into the egg mixture. Then into the crumb mixture. Heat about 2 inches of oil in a heavy pot until it reaches 375 degrees. Fry eggplant slices until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

In fact there are only four grains that can be purchased in their whole form. These grains are rice, oats, wheat and corn. It is possible to find wheat berries but this is difficult to cook and the process is often long.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spread the sun-dried tomatoes and their oil in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until dry. Cool and coarsely chop. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir the sugar and 1/2 cup of the feta into the sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package. Drain the pasta and place it in a large serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the top and toss. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of feta and the fresh basil over the pasta. Bake for 10 minutes.

Mix marmalade and soy sauce. Rub salmon with mixture. Add more orange marmalade or soy sauce as needed until a good glaze coats the fish. Broil or grill to desired doneness. Serve with remaining glaze.
name: chicken and vegetable stir-fry with teriyaki sauceingredients: chicken breasts, red bell peppers, green bell peppers, red pepper flakes, fresh gingerroot, garlic cloves, fresh lime juice, low sodium soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, fresh basil leaves, cooking spraypreparation:Place chicken in a medium bowl and mix with first 4 ingredientsset aside. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add peppers and cook for 1 minute. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add chicken and cook until browned and no longer pink in the center (approximately 2 minutes per side). Remove from skillet. Add remaining ingredients and cook over medium heat for 1 minute or until bubbly and fra

Soak sweetbreads in cold water for 1 hour or overnight. Drain and rinse sweetbreads. Cut into 1/2 inch thick strips. Saute sweetbreads in a skillet with oil and butter until they begin to brown on one side. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Add garlic and continue to cook until garlic begins to turn golden. Add vinegar and water and continue to cook until liquid evaporates and sweetbreads are golden brown on both sides. Sprinkle with garlic powder and serve on hot toast with a little extra bacon on top.

Cut up acorn squash-sprinkle with apple juice. Season squash with nutmeg and cinnamon. Bake for 30 minutes. In the meantime sear pork chops. Make a sauce of maple syrup, apple juice and seasonings. Pour sauce over rice-top with squash and chops. Bake for a few minutes.

In a large nonstick skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add ham and saute until browned. Add in bell peppers and saute until tender. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs and heavy cream. Season with chili powder, garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over ham mixture and stir until well combined. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake until set and golden, 30-35 minutes. Let stand for at least 5 minutes before slicing.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius grease and line an 8 inch square tin with greaseproof paper. In a medium sauce pan heat the butter, sugar, honey and syrup gently until the butter is melted and the sugar is dissolved. Turn off the heat then fold in the oats until combined and spread into the prepared tin. Bake for 25-30 minutes until set and lightly browned. Cool for 10 minutes in the tin then cut into 10 squares using a warm knife and leave to cool completely before lifting out of the tin using the paper. Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

Preheat oven to 350. In large bowl, beat together cookie mix, egg, oil and water until well combined and soft dough forms. On ungreased baking sheet, drop by teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely and frost with cream cheese frosting. Spread with jam and top with white chocolate chips.

In a small bowl combine the brown sugar and the cinnamon. Cut the butter into the brown sugar mixture. In a large bowl combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add the brown sugar mixture, the eggs, orange peel and juice. Stir gently until the dough comes together. Fold in the cranberries. Pour the dough into a greased 9 inch loaf pan and bake for 1 hour or until the loaf is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes in the pan before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve with butter.

Mix first 5 ingredients. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool. To prepare frosting: Beat together half and half, kahlua, and egg or egg substitutebeat until blended. Stir in confectioners' sugar and pecans. Spread over cake. Garnish with pecans and coconut.

Preheat oven to 450f. Snap off the tough stem ends from the asparagus spears and arrange the spears on a baking sheet. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic and almonds. Season generously with salt and pepper. Arrange the almonds evenly on top of the asparagus and bake until just tender and the almonds are golden brown, 6 to 8 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Beat together eggs, milk, sugar and vanilla. Add flour. Pour into a 1 quart buttered casserole. Combine the margarine, flour and sugar. Sprinkle over the top of the custard. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Mix together and store in airtight container.

In a large skillet heat butter over medium-high heat. Add the onion. Cook 2-3 minutes until soft. Add the cranberries. Cook until the cranberries begin to pop. Add the wine and liquid honey. Cook until the liquid is reduced to about 1/4 cup. Remove from the heat. Stir in the rosemary. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the pork in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Pour the cranberry sauce over the top. Bake for 20-25 minutes in a preheated 350F degree oven. Serve the tenderloins sliced.

Cook chicken breasts for about 45 minutes. Reserve 1/4 cup cooking water. In a heavy saucepan cook the onion, celery and garlic in the butter for about 5 minutes until softened. Add the reserved water from the chicken and the vegetable mix to the saucepan. Add the cooked wild rice blend to the liquid and bring to a boil. Stir in the cooked chicken and serve over hot cooked wild rice blend.

To make dressing, combine all ingredients in a small bowl. In a large bowl, mix together the greens, apples and cherries. Pour dressing over and toss. Arrange the greens mixture on a large platter. Sprinkle with pecans. Crumble cheese over the top and serve.

In a mixing bowl, combine the butter, lemon juice, zest, and the chopped herbs. Beat until smooth. Add the minced garlic. Store in airtight containers in the refrigerator for 1 month. To use the butter, place a small amount in a small bowl. Microwave for 10 seconds, or until melted. Serve immediately with your favorite bread.
name: roasted tomato soup with basil oilingredients: olive oil, fresh basil leaves, tomato paste, canned tomatoes, vegetable broth, salt, dried oregano, fresh lemon juicepreparation:Heat oven to 400°F. Place tomatoes in a baking pan. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano. Bake for 45 minutes or until tomatoes are soft. Blend tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Pour into a large pot. Add broth, tomato paste and lemon juice. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Season with salt. Pour into bowls. Drizzle

Cook the cavatappi according to the package directions. Drain and return the noodles to the sauce pan. Add the melted butter. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk, heavy cream, garlic salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the Pecorino Romano cheese. Add the Parmesan cheese. Continue stirring until the cheeses are melted. Pour the cheese mixture over the noodles. Stir in the cheddar cheese. Toss gently. Transfer the macaroni and cheese to a 2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with more Parmesan cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the macaroni and cheese is bubbly and golden brown on top. Serve immediately.
I've been making this recipe for years. It is so delicious. I like it with the addition of bacon or ham. I use freshly grated parm cheese.
This is absolutely the best recipe ever. I've made it many times. I use fresh gr
In the bottom of your crockpot, combine all ingredients. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve in bowls and garnish with cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow dish combine goat cheese and garlic powder. In a separate shallow dish add eggs and beaten together with a whisk. In a third shallow dish combine the spaghetti sauce and white pepper. Coat both sides of each breast with seasoned flour. Dip each breast into the egg mixture and then coat each side in the sauce and cheese mixture. Bake for 20 minutes. Top with more sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake for an additional 5 to 10 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked and the mozzarella has melted.

Mix the tuna, white beans, celery, olives, green onions, parsley in a large bowl. Mix the dressing ingredients together. Add the dressing to the tuna mixture. Chill. Garnish with lettuce leaves and hardboiled egg.

Sauté the turkey until it is no longer pink and crumbles easily. Add the vegetables and sauté until tender. Add the barley and sauté until the barley is translucent. Stir in the tomato paste and stir until it begins to cook. Stir in the beef broth and water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Rinse the chickpeas under cool running water, then drain and place in a large mixing bowl. Add the onion, garlic, and oils and mix thoroughly to coat the chickpeas. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand overnight. The next day, add the lemon juice and turmeric to the bowl and stir until combined. Transfer the hummus to a food processor. Add the chili powder and cilantro and blend until smooth. Pour the hummus into a serving bowl and sprinkle with paprika. Serve with pita bread.

In a small bowl combine garlic and next 4 ingredients. Rub over both sides of chicken. In a large nonstick saut pan heat a small amount of oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown on both sides. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add remaining marinade and cook covered 10 minutes. Turn and cook an additional 5 minutes.
This recipe is a combination of two of my favorite chicken recipes. The first is from a magazine that my mom got, it is for a Cajun Skillet Chicken. The second is from one of my cookbooks that I have that is called The Best of Martha Stewart Living. It is for a Chicken Ragu. I thought that they would go well together so I combined them and came up with this recipe. I hope that you enjoy it as much as I did.
I think that this is a really yummy recipe. I made it for dinner last night and it was delicious. It was easy to make and had a great flavor. I would recommend this recipe to anyone.

Cut watermelon into cubes and puree in blender. Combine with strawberries and sugar in blender until smooth. Strain through fine sieve. Combine with undiluted lemonade and fresh lemon juice in large pitcher and stir. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Serve over ice in tall glasses and garnish with lemon slice.

Combine the cereal, flour, salt and spices. Melt the butter in a shallow dish. Dip the chicken in the melted butter and then roll in the flour mixture. Place the coated chicken in a single layer in a baking dish. Drizzle the remaining butter over the top of the chicken. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with pan sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook about 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Add the eggs. Cook until the eggs are firm. Stir in the picante sauce. Spread half of the mixture evenly over the bottom of the baking dish. Top with the flour tortillas. Layer the remaining egg mixture over the top of the tortillas. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven. Top with the remaining tablespoon of oil. Let sit 5 minutes to allow the oil to soak into the bread. Cut into wedges.

Mix butter and sugar until creamy. Add one egg at a time and beat until combined. Add almond extract and fold in sifted dry ingredients. Pour into greased 9 inch spring form pan. Bake 30 minutes. Remove and cool. Dust with ground almonds. Fill with cherries. Drizzle with chocolate glaze and refrigerate.
In 10x15x2 pan mix together ground turkey, cut green beans, condensed soup with milk. Add frozen tater tots (not thawed). Cover with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until bubbly.

In a small bowl, combine the beef and barbecue sauce, mixing well. Divide the mixture into patties and season with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the patties and cook until browned and cooked through. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the teriyaki and adobo sauces. Add more water if the mixture is too thick. When the patties are done cooking, brush them with the teriyaki and adobo mixture. Serve the patties in the hoagie rolls with extra sauce.

Cream butter and sugar together. Add egg and beat until well mixed. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Mix together. Knead dough together. Add egg white and water. Mix together. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Press thumb in center. Place a sliced almond in each cookie. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Cut bread into 1" cubes. Place in a large bowl. In a skillet cook the tomato, onion, and garlic for 5 minutes. Drain the mixture well. Sprinkle the bread cubes with the onion mixture. Set aside. In a large bowl beat together the eggs, milk, butter, cheese, basil, garlic salt, and pepper. Pour over the bread cubes. Cover. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Place in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serves 12.

Cook rice pilaf mix according to package directions. Combine in a bowl with marinated artichokes. Add the remaining vegetables and herbs and toss together. Combine the dressing ingredients in a small bowl and toss with rice mixture. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour. Garnish with parsley. Serve at room temperature.

Mix all spices together in a small bowl, using a wire whisk to distribute evenly. Place in a tightly sealed container for up to two months. To use, sprinkle generously over the surface of a whole chicken or piece of chicken and work into the meat with the back of a spoon.

In a heavy saucepan combine water, sugar, and salt. Cook over high heat until mixture reaches 260f on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add the egg whites, beating until they form stiff peaks. Add the vanilla, cinnamon, and pecans. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to one week.

Combine pineapple, orange zest and sugar in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil& cook 5 minutes. Stir in gelatin and cook for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Add orange juiceset aside to cool. Beat egg yolks& add to orange mixture. Cook over low heat until mixture thickens. Add vanillacool completely. Beat egg whites& sugar until peaks form. Gently fold whites into orange mixture. Pour mixture into pie shell. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Cool completely. Sprinkle top with coconut. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a bowl mix together the cream cheese, crabmeat and seasonings. Divide into 10 equal portions and shape into small balls. Take a wrapper and wet the edges with a bit of water. Place a ball of filling in the center. Fold over the wrapper and press the edges to seal. Repeat with remaining filling and wrappers. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add wontons and cook until golden. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.
name: crab spread or dip
ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, imitation crabmeat, celery, green bell pepper, garlic clove, cracker
preparation:Microwave cream cheese on high for 30 seconds until softened. Add mayonnaise and whisk until smooth. Add crabmeat, green pepper and celery. Add pressed garlic and mix well. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours so that the flavors will blend together. Serve on crackers.
name: easy crab spread
ingredients: light cream cheese, light sour cream

Spray a pie plate with cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine the graham cracker crumbs and the butter. Mix well. Press the mixture onto the bottom of the pie plate and bake for 6 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. In a medium bowl beat the cream cheese until smooth. Stir in the lime juice and salt and beat until smooth. Add the fat free cream cheese and beat until smooth. Stir in the eggs one at a time. Spoon the mixture into the pie plate and bake for 15 minutes. Allow the pie to cool for about an hour. Cut and serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the cream and milk. Bring just to a boil and remove from heat. Let the mixture cool for about 15 minutes. Beat the egg and then add the egg mixture to the cooled cream mixture. Mix in the corn and wild rice. Add the cayenne and the salt and pepper to taste. Melt the butter in a casserole dish and pour the egg mixture over top of the melted butter. Bake uncovered in a preheated oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

Heat the olive oil and add the garlic and cook for 10 seconds. Add the green peppers and cook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add 1/4 tsp. of sea salt and cook for 5 to 6 minutes more or until the rings are cooked. Check for seasoning. Remove the rings from the skillet and set aside. Prepare another skillet with the remaining olive oil, add the garlic, 1/4 tsp. of sea salt and 1/4 tsp. of peppercorns and cook for 1 minute or until the garlic is golden brown. Remove from heat and add the green peppers. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine all the dressing ingredients. Whisk well. Set aside. In a large pot of boiling water boil the red cabbage for 10 minutes. Remove from water and place in a large bowl. Add the remaining vegetables and mix. Add the dressing. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate. Serve cold.
Combine first six ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boilcool. Add poppy seeds. Whisk in oil. Store, tightly covered, in refrigerator. Makes about 2 cups.

Heat oven to 425f. Prepare pie crust as directed on package for a 9-inch one-crust pie using an ungreased 9-inch pie plate. In a small bowl combine sugar, cornstarch and apple pie spice. In a medium bowl combine peaches and flourtoss to coat. Spread half of the fruit mixture in prepared crust-lined pan. Sprinkle with half of the sugar-cornstarch mixture. Arrange remaining fruit mixture over sugar-cornstarch mixturesprinkle with remaining mixture. Bake 40-45 minutes or until juices are bubbling and crust is golden brown. Cool on wire rack for at least 1 hour before cutting.
Combine first 5 ingredients. Spread into a 9-inch pie pan. Top with a layer of the remaining 4 ingredients. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine spinach, ricotta and parmesan. Season with black pepper to taste. With a cookie spoon or small ice cream scoop, place a heaping teaspoon of spinach mixture in the center of each wrapper. Fold wrapper over filling. Press together the edges of the wrappers with your fingers to seal. Place sealed wrappers onto the prepared baking sheet. Spray the tops with cooking spray. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the edges of the wrappers are golden brown. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve warm.

Season salmon with salt and pepper. Combine french dressing with lemon juice and parsley. Dip each side of the salmon in french dressing mixture. Grill the salmon. Cook on each side for 4 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.In a large bowl combine potatoes and next six ingredients. Stir well and set aside.In a small bowl combine next three ingredientsset aside.Rinse and pat dry chicken breast halvesplace in a 9- x 13-inch baking dish. With a pastry brush, spread chicken with reserved marinade mixturesprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour potato mixture over top of chicken. Bake uncovered for 55-65 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 165 degrees F and juices run clear when thickest part of leg is pierced with a knife or fork.Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into wedges. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a skillet, cook bacon until browned. Remove bacon and drain. Add a little extra-virigin olive oil to pan. Add onions and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add black beans and cooked bacon. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in cumin and hot sauce. To serve, place a scoop of beans on each tortilla and top with sour cream.

Cook and drain ground beef and red beans in a skillet. Add polenta and water and heat through, stirring occasionally. Add salsa and heat through. Pour into a 9x13 inch glass pan. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375f for 40 minutes or until hot and cheese is melted.

Cook potatoes in large pot of boiling salted water until tender, about 30 minutes. Drain and return to pot. Mash with butter, half-and-half, garlic and basil until smooth. Stir in goat cheese just until blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Today we are going to look at some of the different options available for car insurance coverage. There are many things you can do to reduce your insurance costs and protect yourself from liability if you are involved in an accident. We will go over the different types of coverage available as well as ways you can reduce your monthly premiums without having to take out less coverage.
Before we look at what is covered we must first understand how you will pay for your insurance premiums. There are two types of insurance plans you can choose from, full coverage or liability only coverage.
Liability only is the least expensive type of plan available, but it is also the least comprehensive. Liability only will pay for any expenses you cause someone else while you are driving. This includes damages done to their vehicle or injuries they may suffer. If you are involved in an accident where you

Cut oysters into small pieces. Heat olive oil in skillet until hot. Add oysters. Cook 3 minutes. Add teriyaki. Stir. Cook 1 minute. Add steaks. Cook 4 minutes per side. Serve over rice.

In small bowl combine first four ingredients. Cook in small pan over medium heat. stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Bring back to boil and boil 3 minutes or until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and walnuts. Cool. Place in container and refrigerate. Serve over ice cream.

In a large bowl combine the first 3 ingredients and set aside. Wash and hull the grapes and nectarines and chop into small bite size pieces. Wash and peal the pears and chop into small pieces and add to the grapes and nectarines. Add the watermelon and mix well. Pour the dressing over the fruit and mix well. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Garnish with poppy seeds and serve with a slotted spoon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. (175 degrees C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.In a medium bowl, mix together the brown sugar, cocoa powder, and granulated sugar. Beat the butter and vanilla extract into the mixture until smooth. Add the egg and beat until incorporated. Stir together the flours and the baking soda. Add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix until just combined. Stir in the white and milk chocolate chips.Using a cookie scoop, drop mounds of dough onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are set but the middle is still slightly soft, about 10 minutes. Cool on baking sheets before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Peel the potatoes and slice them into thin strips. Toss them in a bowl with the oil and cajun seasoning. Lay the strips on two baking sheets and bake for about an hour or until crisp and browned on the edges. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the strips with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375f. Drain the marinated artichokes reserving the marinade. Cut any large pieces in half. Mix the artichoke pieces, thyme leaves and parmesan cheese in a bowl. Remove the fat from the chicken breasts and stab a couple of times with a fork. Stuff the chicken with the artichoke mixture. Sprinkle the tops of the breast halves with the reserved marinade. Place the breast halves in a glass baking dish. Drizzle the top of the chicken pieces with the extra virgin olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the stuffed breast halves from the baking dish. Serve immediately.

Cook the asparagus in the microwave for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a small bowl combine the lemon juice, reduced-fat salad dressing and the mushroom. Add the asparagus. Chill at least one hour before serving. Sprinkle with almonds just before serving.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in honey and cinnamon. Add oats and mix well. Add in rest of the dry ingredients and mix well. Place in greased pan and bake at 275 F for 2 hours or until golden brown and crunchy. Stir every half hour or so. Remove from oven and spread out and cool completely. Store in air tight containers for up to two weeks.

Rinse edamame. Add to large bowl with lemon juice. Toss to coat with juice. Add seasoning and cayenne. Toss again until coated evenly. Serve immediately. Store leftovers in refrigerator for up to 1 week.
Place all in food processor and pulse until combined. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 375. Line a shallow roasting pan with aluminum foil. Spray with cooking spray. In a small bowl, mix thyme and pepper. Sprinkle evenly on both sides of fish. Place fish in the pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Heat cream in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Stirring constantly, boil for 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Stir in mushroom, chicken broth and Dijon mustard. Bring to boil again. Pour over fish. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until sauce is heated through. Garnish with thyme sprigs. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream together butter and barbecue sauce. Add sugar and beat until well blended. Beat in egg. Add flour and spices. Roll into balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden. Cool on wire racks. Store in an air-tight container.

In a small bowl mix together cornstarch, water and almond extract. Set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat melt the swiss and gruyere cheeses. Whisking constantly add cornstarch mixture to the cheeses. Continue to whisk until smooth. Add the brie cheese to the fondue. Add the champagne. Mix well. Sprinkle the fondue with nutmeg. Serve with bread cubes or breadsticks.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the tuna and cook for about 3 minutes. Add the beans, spinach, cheese, oregano and season with salt. Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and pour the eggs into the mixture. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil. Turn the heat down to low. Place the fritatta on a baking sheet. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the eggs are set. Cut into wedges and serve.

In a bowl, mix the eggplant slices with the oil and season with the salt and black pepper. Put on a baking tray and roast in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until they are golden brown. In the meantime, toast the bread. Spread each slice with a little pesto and place the slices of mozzarella over the top. Top with the eggplant slices and the plum tomato slices. Sprinkle with the coarse sea salt.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until well blended. Mix in eggs. Add frozen orange juice concentrate and mix well. Fold in mandarin oranges and juice. Pour into a chilled 9 inch pie pan with the shortbread crust. Bake at 325 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool before serving.

Peel carrots. Grate carrots and pears. Toss with pineapple and lemon juice. Add other ingredients. Cook over medium heat until thick. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Place in sterilized jars. Seal.
We've had a wonderful time here at the farm this weekend. We spent Friday night at my friend's home where we had an absolutely wonderful time. I'll post more about that later. Saturday morning, we got up early and started the day at the farmer's market. We bought a lot of yummy things like honey from our friend's bees, apples from our friend's trees, cheese from our friend's goats.
After that we went to the apple orchard. We didn't get any apples from our own trees this year. The squirrels ate them all. We have a few in pots that we'll move to a different spot. In any case, we had a wonderful time picking apples with some friends. We had a picnic with some other friends later that day.
On Sunday, we got up early and went to church. Then

In a 2-quart saucepan, cook the ground chicken with the onion and the garlic until browned and no longer pink. Add the tomato sauce and the salsa. Season with the chili powder and the cayenne pepper and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add the beans and the cheese. Cook over low heat for 5 more minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serve with a green salad.
Chili is one of the best things you can have to warm you up.
I'm going to try a few of those recipes!
I love chili. I'm going to try the taco stuffed bell peppers.
I'll have to give some of these a try.
I love chili, I'm going to make it today. Thanks for the recipes.
Chili is one of my favorite foods!
Chili is one of my favorite foods. Thanks for the recipes.
I love making chili. I'll have to try some of these recipes.
I love making chili. I'll have to try some of these recipes. Thanks for the

Preheat oven to 375f. Cream the butter and add the sugar. Add the egg and vanilla. Mix together the dry ingredients and sift them over the wet. Mix well. On a well greased cookie sheet, drop by teaspoonfuls, or use a cookie press or spoon to form circles on the cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on the cookie sheet for a few minutes before removing to cool on a wire rack. Drizzle each cookie with raspberry jam, and sprinkle with a few drops of water. When the water evaporates the cookie will be shiny from the jam. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Wash and scrub the potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch chunks. In an extra large mixing bowl mix the potato chunks with the olive oil, salt and pepper and rosemary until well coated. Spread the potato chunks evenly on 1 or 2 baking pans and bake for 25 to 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender and lightly browned on top. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with additional sea salt if desired and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Trim any brown or discolored leaves from brussels sprouts. Cut sprouts in half lengthwise through the stem. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add sprouts in a single layer and cook until slightly browned, about 2 minutes. Remove from pan. In the same pan add the remaining olive oil along with Sriracha and honey. Bring mixture to a boil and reduce heat to medium. Add brussels sprouts back into the pan. Add salt and lime juice. Toss until sauce coats the brussels sprouts. Place brussels sprouts in a single layer in a roasting pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Transfer brussels sprouts to serving plate.

beat the egg with the kirsch and icing sugar. add the aniseed and sift the flour into the mixture and combine well. refrigerate overnight if possible or for at least two hours before using. roll out the dough and cut out with biscuit cutters. place on ungreased trays and bake in a hot oven for about ten minutes or until lightly browned. remove from the trays while still warm and allow to cool on wire racks. dust with icing sugar before serving.

Bring sugar and water to a boil. Add cream of tarter and stir well. Lower to medium heat. Continue to cook until mixture reaches hard ball stage. Remove from heat and add salt. Cool. Strain. Store in the fridge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch cake pan with nonstick spray. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. Combine dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture alternately with banana. Stir in nuts and vanilla. Spread into prepared pan. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and bake for 20 minutes.
In a crockpot combine the beef broth and the soup. Add the onions and the meat and cook on high for 6-8 hours. Serve with biscuits or toast.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the veal and cook for about 10 minutes on each side. When the veal is finished cooking, put in a bowl and set aside. Heat the butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until it is golden. Add the chopped tomatoes, oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Stir and let cook for about 10 minutes. Add the white wine. Stir and let cook for about 10 minutes. Add the veal back into the skillet and stir to combine. Toss the parsley into the skillet and serve.

Melt margarine. Saute the onion and mushrooms. Blend with flour. Cook 3-5 minutes. Gradually add soymilk stirring constantly until smooth. Add salt, pepper, garlic powder. Bring to boil. Add beans. Simmer covered for 5 minutes. Serve hot. Sprinkle with french fried onions.

Preheat oven to 425f. Line a baking sheet with foil. Toss the broccoli, garlic, teriyaki sauce and pepper in a medium bowl until combined. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Spread broccoli mixture evenly over baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until tender. Serves 2-4.

Cook the rice in the milk. Mash the rice well. Add the other ingredients. Fold in the whipped cream. Pour into an 8 x 8 inch pan. Let cool. Cut into squares.
 cranberry fluffingredients: cranberries, miniature marshmallows, sugar, apples, walnuts, green grape, salt, heavy whipping creampreparation:Place cranberries in food processor. Cover and process until finely chopped. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in marshmallows and sugar. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, stir in the apples, grapes, walnuts and salt. Fold in the whipped cream.

Cut the peppers in half, remove seeds and veins (save for stock), then slice into strips. Cut the onion in half then slice into strips. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the peppers, onion, mushrooms, cheddar cheese rinds and bay leaf. Saute until the vegetables are tender (about 10 minutes). Remove the bay leaf and set aside. Heat the stock in a saucepan to boiling then add the peppers, onions, mushrooms and bay leafsimmer for 10 minutes to infuse flavor into the stock. In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the stock until just boiling (about 5 minutes). Stir in the cooked pasta, tomatoes, cooked chicken and cheese rind. Cook for 2 minutes more, stirring frequently, until the cheese rind has melted and the pasta is heated through. Stir in the reserved vegetable mixture. Spoon the pasta mixture into the prepared baking dish. Top with the remaining cheese. Bake for 15 minutes or until

Saut onion in butter in a large pot until transparent. Add potato and cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in chicken stock and bring to boil. Cover and turn heat down to low. Simmer gently for 15 minutes. Stir in brussels sprouts and cook for 3 minutes or to desired tenderness of sprouts. Remove bay leaf and sprinkle with parsley before serving.
I am trying to make this recipe. The recipe calls for 3/4 tsp of salt and 3/4 tsp of pepper to be added with the vegetable broth, but does not say how much vegetable broth to add. I am confused.
Thank you for your question. I believe that the recipe is missing a step, you need to add the vegetable broth, you should add 3/4 tsp of salt and 3/4 tsp of pepper to it and then add that to the recipe. Let me know if this helps or if you need any further assistance.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a large bowl combine beets and parsnips with olive oil and toss to coat. Transfer to a large baking sheet. Add the baby carrots and mushrooms to the baking sheet and toss to coat. Sprinkle with brown sugar and season to taste with salt and pepper. Roast for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally and then add the beet greens and cook for 15-20 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender and lightly browned. Remove from oven and transfer to a serving platter. In a small bowl combine the vinegar and sugar and whisk to combine. Toss the vegetables with the dressing and serve.

Preheat oven to 425. Sprinkle thighs with salt and pepper. Spread the ginger evenly over thighs and rub into the flesh. Set aside. In a bowl mix together the remaining ingredients. Pour half over the thighs and turn the thighs over and pour the remaining half over. Bake in the middle of the oven for 45 minutes or until the thighs are golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot.

Slice open an English muffin, and place on a plate. Top with two sausage patties and sprinkle with cheese. Crack an egg onto the plate and place it on top. Drizzle with margarine and sprinkle with salt. Put another English muffin half on top, and cook on both sides until crispy. Serve with ketchup.

Brown the beef in a skillet over medium-high heat for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms, onion, and soup. Stir in water. Bring to a boil. Coverreduce heat. Cook for 45 minutes. Stir in the mustard and parsley. Serve over hot rice. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the radishes with the all-purpose flour and mix well. Add the water and stir to form a smooth paste. Pour in the cider vinegar and mix. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over low heat and stir in the radish mixture. Let it cook, stirring occasionally, for 4-5 minutes. Add the onions and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Add the potatoes and stir well to combine. Pour in the cold water and boil. Season with salt and ground pepper. Remove from the heat and let it cool. Mix in the cucumber. Serve chilled.

In a 4-quart crock pot combine the first 10 ingredients. Place the chicken pieces in the crock pot and turn to coat with the liquid. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until the chicken is fork tender. Transfer the chicken to a platter. Add the parsley. Serves 4.

In a large bowl, combine dates and cherries with walnuts, and set aside. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder, and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until thoroughly mixed. Stir in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the date mixturebeat thoroughly after each addition. Pour batter into greased and floured loaf pan or bundt panbake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 1 1/2 hours. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.

In a skillet over medium heat, add the butter and cook the tomatoes until they are soft. Remove the tomatoes from the pan and set aside. Place the cooked bacon in the pan and cook until the fat is rendered and the bacon is crispy. Remove the bacon and set aside. Spread the cooked tomatoes on the inside of the bread with the bacon inside the other slice. Fold the bread over and place the sandwich in the pan. Sprinkle the grated cheese over the top and let the sandwich cook until the cheese is melted and the sides of the bread are slightly brown and crispy. Cut the sandwich into quarters and serve with a salad or fruit.

Prepare the pie crust according to the instructions on the back of the package. In a large mixing bowl beat the sugar, nutmeg, salt and eggs until light and foamy. Gradually add the flour until well blended. Fold in the rhubarb, stirring until the rhubarb is evenly distributed throughout the batter. Pour the filling into the prepared pie crust, spreading to fill the pan evenly. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes or until the center is set and the top is golden brown. Cool completely before slicing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a 9x13 baking dish combine the soup and milk. Add the cooked chicken and corn. In a separate bowl combine the corn muffin mix and milk. Mix well. Pour over the chicken and soup mixture. Sprinkle with butter. Bake at 375 degrees F. for 20 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until the top is lightly browned.

Place broccoli in container of blender. Add remaining ingredients except chicken, black pepper, and tomatoes. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in chicken, black pepper, and tomatoes. To serve, toss into warm buttered pasta.

Marinate chicken breasts in lime juice and a few drops of lime rind. Thread onto lemongrass skewers and cook for 15 minutes turning every 5 minutes. To make sauce put macadamia nut oil and garlic in a small frying pan over a medium heat. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring. Add sugar and stir until sugar has melted and sauce has thickened. Add 2 teaspoons of water and stir. Turn off heat and stir in the juice of 1/2 a lime. Season to taste. Pour over the cooked chicken. Garnish with coriander and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook and drain ziti according to package directions. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and crumble sausage until no longer pink. Add tomato sauce and stewed tomatoes. Cook over medium-low heat until simmering. Combine cooked ziti and sausage mixture in a large bowl. Add oregano, parsley and pepper. Pour into a 13x9-inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumb mixture and top with cheese. Bake uncovered until top is brown and bubbly. Serve warm.
These look like really good recipes. I like the Italian food. Thank you for sharing.
I like this! Thanks for sharing.
I like that you added some of your own recipes too! I'll have to try these sometime.
I like Italian food too!
I'm a big fan of Italian food too. Thanks for posting these recipes.

In a 2 quart pitcher, combine 8 tea bags and 4 cups boiling water. Let steep 10 minutes. Add the oranges and lemons. Squeeze out all the juice and add to the liquid.
