Refrigerate 2 hours or until chilled. Add lemon and orange slices for garnish. Add honey to taste. Add ginger ale just before serving. Serve over ice.

Place all ingredients in bread machine according to manufacturer's directions. Select basic white bread cycle and press start. When cycle is complete, remove bread from bread machine and let cool on a wire rack before slicing.

Put 1/2 cup of the ginger ale in a slow cookeradd 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 2 garlic cloves, crushed to a paste with a mortar and pestle. Place a large sheet of foil in a baking panplace the meat on top and cover with remaining ginger ale. Seal very tightly with foil and bake for 16 hours at 325 degrees or until tender and falling apart when pierced with a fork. Prepare a spice rub by combining 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 teaspoons salt, 1 1/2 teaspoons pepper, 1/4 teaspoon cumin, 1/4 teaspoon coriander, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper and 1 teaspoon mustard. Remove the meat from the slow cookerdiscard the liquid. Pat the meat dry with paper towelsbrush with the spice rubreturn to slow cook
Melt margarine in a 13x9 pan. Add the chocolate chips and nuts (if using). Remove from heat and stir in mini marshmallows. Press mixture into the pan and refrigerate until set. Cut into squares.
Place all of the above ingredients in crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours.

In a heavy saucepan combine sugar, dark corn syrup, butter, and creambring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until mixture reaches hard crack stage, about 25 minutes. Remove from heatstir in blanched almondspour onto prepared surface. Cool completely in refrigerator. Break into piecesstore in tightly covered containers.

Combine garlic and salt in food processor. Process until smooth. Add egg yolk and process until well mixed. With motor still running gradually add olive oil in a slow steady stream. Continue to process until dressing is thick. Add pepper and parmesan cheese and process to a smooth consistency. Cover and chill. Place lettuce in a large salad bowl. Toss with dressing. Sprinkle with bacon bits.

Cut up the green onions, then dice them fine. Mince the jalapeno peppers. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. When melted, add the green onion-jalapeno mixture. Cook and stir until the onions are transparent, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken and cook until it is no longer pink in the center. Stir in the honey, lemon juice, thyme, and a pinch of salt. Heat through. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium size bowl stir together the cornmeal, salt, sugar, eggs, milk, baking powder, and flour. Mix just till smooth, stir in the melted butter. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake 20-25 minutes till golden brown. Remove from pan immediately and cool on wire rack.

Place the meat in the bottom of the slow cooker. In a small bowl mix together all remaining ingredients. Pour over the meat. Cover and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours, or until the beef is very tender. Remove the meat from the slow cooker. Shred the meat into small pieces. Return the meat to the slow cooker and stir in any juices that have accumulated. Add more water if the sauce is too thick. Re-cover the slow cooker and cook until heated through, 30 to 60 minutes. Serve over noodles or rice.

Cream butter and sugars in large mixing bowl until fluffy and well combined. Add in eggs and beat until thoroughly combined and creamy. In a medium bowl combine dry ingredients and add to wet ingredients. Mix until just combined, leaving a little texture. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts. Place on cookie sheet lined with parchment paper and press with the back of a spoon into a round shape approximately 2 inches in diameter and 1/4 inch high. Bake in a preheated 425 degree F (220 degree C) for about 6 minutes or until the edges are golden. Remove from the oven and place on wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 24 cookies.

Mix the above ingredients and put in a greased cake pan. Bake at 350 for about 45 minutes. Cool and dust with confectioners sugar.
name: rose's world famous pancakesingredients: eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, sugar, saltpreparation:Preheat griddle. Beat eggs and milk together. Add dry ingredients and beat well. Pour on griddle. Cook until bubbles appear and flip over.
name: never fail banana breadingredients: flour, margarine, bananas, nuts, salt, sugar, eggs, baking sodapreparation:Mix sugar and margarine till creamy. Then add eggs and mix well. Add all other ingredients. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Also makes beautiful muffins.
name: ukranian nothingsingredients: eggs, oil, sugar, flour, saltpreparation:Beat eggs well. Add sugar and beat well. Add oil and beat well. Add flour, pinch of salt and beat until batter is b
Mix together all ingredients in a bowl. Put in crock pot and let sit until ready to serve.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil and saute the chopped onion and bacon bits over medium high heat until they are browned and crisp. Add the chopped beet greens and saute until tender. Stir in the white wine and cook until almost dry. Stir in the parsley and lemon juice. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper and serve.

Pour milk into large bowl and add instant pudding. Beat on medium speed for about two minutes until thick and creamy. Add the Cool Whip and beat until just combined. Spread into pie crust and refrigerate for one hour or until set. Sprinkle with the toffee pieces and refrigerate for another hour. Top with fresh whipped cream or cool whip if you like.

Cut up the chicken into small strips. Mix together the remaining ingredients. Cook in a skillet. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve over rice.
 chicken fajita with green salsaingredients: green salsa (recipe below), green bell pepper, onion, tomato, cilantro leaves, cumin, ground coriander, ground cayenne pepper, salt, black pepper, olive oilpreparation:Place green bell peppers, onion and tomato in a bowl. Sprinkle with cilantro and toss. Place mixture in a fajita-size tortilla. Top with green salsa and sprinkle with cumin, ground coriander and cayenne. Roll up and serve. Green Salsa:Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Makes about 2 cups.

Soak barley in water for 1 hour. Drain. Rinse and place in saucepan with 3 cups water. Bring to the boil. Cook until water is absorbed and grains are tender about 35 minutes. Cool. Combine barley with corn and tomatoes. In a small bowl combine vinegar with 1 1/2 teaspoons of olive oil. Whisk in salt. Toss with barley mixture. Garnish with fresh basil.

Place all ingredients except bourbon and brown sugar into a crock pot. Cover. Set crock pot on low for 7 to 8 hours or high for 5 to 6 hours. Just before serving add the bourbon and brown sugar. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with cornbread.

In large mixing bowl combine all ingredients except the walnuts and cranberries. Mix well. Spread the mixture evenly in a baking dish. Bake at 325 degrees for about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Mix the walnuts and cranberries into the granola and store in an air tight container. Yields about 7 cups of granola.

Mix crust together and press into a greased 10 inch jelly roll pan or any pan of the same size. Bake at 325 for 20 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Mix filling together and pour over crust. Bake at 325 for 25-30 minutes or until the mixture is firm in the middle and golden around the edges. Spread with frosting and sprinkle with flaked coconut. Cool and cut into squares.

Set bread machine to dough setting and add all the ingredients. Run bread machine according to manufacturers instructions. When cycle is finished, turn dough out onto floured surface. Knead briefly by hand until smooth. Divide dough into 4 equal portions and roll into balls. Place on greased baking sheet. Flatten to 1/2 inch thickness with bottom of cup or glass dipped in flour. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on rack. Serve with butter or margarine. Makes 4 servings.
Cream together cream cheese, splenda, orange extract until smooth. Fill strawberries with filling. Cover with walnut pieces. Refrigerate over night. Serve cold.

Brown beef in a large skillet. Add onion, garlic and green pepper. Cook until vegetables are soft. Add butter. Add the canned tomatoes, rotel tomatoes and tomato sauce. Cook 20 minutes. Add cabbage. Stir well. Add seasoning to taste. Serve over cooked rice. Serve with hot cornbread.

Soak the anchos in the vinegar for about an hour. Drain and discard the vinegar. Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the anchos and toast until fragrant and dark brown, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a blender and purée with the remaining marinade ingredients. Put the meat in a large zipper bag and pour the marinade over it. Refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. Remove the meat from the marinade and pat dry. Grill until cooked through and browned, about 3 minutes per side.

Toss lettuce, spinach, hearts of palm, cucumber, carrot, and red pepper in a large bowl. Add green peas and capers and toss lightly. Place in the refrigerator for about 1 hour. Add tomato just before serving. Serve at room temperature with favorite dressing.

Sweat the onion with the olive oil and the ginger for 5 minutes. Add the carrots and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Simmer the soup for about 10 minutes. Add the honey and the salt and pepper. Blend the soup until smooth. Chill the soup and serve cold. Or alternately, serve the soup warm.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Combine the sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg in a small bowl. Toss with the squash to coat, then spread the mixture evenly over the cut surface of each half of the squash. Place the halves cut side up on a baking sheet lined with foil. Bake for 45 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife. Remove from the oven, sprinkle with the pecans and drizzle with the honey. Serve immediately.

Cut meat into small pieces. Season with salt & pepper and dip into flour. Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in a large frying pan. Fry meat quickly. Add a little more oil and fry chopped onion. Add a little more oil and fry chopped white mushrooms. Add beef stock. Cook for 5 minutes. Add tomato paste. Stir well. Cook for another 5 minutes. Add tomatoes. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Add prepared mustard. Simmer for 3-5 minutes. Serve with hot rice. Pour a little sour cream over meat. Garnish with chopped parsley.

Heat butter and oil over medium heat until butter is melted and oil is hot. Combine flour and salt and white pepper together in small bowl and add to hot pan stirring constantly until smooth and bubbly about 2 minutes. Gradually add milk stirring constantly until smooth and bubbly about 2 minutes. Add cream and oregano stirring constantly until smooth and bubbly about 2 minutes. Stir in chicken and cook over medium heat 1 minute or until no longer pink stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese and canadian bacon. Serve over rice or pasta.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add celery and green onion. Saute 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in rice and saute 1 minute. Stir in juice and next 5 ingredients. Cover and cook over low heat 20 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in slivered almonds.

Brown the ground beef with the onion. Drain the fat. Add the taco seasoning to the meat mixture. Add the water. Simmer for 10 minutes. Mix the condensed tomato soup. Add the sweet corn. Add the taco meat mixture. Add the macaroni noodles. Add the green pepper. Add the black olives. Mix well. Add the cheddar cheese. Mix well. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 10 inch tube or bundt pan. Sift together the dry ingredients. Add the lemon juice. Mix the dry ingredients with a paddle or wire whisk. Cut the butter into small pieces. Add the butter to the mixture one piece at a time. Mix with a paddle or wire whisk. Add the eggs one at a time. Mix until the batter is smooth. Pour into the tube pan. Bake for 55-60 minutes. Cool for 5-10 minutes in the pan on a wire rack. Invert the cake onto the wire rack. Let cool completely.
I’ve been eating a lot of scones lately. I was having a bit of trouble with the recipes I found. I needed a little more help. I was hoping to find an easy scone recipe that didn’t involve a lot of rising.
I found this recipe. It’s simple and easy. I added some cinnamon. It was the perfect scone recipe for me.
I think the hardest part

Cut the mushrooms into thin slices. Combine the oil, thyme and vinegar and mix well. Add the shallots and mix again. Add the mushrooms and mix to coat them evenly. Marinate for at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan with 1 tablespoon of salt. Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add garlic, and cook until aromatic, about 1 minute. Add tuna to skillet, breaking up with a fork. Stir in broth to deglaze pan. Cook until broth evaporates, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Add parsley and cayenne to skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain pasta. Toss pasta with tuna mixture in a large serving bowl. Garnish with additional parsley if desired. Serve immediately.

Peel the outermost skin of the cucumbers, then cut them into small chunks. Place the cucumbers in a large bowl. Add the cherry tomatoes and the yellow pear tomatoes. Add the fresh lemon juice, apple cider vinegar and flax seed oil. Combine well and add the garlic clove. Add the dill and season with the dijon mustard. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in blender container. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat together the egg, milk and vegetable oil. Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and stir just until combined. Fold in the strawberries and rhubarb. Spoon the batter into a greased and floured muffin tin. Bake for 15 - 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Layer the bread cubes in a buttered 9x13 dish. Mix the rest of the ingredients together. Pour over the bread cubes and refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours. Bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Serves 4-6.

In a shallow bowl or pan combine stuffing mix, parmesan cheese and melted butter. Mix well. Place the chicken in the shallow pan. Spread the stuffing mixture over the entire chicken. Bake uncovered at 325f for 20-25 minutes or until the juices run clear. Serve with gravy.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small bowl. Cut each fillet into 4 portions. Place on a baking sheet and brush with 1 tablespoon sauce. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon marjoram. Brush with remaining sauce. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon marjoram. Bake at 400 for 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place the almonds in a small bowl and toss them with the pumpkin pie spice. Cut each pear into 6 wedges and place them in a large bowl. Drizzle the wedges with the melted butter and toss them well to coat them evenly. Add the almonds and toss well again. Spread the mixture evenly in one layer on one or two baking sheets. Roast in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, until the wedges are golden and tender. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Ingredients: 1 lb. ground chuck or ground beef 1/2 tsp. onion powder 1/2 tsp. garlic powder 1/2 tsp. chili powder 1 tsp. paprika 1 tsp. Italian seasoning 1/2 tsp. salt 1/2 tsp. black pepper 1/4 cup diced onions 2 cups uncooked elbow macaroni

Cook the sweet potatoes in boiling water until tender. Cool slightly. Remove the skins (you can leave some on for color if you prefer) and mash the potatoes with the apple and sugar. Stir in the flour. Mix well. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. Put the sausage in the bottom of the baking pan. Sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Spread the potato mixture on top of the sausage. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 13-by-9-inch baking dish with foil. Coat with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine dressing, mushrooms, green onion, salt and pepper. Spread over the bottom of the prepared dish. Place the salmon over the dressing. Spray top lightly with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve over pasta with more dressing.

Heat oil in a skillet pan. Add shrimp and cook until opaque throughout. Remove and set aside. In the same pan add lemon juice and green onions and cook until tender crisp. Return shrimp to pan and stir in parsley and cooked noodles or rice. Serve with grated cheese and parsley.

Clean the leeks well, separate the dark green parts from the white parts and put both parts into a saucepan with a little water to cover them. Cook over a low heat until tender then drain well. Melt a little butter in a saucepan, add the flour and cook until light brown. Pour in the milk gradually, stirring well until smooth and thick. Add the seasonings and a little paprika. Cook until boiling then remove from heat. Stir in the egg yolks one at a time while stirring well. Place the cooked leeks into a casserole dish with a little of the liquid in which they were cooked. Cover with the sauce. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees F for 30 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

Peel and slice ginger. Toss together with water and rice wine vinegar. Cook, uncovered over medium heat for 10 minutes or until ginger is tender and liquid is reduced by half. Add sugar and cook an additional minute or two until ginger is fully soft. Remove from heat and let cool. Combine pickling liquid and sugar and stir to mix. Let cool completely and store in refrigerator. This is great over salmon or fish tacos!

Grease a 33 x 18 x 5cm slice tin & dust with breadcrumbs or flour. In a saucepan combine 4 cups of boiling water with the dried dates & soak for 1 hour or until softened. Drain dates & remove skins. Combine dates, brown sugar & crystallized ginger in a large mixing bowl. Add the butter & beat until blended. Beat the egg in a small bowl & add to the mixture. Combine the bicarbonate of soda & the self-raising flour & add gradually to the date mixture. Spoon into the prepared tin & level the top. Bake for 45 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven & cool in the tin for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar before serving.

Melt the butter in a medium-large pot over medium heat. Stir the green bell peppers and sliced mushrooms into the pot. Continue to stir until the vegetables are tender. Stir the garlic powder into the vegetables. Sprinkle the tomatoes evenly over the vegetables and stir to combine. Add the long-grain rice and stir to combine. Stir the chicken broth and water into the pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Cook the rice for 20 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Sprinkle with the salt and the pepper.

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Add frozen spinach to bacon drippings. Saute until all liquid is gone. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add bacon. Serve warm.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it starts to get translucent. Add in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add in the brussels sprouts. Toss until they are well coated in oil and begin to get slightly browned. Add in the vinegar and butter. Stir for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients and blend until smooth. Store at room temperature for up to two weeks.

Preheat oven to 250f. Combine popped corn, nuts and butter in a very large bowl. Heat corn syrup, sugar and vanilla in saucepan until it begins to boil stirring constantly until the mixture is light brown in color. Pour over the popcorn mixture in the bowl and stir until completely coated. Spread out on two cookie sheets. Bake for 30 minutes stirring frequently. Remove from oven allow to cool completely, then break apart. Store in sealed containers at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine the cheese, flour and salt. Mix with a fork until it looks like course corn meal. Stir in the milk. Then add the eggs and mix well. Add the ham and mix well. Pour into the unbaked pie shell and bake in a 375 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool for about 5 minutes before serving.
In a blender, combine all ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve in tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with orange and/or lime wedges.

Preheat the over to 350 degrees. Line a 9x13 inch pan with foil, leaving a 1 inch overhang on two sides. Spray with nonstick cooking spray and set aside. In a food processor, pulse the beans until finely chopped. Add the egg, granulated sugar, oil, and extract and pulse until smooth and creamy. Add the baking powder and cinnamon and pulse until combined. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the oats and chocolate. Spread into the pan and sprinkle with the remaining 3/4 cup of cinnamon. Bake until set and golden brown on edges, about 35 minutes. Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Carefully lift the foil to remove the blondies from the pan. Cut into 16 bars. Serve.

Season cutlets with salt and pepper. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add cutlets and cook for 4 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Add apricot jam and cook for 1 minute. Remove cutlets from pan and set aside. Add stock and corn and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cup. Return pork cutlets to pan and add parsley. Serve immediately.

In a large sauce pan, combine the broth, cream, pumpkin puree, brown sugar, and seasonings. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 15 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cheese and cilantro. Serve in individual bowls. Garnish with dollops of sour cream, if desired.
1. Chop the celery and red onion into small pieces.
2. Place the chopped celery and red onion into a large bowl.
3. Add the mayonnaise and lime juice and zest and mix well.
4. Add the cumin and chili powder and mix well.
5. Add the sugar and salt and pepper and mix well.
6. Add the raisins and mix well.
7. Place a small amount of the salad on each plate and top with a dollop of sour cream.
1. Cut the broccoli and celery into small pieces.
2. Cut the red onion into small pieces.

In a large skillet heat oil and brown chicken. Add sour cream, milk and 1/2 cup of the cream cheese. Stir constantly. Add pepper and onion. Heat until heated through. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup of the cream cheese. Serve with warmed tortillas.
In shallow bowl, combine egg substitute, milk, spices. Dip bread slices in egg mixture to coat. Transfer to skillet. Brown about 3 minutes on each side. Top with syrup if desired.

Scoop out olive center. Spoon in cream cheese spread. Fill the center with the parsley and some of the olive mixture. Replace the olive in the jar and place a toothpick in the top of the olive to hold it in place.

Combine graham cracker crumbs with 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour in a mixing bowl. Add the margarine and beat well. Press mixture into a greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely in pan. Combine condensed milk and remaining all-purpose flour in a mixing bowl. Stir well until smooth. Spread over crust. Combine remaining flour with 1/4 teaspoon baking powder and salt in a bowl. Mix with margarine until blended. Crumble over filling and sprinkle with raisins and nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 18-22 minutes or until lightly browned and set. Cool completely in pan before cutting into squares. Store in an airtight container.

Place steaks in a plastic bagadd the garlic salt, black pepper, and oilseal bag and marinate in refrigerator 1 hour. Remove steak from bagdrain well. Grill or broil 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until done. Slice thinly across the grain. Place sliced meat in tortasprinkle with parsley. Add mayo to torta if desiredserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse and pat dry your red bell peppers. Cut a small slice off the top of each pepper to allow some steam to escape. Sprinkle insides of each pepper with a little bit of coarse salt. Cut off the tops and discard. In a medium bowl combine the ground beef, garlic salt and Tabasco. Divide into four equal portions and place in each bell pepper. Place the remaining tops back on each bell pepper. Bake for 40 minutes. In a medium skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Add the breadcrumbs. Cook, stirring constantly, until breadcrumbs are golden brown. Remove from heat and place into a small bowl. Sprinkle 1/2 of the breadcrumbs into the bottom of a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Place the bell peppers into the dish. Top with the remaining breadcrumbs. Bake for 5 minutes. In a small bowl combine the sour cream and lemon juice. Remove bell peppers from oven and top

Heat vegetable oil in wok. Add dried shrimp and curry paste. Stir fry for about 2 minutes. Add green beans, stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add chicken stock, fish sauce, palm sugar and lime leaves. Simmer until beans are crunchy. Add pork and simmer until cooked. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350. Pound out the chicken breast to 1/2 inch thickness. Spread the cream cheese over the chicken breast. Put the bacon on the chicken breast. Sprinkle the garlic salt, cheddar cheese and the chopped parsley over the chicken. Place the stuffed chicken on the foil. Wrap the foil around the chicken. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes.
Mix together all ingredients (except 7-up) until well blended. Refrigerate 1 hour. Add 7-up just before serving. Serve over ice.

Prepare pie crust as directed on package. Prick bottom and sides with fork. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Sprinkle bottom with broccoli and salmon. Beat together eggs and cream. Stir in dill weed and red cayenne. Pour over broccoli and salmon. Sprinkle with swiss cheese and chives. Bake at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes. Slice and serve.

In a large bowl combine eggs and milk. Add vanilla and sugar and mix well. Pour mixture over cinnamon-swirl bread and soak thoroughly. In the center of each slice of soaked bread place 1 teaspoon cream cheese. Sprinkle fruit over cream cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until brown and bubbly on top. Serve topped with whipped sweet cream and additional fruit.
These were the best French toast I have ever made and eaten. I used the strawberry swirl cinnabun bread and used blueberries and strawberries for the fruit. I also used some of the left over strawberry glaze from the swirls and drizzled it over the french toast after I cut it up and it was very good. Thanks for the recipe!
I love french toast and this is the first time I've ever made it myself and it came out great! I used the swirl cinnabun bread and used sliced apples in place of the strawberries and it was delicious!
These were so

Preheat broiler. In a large skillet over high heat, melt butter. Add shrimp and cook 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a broiler-safe dish. Add lemon juice and parsley. Toss to combine. Season with pepper and red-pepper flakes. Broil 6 inches from heat 2-4 minutes or until shrimp are opaque and firm. Serve.

Prepare pastry as directed on package for a double-crust 9-inch pie. Line a 9-inch pie plate with pastryset aside. Combine berries, sugar, tapioca and lemon juice in a large mixing bowlmix well. Let stand 1 hour or until mixture thickens and berry juice is released. Spread filling over bottom crust in prepared pie platedot with butter. Adjust top crusttrim and seal edges. Cut slits in top crust for steam to escape. Bake in a preheated 425-degree oven 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Let stand 1 hour before cutting. Yield: 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 9 x 9-inch pan and line with baking paper. Melt butter and golden syrup together. Remove from the heat and stir in condensed milk. Add biscuits and stir to break up slightly. Spread in pan and top with almonds and then chocolate. Bake for 30 minutes or until firm. Cut into bars to serve.

In a small bowl combine the egg, mayonnaise, italian and old bay seasonings. Cut the ends off of the zucchini and cut it into thin strips. In a large bowl combine the zucchini and crab meat. Add the egg mixture and combine. Form into cakes about 3 inches wide and 1 inch thick. In a large skillet over medium high heat add the oil and the onion. Once the onion is cooked down place the cakes in the skillet and cook until lightly browned. Remove from skillet and drain on a paper towel. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. I like remoulade but you can use tartar or cocktail. You can also broil the cakes instead of saute. They are also good served on a bun with lettuce and tomato.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add sugar and egg and cook over low heat until thick. Add flour and cook stirring until blended. Remove from heat and stir in orange rind and juice and vanilla. Pour into mold and refrigerate overnight. To make sauce melt butter and cocoa and stir in water until smooth. Heat over low heat until thickened. Pour over pudding and serve with whipped cream.
name: fudgy orange browniesingredients: sugar, oil, eggs, orange, zest of, fresh orange juice, vanilla, flour, salt, baking powder, cocoa powderpreparation:Preheat oven to 325. Mix together oil and sugar. Add eggs, vanilla, zest, and juice. Mix well. Sift together dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture, stirring gently until just combined. Pour into greased 8x8 baking pan. Bake 20-23 minutes until done. Allow to sit at room temperature at least 30 minutes before cutting. Let me know how long it took you to bake
Melt together first 5 ingredients. Remove from heat and stir in coconut and nuts. Let cool to room temperature and shape into balls. Roll balls in melted chocolate and place on wax paper to harden.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease 2 10inch x 6inch loaf pans. Cream together the butter and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the treacle and eggs. Sift together the plain and self raising flours, ginger, cinnamon, cloves and bicarbonate of soda. Add to the creamed mixture and beat until well incorporated. Divide between the loaf pans and bake for 40 to 50 minutes. Cool in pans on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes. Add the corn and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the nutmeg. Stir in 1/2 cup of water. Remove from heat. Beat 2 eggs in a medium bowl with a whisk. Add the corn mixture and 1 cup of milk. Add 1/2 cup cheese and beat until well blended. Spoon into a 9-inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting. Serves 6.

Mix vegetables together in a large bowl. Place in a steamer basket and add margarine. Steam vegetables until tender. Drain and add lemon juice. Stir together. Sprinkle with dried basil and marjoram. Serve immediately.

Heat the cream, milk, brown sugar, honey, gingerroot and salt in a large saucepan until it reaches 175 degrees on an instant read thermometer. Do not boil. Remove from heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. In a large bowl beat the egg yolks with an electric mixer on high speed for about 30 seconds or until thick and light. Slowly pour about 1/4 of the warm liquid into the egg yolks while beating on medium speed, then slowly pour the rest of the mixture into the egg yolks while beating on high speed. Pour the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a large bowl. Stir in the vanilla extract. Chill the mixture for at least 8 hours or until thoroughly chilled. Pour the mixture into your ice cream machine and process according to manufacturers instructions. Serve immediately or transfer to an airtight container and freeze for at least 6 hours before serving.
Combine milk, honey, ginger, red pepper, and cayenne pepper in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Stir in cocoa, salt and vanilla. Pour into mugs or cups and top with whipped cream.

In a large skillet or pot, bring 3 cups water to a boil. Cook the pasta in the boiling water for 7 to 9 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Meanwhile, in another pot or skillet, brown the turkey in the butter. Add the soup and milkcook and stir until heated through. Drain the pasta and mix with the turkey mixture. Stir in the sour cream. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve warm.

Mix cereal and spaghetti sauce mix. In a large bag combine all dry ingredients. Add pretzel nuggets. Pour vegetable oil into a small bowl. Add garlic powder to the vegetable oil. Mix well. Add to bag of dry ingredients. Mix well. Spread on wax paper to cool. Store in air tight container.

brown pork chops in oil. Place chops in bottom of greased casserole dish. Layer rice and vegetables. Combine broth and dry onion mix and pour evenly over rice and veggies. Cover and bake 1 hour at 350 degrees.
Melt the butter in a frying pan. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and stir fry for 5 minutes. Stir in the chives. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Pour 3 teaspoons of instant tea into 3 cups of milk. Stir and bring the mixture to a simmer over low heat. Add 2 tablespoons of sugar and stir until completely dissolved. Add 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Stir for 30 seconds until the cinnamon is completely incorporated into the drink. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add in onion and saut till it becomes light brown. Add in the passata and cook for 5 minutes. Add in turmeric powder, garam masala powder and green cardamom seeds and mix well. Add in the water and bring it to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes and add in the salt. Turn off the heat and allow the gravy to cool. Once cooled add in the melted butter. Serve it with curry chicken or rice.

Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add shallotsaut until translucent. Add paprika. Cook a minute more. Add stock. Cook until it is reduced by half. Add tomato, potato, salt and pepper. Cook until tender. Puree in a blender. Strain. Add sour creamheat. Serve hot.

Spread refried beans evenly over the bottom of a casserole dish. Top with the tortilla strips. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and stir to blend. Pour over the beans. Bake for 20 minutes.
Saut broccoli in hot oil until tender-crisp. Stir in chili and garlic. Toss to combine. Add dark soy and toss to coat broccoli. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

Grease a 9x13 disposable foil pan with non-stick cooking spray. Place chicken pieces in dish. Sprinkle with garlic salt and paprika. Mix together remaining ingredients and spread over chicken. Cover dish with foil. Freeze. When ready to bake, thaw in refrigerator overnight. Uncover dish and bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until bubbly. Cover with foil mid-way through cooking if cheese starts getting too brown.

Mix the low-fat cream cheese with the double cream until smooth using an electric mixer. Add the sugar to taste and the lemon juice and zest. Spoon into glasses or dessert dishes and refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to broil. Rinse scallops under cold water. Pat them dry. Melt butter in an oven proof skillet over medium heat. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add scallops. Cook 5 minutes. Turn scallops over. Add wine to skillet. Bring to a boil. Cover skillet and bake 4 minutes. Add cream. Bring to a boil. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with scallions and parsley. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

Soften the neufchatel until its room temperature. Add the softened butter and beat until combined. Add the egg and the vanilla and beat until combined. Add the chocolate cake mix and beat until combined. Using a cookie scoop, scoop out the dough onto the parchment lined baking sheets. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 450. Place tomatoes cut side up on baking sheet. In medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese and chives. Place butter in small saucepan over medium heatcook 3-4 minutes or until melted. In another bowl combine Parmesan mixture and butterspread evenly over each tomato. Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with basil and serve immediately.

Mix pineapple chunks with sour cream. Add lettuce leaf in center of plate. Spoon pineapple mixture around the lettuce. Top with mandarin orange sections and bananas. Sprinkle with flaked coconut and add 2 or 3 maraschino cherries to each serving.

In a large pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add pork and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, pepper and ground ginger. Mix well. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add chinese cabbage and cook 2 minutes. Add chow mein noodles and cook 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and saut until soft. Add the spinach and cook for 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a food processor or blender and puree until smooth. Stir in the feta. Season to taste with salt, pepper and creme fraiche. Serve at room temperature or warm.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chickens and cook on each side until lightly browned. Sprinkle with seasonings and cover. Place in a baking pan and bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and cook for additional 10 minutes.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Chill.

Cut off both crusts from each slice of bread. Spread butter or margarine thinly on each slice of bread and sprinkle with seasonings. Top each slice with a small amount of onions and place in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Bake at 400 degrees for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and bake for another 5 to 7 minutes or until crusts are crisp. Melt butter in a sauce pan. Stir in flour and cook over medium heat. Stir in milk slowly. Add seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until thickened. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve over toast strips. Serves 4.
In large bowl beat together eggs, maple syrup, milk, salt and nutmeg until smooth. Divide mixture evenly among 4 custard cups. Bake at 350f for 25-35 minutes or until firm when touched with finger.

Add all ingredients to ground meat and mix well. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Stuff into hot dog rolls. Serve with additional relish and mustard.
name: sloppy joe sandwichesingredients: ground beef, onion, tomato paste, brown sugar, prepared mustard, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, ground allspice, hot dog bunspreparation:Brown beef and onion in large skillet. Stir in tomato paste. Add sugar, mustard, garlic and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve in buns.
name: sloppy joe sandwichesingredients: ground beef, onion, tomato paste, brown sugar, mustard, garlic powder, salt and black pepper, ground allspice, hot dog bunspreparation:Brown beef and onion in skillet. Add tomato paste. Stir in sugar. Add mustard, garlic and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer

In a large bowl combine the ground pork, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, water chestnuts and green onions. Mix well and then shape into balls. Place about a teaspoon of the pork mixture in the center of each wrapper. Dampen the edges of the wrapper with water and fold over the edges to form a half moon shape. Place on a baking sheet and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Heat the oil to 375 degrees. Place the dumplings in the oil and cook until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Serve with the hoisin sauce.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper and set aside. In a small bowl, stir together soy sauce, cider vinegar and sugarset aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd chilies and saute for 2 minutes or until chilies are softened and skins are blistered. Add chickencook for 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add soy sauce mixturecook for 2 more minutes or until chicken is done. Cut rolls into halves and place on a baking tray. Spread bottom of rolls with mayonnaise and sprinkle with cheesetop with chicken and green chilies. Broil for about 2 minutes or until cheese is melted and top is crispy.

In a large saucepan, combine butter and garlic. Saute for 1 minute. Add flour and stir for 3 minutes. Add milk. Stir constantly until thickened and smooth. Add the chicken and heat through. Add the pasta and toss. Sprinkle with parsley and grated cheese. Serves 4.

In a large skillet saute onion and garlic in oil until onion is tender and lightly browned. Stir in cayenne and bacon and saute until bacon is crisp. Stir in the oysters and cook until oysters are heated through and liquid has evaporated from skillet. In a shallow dish mix together the dry bread crumbs and the cheese. Dip the cooked oysters in the egg and then in the bread crumb mixture. Place in skillet and brown until browned on both sides and the coating is crisp and golden. Serve immediately.

Heat the butter and saute the onions in the saucepan until soft and lightly brown. Add the flour and blend well. Add the milk and cook over low heat until thick and smooth, stirring constantly. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the salt, pepper and mace and cook for about five minutes more. Add the egg yolks and cook for a few more minutes, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and becomes smooth. Stir in the parsley and serve hot in the individual bowls or mugs. Makes 4 servings.

Place nuts in a single layer in an ungreased shallow pan. Combine butter, liqueur and orange rind in small saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heatcook 3 minutes. Remove from heatstir in nuts until coated. Arrange on wax papercool 10 minutes. Store in an airtight container.

Place chops in a resealable plastic bag and pour in remaining marinade ingredients. Seal bag and turn to coat chops evenly with marinade. Place on grill over medium heat and cook until browned and meat thermometer reads 150f for medium doneness, about 10 minutes per side. Transfer to a platter and let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
 spicy sweet potato soupingredients: sweet potato, ginger root, onion, peeled and finely choppedpreparation:Peel and finely chop potato and onion. Saute over medium heat until potato is almost cooked through and onion is translucent. Stir in ginger and cook for one minute more. Season with pepper to taste and pour into bowls. Garnish with sour cream and chopped green onion and serve hot with crackers.

Spread margarine on one side of each slice of bread. Put tomato slices on one side of each slice of bread. On the other side of each slice of bread put slices of bell pepper and slices of ripe olives. Place a slice of swiss cheese on top of each sandwich. Cook sandwiches in a preheated frying pan until both sides are golden brown. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Melt butter in 9 inch square baking dish. Cook and stir onions in butter until softened. Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Add to onions and stir until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens and boils. Sprinkle in cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Stir in carrots. Sprinkle with crumb topping. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Topping: Combine crumbs and margarine in small bowl. Press over casserole. Bake an additional 15 minutes.

Preheat grill to high heat. Salt each side of the roasting chickens with a 1/4 teaspoon of each of the spices. Place each piece skin side down on a baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes per side or until a thermometer reads 160 degrees fahrenheit in the thickest part of the chickens. Brush both sides of each piece with 1/2 teaspoon each of the spices. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of each of the sauces. Serve with sliced scallions and a few springs of fresh ginger.
A lot of people today like to use an electric grill to cook their foods. This is a great way to cook foods because it allows you to control your temperature better than a charcoal grill. It is also a much cleaner way to cook foods than a charcoal grill. Here are a few tips to help you make a great electric grilled meal!
When you are cooking meats on an electric grill, you want to make sure that you are not using a lot of heat for a long period of time

In a large bowl combine the meats and all but 1/2 cup of the bread crumbs. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of bread crumbs and mix again. Add the seasonings and mix well. Shape into 1 inch meat balls. Place in a baking pan and bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes or until done. You may serve them on a bun like a burger or with pasta. You can also serve them with a homemade sauce.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Heat the oil in the oven. Rinse and dry the pheasant and pat dry with paper towels. Rub the bird inside and out with the honey mixture. Place the pheasant in a shallow roasting pan and place in the preheated 450 degree oven. Roast for 30 minutes or until the skin is crisp and golden. Reduce the heat to 325 degrees and continue roasting for another hour. Sprinkle the pheasant with additional honey mixture during the last half hour of cooking. Remove from the oven and allow the pheasant to rest for 5 minutes. Garnish with the tarragon and serve immediately.
In a large skillet, heat butter and olive oil. Add edamame, corn, and onions. Cook until tender. Add sherry and cook 5 minutes. Add basil and stir well.

Remove stones from plums and chop roughly. Place into a large heavy bottomed pot with the water and simmer until tender but not too soft (20 mins). Pour into a blender with the lemon juice, sugar, fresh ginger and zest of lemon until smooth. Pour back into pot and simmer until thick (30 mins). Pour into sterile jars and let cool before sealing. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread melted butter evenly in bottom of 9 x 13 inch pan. Evenly layer crumbs, then coconut and finally chips. Pour condensed milk over all. Sprinkle with peanuts. Bake for 25 minutes or until edges are light brown. Cool on wire rack. Chill until set and cut into bars.

In large bowl, beat egg white until foamy. Stir in pecans, almonds, cashews and seasoning salt. In small bowl, stir together brown sugar, curry powder and seasoning salt. Add curry mixture and toss until well coated. Spread on cookie sheet and bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour stirring occasionally. Cool thoroughly. Makes about 4 cups. Store in airtight container.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, garlic and chicken. Saute for 10 minutes. Add cold water to cover. Add sour cream, milk, season to taste with salt and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Break crackers into a food processorprocess until fine crumbs are formed. Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extractpour into a 9x13 inch pan. Press firmly onto bottom of panset aside. Combine milk, 1/2 cup brown sugar, vanilla extract, baking powder, and flourmix well. Pour into crust. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Combine the maraschino cherries with the coconutspread evenly over the surface of the bars. Return to the oven and bake for 10 minutes longer, or until set. Cool completely in the pan before cutting.

Preheat oven to 375. Cut top off peppers, remove seeds and place peppers in baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until skin is blistering. Remove from oven and let cool. In skillet heat enchilada sauce until warmed through. Remove from heat and add sausage to the sauce. Stir well. Fill each pepper with one half of the mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes.

Melt the butter over low heat in a small skillet or saucepan and add the mushrooms. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook over medium heat until tender and the liquid is evaporated. Add the wine and bring to a simmer. Add the salmon and cover the pan with a lid or a piece of foil. Simmer gently for 8 minutes or until the fish is just cooked through. Remove from the heat and discard the mushrooms. Meanwhile, bring the cream to a simmer in a small saucepan over low heat and cook for about 3 minutes or until reduced by half. Remove from the heat and stir through the tarragon, then season to taste with salt and pepper. Drain the salmon and arrange on a warm plate with a little of the sauce spooned over it. Serve immediately, with some of the sauce spooned over the fish and some on the side.

In a crock pot combine potatoes, onion and soup. Stir until combined. Add milk and bring to a boil. Cover and cook on high for 2 hours or until tender. Uncover and stir in cheese. Cover and cook for another hour. Stir in pimiento and pepper. Cover and cook for another hour. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream the butter with the sugar and vanilla. Beat the egg yolks with a fork and stir into the mix, followed by the sifted dry ingredients. Beat the egg whites with a fork until stiff peaks form, then fold into the mixture with the almonds. Pour into a 25 cm greased springform pan or similar pan with straight sides. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until firm to touch and golden brown on top. Remove from oven and let cool in pan on rack for 15 minutes. Turn onto rack to cool completely. To decorate, spread with strawberry jam and top with heavy cream before serving. Serves 8 to 10.

Peel and slice potatoes lengthwise. Cook in boiling salted water until done and drain. Melt margarine in skillet and saute potatoes and vegetables until heated through. Stir in onion soup mix and cook for about 2 minutes. Serve hot.

Cook frozen peas in boiling water until crisp tender. Drain and chill. Combine other ingredients well in a large bowl. Add the cooked peas to mixture. Fold together gently. Refrigerate overnight. Serve chilled on lettuce leaves as a sandwich filling or as a side dish with hot roast beef or pork.

In saucepan, cook and stir butter and onion until tender. Remove from heat. Add soups and half-and-half. Heat to a boil. Add sherry and cook 1 minute. Add crabmeat and cook over low heat 2-3 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally. Serve over hot rice.

Rinse the pomegranates under running water. Cut the pomegranates in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds from the halves with a spoon and discard the pulp. In a bowl add the pomegranate seeds and the other ingredients. Mix well. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with the mint leaves before serving.
Shake first 3 ingredients with ice cubes. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime slice.

Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer for 15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Cool completely before using. Store covered in refrigerator for up to one week. Use as a dipping sauce or a marinade.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line the bottom of a 13 by 9 inch baking pan with white castle hamburgers. Spread the chilies over the hamburgers. Sprinkle the cheddar over the top. Beat together the egg, milk and seasonings in a bowl. Pour the mixture over the top. Cover and bake for about an hour.

Beat butter and sugar together until light and creamy, add in the egg and continue beating. In a separate bowl mix together the dry ingredients and stir into the butter mixture. Mix until the batter is smooth. Spread batter into a 9x13 pan and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool completely. Beat together cream cheese and orange juice until smooth and spread evenly over the cooled bars. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and orange zest before serving.

To make the filling, put the tomatoes in a bowl with the sugar, salt and pepper and leave for about an hour or so. Then pour into a food processor and pulse until smooth. Sift the flour into a bowl, then make a well in the centre and pour the tomato mixture into the well. Gradually add the egg and then the olive oil, mixing well until a thick dough is formed. Divide the dough into eight pieces and roll each into a ball. In a large frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the balls of dough, turning occasionally until golden brown all over (about eight minutes). Remove from the pan and drain on paper towel. Sprinkle over the mint leaves before serving.

Heat oil in large skillet. Add onion and cook until softened. Add shrimp and saute for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Serve over rice or pasta.

Place carrots in a saucepan of boiling water for 3 to 5 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain. Place carrots in a medium bowlset aside. In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heatadd brown sugar and bourbonbring to a boil. Pour bourbon mixture over carrotstoss to coat. Garnish with parsley. Serves 4 to 6

Slice the prosciutto and place a slice on each piece of cheese. Wrap up the prosciutto around the cheese and roll in the panko. Place in a skillet and add a little bit of olive oil. Fry for about 5 minutes each side. Plate and drizzle with the cranberry sauce. Serve with salad greens.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the margarine, italian bread crumbs, oregano, basil, garlic powder and salt. Add the cauliflower florets and mix well. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until tender. Serve hot.

Mix radish, bell peppers, and carrots. Add dressing and dill. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Add more dressing if desired. Chill overnight. Serve over cooked potato pancakes or baked potatoes.

Heat the oil in a stockpot over medium-high heat. Add the sausage to the pot and cook until browned. Stir in the carrot and cook 5 minutes. Stir in the onion and cook 5 minutes. Stir in the Italian seasoning. Add the stock and the kale. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 25 minutes. Stir in the pasta. Simmer 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Bring stock to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Stir in couscous. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Add pine nuts, apricots and sultanas. Gently toss to combine. Serve with cooked chicken. Drizzle with french dressing. Sprinkle with mint.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In small bowl combine salad dressing and waterpour over salmon. Bake uncovered 25 to 30 minutes or until salmon is firm and opaque in center. Sprinkle with lemon juice and mushrooms and serve.
In blender combine honeydew, lime juice and honey. Blend until smooth. Add yogurt and blend until smooth. Spoon into bowls. Top with honeydew balls.

Heat oil in a wok 180 degrees. Add onion and capsicum and cook until soft. Add broccoli and prawns and cook until prawns are cooked through. Add noodles and teriyaki marinade and mix through. Serve immediately.

Melt margarine in skillet. Add shallots and saute till tender. Add green beans and stir. Add enough chicken broth to cover the beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until beans are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese.

Combine the first four ingredients in a large bowl and stir to mix well. Add the catfish fillets and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove the catfish from the refrigerator and allow to come to room temperature for 30 minutes. Combine the cornmeal and the salt and pepper on a plate and place another plate of flour next to it. Dip each catfish fillet in the buttermilk mixture and then in the cornmeal mixture and then in the flour mixture to coat thoroughly. Heat the oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until hot. Add the catfish and cook, turning once, until golden brown and cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.

First wash the strawberries. Slice them and let them stand in the sink for about five minutes so the juice will run out. In large bowl mix the sour cream and whipped topping together. Drain the juice from the berries and mix it with the sour cream mixture. Toss the berries gently and add the nutmeg. Spoon the mixture into a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Chill for one hour and serve.

Place the water in a saucepan and bring it to a boil. Add the salt and the rice. Stir well and bring back to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat until the rice is tender. Drain the liquid from the mushrooms into a measuring cup. Add enough additional water to make one cup. Bring the liquid to a boil in a covered sauce pan. Add the finished rice and stir well. Saute the onions and mushrooms in the butter. Add the cream cheese and stir until it is completely melted. Beat the eggs in a small bowl. Add them and the evaporated milk to the pan with the mushrooms and onions. Stir and heat through. Turn into a greased two quart casserole. Spoon the rice mixture over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes.

In a saucepan combine the water, splenda brown sugar blend, cinnamon and chili powder. Stir until well mixed. Stir in the dark cocoa until it dissolves. Remove from heat. Stir in the milk. Stir in the vanilla extract. Pour into mugs. Serve with cinnamon sticks and whipped cream. Makes 16 servings.

Cook the spaghetti according to the pack instructions and set aside. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a frypan and fry the bacon for 3-4 mins until crisp. Add the zucchini and cherry tomatoes to the pan and fry for 3-4 mins. Add the pesto sauce and fry for 1-2 mins. Toss the bacon mixture through the pasta and top with parmesan.

Crack and whisk together eggs, milk and seasonings in a mixing bowl. Melt butter in a 9-inch pie plate. Add chopped bacon and sauté for 5 minutes or until cooked through and lightly browned. Add vegetables and sauté for 3 minutes or until tender. Pour the egg mixture into the pie plate and mix well with the other ingredients. Add the cheeses and continue to mix well. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the center is set and the top is golden brown. Serves 4 to 6.
Place chickpeas and water in food processor. Blend. Add next four ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a saucepan or large pot over low heat, combine coffee beans, red pepper flakes and whole cloves. Add water and simmer for 15 minutes, then remove from heat and set aside to cool. Strain coffee grounds from hot water and set aside to cool completely. Add coconut milk and honey to the strained water and mix well. Serve hot with cinnamon sugar cookies or toast with butter or cream cheese spread and fresh fruit.

Boil the potatoes for 10 minutes or until just tender. Drain the potatoes and place them in a bowl. Toss the potatoes with the bacon. In a small bowl combine the dijon, olive oil, broth, vinegar, and garlic. Stir until all the ingredients are combined. Pour the mixture over the potato and bacon. Add the green onions and the parsley. Toss to blend the flavors. Cover the dish and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan, or line with parchment paper. Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a small bowlset aside. Beat butter and sugars in a large mixing bowl until creamy. Beat in the vanilla and eggs one at a time until smooth. Stir in the dry ingredients and chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean. Let cool on a wire rack and cut into squares.

Spray skillet with cooking spray. Add chickensprinkle with cumin and season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until browned. Drain excess grease. Add curry powderstir until well blended. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 30 minutes or until chicken is done. Add frozen peassimmer until heated through. Mix couscous and raisins. Add to skillet mixture. Stir until well blended. Serve immediately.
I'm a little confused by your statement that the nutrition values are incorrect. When I looked at the nutrition facts for 1/8th of the recipe (the amount in the serving column), it appears to be accurate.
If it were my own recipe I'd probably add some salt. Other than that I'd say it's a good starting point.
I just tried this recipe last night and the flavor was amazing!
I cooked the rice in the same pan as the chicken, and I used 1/2 tsp of curry powder instead of 1

Lightly brush one side of each slice of bread with butter. Layer bottom half of sandwich with salami, ham and provolone. Layer other half of sandwich with salad and provolone. Brush tops of sandwiches with butter. Spread olive salad on bottom half. Close sandwiches. Brush tops of sandwiches lightly with butter. Place sandwiches in hot panini grill or on griddle. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Cut sandwiches in half. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Place almonds in a roasting pan and sprinkle with sugar, salt and water. Bake at 270c for 2 hours until golden brown and crispy. Let cool completely. Melt honey and add oil and brush over roasted almonds. Let cool completely and store in an air tight container.

Preheat oven to 190 degrees c. In each of 4 4 oz ramekins, combine 2 tbs amaretti crumbs and 2 tbs short grain rice. Add 1/2 cup caster sugar and 1/2 cup whole milk. Heat in microwave for 2 minutes or until bubbling. Stir in 1 ounce white chocolate. Bake for 5 minutes or until set. Let cool slightly before serving. Serves 4.

In a large Dutch oven or saucepot over medium-high heat, cook meat until brown. Drain. Add pasta sauce and waterbring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in pasta and simmer for 10 minutes. Add mushrooms and simmer 3 minutes more. Sprinkle with cheese.

Trim fat from round steak. Cut into serving pieces. In a 4-6 quart kettle or dutch oven, saute the onion, carrot and green pepper in a small amount of oil until tender. Add the steak, beef broth and gravy mix. Simmer covered for 1 1/2 hours or until tender. Serve with noodles or rice.

Sauté bacon until crisp. Remove from pan. In the same pan saut rice until lightly browned. Add onion, celery, and broth. Bring to boil. Cover tightly. Simmer 20 minutes. Add corn and cook 5 minutes. Stir in crumbled bacon. Salt to taste. Sprinkle with dried chervil.

Place sugar and water in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Stir constantly until sugar reaches hard ball stage (260 degrees on a candy thermometer). Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a small bowl, beat egg white with a pinch of salt until frothy. Gradually beat in vanilla and cinnamon. Beat in 1/4 cup of the syrup until thick and glossy. Gently fold in nuts until coated. Spread mixture onto wax paper. Let cool at room temperature or in the refrigerator until set (24 hours). Store in an air-tight container at room temperature.

Heat 1 tbsp oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 min. or until fragrant. Add sweet red pepperscook 3 min., stirring often. Add 2 tbsp water to skilletcover. Cook 3 min., stirring often. Add remaining 1 tbsp oilcover skilletcook 3 min., stirring often. Add spinachcook 1 min., stirring often. Add hot pepper flakescook 1 min., stirring often. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring 4 quarts of water to boil. Add salt and cook pasta according to directions on package. Drain well. Melt butter and add cream cheese, stirring until creamy. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add garlic powder and ground black pepper. Stir well. Add pasta and heat through. Stir in parsley and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut corn kernels from corn and place in small saucepan. Add 2 cups of water and simmer until kernels are tender and cooked through. Remove from heat and puree until smooth and creamy using hand blender or food processor. Stir in 2 tbsp mayonnaise and 1/2 tsp chipotle chile powder (or less if you prefer milder). Stir in 1/4 cup feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place a layer of refried beans in the bottom of a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Place a layer of the white corn tortilla chips on top of the beans. Sprinkle the onion and jalapeno over the chips. Add another layer of refried beans and sprinkle the cheeses over it. Place another layer of chips over it. Add the remaining refried beans. Sprinkle the chili over it. Top it off with the remaining chips. Place the dish in the oven. Bake for 10 minutes. Top with the green onion and tomato. Serve immediately.
I had to get this for my husband for Christmas and he loved it! Thanks for the great service!

Heat oil in a large skillet or dutch oven. Add pork and cook over medium heat until browned on both sides. Add mushrooms, onion and cook until onion is tender. Stir in cracked pepper and salt. Stir in red wine. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for about 1 hour. Add parsley and cook for about 10 minutes longer. Serve over spaetzle or rice.

Wash okra. Slice it thinly. Slice onion thinly. Slice green chillies thinly. Grate the fresh ginger. Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a pan. Add chopped onions. Sauté till it changes color. Add okra. Sauté for 5 minutes. Add green chillies, grated ginger. Sauté for 3 minutes. Add turmeric powder. Add water. Add salt to taste. Cook covered for 5 minutes. Add the ground spices. Cook for 1 minute. Add lemon juice. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat egg yolks in a medium bowl. Gradually add the milk and beat well. Add the lime juice and beat again. Pour the mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 12 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes and refrigerate. Serve with whipped cream and fresh lime.

Heat the oven to 350 f. Grease and lightly flour a 13 x 9 inch pan. Beat the flour, baking powder and cinnamon in a bowl. In a saucepan combine the rhubarb, white sugar, and the water. Cook over medium heat until the rhubarb is softened, about 5 minutes. Drain the rhubarb in a colander and set aside to cool. In another bowl cream the vegetable oil and the brown sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat after each addition until well blended. Stir in the flour mixture and the rhubarb mixture. Fold in the oats and pour into the pan. Bake for about 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool before cutting and serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, combine white sugar and butter. Beat until light and creamy. Add eggnog and beat until well blended. Add egg yolks and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Stir in the dry ingredients. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Makes about 12 dozen cookies.

Cook macaroni according to package instructions. Drain. In a large bowl, combine cooked macaroni, butter, evaporated milk, milk, sharp cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, and velveeta cheese until smooth. Add ground cayenne pepper and salt & pepper to taste. Spread mixture into a greased casserole dish and top with more cheese if desired. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until bubbly and browned on top.
Combine marinade ingredients. Marinate chicken overnight or at least 8 hours. Grill or broil chicken over medium heat. Turn and cook until done. Serve with rice.

Brown the sausage and ground beef together. Remove from pan and set aside. Add the celery and green bell pepper and cook for a few minutes. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the garlic, cayenne pepper and black pepper. Add the rice and stir until the rice is well coated with the seasonings and vegetables. Add the reserved sausage and ground beef. Cook until the rice is tender. Add the water and cook until the liquid is absorbed.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Sift the flour, baking powder, and cardamom together. Cut in the butter and combine with the flour mixture. Beat the egg and add the egg mixture into the flour and butter mixture. Add the lingonberry preserves and mix until just moist. Divide the batter into two greased and floured 9-inch pans. Bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, make the topping. Beat the butter with the brown and granulated sugars until creamy. Add the oatmeal and the vanilla extract and beat until combined. Spread the streusel topping evenly over the cake. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the cake is done. Let cool on a wire rack.

I usually use 3-4 jars of pickles, but you can use more or less. I use 1/4 cup sugar for the whole batch. If you like them sweeter you can use more. Just taste and see if you like it. I use 4-6 cloves of crushed garlic per jar. Again you can use more or less. I like a lot of garlic. And I use 1/2 a tablespoon of Tabasco per jar. That is a nice amount of heat. I don t add any other seasonings to the pickles. I just like it like that.

Put potato in a large pot of salted water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes, until tender. Drain and place potatoes back in the pot over low heat and shake the pan to remove excess moisture. Peel. Put through a potato ricer and immediately add 1 tablespoons of heavy cream and add as much melted butter and salt and pepper as you feel like. Eat immediately.
Gramma grampa fjerstad s lefse
Scalloped potatoes curdle free
Nora ephron s mashed potatoes
Homemade potato soup
Potato nuggets with dill cream
Swedish creamed potatoes with dill
Baba marion s perogy dough
Cheesy spuds dauphinoise
Gramma grampa fjerstad s lefse (1)
Scalloped potatoes curdle free (1)
Nora ephron s mashed potatoes (1)
Homemade potato soup (1)
Potato nuggets with dill cream (1)

In a microwave-safe bowl, combine all ingredients except the egg. Mix well. Beat egg and egg white until blended. Add to pumpkin mixture. Heat in microwave on high for about 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.
Cut chicken breasts into strips. Combine all other ingredients in a sauce pan. Stir over medium heat until bubbly. Add chicken strips and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Heat the oil in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the zucchini and onioncook, tossing often, for 5 minutes or until the onion has softened. Add the garlic, oregano, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the tomatoescook for 1 minute or until heated through. Add the roasted red pepperscook for 1 minute or until heated through. Add the fish to the skilletcook for 1 minute on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve immediately.

Combine the eggs, sugar, and cocoa powder in a large bowl. Add the cream and milk and stir well. Stir in the vanilla extract and honey. Pour the mixture into a large bowl or container with a tight fitting lid. Cover and freeze. To serve, let ice cream soften slightly at room temperature for about 15 minutes. Transfer ice cream to a freezer-safe container. Place the crackers in a single layer on a plate. Top each cracker with a square of chocolate and a marshmallow and drizzle with a little hot fudge or caramel sauce if desired. Serve with a scoop of ice cream.

In a 2 qt. saucepan over medium heat, combine oysters with butter, water, worcestershire sauce, and salt to taste. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 5 minutes or until oysters are heated through. Cut potato into 1 inch cubes. Cook in the microwave until tender. Drain. In a small bowl, combine the potato cubes with the low-fat milk, white pepper, and ground nutmeg to taste. Serve stew in a bowl. Sprinkle potato cubes over the top.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute squash until browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add water, salt and pepper. Simmer until squash is tender, 6-7 minutes. Stir in basil.

Bring a medium pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add string beanscook 6 minutes or until crisp-tenderdrain. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup sugar, the next 2 ingredientssprinkle over the beans. In a large skillet coated with cooking spray, saute the mushrooms over medium heat for 2 minutesstir in the next 2 ingredients. Stir the mushroom mixture into the beansdrizzle with whipped cream. Serve immediately.

Pour 6 cups of water into a large pot. Bring it to a boil and add the tea bags. Boil for about 5 minutes. Cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. When ready to serve, stir the contents of the pot with a wooden spoon until the sugar dissolves. Stir in the baking soda until it is fully dissolved. Pour through a strainer into glasses or pitchers. Serve with ice cubes or chilled if desired. Serves about 8 people.

Heat oven to 350f. Lightly grease 13x9x2-inch baking pan or 12-cup muffin pan. Combine all in medium bowl. Spread evenly in prepared pan or muffin cups. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden and bubbly. Serves 8-10.
I have just taken this off the top of my fridge where it has been for the last 2 days since I made it. I did make it with 1 large Granny Smith apple and 1 large Bramley apple as that is what I had in and it is delicious. I used unsalted butter and about 1 tsp of cinnamon and a little more brown sugar. It was so quick and easy and the result was absolutely fantastic - even my hubby liked it and he never eats apple pie!
I made this today and it is fantastic! I didn't have any brown sugar so I used white and added a little more cinnamon than the recipe called for and it was perfect! I will be making it again and again! Thanks!
I just made

Beat eggs with a wire whisk. Add light cream, salt and pepper. Stir in the worcestershire sauce. Cook in a skillet over medium heat. Stir constantly while cooking. Cook only until eggs are set. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

Combine wine and salt in a medium saucepan. Add halibut fillets. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook over low heat for 4 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Combine the breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, sour cream, and onions in a large bowl. Spoon about 1/2 cup of the sauce over the fish. Spread with the breadcrumb mixture. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until fish is heated through. Serve immediately with the remaining sauce.

Combine all of the pesto ingredients in a food processor or blender and process until smooth, scraping down the sides as needed. Coat shrimp with the pesto and then refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat a gas or charcoal grill until the coals are hot enough that a wood chip will burn for 5 seconds before going out. Grill the shrimp until the pesto is well browned (about 3 minutes on each side). Serve with the pesto on the side for dipping.
Name: Tomato Pesto SpaghettiIngredients: Spaghetti, pesto sauce (olive oil, basil, pine nuts, Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, lemon juice, garlic), Parmigiano Reggiano cheesePreparation: Cook spaghetti according to package directionsDrain well. Toss with pesto sauce and serve with Parmigiano Reggiano cheese.
Name: Parmigiano Reggiano Pesto PizzaIngredients: Pizza dough (bread flour, water, salt, instant yeast

In a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat, mix together the first four ingredients. Add snow peas, stirring occasionally. Cook 2-3 minutes. Add radish and stir to combine. Cook 2 minutes. Add scallions and cashewstoss and cook 1 more minute. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375. Mix cranberries and panko together. In a shallow bowl beat together egg whites. Dip each salmon filet in egg whites. Then coat with cranberry mixture. Place fish in greased baking pan. In a small saucepan melt 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat. Stir in the green onion and thyme until mixture is fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour this mixture over the salmon. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large bowl toss together the apples, cranberries, onion and cashews. Combine the mayonnaise, lemon rind and juiceadd to the salad and mix well. Place on a bed of crisp romaine lettuce and serve immediately or chill for several hours before serving.
name: apple cheese saladingredients: red apples, fresh lemon juice, celery, swiss cheese, mayonnaise, prepared mustard, salt and pepper, lettuce leaf, filbertspreparation:Put apples in a serving dish. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Add celery and cheese. Mix mayonnaise and mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Add to apple mixture. Refrigerate 1 hour to blend flavors. Serve in lettuce cups sprinkled with nuts.
name: apple country chicken saladingredients: cooked chicken, mayonnaise, orange juice, apple jelly, lemon juice, celery, apples, walnutspreparation:In a large bowl, mix mayonnaise

Preheat the oven to 190°C (375°F). Grease two cookie sheets with margarine and line them with parchment paper. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the margarine until smooth and creamy. Add the marzipan, and beat until smooth and creamy. Add the egg and beat until smooth and creamy. Add the flour and salt and mix well. Add the poppy seeds and currant jam and mix until combined. Divide the dough into two pieces and roll each into an 8 inch (20 cm) log. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 1 hour or until firm enough to roll. Cut the dough logs into 1/4 inch (1/2 cm) slices and place them on the prepared cookie sheets about 1 inch (2.5 cm) apart. Bake for about 12 minutes or until just set. Cool on the cookie sheets for about 5 minutes and then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

Sift dry ingredients together and mix well with other ingredients except sweet potato. Peel and chop potatoes into small chunks and cook in boiling water until soft (15 to 20 mins). Drain and mash and leave for about 1/2 hour until cool enough to handle. Add mash and mix well. Drop batter in tablespoonfuls into hot oil and cook until golden brown. Drain on paper towel and serve immediately with sour cream or yoghurt and a salad.

In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the fennel bulbs. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the bucatini and cook until the pasta is al dente. Stir in the wild fennel and cook until the fennel is crisp-tender. Drain the pasta in a colander. Add the anchovy fillets to the pan with the pasta. Stir in the red pepper flakes and cook for a minute. Season with the pepper and salt. Serve hot.

Combine cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayo, garlic, onion powder, tabasco sauce in a small bowl. Place in a pastry bag and pipe into a log shape onto a platter. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least one hour to firm up. Cut into thin slices. Garnish with pimento stuffed olive. Serve with butter flavored cracker.

Combine all the ingredients for the chipotle mayo in a small bowl and set aside. Place a flour tortilla on a work surface and spoon in about 1/2 cup of the turkey mixture. Top with some of the romaine and some of the chipotle mayo. Roll up tightly and cut in half. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl add tuna, mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, and seasonings. Add peas and roasted red pepper. Toss to combine.
