Cook pasta according to package directions and rinse under cold water until cool. Add to tuna mixture and stir gently to combine. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve with lettuce leaves.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onionsaute 5 minutes or until tender. Add the green beanssaute 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add the watercover and cook 3 minutes longer or until heated through. Add the parsleytoss to coat. Sprinkle with the seasonings.
A perfect side dish to go with your main course.
In a small bowl combine the tomato sauce with the cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves and cayenne pepperset aside.
Place the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the green beans and saute for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the tomato sauce mixture and the water and mix well. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the green beans are tender. Remove from the heat and let cool for 10 minutes.
Serve warm over rice or couscous.
This recipe was created as an entry in the 2008 Green Bean Recipe Contest

Prepare the first six ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the first seven ingredients through the

Clean and sort the lentils. Add them to a pot and cover with water. Add the hocks and bring to a boil. Simmer 5 minutes and remove the hocks. Add the celery and the onions and cook slowly until tender. Add the garlic and cook a little longer. Add the brown sugar and bring to a boil. Add the lentil and hock broth and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and let simmer. Add the hocks and cook for another 30 minutes. Serve with bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart casserole dish. Layer half the potatoes in the bottom of the casserole dish. Layer half the tomatoes, half the onions, half the margarine, and half of the chopped herb over the potatoes. Repeat layers. Pour the milk over the top and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Cover the casserole dish with the aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Remove the foil and sprinkle the cheese over the top of the casserole. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a medium saucepan combine the first four ingredients. Bring to a boil on high heat, then reduce the heat to a medium low and boil gently until the mixture forms a soft ball when dropped into cold water. Remove from the heat and beat until mixture is stiff and glossy. Add the mayonnaise and orange rind, then beat for 1 minute longer. Pour the mixture into a buttered 9x13 pan or two 9 inch cake pans. Cool for 1-2 hours at room temperature or until firm to the touch. Cut into squares or rectangles, about 1x2 inches. Serve with the marshmallow topping. For the topping combine all the ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and stir constantly for about 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Pour over the fruit plate and serve. Serves 8 to 12.

Mix all ingredients together with hand mixer until smooth. Spread on crackers or bread cubes for appetizers or snacks. Store in fridge for up to two days. Makes 1 cup.
name: lebanese garlic sauceingredients: garlic, lemon juice, salt, olive oilpreparation: In the container of a blender, combine the garlic cloves, lemon juice and salt. Blend at medium speed until smooth. Continue blending while pouring olive oil into the blender in a thin stream. The mixture should become thick and white like salad dressing. Store refrigerated in a glass container.
name: cheesy lemon butteringredients: eggs, lemon juice, butter, sugar, lemon peel, cream cheese, saltpreparation: In heavy pan mix eggs, juice, butter, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil while stirring over low heat, then cook for 3 minutes more. Remove from heat and cool. Beat cream cheese and lemon peel. When egg mixture is cool, blend into

Combine marmalade and butter in a bowl. Stir in cold water and baking mix till soft dough forms. Divide into 10 equal pieces and pat out each piece on a lightly greased surface into a 3 inch round. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until golden brown and puffed. Cut into wedges and serve warm with marmalade on the side if desired.

Cream butter & sugar, add beaten egg. Then mix dry ingredients with milk, then mix all together. Chill for 1 hour. Roll out 1/4 thickness and cut out with cookie cutters. Bake 300 for 12-15 minutes. Cool on waxed paper.

Combine first 8 ingredients in slow cooker. Stir in chickencover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. Remove chicken from slow cooker with slotted spoon. Shred or cut into bite-size pieces. Discard bones. Return shredded meat to slow cooker. Stir in pineapple. Cook on high for 10 minutes. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 1 1/2-quart baking dish with melted butter. Peel and core 4 medium baking apples. Toss with 1/4 cup of the sugar, 1/4 cup of the flour, and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon in a shallow bowl. Arrange half of the apple mixture evenly over the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Cut up 1/2 loaf of bread into cubes, add to baking dish. Spoon remaining half of apple mixture evenly on top of bread cubes. In a medium bowl, whisk together 1 1/2 cups milk, eggs, remaining 1/4 cup of sugar, 1/4 cup of flour, orange zest, and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon until smooth. Pour egg mixture evenly over bread cubes and apples. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Bake in preheated oven until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean,
Brown ground beef with onions and salt. Drain. Mix in gravy mix and biscuits. Add milk and heat through. Serve.

Combine the ketchup, cider vinegar, orange and pineapple juices in a large saucepan. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Cook over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Bring to a boil again. Cook until thickened. Cool. Serve warm or cold.

sift together the dry ingredients. Mix the wet ingredients. Add the dry ingredients. Stir only until mixed. Mixture will be slightly lumpy. Pour batter into a greased bread pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes.

Combine sugar, flour and cinnamon in a mixing bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in orange juice and set aside for filling later. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Pour the filling evenly into the bottom of the pie shell. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven, and sprinkle the crumb mixture over the filling. Bake for an additional 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until filling is bubbly and crust is golden brown. Cool before serving.
Combine eggs with ricotta cheese. Add heavy cream, sweeteners, cinnamon, nutmeg. Pour into a greased pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cool. Serve.

Mix dry ingrediants and set aside. Beat together the wet ingrediants and add the dry ingrediants. Add the rice krispies and mix well. Drop by teaspoons on wax paper. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Allow to cool before storing. Yields 24 cookies.
I have been making this recipe for a couple years now. It is always a hit at the potlucks.
I have been making this recipe for a couple years now. It is always a hit at the potlucks.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the bell pepper and cook for 5 minutes. Add the onions and cook until soft. Add the cumin and cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken and the oregano and cook for 3 minutes. Add the chile and cook for 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Serve with rice.

Wash the lentils and rice well with water, then soak them together for 30 minutes and rinse again. Drain the water and add the rice and the lentils to a large saucepan of boiling water. Boil them for about 20 minutes or until the rice is tender but not overcooked and the lentils have softened. Drain the rice and the lentils and spread them out on a plate to cool down a little. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat and add the cumin and the black pepper and stir for a couple of minutes. Add the onions and stir for another 5 minutes or so until the onions have softened and turned translucent. Add the lentils and the rice to the frying pan and stir well so that all the grains of rice and the lentils are mixed together with the seasonings and the onions. Add the salt and the lemon juice and stir well so that the dish is thoroughly mixed together. Turn off the heat and leave it to cool for a while or serve it hot or warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute onion in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.
What kind of a cheese is used in the spinach quiche recipe?
I am allergic to whey. Is there a substitute I can use for this recipe?
If you are allergic to whey, I would suggest using non-dairy milk in its place.
Are you sure that's right? Whey is a type of dairy product. I'm not sure what to recommend as a replacement.
Is there a substitute for cottage cheese?
You may use ricotta

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a skillet, brown sausage, drain. In a medium bowl, combine sausage, cheese, eggs, salt and pepper. Pour mixture into a 9-inch pie plate or a glass 1 1/2-quart casserole dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Place 1 crescent roll on top of filling and press down gently. Repeat layers until you have 3 layers of crescent rolls on top of the filling. Bake 20 minutes or until filling is set. Cut into wedges to serve. Makes 12 servings.

Prepare the rice according to package directions. Combine the cooked rice with the whole milk, coconut milk, sugar, salt and coconut extract in a large bowl or pot. Bring to a boil over medium heat stirring frequently until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the coconut flakes. Chill for 2 hours or until ready to serve.

Crush the graham crackers using a food processor. Add the margarine and pulse until the crackers are wet and slightly sticky. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan and bake for 5 minutes. In a large bowl combine the soy cream cheese, pumpkin puree, light brown sugar, rum extract and spices. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Pour the mixture on top of the crust. Bake for 1 hour. Let it cool. Refrigerate it overnight before serving.

Beat eggs, water and biscuit mix together just until smooth. Stir in onion and half the cheddar cheese. Divide into four rectangles in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until set in center. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar cheese and cayenne. Bake an additional 2 minutes or until the cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine all ingredients except the pork chops. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Dry chops with paper towels and add to the hot skillet. Cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Transfer chops to a shallow baking dish and pour the sauce over the top. Bake until the chops are done.
I like the looks of all those pork chops. The swiss one looks real good.
Thanks for the recipes. I love pork chops and I have not had one for a long time. I will try one of these recipes soon. I like the apple sauce one best.
All of the recipes look good but I think the swiss one looks the best. I'm going to have to try it.
I love the idea of using the cranberry sauce on the pork. I have not seen that one before.
These sound pretty good. I might have to try the one with the apple sauce. I think it sounds really good.
I love all the recipes but the crock
Boil potatoes til soft. Add in shredded coconut, almonds, vanilla, and powdered sugar. Form into a ball and roll in melted dark chocolate. Store in fridge or freezer until ready to eat.

Mix together first 7 ingredients. Chop chicken. Add to mixture. Divide mixture into 4 portions. Place in middle of crescent roll dough. Roll up and pinch edges together. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Melt the butter in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Add the onion and saut until softened. Add the courgettes, then toss well. Cook until the courgettes are just tender. Drain the pasta and add to the pan with the cream. Cook until the cream has evaporated and the sauce has thickened. Stir in the parsley. Remove from the heat and stir in the walnuts. Divide the pasta between 4 plates. Top with grated parmesan.

Combine the coffee and sugar in a large pitcher and stir until the sugar dissolves. Add the vanilla bean and stir well. Pour into the blender and add the bananas, almonds and ice cubes. Process until smooth. Pour into tall glasses and serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients well. Form into 2 loafs. Place in a 9 x 13 pan and bake 1 hour at 350 degrees.

Cook the rice according to the directions on the package. In a separate skillet, saute the onion in the oil. Add the ground turkey. Break up the turkey with a wooden spoon as you cook it. Add the rest of the ingredients. Taste for seasoning. Serve over the rice.

Place ham shank in pressure cooker with about 2 cups of water. Cook for 40 minutes. Add diced potatoes, onions, carrots and cabbage. Cook 10 minutes with pressure cooker weight on. Remove weight and let cook an additional 10 minutes. Season with pepper to taste. Remove from pressure cooker, let stand 10 minutes and serve.

Rinse and chop spinach. In a large bowl combine all ingredients except for the boiling water and the butter. Mix well. Add 1/2 cup boiling water. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Add more boiling water 1/4 cup at a time until it forms a dough. Use a rolling pin and roll out the dough to make gnocchi. Boil a large pot of lightly salted boiling water. Add the gnocchi and boil for 2 minutes or until they rise to the top. Add the butter and serve immediately.

Combine sugar in a 3 quart saucepan and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Once the temperature reaches 240 degrees F. remove pan from heat. Add nuts and continue cooking until temperature reaches 265 degrees F. (hard crack) Remove pan from heat. In a small bowl combine rice flour and baking soda and set aside. Stir sugar nuts mixture into the rice flour and baking soda. After the candy has cooled enough to handle, begin rolling the candy into balls about the size of a walnut. The candy will stick together so keep on hand a damp cloth. To decorate the candy, break off a small piece of the candy and roll it into a ball. Using a sharp knife, cut a slice through the middle of the ball and use your fingers to pull apart the candy. Gently press a nut into the candy with your fingers and you have a dragon hair or dragon beard candy.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Sift dry ingredients together in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine butter and milk, whisk until smooth. Add liquid mixture to dry mixture, stirring with a wooden spoon just until batter is smooth. Pour batter into greased muffin tins or popover tins. Bake at 425 degrees for 10 minutes then reduce heat to 375 degrees and bake for another 10 minutes. Serve with preserves or honey.

Heat butter in 1-1/2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook 5 minutes or until tender. Add bell peppercook 5 minutes longer or until tender. Add tomatoescook 2-3 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Add beans and meatcook 3-4 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with paprika. Serve over baked potato or cooked pasta.

In a food processor with a metal blade or a blender container combine the meat, broth, onion and seasonings. Process until thoroughly combined. Heat mixture in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until thoroughly heated. Serve over hot cooked rice. To serve, ladle soup into two individual bowls. Spoon one tablespoon of sour cream on top of each. Swirl gently. Sprinkle with green onions.

Heat 1 Tbsp of the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the pine nuts and cook until golden. Remove from heat and stir in the chard and season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain pasta and add to the saucepan. Add the remaining olive oil to the saucepan and return to medium heat. Cook 2 minutes. Add the broth and tomatoes. Cook 2 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Top each serving with parmesan. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Season the chicken with salt. Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Put the seasoned chicken in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Pour the marinade over the chicken. Cover the dish with aluminum foil. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for another 15 minutes until the chicken is done. Garnish with the scallions and serve.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the brussels sprouts, season with salt to taste, and cook for 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add the lemon juice and water. Bring to a simmer. Add the sugar and cook until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat. Stir in the pepper. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine buttermilk and next 3 ingredients. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes. Stirring constantly remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Add the shrimp and cucumber and allow to chill. Add the green onions and serve chilled. Serves 4.
name: shrimp deviled eggsingredients: hard-boiled eggs, small shrimp, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, fresh dill, lemon juice, garlic salt, pepperpreparation:Cut peeled eggs in half lenghtwise. Scoop yolks out into a mixing bowl and mash with a fork. Add mayonniase, dijon mustard, dill, lemon juice, garlic salt, pepper and shrimp to egg yolks and stir to blend completely. Fill each egg white with yolk mixture. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
name: baby greens with mustard vinaigretteingredients: eggs, honey dijon mustard, white pepper

In a bowl, mix the dried apple, water and orange juice and zest. Add the cinnamon and salt and mix well. In a pastry bowl, combine the flour and salt. Cut in the shortening with a pastry blender or fork until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the water and stir until the dough comes together. Divide the dough into four portions and roll each into a ball. On a lightly floured surface, roll each ball into a 9-inch circle. Place the circles into a greased 9-inch pie plate and fit them together so that the edges of each circle overlap the edge of the pie plate. Scoop the dried apple mixture into the center of the pie shell and smooth the top with a spoon. Fold the edges over the top of the filling to form a top crust and pinch them together at the edge of the shell. Trim the top edge of the pie shell even with the top edge of the shell. Make a couple of small slits in the top of the pie for steam to escape and bake in a preheated 375 degrees F oven for 4
Whisk together dressing ingredients. Drizzle over the greens just before serving. This can be made ahead up to 1 day and refrigerated until serving time.

In a medium saucepan heat 1 cup water to boiling. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add lemon juice and gelatin. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Remove from heat and add 1/2 cup of the hot mixture to the remaining cold mixture. Beat until smooth. Pour into prepared crust. Refrigerate until set. Mix remaining 1/2 cup of hot mixture with whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Spread over the gelatin mixture. Refrigerate until set. Garnish with lime zest and serve.

Combine flour and baking powderset aside. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heatadd sugarstir until blended. Add beaten eggstir until well blended. Add vanillastir until well blended. Remove from heatadd flour mixturestir until well blendedspread in greased 11 x 17 jelly roll pan. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until top springs back when lightly touchedcool completely before cutting into squares. Sprinkle with chocolate chips or chopped nutsrefrigerate until ready to serve.

Brew tea according to package directions or steep lavender in 1 quart cold water for 15 minutes. Strain lavender. Add 3 cups of the tea or lavender-infused water and remaining ingredients to blender and blend until smooth. Chill until ready to serve. For iced tea, omit the lavender-infused water and chill the mixture for 2 hours. Serve in tall glasses over ice. Garnish with lavender sprigs or lavender flowers if desired.

Mix the graham cracker crumbs with melted margarine and brown sugar. Press firmly onto bottom of ungreased 15x10x1-inch pan. Bake at 350f for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool. Melt chocolate chips with the 1/2 cup of milk. Spread evenly over the cooled crust. Sprinkle with nuts. Chill until set. Cut into squares.

Peel carrots and cut in half lengthwise. Slice into strips about 1/4 inch thick. Heat cooking spray in large skillet over med-high heat. Add in carrots and onion and stir fry until they are light brown and crisp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Combine the cornstarch and the egg whites in a shallow bowl. Combine the panko and parsley in another shallow bowl. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Dip the chicken in the cornstarch mixture and then in the panko mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken until browned, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Prepare lemon jello according to the package directions, using 3 cups boiling water and 1 cup of frozen lemonade. Add frozen whipped topping and mix until blended. Pour into a 9 x 13 baking dish and refrigerate for 3 hours or until set up. Beat cream cheese and lemon jello until smooth. Add yello food coloring if desired and mix well. Spoon over mousse and refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with additional whipped topping if desired.

Place potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for approximately 12 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool slightly. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the potatoes and toss until coated. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the garlic and cook until the potatoes are golden brown and crisp, approximately 25 minutes. Stir frequently. Serve hot.

In a medium size bowl, cream together butter and sugars. Beat in egg and molasses. In another small bowl combine dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture and mix well. Cover and chill dough at least 30 minutes or overnight. Preheat oven to 350f. Drop dough by teaspoonsfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes until just slightly browned around edges. Remove from oven and transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Bring 1-2 quarts of water to a boil. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Drain water and allow to cool. Meanwhile, cook the orzo according to package directions. When the spinach is cool, squeeze out all of the water. Add the spinach to the cooked orzo, along with the butter, garlic, lemon juice, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine. Top with shredded parmesan cheese.

Heat oven to 350f. In skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towels to drain. Combine sour cream and onion. In another skillet over medium-high heat, combine mozzarella and butter. Add tomatoes. Cook until the mixture is bubbly and mozzarella is melted. Remove from heat. Spread 1/4 of the sour cream mixture in the bottom of each bread half. Top with bacon and 1/4 of the mozzarella mixture. Roll up and place seam side down in a greased 13x9 pan. Repeat with remaining bread and toppings. Combine the remaining sour cream mixture with the oregano and pour evenly over top. Bake 25-30 minutes or until heated through and topping is browned. Remove from oven. Top with basil leaves.

Pour orange juice into a large pitcher. Add honey and stir until dissolved. Add the pineapple juice, lime juice and rum. Add ice cubes and stir. Pour the ginger ale over the mixture to fill the pitcher and stir. Garnish with a large pineapple chunk and a few melon balls.

Heat the oil in wok over medium-high. Add eggs and scramble until they are no longer runny. Add the bok choy and stir-fry until they are tender crisp. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until cooked. Stir in the bamboo shoots. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat egg whites in a medium bowl until foamy. Add pecans, sesame seeds, and salt. Beat until mixture holds together when pressed into a ball. Shape mixture into 1 inch balls. Place in a single layer on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake 8 minutes or until golden brown. Place chicken in a single layer in a shallow dish. Combine hoisin and mustard in a small bowl. Brush mixture evenly over chicken. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. To prepare sauce, combine preserves and cornstarch in a small bowl. Heat over med high heat in a small skillet until thickened. Serve chicken tenders with apricot dipping sauce.

Cook broth with garlic and lemon juice. Remove garlic. Chop avocados into large chunks. Combine in blender with chicken stock. Add yogurt and blend. Add crabmeat. Chill for a few hours. To serve, sprinkle with parsley.

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add raspberries. Chill. Mix cream cheese and 1 cup sugar. Stir in cool whip. Spread in 9x13 inch dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Spread raspberry mixture on top. Chill. Mix 1/4 cup sugar with 1 tsp cornstarch and add a little water if necessary to make a paste. Spread on top of raspberry layer. Refrigerate until set. Garnish with additional raspberries and sprinkle with additional pretzels.

Mix hash browns with salsa, soup and beef in a large casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes.
Combine all of the above ingredients (except for the potatoes) into a large pot and let it simmer for about an hour and a half to two hours.
Cut the potatoes into little squares and add them to the mix and cook for another hour.

In a bowl, combine the cooked chicken, celery, breadcrumbs and fresh parsley. Salt to taste. Add the eggs and mix thoroughly. Put into a shallow baking dish. In another bowl, combine the melted margarine, chicken broth, flour and milk. Pour over the chicken mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.

In a medium sized microwave safe bowl combine butter and garlic. Microwave until melted and fragrant. Add shallots and cook until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in dried tarragon and thyme and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add mussels and cook until mussels have opened, about 3-5 minutes. Add ale and bring to a boil. Stir in parsley and chives. Serve with bread or toasted baguettes.

Brown chicken breasts in a large skillet. Add wine. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in butter, garlic powder, italian seasoning. Cook for 10 minutes. Add 1 cup of water, 1 envelope salad dressing mix. Cook for 20 minutes. Stir in cream cheese, cream of mushroom soup. Stir until heated through. Serve over angel hair pasta.

Mix sour cream, lemon juice, and sugar in a medium bowl. Fold in crushed pineapple. Place in individual paper cups. Freeze until firm. Remove from freezer about 10 minutes prior to serving. Top with bananas, nuts, and red food coloring.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl, blend together all dry ingredients. Add the melted butter, bananas, eggs and vanilla extract. Stir until just combined. Add chopped pecans and mix well. Fold in the banana slices and sprinkle with sea salt. Transfer batter into a greased loaf pan and place in preheated oven. Bake for about 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for about 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Mix dry ingredients in a bowl with a whisk. Add wet ingredients to dry. Fold in pecans. Pour into greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan before removing to cooling rack. Dust with powdered sugar.

In a large skillet, saute the onion and broccoli in 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Combine the broccoli mixture with the cooked white rice and 1 cup of the cheese in a 13 X 9 X 2-inch baking dish. Spread evenly. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1/4 cup butter, the sour cream and the remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Pour over the broccoli mixture. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a bowl and set aside. Spread the sourdough breads with the chive & onion cream cheese. Layer the sandwiches with the turkey, provolone, peppers and spinach. Spread the Dijon-Style Mustard mixture over the top halves of the sandwiches. Place the sandwiches in a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Cook until browned on both sides. Cut the sandwiches in half.

Peel and slice Granny Smith apples into eighths. Combine sugar, salt and spices. Toss with the apples and spread into the bottom of the pie crust. Mix together the flour and light brown sugar. Cut the butter into the flour mixture until it is crumbly. Sprinkle the streusel mixture over the top of the apples. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour or until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly. Cool on a wire rack.

In a large skillet saute almonds in butter until lightly browned. Add celery and mushrooms and cook until tender. Add the frozen mixed veggies and cook until heated through, stirring often. Stir in the soy sauce and enough water to cover the veggies. Bring to a boil and cook until liquid is evaporated. Sprinkle with parsley if desired. Serve over rice or noodles.

Cook the rice according to the directions on the package. While the rice is cooking, melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic. Cook until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms. Cook until the liquid is gone. Stir in the barley. Cook 5 minutes more. Add the chicken broth. Stir in the pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover. Cook 20 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the parsley. Serve the rice in a bowl.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Separate each crescent roll into 2 triangles. Wrap each triangle around an apple slice and place in a 9x13 baking pan. In a bowl combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 sticks of melted butter and pour over the rolls. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of cinnamon. Slowly pour 1 can of Mountain Dew around the rolls and sprinkle with 1/2 cup of sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat together eggs and corn syrup until fluffy. Add in pumpkin and mix until blended. In a separate bowl mix together brown sugar and kahlua. Pour into pie shell and bake for 1 hour.

Lay fillets in baking dish. Season with salt & pepper. Top with 1 cup spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup parsley. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup mozzarella. Bake for 5 minutes more. Cut into portions & garnish with remaining 1/3 cup parsley.

In a heavy large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the leek and cook until softened but not browned. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Add the cauliflower florets and cook until tender. Remove from the heat and purée the mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Season with the nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cube chicken breasts and place in crock pot with cream of chicken soup and broth. Cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours. Meanwhile, cook egg noodles and drain well. Remove chicken from crock pot and place on a plate and shred with two forks. Add butter to the crock pot and mix well. Add the shredded chicken and stir well. Serve with noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In 9x13 baking dish combine eggs, milk, salt and pepper and set aside. Melt butter in skillet and add bagels (2 per person) and cook about 2 minutes each side until golden brown. Remove from heat and place bagels in baking dish and pour egg mixture over bagels and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes until set and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the apples in a 12-inch baking dish with the water and butter. Cover and bake until the apples are tender but not mushy. Stir in the raisins and set aside. In a separate bowl, combine the oats, cinnamon and salt. In a small saucepan, combine the soymilk and maple syrup. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Pour over the oats and stir to combine. Top with the cooked apples and nuts. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350F. Season chicken with salt and pepperset aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heatadd chicken and cook, turning occasionally until browned on all sides. Place chicken in a large baking dishsprinkle with relish and top with any drippings in skillet. Bake, uncovered for one hour or until chicken is tender and juices run clear when pierced with a fork. Cut chicken into serving pieces and serve with sliced lemons. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli or green beans.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until golden. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in the tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened. Add the chili pepper flakes, vinegar, sugar and basil. Cook 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over pasta.

In a saucepan or skillet add the oil and saute the onion over medium heat until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the rice. Stir to coat and cook for 1 minute. Add the carrot and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the frozen veggies, season with the salt and pepper. Cook the veggies until tender. Add the basil and oregano. Stir to mix. Remove from the heat. Serve.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. In a large skillet brown the beef and drain. Add the spaghetti sauce and simmer. Pour half of the meat and sauce into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Add the pasta shells and pour the rest of the meat and sauce over the pasta shells. Combine light sour cream and whipping cream and add to the baking dish. Sprinkle the top with Parmesan and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the top is browned and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare macaroni according to package directions. Stir in tuna fish, cheddar cheese and potato chips. Spoon into a lightly greased 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.
Drain the water from the tofu and cut into -inch cubes. In a bowl, combine all other ingredients. Stir in tofu. Chill until ready to serve.

Heat the oil and red pepper in a large skillet over medium high heat until the garlic begins to color. Add the shrimp and cook until just pink and firm. Stir in the sherry or lemon juice. Remove from the heat and add the parsley and Old Bay Seasoning. Serve at once.

Grease a medium oven-safe baking dish with the butter and dust with nutmeg. Slice the dry white bread into 3/4-inch slices and arrange them in the bottom of the baking dish. Dot the top with the golden raisins. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and heavy cream until smooth and thickened. Add the milk and vanilla and whisk again until smooth. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, heat the egg whites and superfine sugar until the sugar has melted and the mixture is hot and foamy, about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and beat the mixture with a hand mixer until it becomes stiff and glossy, about 2 to 3 minutes. Fold the egg white mixture into the egg yolk mixture until incorporated and smooth. Pour the custard over the bread and let sit for about 5 minutes so the bread can soak up the custard. Place the dish in the oven and bake for 35 to 40 minutes until the

Preheat oven to 425. Peel and cube sweet potatoes. Cook in boiling water until fork-tender. Drain and mash until smooth, then stir in butter. In a small saucepan, combine milk and brown sugar. Cook over medium heat until warm and dissolved, about 1 minute. Pour milk mixture into sweet potato mixture and stir until just combined. Stir in pumpkin pie spice and blanched slivered almonds. Spoon mixture into prepared muffin cupssprinkle with additional almonds if desired. Bake until golden and puffed, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Slice leeks lengthwise into rounds. In a large saute pan, heat olive oil. Add leeks, garlic and salt. Saute on medium heat for 10 minutes or until leeks are tender. Add 1/2 cup water. Cook another 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Serve with crusty bread.

Cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. In a large bowl combine the broccoli florets, cheese, pineapple tidbits, raisins and onions. In a small bowl whisk together the mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar until smooth. Pour over the broccoli mixture and toss until evenly coated. Add the crumbled bacon, tossing to distribute.

Line a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with the chocolate wafers. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add sugar and cocoastir well. Add almonds. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in coffee and coffee liqueur. Pour over chocolate wafer layer. Bake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes. Spread cinnamon sugar over baked layer. Let cool. Dip balls into melted chocolate. Cool. Store in tightly covered container.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut each biscuit into four pieces. Arrange evenly in a 10-in. Fluted tube pan coated with cooking spray. Combine the brown sugar, cream and cinnamon. Pour over biscuit pieces. Bake in preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before inverting onto a serving platter. Sprinkle tops lightly with nuts, if desired.

Clean and prepare the kohlrabi. Cut off the top of the root. In a large pot of boiling water, blanch the kohlrabi for about 2 minutes. Drain. In a large skillet, melt the butter. Add the blanched kohlrabi. Add the sugar, and cook until the kohlrabi is lightly browned. Add the chicken broth. Stir in the parsley. Add the flour slowly, stirring constantly. Cook until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Beat butter on medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in the powdered sugar slowly until a spreadable consistency is achieved. Beat in cornstarch and then gradually beat in flour until just combined. Chill the dough for at least an hour. On a lightly floured surface roll out dough to about 1/4" thickness. Cut into shapes with a cookie cutter and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned around edges.

Peel carrot. Cut on the bias to form a 1/2-inch dice. Melt the butter and oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the carrot and cook, stirring constantly, until tender. Remove from heat and stir in the apple cider and brown sugar. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Return the pan to the heat and add the tarragon. Season with the salt and pepper and serve hot.

Cook the broccoli and French beans in boiling water for about 5 minutes. Drain. In a saucepan, combine the cashews, almonds, vegetable oil, onion, green onions, soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, ginger and red pepper flakes. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add the broccoli and French beans. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Salt to taste.

In a mixing bowl beat together the egg yolks and the condensed milk until well blended. Stir in the vanilla and beat until smooth. Pour the mixture into the ice cream maker canister and freeze according to the manufacturers instructions. After the mixture is frozen, add the whole cookies and continue freezing until the cookies are hardened and the ice cream is frozen and has the consistency of soft serve ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg yolks and cocoa. Add salt. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool. Beat whipping cream until stiff and fold into cooled filling. Garnish with nuts and chocolate curls. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat coconut milk in a large skillet. Whisk in the orange juice and zest. Bring mixture to a boil and lower heat. Stir in thai fish sauce. Add salmon and gently toss to coat. Remove from heat and set aside. In a small bowl, combine chili sauce and ginger. Place on a small plate. In another small bowl, combine mint and cilantro. Place on a small plate. Serve salmon with mint and chili on top.

Combine butter, brown sugar and salt in saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently, for 3-5 minutes or until mixture is melted and slightly bubbly. Add maple syrupcook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from heatcool slightly.

Grease a 2 quart baking dish or a deep sided 8x8 pan. Arrange bread cubes at the bottom of the pan. Top with the cooked sausage, then the grated cheese. Beat the eggs with the milk, salt and pepper and pour over the top of the baking dish or pan. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for one hour or until done. Serve with buttered toast or muffins or biscuits or whatever you want with your breakfast.

Split the jalapenos in half and remove the seeds, leaving the ribs intact. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese with the seasonings. Fill each of the pepper halves with the mixture. Wrap each one with a strip of bacon. Secure with a toothpick. Broil for about 10 minutes or until the bacon is crisp.
Peppers are hot, but they are also good for you! They contain the important antioxidant vitamin C. And they have a lot of vitamin A, which helps protect the eyes and boosts the immune system.
If you're looking for some spice for your recipe, use bell or jalapeño peppers. Bell peppers come in a variety of colors, from green to yellow to red to purple to brown. Jalapeño peppers are small and green with a pointed end, and they're very spicy.
Use raw bell peppers for salads, and roast or stir-fry jalapeños to add some heat to your meals.
You may be allergic to peppers if you have a runny nose after

Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Beat together the egg, orange juice, and water. Pour into the well. Mix until just moistened. Heat a griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray. Pour batter by the 1/4 cupful. Bake until small bubbles form on the surface of the pancake. Flip carefully with a spatula or a fork. Continue to cook until lightly browned on the other side. Serve with honey.

Wash the mushrooms. Put the butter, garlic granules and oil into a saucepan and heat gently until the butter has just melted. Add the mushrooms and fry gently for 5 minutes or until they begin to brown. Pour in the red wine and bring to the boil. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the wine has reduced by half.

Heat a skillet over medium heat and add butter, when foam subsides add 2 beaten eggs and cook until scrambled. Add milk and cook for 30 seconds more. Add a little salt and pepper, mix well and remove from heat. Arrange 1/2 of the egg mixture on 1/2 of each slice of bread. Top with slices of cheese and sprinkle with remaining egg mixture. Cook on a hot griddle until golden brown on each side and serve immediately.

Boil hot dogs in water for about 2 minutes or until done, remove from water and let cool. In a bowl beat the eggs and water until well blended. In another bowl combine the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, parsley flakes, pepper, oregano, paprika, italian seasoning and basil. Dip hot dogs into the egg mixture then dip into the crumbs mixture. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake uncovered in a preheated 425f degree oven for about 25 minutes or until the crumbs are golden brown.

Mix dry ingredients and press into bottom of greased tart pan. Spread with jam and set aside. Combine rhubarb and raspberries. Add orange zest and sprinkle with sugar, flour and spices and mix well. Pour into tart shell and bake for approximately 1 hour or until the fruit is cooked through. Cool before serving.

In a small bowl place dried apple slices. Cover with boiling water. Cover bowl and let stand for 20 minutes. Drain apple slices. In a heatproof container place apple slices along with sage leaves. Add whisky and stir. Place container on top of stove. Add honey, cinnamon stick and boiling water. Stir. Cover container. Simmer for 30 minutes over low heat. Stir occasionally. Strain liquid into mugs. Add 1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg. Garnish each mug with an apple slice. Makes 4 servings.

Boil zucchini until tender. Cool. Cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Saute onion with pimiento until tender. Stir in zucchini cubes. Add corn. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan, saute the potatoes in the butter for 5 minutes. Add the onion, garlic and creole seasoning. Continue sauteing for 1 minute longer. Add the green beans and enough water to cover the potatoes. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce temperature to medium-low heat and cover. Simmer for 5-10 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender and beans are crisp-tender. Drain well. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Combine all of the ingredients in a small bowl or jar. Cover tightly and shake to blend. Use immediately or store in a cool, dark place for up to 1 month. Rub on meats just before cooking or use to season grains, vegetables, or salad dressings.
Fry onions till brown and soft, then add tomatoes and fry till soft and mushy. Add water, curry powder and oxtail soup and cook till done. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Combine the quinoa flour, quinoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowlmake a well in the center. Beat the eggs in a small bowl, then stir in the honey and mashed bananaspour the mixture into the well in the dry ingredients.Stir just until all ingredients are incorporated. Spray a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. Scoop batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 fullsprinkle the tops with cinnamon, if desired.Bake in the preheated oven until the tops spring back when lightly pressed with a fingertip, 20 to 22 minutes.Remove from the ovencool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
I am a little surprised that the recipes do not call for more than one banana. Bananas are not expensive in my area.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix eggs, oil, sugar, vanilla and salt in large bowl until creamy. Add flour and mix just till blended. Fold in raspberry preserves. Roll out on lightly floured surface. Using cutters of your choice cut out rounds. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or till edges are lightly browned.

Crumble vanilla wafers and mix with powdered sugar. Melt oleo. Mix all together. Roll into balls and place on wax paper. Refrigerate overnight. Mix together frozen orange juice and coconut and roll balls in this mixture. Roll again in oleo. Let stand in refrigerator overnight.

Boil water with fat salt pork. Add in cod fish. Boil until tender. Add in boiling water. Add in raw carrot and raw potatoes. Boil until cooked. Add in milk and cook until thicken. Add in seasoning and serve with corn.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk and sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the egg yolks one at a time and whisk until the mixture is thick and custard like. Remove from heat and add the heavy cream and vanilla extract. Stir to combine. In a medium bowl combine the egg whites and salt. Beat on medium until soft peaks form. Fold the egg whites into the custard mixture. Add the Kahlua and Grand Marnier. Pour into small pudding cups. Place pots de crème in the refrigerator and chill for at least 2 hours. Top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of chocolate chips.

In a shallow bowl, mix together coconut, crushed corn flakes and macadamia nuts. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture, then coating with crumb mixture. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat and cook toast until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot with maple syrup and whipped cream.

In a saucepan prepare egg noodles as label directs. Drain in colander and return to saucepan. In a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add pot cheese, stirring constantly till melted. Add sour cream and heat through. Pour over noodles and mix well.
I'm not sure what I'd do without the internet! It's so amazing to be able to get all these great recipes from the comfort of my home. Thank you for this website.

Saute bacon grease in a large pan. Add onion. Saute until lightly browned. Add flour. Stir until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Gradually add milk. Stir constantly until mixture boils. Add canned tomatoes. Stir until thickened. Remove bay leaf. Sprinkle with celery leaves.

Place trout in buttermilk for 30 minutes in refrigerator. Drain and pat dry. Combine breadcrumbs, parsley and mustard in shallow dish. Dip fish in egg and then in crumb mixture, pressing crumbs into fish. Place on greased baking sheet and bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. Garnish with almonds and serve with lemon wedges.
Warm milk over low heat in small pan with cinnamon stick and sugar. Remove from heat and add rum. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Place the wonton skins on a cookie sheet and brush the edges with beaten egg. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5 minutes until the edges of the wontons are golden brown. Remove from the oven and let cool. Mix the broccoli with the roasted red peppers, onion powder and thyme. Spoon 1/4 cup of the mixture into each wonton and sprinkle with a little more cheese. Bake for 3 to 5 minutes more until the cheese is melted.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large skillet, saute the onions in the butter over medium heat until they are soft. Add the flour, and stir to make a paste. Add the salt and pepper and stir into the paste. Slowly add the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until thickened. Stir in the cheddar cheese, and cook until the cheese has melted. Stir in the frozen hash brown potatoes. Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is lightly browned. Serve immediately.
Cook potatoes and onions until tender. Drain. Beat eggs and milk. Add potatoes and onions. Add seasoning to taste. Melt butter. Fry hash browns. Serve with butter and syrup. Makes 4 servings.

Cook macaroni al dente. Drain and set aside. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the tomatoes and the salt and pepper. Cook for 5-6 minutes. Pour over the pasta and stir well. Spread mixture into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Place veggies into a large bowl. Pour the honey, soy sauce, sriracha, sesame oil, and pepper over the top. Toss well to coat. Heat 1 Tablespoon of oil in a large skillet. Add the vegetables to the skillet. Stir fry over medium heat for 5-8 minutes. Add the peanuts. Continue to stir fry until the vegetables are tender. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Line a shallow baking pan with aluminum foil.Rub the inside of the pan with olive oil. Place fish in pan, skin side down. Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper. Squeeze 1/2 lemon over fillet. Squeeze 1/2 orange over fillet. Sprinkle capers over fillet.Place in oven and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and turn over. Sprinkle capers over fish again. Place in oven for 10 minutes longer. Remove from oven and serve.

In a large bowl, combine pasta and the soup. Add the tuna and mix well. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with Velveeta. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 5 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic, cook until fragrant. Add cannellini beans, cook 1 minute. Add white wine. Cook 3 minutes. Add vegetable broth. Add pasta. Cook 1-2 minutes until pasta is just tender. Add freshly chopped spinach, cook until pasta is tender. Add parmesan. Toss. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small skillet, saute the onion and mushroom. Add asparagus and cook until tender. Cut the pie shell into 12 pieces. Layer a piece of the crust with the onion mixture. Sprinkle the crust with the cheddar cheese. Add a layer of bacon, then a layer of the asparagus mixture. Repeat with the rest of the crusts. In a mixing bowl combine the milk, eggs and italian seasoning. Pour the mixture over the crusts. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 10 minutes before slicing. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove giblets from inside of turkey legs. Rinse legs well with water. Pat legs dry with paper towel. Season generously with sea salt, black pepper, molasses, vinegar, and ketchup. Place in oven safe dish. Bake for about an hour. Turn legs over and bake for an additional hour. Remove legs from oven. Brush with extra mild worcestershire sauce. Add thinly sliced red onions. Bake for 5 minutes. Serve with extra mild worcestershire.
Toss all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix vinaigrette with a whisk. Pour over salad. Mix well.

Beat the cake mix, diet sprite and egg whites on medium for 2 minutes. Bake in a greased and floured 9x13 inch pan at 350 degrees for 28-32 minutes. Let cake cool. Pour boiling water over 1 cup raspberry jell-o gelatin and stir until dissolved. Let cool and pour over top of cake. Beat 1 cup of fat free cool whip and 1 tsp lemon jell-o gelatin until fluffy. Spread over top of cake. Garnish with flaked coconut. Refrigerate. Serve chilled.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Dip the chicken into the mixture and then coat with the crumbs. Place chicken in a large baking dish and bake for 15 minutes.

Beat whites, then add yolks. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat canola oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook until mixture is set, about 3 to 4 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl, beat together egg yolks and honey until light and fluffy. Add dry breadcrumbs and beat until smooth. Stir in cream cheese. In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into breadcrumb mixture. Fold in carrot and spices. Spoon into a greased and floured loaf pan and sprinkle with hazelnuts. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F oven for 1 hour or until firm and golden brown. Cool in pan for 15 minutes before removing and cooling on a wire rack.
In a small bowl, mash avocado with a fork until chunky. Add all remaining ingredients except the green onions. Stir to blend. Fold in the green onions. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cook rice according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine 2 cups water and juice. Add chicken and bring to a boil. Add next 5 ingredients. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Pour into a bowl and refrigerate overnight. Stir in rice and parsley. Spoon onto 2 plates.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Rub pork chops with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd the chops, and cook until browned on both sides, about 8 minutes total. Transfer the chops to a baking dishset aside. Pour the wine into the skilletcook until reduced by half. Whisk in the honey and mustard. Pour over the chops, and bake until done, about 30 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Rinse fish. Pat dry with paper towel. Place fish in 13X9 inch baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Divide mixture into 3 equal portions. Place each portion on top of a fish fillet, pressing down gently to adhere. Bake in preheated oven 20 minutes or until fish is cooked through.

Mix all ingredients for marinade. Add fish and marinate for 30 minutes. Remove fish and pat dry with paper towels. Dust with flour and season with salt and pepper. Grill fish over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until it flakes with a fork when pressed. Serve with green onion sprinkled on top.

In a blender combine the cream, coffee and yogurt. Blend well. Pour the mixture into a bowl and freeze for 4 hours or overnight. Remove from freezer and puree the mixture. Add the condensed milk, cinnamon and figs. Mix well and return to the freezer. Freeze until firm and store in the freezer. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream and some fresh figs.

Place the avocadoes in a large bowl. Sprinkle with lemon juice to stop browning. Mash with a fork until chunky or blend with a blender or food processor until smooth. Add onion and mix thoroughly. Season with salt to taste. Adjust water as needed to reach desired consistency. Serve with tortilla chips. Can be refrigerated up to 3 days.

Dissolve the raspberry flavored gelatin in the boiling water. Add the cold water and stir. Add the cool whip and stir until you have a fluffy mixture. Divide the mixture among three bowls. Place a layer of strawberries in each bowl. Spoon the mixture on top of the fruit. Chill for several hours. Garnish with fresh strawberries.

In large skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Add frankfurterscook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until frankfurters are browned, stirring occasionally. Add basil, soup, milk and tomatoes. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Cook over low heat 5 minutes. Add noodles and cook until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley.

Mix together cream cheese and mayonnaise. Spread on tortillas. Add 1/2 of the salsa and mix well. Add 1/4 of the lettuce and tomato and spread over. Add 1/4 of the bacon. Roll up and slice into pinwheels. Cut pinwheels into bite size pieces. Serve with remainder of salsa.

In a large pot of salted water cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced sausage and cook until the meat is browned and crumbled. Add the crushed tomatoes and water. Bring to a simmer. Add the beans and cook until heated through. Add the cooked pasta, fresh basil and asiago cheese. Toss until evenly coated. Serve immediately.

Combine first 5 ingredients in small bowl. Place asparagus in 13 by 9-inch baking dishadd shallot. Combine shallot mixture with oil mixturepour over asparagus. Cover with aluminum foilbake at 375f for 20 minutes. Uncoverbake an additional 5 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with parsley if desired.
These are some of my favorite recipes that I have found using Asparagus. I hope you enjoy them too!
Thanks for visiting my site today! I hope you'll return again!
If you like these Asparagus recipes, you may also like to try my other recipes from my site listed below!
I have another Asparagus Recipe to share with you!

Remove excess fat from chicken. Combine grill seasoning, lemon juice and olive oil. Place chicken breast side down on foil-lined baking sheet. Top with lemon, rosemary and garlic. Pour 1/2 of marinade mixture over top and rub into skin. Turn chicken over and baste with remaining marinade. Cover tightly with foil. Bake at 425 for 30 to 40 minutes or until no longer pink.

Heat butter in skillet until it melts. Add green beans and saute until they are tender-crisp but not mushy. Add brussel sprouts and saute until tender-crisp. Stir in vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Coat a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Combine the first 7 ingredients in a shallow bowl. Combine the buttermilk and egg in a shallow bowl. Dip the chicken in buttermilk mixturedrain and then dip in the bread crumb mixture. Place chicken in the baking dishbake 25-30 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Melt butter in large saute pan. Saut shrimp and artichokes in butter for about 4 minutes. Add dry white wine and continue cooking until liquid is nearly gone. Add chopped pimiento. Stir in lemon juice and parsley. Serve over toasted French bread.

Put all ingredients in order in bread machine. Select dough cycle and start machine. Let dough rise in machine for about an hour. Punch down and roll out on lightly oiled surface. Let rise again and bake at 425 f for 15 minutes.
In a large bowl combine the chicken and the boiled egg slices. Add the remaining ingredients and stir until well blended. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Mix all of the ingredients together in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.

Preheat oven to 400f. Line a muffin tin with 12 paper muffin cups. In a small bowl combine the plum, sugar, 1 teaspoon of the almond extract, and the cornstarch. Mix well. In a large bowl sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. In a medium bowl combine the egg, butter, and milk. Beat until well combined. Stir into the sifted ingredients just until moistened. Fold in the plum mixture. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center of the muffin comes out clean. Cool the muffins in the tin on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove the muffins from the tin and place on a wire rack to cool completely. To make the glaze combine the confectioners sugar, remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons almond extract, and the lemon juice in a small bowl. Drizzle over the top of the muffins.

In a large saucepan or stockpot, bring the broth to a boil over medium heat. Add the kale leaves and cook until the kale is wilted (about 2 minutes). Remove from the heat and drain into a colander. Set aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. In a large pot or saucepan, cover the potatoes with water. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce the heat to medium low and cook until the potatoes are soft (about 12 minutes). Drain the potatoesreturn them to the pot. Mash the potatoes with the butter until smooth. Add the milk, kale, chicken broth, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic powdermix until thoroughly combined. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top (about 20 minutes). Makes 6 servings.

In a large dutch oven over medium high heat brown stewing beef and italian sausage. Drain fat. Add onions, green peppers and garlic and cook until tender. Add potatoes, kidney beans and tomatoes. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly and cook 1-1/2 to 2 hours, or until beef is tender. Stir in basil. Serve over hot cooked rice.

In a large non-stick frypan over medium-high heat, cook the chicken for 4 minutes each side or until cooked through. Remove and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a large bowl combine the beans, asparagus spears and tomatoes. Add the pine nuts and basil and toss to combine. In a small jug combine the dressing ingredients. In a large bowl combine the warm salad leaves and the warm salad dressing. Toss well. Arrange the salad leaves on a serving plate and top with the warm salad. Serve with the warm chicken.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, combine eggs, milk and watermix well. Add ham and chives and mix lightly. Combine 1/2 cup sour cream and 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese in another bowlstir well and set aside. Spoon half the egg mixture into the baking pan and sprinkle half the Cheddar mixture over top. Repeat layers. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 minutes or until done. Cool 5 minutes. Sprinkle with Ortega Chile Mix to taste, if desired.

Cook grits as directed on package. Meanwhile, fry the bacon until crisp. Sauté the onion with the bacon drippings until tender but not brown. Drain the grease from the fried bacon. Add the bacon to the grits. Dice the tomatoes and add to the grits along with the sautéd onion and the remaining bacon drippings. Mix thoroughly and serve.

In a small saucepan combine tomato sauce, lemon juice, brown sugar, and apple cider vinegar. Bring to a boil over medium heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in dijon mustard and red pepper flakes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Makes about 1 cup.

Make the shortcrust pastry by mixing together the flour and butter in a food processor, add the dark brown sugar and process to form a crumbly dough. Add the beaten egg and process briefly until the pastry clumps together. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 200c/400f. Roll out the pastry to a thickness of 5mm on a lightly floured surface. Line a tart tin with the rolled out pastry, pressing the edges together to seal. Spread the mixed dried fruit over the base, followed by the walnuts. Brush the base with the beaten egg. Bake for 10 minutes then add the glace cherries on top. Bake for a further 5 minutes then sprinkle the icing sugar on top.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and slice potatoes very thin. Beat egg white in a medium bowl. Mix together with dried herbs. Mix flour with cumin and sumac. Spread out potato slices on a baking sheet. Dip each slice in egg white and flour mixture. Spray with cooking spray. Bake for 10 minutes. Flip over and bake 10 minutes more. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add potato slices and saute. Add more butter and season to taste. Serve with a green salad.

Cook hamburger, drain fat. Combine hamburger and onions and cook until done. Add water, tomato paste and seasoning and stir until well blended. Spoon into a greased 9 x 13 casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and top with taco chips. Bake uncovered for 1 hour at 325 degrees. Serve with sour cream, salsa and guacamole.

In a heavy saucepan, heat 1/2 cup of water or broth over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour until a smooth roux forms. Stir in the remaining liquid and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and let cook, uncovered until thickened. Add diced tomatoes and their juice and cook a few minutes longer. Add onion and bell pepper and cook 3 minutes longer. Add minced garlic and cook 1 more minute. Serve over meat or poultry or rice.

Place the rhubarb in a large saucepan. Cover with water by about one inch. Bring to a boil and boil for 20 minutes or until the rhubarb is very tender. Add the sugar and bring back to a boil. Turn the heat down and simmer for about five minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and add the raspberry gelatin. Stir until the gelatin dissolves. Remove the pan from the heat and add the evaporated milk. Pour the mixture into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Refrigerate for at least two hours or until the mixture is set. Cut the rhubarb mixture into squares or triangles. Serve with whipped cream and a raspberry on top.

Cook the macaroni in water until al dente. Drain the water off the noodles. Add the melted butter. Add the eggs and evaporated milk and mix well. In a medium bowl combine the condensed soup with the milk and mix well. Add the macaroni and mix well. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese on top. Cook in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Sprinkle with paprika for color if desired. Serve hot.

Chop cucumber and place in a colander. Add 1 teaspoon of salt and stir gently to remove excess water. Combine cucumber with yogurt, sugar and spices. Mix thoroughly and chill at least 3 hours before serving. Additional seasonings may be added, such as chopped tomatoes and green olives or capers. This salad may be served as an appetizer or as an accompaniment to main dishes such as lamb or chicken.

In a 3 quart baking dish combine broccoli, soup mix and water. Layer half the broccoli mixture in the bottom of the baking dish. Top with chicken. Combine remaining broccoli mixture and milk. Spread over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375f for 1 hour. Top with roasted red pepper and serve over rice.

Place a fish fillet skin side down in a nonstick baking dish coated with cooking spray and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Bake at 400 degrees f for 8 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the tapenade by combining the shallot, tomatoes, olives, capers and oregano in a small bowlsprinkle with vinegar and toss to blend. Spoon 1/4 cup tapenade over the fish and bake 4 minutes more. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Serve the fish with the remaining tapenade. Makes 4 servings.
Combine yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices. Marinate the chicken for at least 2 hours in the fridge or overnight. Remove from marinade. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 20-25 minutes.

Heat the oil in a non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and saute until lightly brown. Add the thyme leaves and continue cooking for a few seconds more. Remove from heat, add the potatoes and stir to coat with the onion mixture. Place potato mixture in a casserole dish or shallow baking dish. Drizzle with the butter and bake for 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat and add sour cream, stirring well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped parsley if desired. Serve immediately.

Beat cream cheese and milk in medium bowl with electric mixer until smooth. Beat in mayonaise and horseradish. Add red pepper sauce,worcestershire sauce and tuna. Stir to blend. Add paprika. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Refrigerate leftovers.

Combine crushed pineapple, frozen blackberries and peach slices in a large bowlset aside. Combine flour, sugar and cinnamon in a bowl and blend well. Cut butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in butter until mixture forms a crumbly consistency. Sprinkle the crumbly mixture over fruit mixture. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until the fruit is bubbly and the topping is lightly browned. Let cool at least 2 hours before serving. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Place the 4 slices canadian bacon on 4 halved english muffins. Top with swiss cheese on each half. Crack 2 eggs into each half with half milk and half water on top. Place in toaster oven until yolks are done. Place in oven broiler 1 minute until cheese is brown and bubbly on top of the toasted english muffins. Spread with hollandaise sauce. Garnish with parsley or cilantro if desired.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and saute 30 seconds. Add chicken and brown 4 to 5 minutes. Add potatoes and saute until tender and browned. Add broth and bring to a simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender and broth is reduced. Stir in parsley and season to taste. Serve immediately.

Boil potatoes for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well and return to pan. Melt butter in saucepan over low heat and stir in flour, salt and pepper. Gradually stir in milk and cook over medium heat until thick and bubbly, stirring constantly. Stir in paprika and chicken bouillon. Mix in cheese. Pour over potatoes in pan and stir gently to coat. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 to 30 minutes or until top is golden brown.

Melt 6 tablespoons butter and remove from heat. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Gradually stir in milk and water and cook over medium heat until thick. Add cheese and stir until melted. Combine potatoes and ham and add cheese sauce, stir gently, then place in greased casserole dish and set aside. Melt butter in a skillet. Add and brown bread crumbs. Sprinkle crumbs on top of potato casserole and bake at 350 for 30 to 45 minutes.

Spread the hot pepper jelly on the toast. Layer the slices with the ham and turkey. Top with the cheese. In a small bowl, beat the eggs and milk together. Pour the mixture over the sandwich slices and cover with more slices. Bake for about 10 minutes. While the sandwiches are baking, combine the hot sauce and butter in a small bowl. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and drizzle with the hot sauce and butter mixture. Cut the sandwiches into quarters and serve warm.
Shred cooked chicken and combine with celery and bell peppers. Add dry dressing mix and mayonnaise and blend well. Serve chilled or at room temperature. Makes 5 cups. Serves 12.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare mushroom caps by removing stems and setting caps aside. Heat butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat until foaming. Add sausage and cook until browned and no longer pink in the center. Add scallion and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Fill each cap with about 1 tablespoon of sausage mixture. Place caps on a baking sheet. In a bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of the breadcrumbs, the egg and 1/4 teaspoon of the soy sauce. Spoon 1 tablespoon of the mixture into each cap. Place caps cut-side down on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. In a small bowl, mix the remaining 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of soy sauce. Remove the caps from the baking sheet and place into a bowl. Toss the caps with the remaining breadcrumb mixture. Place caps cut-side down onto another baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes or until golden

In a medium saucepan bring the sugar and water to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter. Let cool for a few minutes. Serve over vanilla ice cream. Garnish with salted peanuts.

Place the sweet potatoes in a large saucepan. Add the water. Cover the saucepan with a lid and cook the sweet potatoes over low heat until they are tender. Remove the lid and continue to cook over medium-low heat until all the liquid has evaporated. Mash the potatoes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine the cooked sweet potatoes with the sugar, evaporated milk, eggs, vanilla extract, and butter. Mix well. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. To make the topping, combine the coconut and nuts. Sprinkle the topping evenly over the top of the casserole. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together milk and honey until smooth and well blended. Stir in cinnamon and bring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in couscous and return to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in mixed fruit and nuts. Spread mixture into a 9-inch baking dish and chill, uncovered, until chilled through, at least 2 hours or overnight. Cut into squares and serve cold with whipped cream and additional honey or cinnamon if desired.

Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add pastina and stir often until softened (about 10 minutes). In a bowl, beat eggs with salt and pepper until foamy. Stir into the pastina mixture and cook over medium heat until the eggs are cooked through (about 2 minutes). Transfer to a bowlsprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano and serve immediately.

Cut ginger into thin strips. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add ginger and cook about 3 minutes, or until golden. Add steak and cook 3 to 5 minutes per side. Sprinkle with pepper. Remove meat and set aside. Add sweet potatoes to skillet. Cook, turning several times to coat with cooking juices. Cook until potatoes are tender when pierced with fork, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove potatoes from pan and set aside. Add sweet chili sauce to skillet and cook over high heat until thickened. Whisk in lemon juice and return meat to pan. Coat meat with sauce. Serve over sweet potatoes. Garnish with parsley.
name: grilled halibut with potatoes and corn salsaingredients: vegetable oil, canola oil, flour, lime juice, minced jalapenos, corn kernels, halibut fillets, potatoes, green bell peppers, sweet red bell peppers, onions, red chile peppers, fresh coriander leaves, white wine, chopped c

In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and onion flakes. In a shallow bowl combine the parmesan, worcestershire sauce, and parsley. On each half of the buns spread the cream cheese and top with the ham and then the gruyere. Place in the microwave for a minute or until the cheese is melted. Sprinkle the parmesan mixture over each half and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place biscuits in 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Bake 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Top with remaining ingredients and bake for 15 minutes more or until lightly browned. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Cut peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds and membrane from inside. Place in a greased baking dish. In a large skillet brown ground round with onions and garlic salt. Add the tomato sauce and the water and heat to boiling. Cover the peppers with the meat mixture and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until the meat is done. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a bundt pan with cooking spray. Mix together the cocoa powder, yellow cake mix, and chocolate pudding mix. Stir in the eggs and vegetable oil. Beat in the coffee and coffee liqueur until well blended. Pour the batter into the prepared bundt pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with confectioners' sugar, if desired.

Place beans in a large pot. Add onion and water to cover. Bring to a boil. Skim off the foam and add the ham hocks and the ham bone or ham shank. Add a little more water to cover the ham hocks and ham bone or shank. Lower the heat to a low boil and simmer the ham hocks or ham bone or shank for 15 minutes. Add the bay leaf and the garlic cloves. Cook for another 30 minutes or so. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Cook for an additional hour or so. Remove the ham hocks or ham bone or shank. Chop it up into small pieces or bite size pieces and return it to the pot. Continue to cook the beans for another hour or so. Remove the bay leaf before serving. Serve with white rice or white cornbread, or both.
