In a blender combine all of the first 5 ingredients. Blend until smooth. Add the hot pepper sauce and black pepper and blend until well incorporated. Taste and adjust seasoning. Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease and lightly flour a 9x13x2-inch baking pan.In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Sift together the flour, soda and nutmeg. Stir into the creamed mixture. Fold in the chocolate chips and bananas. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center of the pan comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting.

In a small bowl mix together miracle whip, lemon juice, and pepper. On a lightly floured surface, unroll the crescent rolls. Roll each piece out as thin as possible. Cut each piece in half lengthwise. Place the crescents in a greased 9x13 pan. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese over the top. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until the tops are golden. Drain the crabmeat. Mix together the crabmeat and imitation crab. Add the green onions. Spread over the top. Garnish with the parsley. Serve warm.
The Pillsbury Crescent Roll dough is a wonderful thing. I have had it on my list for quite awhile to make these sandwiches. They are so quick and easy and everyone in the family loves them.
Mix the crabmeat with the imitation crab.
Cut up some green onions for garnish.
Sprinkle the cheddar cheese over the top.
Bake at 350 for 1

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line baking sheet with foil. In a small bowl combine bread crumbs and parmesan. In a shallow bowl combine the egg and water. Dip the fish in the egg and then roll in the panko mixture. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake for 8-12 minutes or until done. Serve with lemon wedges and your favorite sides.

In a heavy saucepan combine the dark brown sugar, milk and butter over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Continue boiling for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and egg yolks. Beat together egg whites in a clean dry bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form (don t overbeat or the mixture will turn rubbery). Fold egg whites into the pudding mixture. Turn into mold, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Serve cold with whipped cream and additional chopped nuts.

Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Heat 3 tablespoons of the oil in skillet over medium-high heat and saute garlic in it until golden brown and very fragrant. Add 1 tablespoon red-pepper flakes and saute 30 seconds more. Add pasta to skillet and toss over heat for 1 minute, adding remaining 2 tablespoons oil if it looks dry. Season with salt and pepper to taste and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking dish with the olive oil. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the marmalade, vinegar and 1/4 cup of water. Bring to a boil and stir constantly until thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the rosemary and 2 teaspoons of extra virgin olive oil. Place the chicken in a single layer in the prepared baking dish and pour half of the sauce over each breast. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and pour the remaining sauce over the top of each breast. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Peel the potatoes and cut into chunks. Boil in salted water until tender. Drain and add the watercress to the potatoes. Cover and cook until the watercress is wilted. Add the peas, corn and butter and cook over low heat until the peas are tender crisp. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Heat chicken broth in saucepan. Add mashed potatoes and cook on medium heat for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until smooth. Stir in baby spinach and set aside. In a fry pan, saute garlic powder and minced garlic in butter for 2-3 minutes. Stir into soup and add milk. Makes 6 servings.
Mix all together and bake in a greased 12 cup muffin tin at 450 degrees for 12 minutes.

Heat the oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Saut the onion and carrot until the onion is translucent. Add the garlic and saut for 30 seconds. Add the split peas and 6 cups of the water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the peas are tender and the soup has thickened. Stir in the ham. Remove the pot from the heat. Add the marjoram and season with the salt and pepper. Serve in large bowls.

Grill or pan fry the burgers and add a slice of mozzarella cheese. Butter the bun and add the burger. Add the gravy and the fries. Top with the other half of the bun. Serve hot with a pickle or coleslaw.

Combine all ingredients in a slow cookercover with lid. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until mixture is thickened. Cool slightly. Stir in vanilla & spoon into jars. Seal tightly & process in a boiling-water bath for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (165 degrees c). Grease a 10-inch tube panset aside. Beat cake flour, Crisco, eggs, sugar, and vanilla until well blendedstir in milk. Pour into prepared panbake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Remove cake from pancool on wire rack. Remove cake from pancool on wire rack. Serve warm or chilled.

Place the chicken breasts on a greased grill pan and cook over a medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes per side or until cooked through. Allow to rest for 10 minutes before thinly slicing and placing over the spinach. Toss the spinach with the fruit and nuts and sprinkle over the feta cheese and red onion rings. Drizzle with the dressing and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place tenderloin on baking sheet and sprinkle with all spices, except for onion powder and chipotle powder. Sprinkle onion powder and chipotle powder over top of meat. Spread brown sugar over top of meat and bake for 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

Cook bratwurst according to package directions. Remove from heat. Cut sausage crosswise into 1/2 inch pieces. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage. Cook 1 minute. Add red peppers. Cook 3 minutes. Add onion. Cook 3 minutes. Add paprika and caraway seed. Cook 1 minute. Sprinkle with parsley.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally until tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Add carrots and cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally until tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add herbs and cook 5 minutes longer. Add pasta and cook until pasta is tender. Remove from heat and stir in chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat. When hot, add the cumin seeds and allow to sizzle for about 10 seconds. Add the onions and fry until they are golden brown and beginning to crisp. Add the green lentils and stir for one minute. Add the water and bring to boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered until the lentils are tender, about 25 minutes. Add the salt and the cayenne and stir to mix well. Remove from the heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Serve.

Cook macaroni as directed. In a large bowl, toss cooked macaroni with ham, celery and red onion. In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, lime juice and honey. Add to macaroni mixture and toss well. Add cilantro and honeydew, tossing gently until well combined. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate overnight.

Slice chicken breast in half lengthwise. Spread with mustard. Top each breast half with a slice of ham and spinach. Wrap like a candy cane. Lightly dredge in flour. Dip in egg mixture. Cover in bread crumbs. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook for about 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Place in a baking dish. Combine 2 tablespoons of olive oil, parsley and garlic. Toss together. Top each piece of chicken with a slice of goat cheese and sprinkle with mixture. Bake at 350 for about 10-15 minutes or until goat cheese has melted. Serve warm.

Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper and dredge in the flour. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat and brown the chicken on both sides. Add the thyme and olives and pour in the sherry. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter and cover to keep warm. Strain the sherry juices into a saucepan and cook over high heat until reduced to a glaze.

Cook gnocchi in salted boiling water. Drain. In a large skillet heat olive oil. Add garlic. Cook 30 seconds. Add gnocchi to skillet. Stir gently until gnocchi is coated. Add basil, cheeses, and prosciutto. Heat until melted. Stir gently. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Cut each chop in half crosswise. Sprinkle cut sides of each half with cinnamon and arrange in a single layer in a shallow 3 quart glass baking dish. Melt margarine in a small saucepan. Add brown sugar and cook over low heat until mixture is melted and syrupy. Pour over chops. Top each half of a chop with an apple slice and dot with additional margarine. Bake uncovered for 50 to 60 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 160 degrees. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Heat canola oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the snow peas and saut for about 5 minutes. Add the cooked brown rice and stir well to combine. Add the fresh cilantro and toss gently to combine. Serve hot or cold.

Combine the first 6 ingredients in a large sauce pan over medium heat. Stir constantly until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook until thickened and bubbly stirring often. Serve immediately over biscuits, cornbread, or pancakes.

In a saucepan, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract and cinnamon. Cover and refrigerate until cold. Add the soymilk and almonds and stir to blend. Place the granita in a freezer-safe container and freeze until firm. Garnish with the mint sprig.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Stir until blended. In another bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 teaspoon of the salt, the baking soda, and the eggs. Add the corn and the buttermilk. Stir well. Stir the liquid mixture into the cornmeal. Mix well. Spray an 8-inch cast iron skillet with vegetable oil spray. Pour the batter into the skillet. Bake until golden brown and crisp. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour two 8x4 loaf pans. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Mix together the wet ingredients. Stir the wet into the dry. Fold in the bananas. Pour into prepared pans and bake for one hour and fifteen minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Grease cookie sheet. Cream butter and sugar until light. Add beaten egg and vanilla. Add baking chocolate. Stir until melted. Add nuts and flour. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake at 350-degrees f. until puffed and brown. Cool slightly. Roll in icing. Store in air-tight container. Makes about 4 dozen.

In a bowl combine potatoes, salt and italian seasoning. In a crock pot, combine pork chops, apples and sauerkraut. Cook 6 hours or until pork chops are fork-tender. Remove pork chops and shred. Add potatoes and kielbasa. Cook until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, combine wine and peas. Stir into mixture. Serve over pork chops. Garnish with parsley if desired.

In a large bowl, beat together cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla until well blended. Stir in the chips and nuts. Refrigerate about 2 hours or until well set. Roll into a log and wrap in foil. Dip graham cracker sticks into melted chocolate and place around the base of the log. Refrigerate until set. Remove foil and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Peel and cube the sweet potato and put in the bottom of the dish. In a medium bowl, combine the apple pie filling, golden raisins and butter. Stir in the spice and pecans and spread over the potato cubes. Bake uncovered for 40-50 minutes, or until the topping is lightly browned and the sweet potatoes are tender. Makes 6 servings.

In a small bowl, mince the garlic and add the minced garlic, sherry wine vinegar, water, olive oil and green onions. Toss to combine and let sit for 15 minutes before serving. Garnish with the cilantro and jalapeño and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, mix together the fish sauce, red pepper flakes, shallots and crushed pepper. Add the egg and mix well. Add the corn and mix until thoroughly combined. Shape mixture into patties. In a small bowl combine the egg and 1 tbsp of water. In another bowl combine the cornflour and the remaining water. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip each patty into the egg mixture and then into the cornflour mixture. Carefully place each patty into the hot oil. Cook for 2 minutes per side until golden brown. Serve hot.
Brown meat in olive oil. Add garlic, onion and seasonings. Add tomato soup and water and bring to a boil. Add elbow macaroni. Lower heat and let simmer for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Steep tea bags in hot water for 5 minutes. Combine with cranberry juice and apple cider. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add brown sugar, cinnamon stick, ginger and cloves. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove spices. Add 1 cup of the hot liquid to each mug of iced cranberry juice. Garnish with orange slices. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425f. In a large bowl, combine all the dressing ingredients and set aside. Slice the sweet potatoes into 1/4 inch rounds and arrange on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 1/4 cup of oil and toss to coat evenly. Bake for 10 minutes. Stir in the pineapple and pecans. Drizzle with the remaining 1/4 cup oil and return to the oven. Roast for an additional 10 minutes or until tender. Toss the potatoes with the dressing and serve immediately.

In a 4 to 5 quart pot over medium-high heat, melt the butter. When the butter has melted, add the onion, carrots and celery, cooking until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the garlic, stirring constantly for 1 minute. Stir in the chicken stock or broth, bring to a simmer, cover and cook until the rice is tender, 18 to 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley. Add the chicken and heat through. Divide the soup among four bowls, top with parsley.

Combine the honey, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger in a small bowl. Let stand 15 minutes. Add the pork chops and turn to coat. Cover and marinate 30 minutes at room temperature. Meanwhile, combine the orange juice and barbecue sauce. Preheat the grill or broiler. Grill the pork, basting with the orange juice mixture often, until the juices run clear and the pork is no longer pink in the center and reaches a minimum internal temperature of 145 degrees f on an instant read thermometer. (about 20 minutes.) If desired, serve with a squeeze of lime.

Make the dressing by combining sour cream and water and refrigerate. Make the jello by adding the lime powder to the boiling water. Add the sour cream and blend well. Fold in the chopped vegetables and nuts. Chill and serve.

In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the cream and mix to form a soft dough. Add the chiles, cilantro, and garlic and mix well. Turn the dough out on a lightly floured surface and knead lightly to form a smooth dough. Roll out the dough to a 1/2 inch thickness. Cut out with a 2 1/2 inch round cutter. Place the scones on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Scrub the beets well. Slice each beet in half lengthwise. Place the halves cut side down in a baking dish. Cover them with foil. Bake for 1 hour or until tender. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. In the meantime, heat the butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the onions. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until soft. Stir in the sugar. Cook 2 more minutes. Add the vinegar. Heat through. Add the beets to the skillet. Stir well. Season to taste with the salt and the pepper. Serve hot.

Combine lentils, broth, onions and bell peppers in saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to simmer for about 20 minutes. Melt cheese over low heat in small saucepan or microwave until just melted (about 1 minute) and stir until smooth. Stir cheese into lentil mixture until melted and well blended. Top with red pepper flakes to taste. Serve hot with veggies or crackers or pita bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Saute onions, garlic and spices with butter. Add wine and cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Add cream and cheese. Blend well. Line pie plate with puff pastry. Spread cheese mixture evenly. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until pastry is golden brown. Garnish with thyme.

Prepare the stuffing as directed on the box. In a medium bowl combine the chicken breast with the soup and sour cream. Stir in the cheese. Spread the stuffing across the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the stuffing. Sprinkle with the peas and carrots. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Uncover and sprinkle with the parsley. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Mix together soy sauce, molasses, tahini, vinegar, and balsamic vinegar. Set aside. Bring 8 cups of water to a boil. Add soba noodles and boil for 3 minutes. Drain noodles and rinse under cold water until noodles are chilled. Divide noodles between 4 serving plates. Pour soy sauce mixture over noodles. Sprinkle with green onion and chili oil. Serve with sesame oil.
In a medium bowl combine cottage cheese, cucumber, and dill. Mix well. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Add the dry ingredients, including the oats, and stir well. Stir in the bananas and the chocolate chips. Drop by spoonful onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Makes 1 dozen.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add halibut steaks, coating both sides with oil. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Remove from pan. Heat remaining oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add halibut steaks with their juices. Add tomato sauce. Simmer for 2 minutes. Transfer to a baking dish. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 12 minutes or until done.

Cook the noodles according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan cook the broccoli in 1/2 inch of boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and cool under running cold water. In the same saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook 2 minutes. Slowly add the milk and cook until thickened. Remove from the heat and stir in the mustard and the broccoli. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the cheese. Add the cooked noodles and toss to coat. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine jasmine rice with vegetable oil, 2 tbsp fish sauce and 2 tbsp sugar. Mix well and cover with plastic wrap. Set aside. In a large skillet or wok heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil over medium high heat. Add garlic and onion. Saute until golden. Add shrimp, stirring constantly until cooked through. Drain shrimp. Add 1/2 tbsp fish sauce, 1/4 cup crushed pineapple with juice and 1/4 tsp sugar. Stir and cook 3 minutes. Add cooked rice and combine well. Stir in green onions and serve.

Cut wings into 3 pieces each, discard wing tip. Place wing sections on well-greased baking pan. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until done. Mix all remaining ingredients except paprika in small pan. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low. Simmer for 20 minutes or until thickened. When wings are done, add to the sauce and mix well to coat all the wings. Sprinkle with paprika before serving.

In a medium bowl combine the crushed pretzels and white sugar. Add margarine and stir till just moistened. Press mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Cool. Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar together. Spread over cooled crust. Dissolve gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water. Stir in raspberries. Spread over filling. Refrigerate till set. Cut into squares. Garnish with fresh raspberries if desired.
In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in cranberry sauce and lemon juice. Refrigerate until partially set. Add the red raspberries. Refrigerate until set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium saucepan, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in spaghetti sauce. In 13 x 9 inch baking dish, layer half the ravioli over the beef. Sprinkle half the frozen spinach over the ravioli. Top with remaining beef mixture. Sprinkle remaining spinach over the top. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer.
Drain and flake tuna with a fork. Add cream cheese. Spread mixture onto 1 pita bread. Top with sliced vegetable and cheddar cheese. Broil for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Bring 1 1/2 cups water to a boil in a 2 quart heavy saucepan. Remove from the heat and whisk in the dashi powder until smooth. Add the spinach and cook, tossing frequently, until wilted, about 1 minute. Transfer the spinach to a large bowl. In the same saucepan, bring the water to a boil again over moderate heat. Add the soy sauce, sugar and salt and stir until the sugar dissolves. Pour the mixture over the spinach and toss until coated. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds.

In a large skillet brown turkey, carrots and onion. Drain. In a large bowl combine remaining ingredients. Add meat mixture and mix well. Spread into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Top with additional cheddar cheese during the last 15 minutes of baking.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Whisk together the egg yolks, sugar, lemon rind, lemon juice and vanilla extract until foamy. In a separate bowl, sift the flour. Beat the flour mixture into the egg mixture until just combined. Stir in the chopped nuts. Place 1 teaspoonfuls of the batter onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until lightly browned around the edges.

Squeeze out as much moisture from the white bread as possible. Put in a food processor and process until fine crumbs form. In a medium bowl combine the turkey, half-and-half, bread crumb mixture, egg, salt and pepper. Shape into 4 oval patties. Dip patties in dill. Melt butter in frying pan and cook cutlets 5 minutes on each side. Serve with your favorite mustard. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise, honey, rice wine vinegar and poppy seeds. Whisk together until well blended. Combine chicken, apples and cranberries in a large bowl. Add dressing and toss. Divide mixture between 8 slices bread. Top with tomato slices and sprouts. Serve immediately.

Combine butter and powdered sugar in a bowl. Add beaten egg yolks and vanilla extract. Blend well. Combine 2 cups of sifted flour and nuts in a separate bowl. Gradually stir in dry ingredients into creamed mixture. Form into one inch balls. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Press down flat with a fork. Bake for ten minutes in a preheated oven of 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cool on wire rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar when cool.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onions and garlic for 10 minutes. Add brown sugar and cook for 5 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Meanwhile, prepare the steaks as follows. Heat a large heavy skillet over high heat. Place the steaks and sear both sides for about 1 minute each. Reduce the heat and cook until the meat reaches desired doneness. Transfer the meat to a warm plate. Add the balsamic vinegar to the skillet and cook for 1 minute more. Spoon the onions and the juices over the meat and sprinkle with the chopped parsley. Serve.

Mix together all ingredients except for the sauce. Shape into balls about the size of walnuts. Heat the sauce in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sauce is hot and bubbly. Drop in the balls and cover with lid until they are cooked through. If they stick together, let them cook a few more minutes. Serve with hot sauce and/or melted cheese if desired.

Combine cranberries, honey, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boilcook for 5 minutes. Reduce heat, add 1 tsp cinnamon. Simmer for 5 minutes. Let cool slightly. Beat together 3 eggs, 1/2 cup milk, 1/3 cup sugar, 1 tsp vanilla in a bowl. Add cooled cranberry mixture. Butter whole grain bread slices. Dip each piece into egg mixturecoat evenly. Place in skillet. Cook on each side for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Top with brie. Serve with maple syrup. Enjoy.

Melt butter in skillet. Add sliced mushrooms. Saute until tender. Meanwhile place spinach in blender. Blend until pureed. Add cream cheese to spinach mixture. Add parmesan cheese. Saute in skillet until creamy. Stuff into baked pie shell. Top with sliced cheese. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes. Serve with salad.

Prepare the grain mustard by grinding the brown mustard seeds in a coffee grinder for about 30 seconds. Transfer the ground mustard to a saucepan. Add the rice vinegar, mustard powder, salt and beer. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cook the grain mustard until it thickens, about 5 minutes. Pour into clean sterilized jars and store.
name: brown mustard pasteingredients: brown mustard seeds, water, apple cider vinegar, honey, lemon juicepreparation:Combine brown mustard seeds with 1/4 cup of water. Soak for 20 minutes. Place soaked seeds, 2 cups of water, 1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar and 2 teaspoons of honey in the blender. Blend on high for about 1 minute. Add 1 teaspoon of lemon juice. Blend for another minute. Add the remaining 3 cups of water. Blend on high for 3 minutes. Transfer the brown mustard paste

Combine brownie mix, water, applesauce and egg whites in a medium bowl. Stir until blended. Spoon into muffin cups (2 tablespoons per cup). Bake at 350 degrees F. for 12-14 minutes or until done. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Frost with light whipped topping. Sprinkle with candy corn.

In a bowl mix the cornflour and the baking powder until smooth. Add the egg yolks one by one, beating well after each addition. Add the sugar. Add the milk gradually until the batter is smooth. Beat the egg whites until stiff. Fold the egg whites in gently. Pour in a greased cake tin. Bake at 175 deg c for 35 minutes or until the top springs back when gently pressed with your fingertip.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease three 9 inch round cake pans. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Beat together egg yolks, orange juice, rind and vanilla extractset aside. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat 1/3 of egg whites into yolk mixturebeat well. Continue beating egg whites on high speed until stiff peaks form againgently fold into batter. Pour into prepared pansbake 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool before frosting. Frost with orange frosting recipe below.

Heat a large soup pot over medium heat. Add the oil and onions. Sauté the onions for 5 to 7 minutes or until they are translucent. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add the potatoes, cauliflower, broth and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 20 to 25 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender when pierced with a fork. Remove the soup from the heat. Puree the soup with a stick blender. Add the salt and pepper to taste and stir to blend. Top with the freshly chopped chives.

In saucepan over medium heat, saut the vegetables in the oil until they are tender. Stir in the broth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato. Add the chicken. Simmer for 2 minutes or until heated through. Season with the salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings. Can be served with croutons or sour cream.

Mix together the first 4 ingredients in a medium bowl. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ginger and garlic. Stir fry about 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the beef round steak. Stir fry until almost no pink remains. Add the cornstarch mixture. Stir fry until the sauce thickens, about 1 minute. Add the snow peas. Stir fry until the snow peas are crisp-tender. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a large skillet, saute the onions and garlic until tender. Stir in the aroma seasoning and cook 30 seconds. Stir in the broth, curry powder and rice. Cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the chicken and heat through. Turn into a 2-quart casserole dish coated with cooking spray and sprinkle with the corn flake crumbs. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until the crumbs are golden.

Cook macaroni as directed on package. Drain. In a large skillet, brown beef, drain. Add spaghetti sauce. Heat through. Mix in macaroni. Spread half of mixture in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Spread remaining half of mixture over it. Sprinkle with pepperoni. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.

Combine marinara and 1 tablespoon water in a small bowlset aside. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add eggplant and cook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until done. Cut into bite sized pieces. Heat marinara in a sauce pan over medium heat. Add rigatoni to the pan and cook according to package instructions. Stir in the mozzarella and romano cheeses. Add the chicken and eggplant to the pan. Toss to combine. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. Add tomato mixture and toss. Add the fresh basil and toss again. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Cream together margarine & powdered sugar until light & fluffy. Add in vanilla and flour until blended. Stir in chopped nuts. Make into 1-inch balls. Place on a greased baking sheet. Flatten with bottom of a glass that has been dipped in powdered sugar. Bake in 300f preheated oven for 20-25 minutes. When done, roll each in powdered sugar while still warm. Best served warm from the oven with coffee, hot chocolate or your favorite warm drink.
Place the sausage and barbecue sauce in a skillet over medium heat. Cook until the sausage is hot. Serve in the Hawaiian rolls.

Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a small skillet. Add the orange juice concentrate and 2 teaspoons of the chipotle chile and the molasses. Heat over moderately low heat until the glaze is warm and the sauce is thickened slightly, about 2 minutes. Season the glaze to taste with salt. Butter a large heavy baking sheet and set aside. Set the corn on the baking sheet and sprinkle with the remaining 2 teaspoons of the chipotle chile. Grill the corn over moderately high heat until the kernels are crisp and browned in spots and the husks are charred in places, about 10 minutes. Toss the corn in the glaze and sprinkle with the cilantro. Makes 4 servings.

Combine dry ingredients. Cut in lard until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add vinegar and water to form a ball. Flatten into a disk and refrigerate. For use, roll out dough and place in pie pan. Cut vents and place in a 375 degree oven until done. For single crust pies, place dough into a pie plate and crimp edges together with fork tines. Prick with fork tines and place in the oven until done.

Combine the first 6 ingredients in a bowl. In a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan, layer half the bread slices. Pour on half of the pineapple mixture. Top with the remaining bread slices. Pour on remaining mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or till set. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or cold, garnished with whipped cream if desired. Makes 8 servings.
name: honey glazed ham with pineappleingredients: honey glazed ham, green peppercorns, mustard, yellow onion, pineapple piecespreparation:Cut ham into 1 inch pieces. Place in skillet with green peppercorns, mustard and yellow onion. Sauté 10 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. Add pineapple piecescook 1 minute longer.
name: spicy ham and pineapple casseroleingredients: ham hocks or ham shank or ham steak or ham chunks, pineapple tidbits

Sprinkle the shrimp & scallops with a little salt & pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet & saute the shrimp & scallops until cooked through. Remove shrimp & scallops from pan & set aside. In the same pan saute the shallots & mushrooms in the same pan for 2-3 minutes. Add the tomato paste & cook for 1 minute. Add the wine & cook for 3 minutes or so & stir in the shrimp & scallops & cook for another minute or two. Add the mussels & basil & cook for another 2-3 minutes or so until the mussels open up. Serve in pouches with lemon wedges & sprinkle with pepper.

Place the roma tomatoes on a baking sheet. Drizzle on the pesto. Sprinkle each tomato with the green onions and parsley. Sprinkle the top of each tomato with the cheeses. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender. Remove from the oven and sprinkle on the oregano. Serve warm.

Place one tortilla on a cutting board and spoon 1/2 cup of the salsa on top. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Top with half the cheese and spread with the miracle whip. Top with remaining tortilla. Heat a nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat until hot. Add quesadilla to pan and cook 2 to 3 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Turn over and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve with additional salsa if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine apples and cranberries in a large mixing bowl and mix well. In a separate bowl combine the remaining ingredients except for pecans. Cut in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over the fruit and bake for 40 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
Combine the pesto, tomato slices and haloumi slices. Drizzle over the olive oil. Sprinkle over the lemon juice. Serve with salad.

Cook sausage until no longer pink. Break into bite-size pieces. Drain fat. Add potatoes and continue cooking 1 minute more. Add eggs and stir lightly. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook and stir until eggs are set. Serve immediately.
Combine the cubed steaks and all the other ingredients in a 9x13 dish. Cook in a 400 degree oven for about an hour and a half or until the steaks are tender. Serve over cooked rice.

Hollow out the cantaloupe and discard seeds and membranes. Blend together cantaloupe pulp and strawberries. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. When ready to serve, pour mixture into cantaloupe shell and top with ice cream. Garnish with additional fruit and whipped cream. Top with rose water.

In a large saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, celery and salt to taste and cook until tender. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 25 minutes. Add the broccoli and cook until tender-crisp. In a small saucepan whisk together half-and-half and flour until smooth. Stir into the chowder. Add potatoes and thyme. Cook, stirring constantly, until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheddar.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix together the biscuit mix and water in a bowl until dough forms. Roll out to fit bottom of a 9x13 pan. Layer hamburger, onion, mushrooms and soup over the dough. Bake for 20-30 minutes until dough is browned. Serve with a salad and potato chips.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until blended. Add baking cocoa and milkbeat well. Stir in vanilla. Gently fold in whipped topping. Spoon into pie crust. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

Boil potatoes until they are tender. Cool. Combine dressing ingredients. Pour over potatoes. Chop roma tomato. Add to potatoes. Chop black olives. Add to potatoes. Chop green onions. Add to potatoes. Crumble fresh cilantro into salad. Toss well. Serve cold.
This is the first time I have heard of this food. Sounds yummy.

Place chickpeas in a blender or food processor. Add 1/2 cup of water and process until smooth. Add olive oil, lemon juice and remaining 1/2 cup water and process until smooth. Add all the seasonings except the onion and garlic powders. Process until smooth. Add onion and garlic powders and process just until blended. Chill until ready to serve. Serves 4. Serve with fresh sliced vegetables or whole grain bread. Makes about 2 cups.

Make rava ladoo by heating ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add rava, then mix well. Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until it turns light pink color and becomes crisp. Add 2 cups of milk and continue to cook until mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Add green cardamoms, saffron strands and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring continuously. Reduce heat to low and add sugar to the mixture and mix well. Keep stirring constantly for 10 minutes or until mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Add the remaining milk and mix well. Cook for 2 minutes or until mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Remove from heat and add the coconut flakes to the mixture. Mix well. Cool slightly and make ladoos (balls). Store at room temperature for 2-3 days or in refrigerator for 5 days.

Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add shallot and saute for 1 minute. Add chicken to Dutch oven and cook for about 5 minutes per side. Add 3 cups broth, wine and tarragon to Dutch ovenbring to a boil. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add potatoes to Dutch ovencover and simmer for 15 minutes. Uncover and simmer for 15 minutes more. Add parsley and serve over hot cooked rice.

Cook sausage in large skillet over medium heat. When sausage is browned drain. Place cooked rice in casserole dish. Place sausage on top. Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil. Pour over sausage and rice. Bake for 20-30 minutes.

Peel, core and slice the pears. Toss them in the lemon juice. Arrange the arugula on serving plates. Arrange the slices of pear on top. Scatter the nuts over the top. In a screw top jar, mix the oils, vinegar mustard and seasoning. Seal the lid and shake well. Pour over the salad and serve immediately.

Wash the apricots and put them in a large pot with the water, sugar and almonds and boil over medium heat for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the lemon juice and the almond extract and boil for 5 minutes longer or until the fruit is cooked through. Serve warm or chilled.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, pudding mix, water and poppy seeds until well blended. Pour into the loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. Allow to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack. Allow the loaf to cool completely before slicing.

Melt 2 Tbs of butter in small saucepan and stir in flour until smooth. Slowly add chicken stock and bring to boil, stirring constantly. Continue to cook until mixture is thick and smooth. Stir in fresh dill and vinegar. Season with salt, fresh ground pepper, and sugar to taste. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolk.

Combine all ingredients except cranberry sauce and chili sauce. Mix well. Shape into meatballs. Place in 9x13 pan and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. After 40 minutes, pour chili sauce and cranberry sauce over meatballs and bake for additional 15 minutes. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray both sides of croissants with vegetable spray. Place in baking pan. Bake 15 minutes or until croissants are lightly browned. Meanwhile, cook bacon to desired doneness. Cut into bite-size pieces. In small bowl combine mayonnaise, garlic and parsley. Spread croissants with mayonnaise mixture. Top each croissant with lettuce leaf, bacon pieces and tomato. Makes 6 servings.

Mix together the first four ingredients. Spread half of the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Spread the imitation crabmeat over the mixture. Top with the remaining mixture. Sprinkle the shrimp over the top. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until hot. Garnish with the remaining ingredients. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut the cucumber into 1/2-inch slices. Cut the red onion into thin half moons. Cut the radishes into thin slices. Mix together the cucumber, red onion and radish slices. In a separate bowl combine the oil, vinegar, sugar and crushed red pepper. Add the dressing to the vegetables and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Keeps for 2 to 3 days.

Sauté onion & carrots with olive oil until translucent. Add green beans & cover. Cook until crisp-tender. Add veg stock & simmer 5 minutes. Add almond milk & cook for 1 minute. Season to taste with dried herbs & fresh parsley.
name: green bean soupingredients: fresh green beans, carrots, celery, olive oil, tomatoes, leeks, herbs de provence, garlic, dried herbs, fresh parsley leavespreparation:In large pot combine beans with other vegetables. Add stock or water. Add herbs& garlic. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer covered until tender. Add fresh herbs.
name: green bean side dishingredients: fresh green beans, olive oil, slivered almonds, salt, fresh lemon juice, fresh basil leavespreparation:Bring water to a boil. Add beans. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add almonds& lemon juice. Toss& serve.
name: green bean casserole

Remove excess fat from corned beef. Cut into 1-inch cubes. In a large Dutch oven over medium heat, combine the vegetable oil, onions, and apple. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until the onions are translucent. Stir in the corned beef, apples, apple cider, brown sugar, dijon mustard, ground cloves, salt and black pepper. Cover the pot and cook on low for 4 to 6 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender. Add the potatoes and cook for 2 more hours. Remove the meat from the liquid with a slotted spoon and slice thinly across the grain. Add the cabbage to the liquid, cover and cook for an additional 2 hours. Serve the meat with the cabbage.

peel onion and cut into fine julienne strips. Soak in water for half an hour. Drain. Squeeze out excess water. Heat oil. Add onion to a hot non stick frying pan and fry for 5-6 minutes. Add a little water. Stir. When mixture is almost dry add a few more drops of water. Turn mixture into a bowl. Add a pinch of salt and black pepper. Add one egg to mixture. Beat lightly. Add half a cup of flour. Add more water to mix. Mix well. Heat oil in a pan. Spoon a few spoonfuls of mixture into hot oil. Flatten with a spoon. Fry for a minute or two. Turn. Fry for a minute. Remove from oil. Drain on paper towel. Serve hot.

Heat the oven to 350. In a medium bowl beat the cream cheese until smooth. Stir in the tomatoes and bell pepper. Roll up the crescent dough into an 8 inch strip and place the dough along the center of the tomato cream cheese mixture. Roll up the dough, sealing the edges. Place the filled dough strips seam side down on a greased baking sheet. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 2 minutes before cutting. Garnish with bacon or sprinkle with parsley if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Grease a 900ml pudding basin and line the base and sides with baking paper. Melt the butter in a heavy based saucepan. Add the caster sugar and stir well. Cook over a low heat until the sugar has dissolved. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well between each addition. Stir in the self raising flour and mix well. Stir in the grated ginger. Place the pan over a moderate heat. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring continuously. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Add the orange zest and juice and the chopped cranberries. Mix well. Place the mixture in the pudding basin and smooth the top. Place in a large baking tray and add sufficient boiling water to come half way up the side of the pudding basin. Cover the tray with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool slightly. Remove from the pudding basin and serve with cream or ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350f. Coat a baking dish with cooking spray. Sprinkle chicken with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Arrange 1/2 of the vegetables and 2/3 of the diced tomatoes with green chilies in the baking dish. Place the chicken over the vegetables. Top with the remaining vegetables and diced tomatoes with green chilies. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center. Serve the fajitas with flour tortillas and toppings of your choice.

Soak beans in water for 6-8 hours. Drain. In a heavy soup pot or Dutch oven, combine drained beans with 3 cups water. Bring to a boil. Cover partially and reduce heat. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour or until tender. Add onions and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 4 cups stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in bay leaf, thyme and seasoning. Serve hot.

Soak apricot in orange zest and water overnight. Drain well. Roll into 1-inch balls. Combine cranberries and white chocolate. Roll into 1-inch balls. Combine both types of balls in a large plastic bag. Store in the refrigerator until serving.

Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the onions and saute for 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add the peanut butter and cook for 1 minute. Add the coriander, tomato sauce, and red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute. Serve hot with rice.

In a large pan, melt the butter with the leeks and cook gently for 5 minutes until soft and translucent. Add the flour and cook for 3 minutes. Add the potato and cook for 1 minute more. Gradually add the stock and bring to the boil. Simmer for 20 minutes until the potatoes are tender. Strain into a clean pan through a sieve. Bring to a simmer and add the cream. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into bowls and garnish with a swirl of chive cream and a sprig of parsley. To make the chive cream, beat the double cream until stiff peaks form. Fold in the chopped parsley and chives. Chill until required.

Brown the ground beef with the bell peppers. Add the jalapenos and cook until just tender. Add the tomatoes. In a separate pan heat the tomato paste in the broth until thick. Add the beef mixture to the broth and heat through. In a small bowl mix the onion soup mix with the water and add to the broth. Add the rice and heat through. Serve in the bell peppers.

In a large saucepan combine the orange juice, the lemon juice, the sugar and the gelatin. Bring to a boil over low heat. Remove from heat and add the whipping cream. Beat with a rotary beater until soft peaks form. Pour into a freezer tray and freeze. Unmold on a serving platter. Sprinkle with whipping cream to serve.
Gelatin is a food additive used for thickening and gelling. It is often used as a thickener for desserts, aspic, jellies, trifles, etc. Gelatin can be used as a stabilizer in creams.
Gelatin is made from the collagen of various animals, usually pork skin or pig bones, although a fish-based gelatin was used in the past to prepare kosher food. The collagen is hydrolyzed by boiling in water to produce gelatinthe boiling water is discarded and the resulting gel is dried to produce the powdered jelly. The most common type of gelatin is a mixture of collagen from pig bones and skins with a small amount of collagen from

In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and salt. Stir to combine. Pour mixture over popped popcorn and toss until evenly coated. Spread popcorn onto two baking sheets. Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until popcorn is lightly toasted. Remove from oven and pour lemon pepper into popcorn. Toss to coat well. Serve while warm.

Beat together all the ingredients until well combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes until edges are set. Remove from oven and cool on baking sheet. Makes about 4 dozen.

Combine all ingredients except for the meat and vegetables in a saucepan. Bring to boil and cook for 5 minutes. Skewer the meat and vegetables. Arrange on a grill. Cook for 3 minutes per side, basting the kabobs with the sauce. Turn and baste again. Remove from heat and let cool. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix pudding and milk. Add protein powder and blend 1 minute. Fold in 1 cup of the banana and vanilla. Spoon into pie shell. Chill 3 hours. Top with remaining 1 cup of sliced banana and whipped topping.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoescook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return to the pan. Add the cream. Mash until smooth. Season the potatoes with salt to taste. Add the butter, garlic, and parsley. Mash again. Serve immediately.

Mince the garlic and add to a small skillet with olive oil or butter and saute until fragrant and lightly browned. Add the white wine, soy sauce and bring to a boil, lower the heat to medium low and add the mushrooms to the wine mixture. Cover the skillet and allow to simmer for about 20 minutes until the liquid has evaporated and the mushrooms are soft and juicy. Turn off the heat and allow to cool slightly while you prepare the topping. Mix the cracker crumbs and the cheeses together and spread on a small plate. Dip each cooled mushroom into the egg wash and then into the cracker crumb mixture, allowing the excess to fall off. Place the mushrooms on a baking sheet that has been lined with a silpat or foil and place into a 350 degree oven for about 5 minutes or until the cheese is browned and the cracker coating is crisp and golden brown.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. Place the jalapeños on the cookie sheet with the cut side facing up. Bake for 20 minutes or until the skins are crisp and blackened. Remove the jalapeños from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Peel the skin from the pepper using a paper towel or gloves. Carefully slice open the jalapeño with a paring knife, then scrape out the seeds with a spoon. Place the jalapeño halves on a work surface. Spread each with 1/2 teaspoon of the cream cheese, then sprinkle evenly with the turkey bacon and cheese. Fold the sides of the jalapeño halves over the filling and wrap them with the slices of cheese. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Wrap peas in aluminum foil with diced vegetables in a large bowldrizzle with olive oil. Add salt, hot pepper sauce, garlic, and peppertoss to coat. Place in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Roast in the preheated oven until tender, about 30 minutes.

To roast the garlic, preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Place the cloves of garlic on a sheet of aluminum foil. Drizzle with the oil. Season with the salt and pepper. Wrap the foil up into a tight package and place on the middle rack of the oven. Roast for 20 minutes. Allow the roasted garlic to cool slightly. Meanwhile, pour the broth and water into a small pot over high heat. Whisk in the cornstarch until smooth. Bring to a boil and cook until the mixture thickens and becomes clear. Remove from the heat and whisk in the vinegar. Season with the salt and pepper. Put the roasted garlic through a sieve into a bowl. Whisk in the dijon mustard and honey. Whisk in the broth and vinegar mixture. Stir in the peanut oil. Allow the mixture to cool slightly before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees farenheit. Rub each piece of chicken breast with butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange the chicken pieces in a baking dish just large enough to hold them in one layer. Drizzle with sherry wine and bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Add 1/4 cup lemon rind and lemon juice and continue to bake for 10 minutes longer. Remove the chicken from the baking pan and set aside. In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, combine the heavy cream and 1/4 cup lemon rind and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in the parmesan cheese and pour over the chicken. Yields 4 servings.

Put the unthawed raspberries into a saucepan and add sugar. Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until all the sugar has dissolved. Using a potato masher, mash the raspberries and syrup thoroughly. Pour the mixture through a strainer, extract all the juice. Squeeze two of the lemons and strain the juice, add it to the raspberry juice. Add the boiling water to the raspberry juice. Allow the cordial to cool, then chill it in the refrigerator. Serve cordial with a thin slice of lemon in each glass.

Wash and drain the beans. Place in a 3-quart casserole. Cover with water by 2 inches and add tofu dogs. Bring to a boil then reduce heat. Simmer 1 hour. Add ketchup, brown sugar, water, molasses, mustard powder and garlic power. Simmer another 1/2 hour. Serve with toasted buns.

Mix brown sugar, butter and vanilla in a heavy duty plastic bag until creamy. Add nuts and shake until nuts are coated with mixture. Spread mixture on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for about 15 minutes or until toffee is bubbly and starting to brown. Remove from oven and quickly sprinkle with chocolate chips. Let stand until chips are set. Cut into desired shapes with sharp knife. Store in air tight container.
This recipe was written by Anonymous on June 6, 2002.
This is the same recipe I use for the crunchy nut clusters on the back of the package of the Betty Crocker brownie mix. My kids love them! I always cut them into smaller pieces.
We loved these. They are very sweet and I didn't get a chance to make them in the mini muffin pans so I used cupcake liners that I sprayed with cooking spray. It worked fine. I made them for my son's 5th birthday party and they were gone!
I think this is one of

In a saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and saut until soft, about 5 minutes. Add celery and saut until soft, about 3 more minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes and stir to combine. Add stock and paprika and cayenne. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in herbs and sour cream. Serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, melt 2 tablespoons sweet butter. Add half the diced ham and saute until lightly browned. Add half the chives. Add the heavy cream and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the cooked pasta to the saucepan. Add the remaining diced ham and chives. Add the remaining sweet butter and the parmesan cheese. Add the peas. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve immediately.

Sprinkle the brown sugar and salt over the apples. Roll out the puff pastry and place over the apples. Fold the edge over the top and crimp with a fork. Place in the fridge for about half an hour. Brush the top with the caramel and bake in the oven on 180 for about 30 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream and powdered sugar.

Spread the toasted side of 2 of the slices of bread with the mayonaise and the untoasted side with the other mayonaise. Layer the bottom of the bread with 2 slices of lettuce. Then add 2 slices of tomato and 2 slices of bacon. Place 1 slice of cooked chicken on top of the bacon and then add the top piece of toasted bread to the top of the sandwich. Cut in half and serve with a stick of celery or carrot sticks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, combine all ingredients. Pour into a greased 9 inch loaf pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool on rack. Drizzle with glaze. For glaze, combine 1/2 cup confectioner’s sugar with 2 tablespoons milk. Stir until smooth. Spread over warm bread. Cut into slices. Makes 12 to 14 servings.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers and mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add curry paste and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Add coconut milk and fish sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add salmon and cook for 3 minutes per side or until cooked through. Stir in basil and serve over rice.
I want to know how to make salmon. I know how to cook it but how do I make it.
I love this recipe. I've made it many times and it's always a hit!

Whisk together the egg and milk in a shallow bowl. In another bowl, mash together the cream cheese with the dill. Spread the cream cheese on the miniature party rounds. Top with the egg mixture. Top with the smoked salmon. Bake the toasts at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until the egg is set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine the first three ingredients and press into the bottom of a 13 x 9 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl combine the next three ingredients. Pour this mixture over the crust. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars and sprinkle with a few white chips. Store in fridge.

In a medium bowl, combine the cracker crumbs with melted margarine until well blended. Press into a 9x13 inch pan coated with cooking spray. Bake for 8-10 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cool completely before frosting with milk chocolate frosting.Mix together milk chocolate frosting ingredients in a medium bowlbeat until smooth. Spread over crust.Melt 1 cup of the chocolate chips in the microwave on 1/2 power for 2-3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds until smooth. Spread over the frosting layer and sprinkle with peanut butter chips. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 275 degrees. In slow cooker combine all the ingredients except the potatoes and carrots. Stir well. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours. Add potatoes and carrots and continue cooking for 1 to 2 hours longer.
If you are looking for a great way to cook with your Instant Pot, we have a collection of great recipes for you. All of them are quick and easy to cook. This is great when you are short on time. The Instant Pot is a pressure cooker and it is easy to cook food quickly in the Instant Pot. It is also great for making soups and sauces. You can also cook food in the Instant Pot without adding any liquid. This makes it easy to cook food without adding extra calories. You can also cook food in the Instant Pot without adding any liquid. This makes it easy to cook food without adding extra calories. You can also cook food in the Instant Pot without adding any liquid. This makes it easy to cook food without adding extra calories.
Instant Pot is an electric pressure cooker that is easy to use.

Remove seeds from cantaloupe and cut into chunks. Wash and dry spinach and cut into 2-inch strips. In a large bowl, toss together cantaloupe and spinach. In a small bowl, whisk together raspberry vinaigrette and pistachios and sprinkle over the top of the cantaloupe and spinach.

Cook the potatoes in the skins until tender in about 30 minutes of boiling time. Drain the potatoes and let them cool enough to handle them. Peel the skins off the potatoes and put them in the large bowl of your electric mixer. Add the other ingredients, except the cream, and mix until they are combined. Then turn on the mixer to medium speed and beat until the mixture is well blended. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13 inch casserole dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for about an hour at 350 degrees.

Mix dry ingredients in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk egg whites until frothy. Whisk in oil and vanilla extract. Add to dry ingredientsmix until smooth. Cook in a preheated griddle sprayed with nonstick spray until bubbles form on topflip and cook until browned on both sides. Serve with maple syrup or strawberry sauce. Makes about eight 5-inch pancakes.

Heat butter and oil in large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook 3 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Remove chicken from skillet. Cover and keep warm. Cook bacon in same skillet until crisp. Add ranch dressing. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer covered 3-5 minutes or until sauce thickens. Stir in 1/2 cup of the cheese. Cook and stir over medium heat until melted. Spoon dressing over chicken. Roll up and secure with wooden toothpicks. Serve with rolls.

Preheat oven to 400f. Bake potatoes until skin is tender. Remove from oven, and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out insidesleaving a bit of the potato in the shell. Mash insides with a fork. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flourcooking and stirring until a paste forms. Stir in milk slowly, until thickened. Stir in cheese. Place mixture in the potato shells. Sprinkle with chives. Bake in the oven until heated through.

Combine pomegranates and sugar in small sauce pan and cook over low heat until mixture thickens and forms a syrup (30-40 minutes) Strain through cheese cloth into bowl. Add grenadine, tapioca and bring to boil again. Simmer 1 minute and add cream. Serve immediately over vanilla ice cream

Heat olive oil in a wok or skillet. Add beef and stir. Add bell peppers and onion. Stir and saute until the beef is no longer pink. Add seasoning. Stir and saute until the vegetables are soft. Add hoisin sauce. Stir and simmer until the liquid evaporates. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place chicken between two sheets of wax paper and pound until 1/2 inch thick. In a shallow bowl combine honey, mustard and garlic. In a separate bowl combine remaining ingredients. Dip chicken into honey mixture and then roll in crumb mixture. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until done. Serve over rice or potato.

Peel and cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch slices. In a large skillet, melt the butter. Add the potatoes, and sauté over medium heat until they are tender. Add the salt, freshly ground black pepper, and sharp cheddar cheese. Continue cooking for a few minutes longer. Stir in the parsley and the onion. Serve hot. Makes about 8 servings.

In a small bowl combine the olive oil, onions, garlic, allspice, cinnamon, chilli, juice of a lime, brown sugar, salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and set aside. Heat the grill to high. Grill the meat for 4-5 minutes per side. Brush the meat with the Jamaican Baste during grilling. Continue to brush the meat every 3-4 minutes until the meat is done to your taste. Serve immediately.

Cream together shortening and sugar. Beat in molasses. Sift together the dry ingredients. Stir into creamed mixture. Roll out 1/4 inch thick on lightly greased surface. Cut into desired shapes. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes.
Saute bacon until crisp. Remove with slotted spoon and drain. Add onions to pan. Saute until tender. Add clams, beer, white wine and butter. Cover. Steam until clams open. Serve with sliced lemons.

In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and crabmeat until well blended. Add the sour cream and next 6 ingredients. Mix well and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to let the flavors blend. Place the shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet. Broil for 2 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool. In a food processor, blend the shrimp. Add to the dip and stir well. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers. YUMMY!!
name: sauced crab ballingredients: cream cheese, crabmeat, lemon juice, onion powder, hot pepper sauce, seafood cocktail sauce, fresh chivespreparation:Put first 5 ingredients into small bowl. Beat until well combined. Shape into ball. Cover and chill at least 2 hours. Just before serving, place on serving plate. Pour cocktail sauce over crab ball. Garnish with chives. Add more cocktail sauce as needed.
name: my sister's spicy che

Combine boiling water, gelatin and sugar in a 2-cup glass measure. Stir until gelatin is completely dissolved, then add 1 cup cold water. Stir until completely blended. Strain into a small bowl. Pour into 6 glasses of 1/2 cup each, and refrigerate until completely set, about 2 hours. Pour 1 tablespoon cherry vodka into each shot glass. Pour 1/4 cup red bull into each shot glass, then stir well. Chill 1 hour before serving.

Separate the egg yolks from the whites. Add milk to egg yolks. Set aside. Mix together the egg whites until stiff. Add the yolk mixture into the egg whites. Slowly add the flour. Heat a non-stick pan. Melt the butter in the pan. When the pan is hot, pour a thin layer of the batter into the pan. Cook for 1 minute. Flip the crepe over. Sprinkle the crepe with spinach. Cook for 1 minute. Sprinkle the crepe with mozzarella cheese. Cook for 1 minute. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cook for 1 minute. Wrap in a tortilla. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets with nonstick spray. Mix together cake mix, egg, cream cheese and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake for 7-9 minutes in preheated oven. Let cool for 2 minutes, then remove to wire racks to finish cooling. Dip each cookie into melted white chocolate chips. Cool on wire racks for at least 15 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Saute onion for 5 minutes. Add the garlic, parsley and pimiento. Season with salt and pepper. Add potatoes, chicken broth, cover, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425f degrees. Melt the bacon fat in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, salt and pepper and cook until the onion is golden brown, stirring often. Stir in the milk and simmer until the liquid reduces by half. Remove from heat and stir in the bread crumbs until well mixed. Add the egg mixture and stir until well blended. Pour into a greased 11x7 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with bacon. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes. Serve with additional bacon on the side.

In a large mixing bowl, beat pudding mix and milk together until thickened. Fold in the whipped topping. Place a single layer of the squares on the bottom of a 8x8 inch pan. Spread half the pudding mixture over the squares, then add another layer of the squares on top. Spread the remaining pudding mixture over the squares. Chill at least two hours. Top with the chocolate frosting. Store in the refrigerator until serving time.

Preheat griddle or skillet to medium heat. Whisk eggs and milk together in a shallow bowl or dish. In another shallow bowl or dish, mix together cinnamon, ginger, and allspice. Place bread cubes into both the egg mixture and into spice mixture alternating dipping both sides of cubes into both mixtures. Cook on griddle or skillet until golden brown on both sides and cooked through. Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

Cut up dove breasts into small pieces. Cut up mushroom and add to dove pieces. Slice onions. Add to dove mixture. Cut up green pepper into small pieces and add to dove mixture. Slice cherry tomatoes. Thread onto skewers and add to grill. Cook until dove is done.

Dredge chops in flour mixed with salt and dry mustard. Brown in hot oil. Add garlic powder and 2 cups boiling water to chicken soup. Mix together. Pour over browned chops. Add 1 cup water to soup. Cover. Simmer 20 minutes. Serve over rice. Serves 4.
I'm a meat and potatoes kinda guy and my husband is a big fan of pot roast. I was looking for a new recipe for pot roast and found one that looked good in a magazine. It was in a cooking magazine for a crock pot but I was not sure if it would work in an oven. I tried it and it turned out great.
It's really very simple to make but it tastes like it took a lot of time to make it. It was a hit with my husband and everyone who ate it. I will definitely make it again.
The recipe is called "Pot Roast in a Crock Pot". I was able to find a similar recipe online that was adapted for the oven.
This recipe is easy to make and it tastes great. It'

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil. Add onions to pan. Cook, stirring occasionally until softened. Add garlic. Cook for another minute. Add steak seasoning. Cook until fragrant. Add steaks and cook until browned. Sprinkle with garlic salt and black pepper. Place cooked steaks in buns. Top with provolone. Serve immediately.

In 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, red bell pepper, onion and garliccook 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in Cajun seasoning. Add ricecook 1 minute. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Covercook 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Sprinkle with pecans.

Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil in a large pan and gently fry the garlic for 1-2 minutes until soft but not coloured. Add the courgettes and cook for 1-2 minutes until just softened. Add the lemon juice, stirring well to combine the ingredients, and then season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Stir in the basil and then divide the cooked tagliatelle between two plates. Top with the courgette mixture and sprinkle with the parmesan.
