Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet or line with parchment paper. Combine pancake mix and water in a large bowl. Stir in the sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon. Drop the batter by spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving about 1/2 inch between each one. Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from sheet.
Cook and drain potatoes. Toss with onion. In small bowl, mix together sour cream, lemon juice and Dijon mustard. Pour dressing over potatoes and toss gently. Garnish with parsley leaves.

Spread the two slices of bread with the swiss cheese and then the butter, then the cream cheese. Fold in half and then cut into triangles. Fry in a hot skillet for about 2 minutes per side. Sprinkle with parsley if desired. Serve warm. Makes about 8 samwiches.

In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350. Butter 9x13 pan. In medium bowl mix together tomato sauce, eggs, corn flake crumbs and parmesan cheese. In separate bowl mix together italian seasoning and garlic powder. Coat chicken breasts with the spice mixture then roll in tomato egg mixture. Place chicken in prepared pan and top with mozzarella. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until chicken is done. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drainset aside. In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, brown beef in 1 tablespoon oil until no longer pink. Drain. Add garlic to beefcook 1 minute. Stir in tomato pastecook 1 minute. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon oiladd tomatoes, sauce, and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in pastatop with cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve with vegetables.
I like this recipe. I did add some italian seasoning and red chilli flakes.
I made this with 2% milk and it turned out great!
I'm gonna try this recipe tomorrow! I love cheesy casseroles!!!
I made this tonight for dinner. It was delicious! I did add some Italian seasoning to the pasta.
I made this recipe and it was really good. I used 2% milk and it turned out

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and stir until it is golden. Then add the cayenne pepper and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the cream cheese and milk. Bring the mixture to the boil. Stir the mixture constantly with the wooden spoon until it thickens. Add the Parmesan cheese and the black pepper.

In a large bowl, cream together sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Stir in vanilla and mashed banana and mix well. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt and add to creamed mixture in two additions alternating with the buttermilk. Fold in the blueberries just until they are distributed evenly. Spoon into the prepared muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes 18 muffins.
Boil and drain potatoes. Let cool. In a large bowl, combine vinegar and oil. Add potatoes and toss. Add remaining ingredients and toss again. Chill. Serve as side dish or main course.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle salt and olive oil on all sides of the pork. Toss with herbs and spread on baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes. Turn and bake for another 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes. Cut into thin slices and serve.
name: marinated roasted pork loiningredients: dried thyme, dried oregano, dried basil, dried marjoram, pork loin, extra virgin olive oilpreparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle all sides of pork with herbs and season with salt and pepper. Heat 1/4 cup oil in skillet until shimmering. Brown pork on all sides. Place pork in shallow baking dish. In same skillet, heat remaining 1/4 cup oil until shimmering. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and softened but not browned, 5 to

Preheat crock pot to low. Combine first 6 ingredients in crock pot and mix well. Cook until vegetables are tender. Meanwhile, cook bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon and crumble. Add beans and rotel to vegetable mixture. Stir in bacon and mozzarella. Cover and cook on low 4 hours or until beans are tender. Serve with additional mozzarella and parsley.

Cream together butter and caster sugar. Add in custard powder and beat to combine. Add in flour and mix until well combined. Add in chocolate chips or any other nuts or dried fruit of your choice. Roll into balls about the size of a ping pong ball and place on a greased baking tray about 5cm apart. Bake in a preheated oven 200c for about 10-15 minutes until slightly golden brown. Let cool for a couple of minutes before moving them to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve alone or warm from the oven with a glass of milk or hot chocolate.

Mix dark brown sugar, flour, and butter together. Add sugar and milk and cook on medium heat until thick. Add butter and stir well. Add 3 eggs and mix well. Remove from heat and pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve warm or cold.
Thanks so much for the recipes!! I love them and I love your site!!
My pleasure! Thank you for taking the time to let me know you enjoyed them!

To prepare dressing combine white sugar, vinegar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add oil and poppy seeds. Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in feta cheese. Cool to room temperature. To prepare salad combine spinach, strawberries, onions and nuts. Toss with dressing. Serve immediately or refrigerate covered until serving.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spread each half of a hot dog bun with butter. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and sesame seeds. Cut each half into 3 strips. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned and crispy. Makes 12 breadsticks.
This is a great idea and very easy to do. I made this recipe last night and my family loved it.
Thank you very much. I will pass this along to my friends.
I've tried this with my 5 year old and she LOVES it!!!
We tried this and it was a success.
These are great. My kids loved them.
I love the ideas and will try them out.
I made these for my 2 year old and he loved them!! I will make them again!
These are so good. My son is 2 and loves them.
I made these last night and they were a hit with my 4 year old. I used ham slices instead of hot dogs and wrapped them around the slices and used cheese. Then I used lettuce leaves

In slow cooker bowl, place half the diced onions, garlic cloves and all the seasonings except the salt and pepper (you will add these just before serving). Place the bone-in pork roast over the seasonings. Pour in enough cold water to cover the top of the seasonings. Cover. Cook on low for 8-10 hours or until done. Remove the bone-in pork from the slow cooker and place it in a bowl or another container. Discard the fatty liquid. Pull the meat with a fork into shreds or bite-sized pieces and discard bones and fat. Put the pulled meat back into slow cooker with the remaining onions and the BBQ sauce. Cover. Cook for 1 hour more or until desired consistency. Serve hot with buns or rolls.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. Cream butter and sugar, beat well, then add eggs one at a time, beating after each one. Beat mixture until very thick about 10 minutes. Add cake flour mixture to beaten mixture alternately with milk, beginning with dry ingredients. beat after each addition until batter is smooth. Pour into greased and lightly floured 10 inch tube pan (i use a springform pan). Bake at 325 for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes. Cool before removing from pan.

In heavy saucepan, combine all the ingredients except the strawberry. Cook over medium heat until mixture is thickened & bubbly. Stir in strawberry & cook over low heat for 1 minute more or until mixture is smooth & bubbly. Transfer to fondue pot & serve immediately with fruit or shortbread cookies or meringues.

In medium saucepan, cook cabbage in 1/3 cup apple juice, 1 Tbsp butter and 1 tsp salt until crisp-tender6-8 min. Cool 5 min. In small bowl, mix apple, raisins, cider vinegar and honeyset aside. In small bowl, mix remaining 1/3 cup apple juice and 1 Tbsp butter until smoothpour over cooled cabbagetoss gently to coat. Gently toss with raisin mixture. Serve at room temp. Serves 4-6.

In a medium saucepan, heat the butter. Add the turnips and cook until the turnips are soft. Add the milk. Heat over low heat until the turnips are tender. Mash the turnips to a creamy consistency. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top the bread slices with the turnip mixture. Top with the caramelized onions.

Combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese in a large bowl, beating at medium speed with an electric mixer until blendedStir in pumpkin and preservesDivide into 2 equal portionsShape each portion into a ballRoll each ball in cracker crumbsStick pretzel stick into each ballRefrigerate 1 hour.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the thyme and fennel and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the wine and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer until the vegetables are tender. Serve.

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters. Cook in boiling water until tender. Drain. When cooled enough to handle, dice into 1/2-inch pieces. Boil eggs for 10 minutescoolshell and dice. Combine with other ingredients. Dress with salad dressing and serve cold or at room temperature.

Separate eggs. In large bowl beat together egg yolks and milk with fork. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold whites into yolk mixture. Cook in skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat. As edges set, pull omelet from sides of pan toward center. Continue cooking until center is set. Top omelet as desired. Serve with toast if desired.

Cut pork into 1/4-inch thick slicesmarinate 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil and saute pork 3-5 minutes or until cooked through and browned on all sides. Pour wine into skilletboil 1-2 minutes to dissolve sugar. Add remaining marinade ingredients and simmer 1-2 minutes or until thickened and flavorful. Remove pork from panpour marinade through strainer into saucepan or gravy boat. Add 1 tablespoon cornstarch to pan drippingsstir until thickened. Serve with marinade and pork. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil, and spray the foil with cooking spray. Peel the parsnips and cut them into 1/4 inch thick slices. Mix together the parsnips and the sunflower oil in a large bowltoss to coat the parsnips evenly. Sprinkle the parsnips with the salt and herbs. Spread the parsnips out onto the baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until they are crisp and golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature with dips or spreads of your choice.

1. In a large bowl combine all ingredients except for almonds. 2. Blend until smooth and pour in pie pan. 3. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. 4. Cool in refrigerator. 5. Top with crushed almonds. Serve chilled.

Combine ricotta cheese and 2 cups of whipping cream in medium bowl. Beat with electric mixer until smooth and well blended. Stir in remaining 1 cup whipping cream with mini semisweet chocolate chips. Fold in chopped pecans, maraschino cherry halves and mini semisweet chocolate chips. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours to chill. Spoon into cannoli shells or small cups. Serves 12

Place all the ingredients except the dried cranberries in a non-reactive pot. Bring to a boil over high heat and simmer until berries are tender and mixture has thickened slightly. Remove from heat and remove the cinnamon stick. Add the dried berries. Chill completely. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and grease 12 cupcake tins or line with paper liners. Sift together dry ingredients. Add eggs, margarine and buttermilk and stir until well blended. Spoon batter into cupcake tins 2/3 full and sprinkle with jam. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until done. Makes 12 muffins

Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Put in microwave oven for one minute. Stir well. Put back in microwave oven for another minute. Stir well. If desired, add nuts. Place on wax paper. Let cool. Break into small pieces.

Place chicken in a crock pot. In a bowl, combine sauerkraut, cheese and dressing. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve on pumpernickel bread.
name: bacon provolone chicken sandwichesingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, poultry seasoning, kaiser rolls, bacon, provolone cheese, romaine leaf, mayonnaisepreparation:Flatten chicken and sprinkle with poultry seasoning. In a non-stick skillet, cook chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side or until juices run clear. On roll, layer the bacon, chicken and cheese. Broil 4-6 inches from the heat for 1-2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with romaine and mayo. Add additional topping to your liking.
name: cheesy chicken with bbq sauce baconingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, salt, pepper, barbecue sauce, bacon, ched

Heat a large soup pot over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and saute the onion and kielbasa. Add the rice and cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes. Add 3 cups of vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer. Add the rest of the broth. Stir in the black-eyed peas and navy beans and simmer. Stir in the garlic powder and cayenne and simmer 5 to 10 minutes more. Serve in bowls topped with parsley. Serve with cornbread and a tossed salad.

In a large bowl beat together the egg yolks with the pumpkin puree, milk, egg whites, salt, cloves and cinnamon until smooth. Pour into the unbaked pie crusts. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees. Bake until filling is set in center of pies, about 1 hour longer. Cool before cutting into wedges. Makes four servings.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter and cook onion for 3-4 minutes or until translucent. Stir in zucchini and cook 2 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring frequently. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Stir in parmesan cheese and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Toss with hot pasta and serve immediately with additional lemon wedges and parmesan cheese for garnish.

Melt butter in saucepan. Stir in onion & cook 1 min. Add tomato sauce & water. Bring to a boilreduce heat, simmer for 10 mins. Add pasta & simmer until tender, about 15 mins. Salt & pepper to taste. Melt 2 tblsp butter in small skillet over low heat. Add 1 tsp flour & stir for 1 min. Gradually add 2 cups milk & stir until thickened. Add 1/4 cup shredded cheese & stir until melted. Stir cheese mixture into macaroni mixture. Transfer macaroni mixture to a 2 qt baking dish & top with 1/2 cup shredded cheese & 2 tblsp bread crumbs. Bake for 20 mins or until bubbly & lightly browned.
This is a nice recipe for a quick and easy dinner or lunch. I serve it with a nice salad and some crusty bread. It is also great served hot or cold.
Put the ground beef into a large skillet and cook until

Combine the flour and salt together and mix with fork to combine well. Slowly add water and mix with fork. Turn out onto a well-floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes or until the mixture is smooth and elastic. Wrap in cling film and store in fridge for up to 2 days.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese and milk. Stir in chives. In a large bowl, beat eggs. Add the cream cheese mixture and stir to combine. Melt 1 Tbs. oil in a 9-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the egg mixture and cook until almost set. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place skillet in oven and bake 3 to 5 minutes or until puffed and set. Serve immediately. Serves 1. Calories 309. Fat 19.3 g (31 percent calories from fat). Protein 22.7 g. name: egg salad on

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Toss the apples with the butter and cinnamon sugar in an 8-inch square baking dish. Combine the flour, sugar and spicescut in the butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over the apple mixture. Pour the milk over all. Bake for 45 minutes or until the apples are tender and the topping is golden. Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Combine the first five ingredients in a medium saucepan, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thick and smooth, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Whisk the soymilk and margarine into the cooled mixture, and pour into an 8-inch-square baking dish coated with cooking spray or into an 8-inch round cake pan. Cover and chill for several hours or overnight.

This sweet corn soup is a simple recipe for a simple pleasure, with a rich flavor that comes from the melding of sweet corn and sweet onion.
If you are a fan of the classic sweet corn flavor, this soup is for you!
To make this easy sweet corn soup recipe, you only need a few basic ingredients.

In a medium bowl stir together the pineapple. Mango. Cucumber. Red bell pepper. Cilantro. Fresh lime juice. Jalapeno. Salt and pepper. Cover and chill salsa for 6 hours. Heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the olive oil to the pan. When hot, add the scallops and cook for 2-3 minutes per side. Squeeze the juice of half a lime over the scallops. Serve the scallops with the salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 9 x 9-inch pan. In a large bowl mix butter and cocoa until smooth. Add eggs, one at a time beating after each addition. Add sugar and mix thoroughly. Add vanilla extract. Stir in flour until just combined. Pour into pan and bake for about 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted into brownie comes out clean. Cool on wire rack and cut into squares.

Preheat the grill and brush it with olive oil. Season the steak with salt and pepper and rub with sage and paprika. Grill for 5 minutes a side or until cooked through. Remove from heat and leave to rest for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with more paprika and garlic and serve.

Boil 2 quarts of water in a 4 quart pan. Cook celery, bell pepper and onion in water for 5 minutes. Add seasonings. Break up ramen into smaller pieces. Add to pan. Add more water if needed to cover vegetables. Cook until al dente. Beat eggs in a bowl. Slowly pour into pan while stirring. Cook for 1 minute. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Combine first 7 ingredients in a bowlpour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Combine refried beans and enchilada sauce in a bowlspread over batter in pan. Combine eggs and cilantro in a bowlpour over batter in pan. Sprinkle with four-cheese mexican blend cheese. Bake for 5 to 6 minutes or until eggs are set. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into squares.

Peel off papery outer layers of garlic heads. Place in small pot with water to cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer about 2 hours or until completely tender. Drain into food processor. Process with canola oil just until blended. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil just before serving. Makes 2 1/2 cups puree. For roasted garlic oil: Preheat broiler to high. Remove 1 head from puree and place cut-side down on broiler pan. Broil 2 inches from heat for 2 minutes on each side or until cloves are golden brown and tender. Remove from heat, let stand 5 minutes, then squeeze each clove from its skin into a small bowl. Discard skins and add puree to bowl. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and stir to blend. Makes 1/2 cup.

Place coleslaw mix in a mixing bowl. Add the chicken and mix well. Add 1/2 of the fat-free mayonnaise and the salt and pepper. Taste and add more of each if desired. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 1 hour to blend flavors. To assemble the wraps, place about 2 tablespoons of the mixture on each tortilla. Fold the ends up and then roll up. Wrap the wraps tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 8 wraps.

Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a small bowl combine the first five ingredients and set aside. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook the onion and garlic in the olive oil until onion is tender. Add the tahini mixture and cook and stir 1 minute more. Add the noodles and toss to coat. Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve immediately.

Place the fillets in a baking dish and sprinkle with the seasonings. Cut the tomatoes in wedges and arrange on top of the fish. Peel the green peppers and cut into strips. Lay the strips on the tomato slices. Sprinkle the onion over the top of the dish. Pour the oil over the onions. Top the dish with the basil leaves. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for about 30 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily.

For the syrup, combine all of the ingredients in a saucepan over low heat. Bring to a simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until sugar is dissolved. Turn off the heat and let cool for 20-30 minutes. Pour into a tall container with a lid. Cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Strain through a fine strainer or cheesecloth before serving. For the drink, combine equal parts of strained syrup and mineral water in a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.
name: pineapple mojitoingredients: ice cubes, pineapple chunks, sliced, pineapple juice, limes, ice cubes, rum, white, ice cubes, club soda, white sugar, powderedpreparation:In a tall glass with ice cubes add pineapple chunks and pineapple juice. Muddle with a muddler or spoon until smooth. Add rum and stir to combine. Add ice cubes, club soda, and stir. Garnish

Place ravioli into large saucepan and add enough chicken stock to cover completely. Cook until ravioli are tender, about 6 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in spinach. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with grated parmesan cheese and crusty italian bread.

Saute sausage, onion and green bell pepper until cooked through. Drain. Add 1 can of diced tomatoes and 1 can of stewed tomatoes. Add ketchup. Stir in ziti and mozzarella cheese. Bake 20 minutes at 350. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and return to oven for an additional 10 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large skillet brown sausage over medium heat until no longer pink. Remove sausage with a slotted spoon to a plate. In the same skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Stir in tomato sauce. Add back the sausage. Simmer 5 minutes. Sprinkle with oregano. Add 1/2 cup chablis and the mushrooms. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Transfer to a 2-quart shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered 20 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Serve over pasta.

Combine water with soy sauce and Worcestershire in small bowl. Place meat in a glass baking dish. Pour soy mixture over meat. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Remove meat from refrigerator 1 hour before grilling. Preheat grill. Cook meat on hot grill 4 minutes on each side. Serve with balsamic sauce. To make the balsamic sauce, combine all of the ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook until thickened and reduced by half. Cool completely. Serve with meat.

Heat oil in skillet. Add onion, carrot and celery. Cook until soft. Add salmon and cook 2 minutes. Add pearl barley and rice. Add chicken broth. Bring to boil. Reduce to med low. Cover and cook until rice is tender. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.
Puree berries until smooth. Strain through a fine strainer, discarding seeds. Add port and sugar to taste. Heat just until warmed through. Stir in adobo sauce. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan over low heat stir together the first three ingredients. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil. Boil 3 minutes, remove from heat. Add the cereal, toss and coat with cooked mixture until well coated. Quickly press into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Cool, then cut into squares. Melt the chocolate morsels and spread over the top of the cooled treats. Refrigerate until set. Makes about 36 servings.

Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring frequently, until it is soft and translucent. Add the flour and cook for 2 to 3 minutes longer. Whisk in the milk and dry sherry. Season with the salt and paprika. Bring to a boil over medium heat and reduce heat to low. Simmer, whisking occasionally until thickened and smooth. Add the cream and the lobster meat. Cook until heated through. Garnish with chives.

Heat oil in medium saucepot over medium heat. Add celery and onions. Cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in rind and cook for 1 minute more. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Add water and orange juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in salt and parsley. Spread mixture in a 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with almonds and bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees or until heated through and top is lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Place sauerkraut into 8 quart kettle. Add water to cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes. Add sugar, caraway seed and parsley. Cook 30 minutes. Add cooking apples, cover and cook 30 minutes longer. Serve with frankfurters or frankfurters and sausage.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl, whisk balsamic vinegar with 1/3 cup olive oil, 1 tablespoon honey, and 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Sprinkle the chicken with the remaining 1/3 cup olive oilrub to coat. In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon honey with the remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and rosemary. In a small bowl, combine the garlic and the remaining 1 teaspoon olive oil. Season the chicken with the spice mixture. In a large shallow baking dish or rimmed baking sheet, arrange the chicken and brush the pieces with the garlic-oil mixture. Sprinkle the balsamic vinaigrette over the chicken and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and brush the chicken with the balsamic-honey mixture. Bake for 15 minutes longer or until the chicken is brow

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom of the roasting pan with aluminum foilplace the cooked ham on top of the foil. Combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepanheat over medium heat until the glaze is bubbly. Pour over the cooked hamcover the roasting pan with foil. Bake for 30 minutes per pound. Remove from the ovenbrush the top of the ham with the glaze to coat evenly. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes more. Carve and serve immediately.

In a small bowl, whisk together first 5 ingredients. Gradually add oil, whisking until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. In large bowl toss together greens, cranberries, onion and pecans. Add dressing. Toss to coat. Top with goat cheese. Serve.
In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. Add the skim milk and lemon juicestir just until moistened. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 375 for one hour.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and add the butter to the potatoes in the pan while still hot, mash until desired consistency. Mix the juice and sour cream together, then add to the mashed potatoes along with the zest of one orange. Mix until smooth. Garnish with orange zest. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and spices. Cut in the margarine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in applesauce and raisins. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes until slightly golden. Let cool on sheet for 2 minutes before removing to wire rack. Makes 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

Combine brown sugar and tequila in medium saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until the liquid reduces to 2 tablespoons. Add the molasses, water, and salt and pepper to taste. Remove the mixture from heat and let cool for 20 minutes. Rub the mixture over the pork and refrigerate overnight. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the pork in a roasting pan and roast for 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or until the meat is crisp and golden brown. Drain the fat from the roasting pan and return the meat to the pan. Cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the green onions.

Beat shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time then beat in milk. Combine flour, baking powder, salt and soda then stir into mixture. Stir in cinnamon and nuts. Spread in greased pan and sprinkle with additional cinnamon. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until done. Cool 10 minutes before icing. Cream together butter and confectioners's sugar then spread over cooled cake. Decorate with walnuts.

Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Drain pasta and let cool to room temperature. Combine the pasta with the rest of the ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

Heat oven to 350. Arrange half the onions in the bottom of a 9-inch-square baking dish. Top with half the pork. Spoon half the soup over the pork. Repeat layers. Dot with remaining onions. Pour mayonnaise over top. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove foil. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered 15 minutes longer or until a thermometer reads 160 degrees F.

Combine butter, sugars and vanilla in a microwave safe mug. Microwave on high for 45 seconds. Stir in salt and egg yolk until well combined. Add flour and mix until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips and bake for 2 minutes.

Toss together the cucumbers, onion, sugar, salt, mustard seeds, garlic and chilies in a nonreactive bowl until well combined. Set aside for 2 hours. Drain the liquid from the vegetables into a nonreactive saucepan. Add the vinegar. Bring to a boil over high heat for 1 minute to dissolve the sugar. Add the vegetables to the syrup. Bring to a boil for 1 minute. Remove from heatcool to room temperature before serving. Serve the pickles over the tomatoes.

In a bowl combine hoisin sauce with sambal oelek, scallions, wine and pepper. Cut chicken into 2 inch chunks. Place in a shallow baking dish. Pour the mixture over the chicken. Cover the dish with plastic wrap. Refrigerate the chicken for 3 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Bake the marinated chicken 40 minutes to an hour or until no longer pink. Serve with rice.
Baked Hoisin Sauce Chicken Wings.
In a large bowl combine chili sauce, horseradish and lemon juice. Whisk in Worcestershire and hot sauce. Store in refrigerator.

In a small fry pan, cook the onion in the oil over low heat for 10 minutes or until soft and light brown. Add the cardamom and stir briefly. Set aside to cool. In a small bowl combine the peanut butter and brown sugar. In a medium bowl whisk together the soy sauce and lemon juice. Add the onion mixture and the liquid red pepper. Stir to combine. Whisk in the peanut butter mixture until smooth. Serve over vegetables or meat. Makes 3 cups.

Combine first four ingredients in a large bowlbeat on medium speed until well blended. Spoon batter into paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 400f for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely on a wire rack. Frost with frosting.

Combine whole wheat flour, salt, honey and oil in large mixing bowl or food processor. Cut in egg yolk and knead until dough is soft enough to roll out. Roll out on floured board with rolling pin until about 1/2" thick. Cut into squares with knife or pastry cutter. Fry in hot vegetable oil until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot with honey or jam. Makes about 3 dozen.

Combine the vinegar, 3 tablespoons of the oil and the rosemary in a large bowl. Add the chickenturn to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight.Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large heavy skillet over high heat. Add the chickencook until browned and cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes per side. Remove the chicken to a platter. Add the lemon juice and the butter to the skilletswirl to combine. Cook until the butter is melted. Pour the butter mixture over the chickensprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a shallow dish combine potato flakes, buttermilk and garlic. In a small bowl, combine bread crumbs and seasonings. Dip fish first into potato mixture, then into bread crumb mixture and place on baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees fahrenheit. Serve with lemon wedges.

Saute onions in oil until softened. Add lean beef and cook until brown. Add broth, salt, pepper and split peas. Cook for about 30 minutes. Add almonds, apricots and prunes, simmer until done. Serve over rice.

Cook frozen beans according to package directions. Drain well. Add olive oil, minced garlic, and rosemary to pan in which beans were cooked. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until beans are warmed through and have a glaze on them, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large saucepan and cook okra for 5 minutes. Add red onions and cook for 3 minutes. Add remaining olive oil and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in garlic, ginger, cardamom, and jalapenos and cook for 1 minute. Stir in vegetable stock and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low and simmer until okra is tender. Add yogurt and cook for 2 minutes.

In a saucepan, sautee the onions until they are golden brown and then add the yogurt and water stirring all the time until the yogurt is all dissolved. Then add the wheat and cook until it is done. Add the butter and mint and parsley and salt and mix well.

Soak the beans for 8 hours. Saute the garlic, onions and chiles in hot oil until the onions are soft. Add the stock and the beans and cook until they are tender. Mash the beans and stir in the cream and avocado. Season to taste. Heat the tortillas and serve with the soup and the cheese and cream.

Combine cranberries, tapioca and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the tapioca is translucent. Cool the mixture to room temperature. Peel and core baking apples and cut into 1/2 inch slices. Toss the sliced apples with the cranberry mixture. Place the apples in a 9 inch pie pan and cover the top with the remaining dough. Cut several slits in the top and bake the pie at 400 degrees for 25 minutes. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees and bake for an additional hour. Cool the pie on a wire rack. Drizzle the pie with a simple syrup made with orange zest and water.

Sprinkle both sides of chicken with seasoned flour. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saut chicken in hot oil until browned on both sides. Add wine to pan. Cook over medium heat until wine has evaporated. Add broth. Add fresh sage leaves to the pan, and then let simmer for 5 minutes. Add butter. Add mustard to taste. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice off the ends of the potatoes and peel. Cut into 1/2-inch slices. Place in a large bowl. Add the brown sugar and orange zest and toss to combine. In a separate bowl, combine the orange juice and vanilla. Pour over the potato mixture and toss to combine. In a medium bowl, combine the coconut, granulated sugar and cinnamon. Divide the potato mixture into 16 equal portions and form into balls. Roll the balls in the coconut mixture to coat. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and spread out the marshmallows evenly over the tops. Return to the oven and bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden. Makes 16.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in ramen noodles, turn off heat and cover. Let stand for 5 minutes. Drain well and place in a large bowl. In a saucepan over medium heat combine milk and broccoli. Cook for about 5 minutes or until broccoli is tender. Remove from heat and stir in mushrooms. Drain milk mixture over ramen noodles and toss to coat. Stir in mayonnaise and sour cream. Pour into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve hot.

Toast the pecans in a 350 f. oven until lightly browned. In a large bowl, toss together the lettuce, blue cheese crumbles and pecans. Whisk together the raspberry vinegar, oil, Tabasco, salt, pepper and sugar. Pour the dressing over the lettuce mixture and toss to coat. Sprinkle the lettuce mixture with the toasted pecans. Serve at room temperature.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add tomatoes and cook until juices evaporate. Add the spinach and continue cooking until the spinach is wilted. Season with the oregano and the salt and pepper. Stir in the pasta and toss to combine. Transfer the pasta to a serving dish. Top with the olives. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serves 4.

Clean mushrooms. Mince garlic. Fry the mushrooms with minced garlic in hot butter. Season with salt, white pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice. Blend in cream. Pour into warm bread slices. Garnish with parsley.
Heat oil in large skillet. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Dip in milkdredge in flour and add to hot oil. Fry until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread the apricots evenly in a single layer onto a baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes, or until the skins start to get wrinkled. Remove from oven and let cool. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, water and dried apricots. Cook, stirring often, until the fruit is soft, about 15 minutes. Mash the fruit with a potato masher to make sure the dried pieces are broken down. Add the apricots that were roasted in the oven, the lemon juice, and the almond extract. Cool completely before transferring to the ice cream freezer canister. Freeze according to manufacturers directions.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Combine all the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Add the wet ingredients and mix till combined. Fold in the raisins. Drop by large spoonfuls onto a cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 3 dozen.

Cut onion into slices and put into small skillet with oil. Brown lightly over medium-low heat. In large bowl combine onion and garlic with rest of ingredients and mix. Rub brisket with mixture. Wrap tightly and place in refrigerator for at least 12 hours. Cook slowly on grill or in smoker until tender. Slice across grain.

Combine the first four ingredients in a medium size pot and bring to a boil over medium heat. Lower the heat and allow mixture to simmer for three minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the beaten egg and the parsley. Return mixture to the stove and heat over medium heat until the soup thickens slightly. Do not boil. Serve immediately.

Cook the potatoes until they are tender. Cut into cubes. Add the yogurt and celery to the potatoes. Season to taste. Refrigerate. Before serving, add the vinegar and oil. Fold in the onions. Season to taste. Serve.
Name: warm dijon potato saladIngredients: Red Potatoes, Mayonnaise, Parmesan Cheese, Green Onion, Cider Vinegar, Dijon Mustard, Salt, PepperPreparation:Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes or until tender. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Drain potatoes and cut into cubes. Add the mayonnaise mixture and toss gently to coat. Serve immediately.
Name: marinated potato saladIngredients: Potatoes, Water, White Wine Vinegar, White Sugar, Green Onion, Hard-Boiled Eggs, Salt And Pepper, Celery Seed, MayonnaisePreparation:

Line a 9x9 inch square baking dish with a pie crust of your choice. Mix together the bacon and sausage in a large skillet. Brown until cooked through and drain. Add the sour cream and mix thoroughly. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Top with the cheese and sprinkle with the fresh parsley. Beat together the eggs and milk in a large bowl and pour over the casserole. Bake for 35-40 minutes until set. Cut into squares and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 425. Roll out dough and cut each piece in half. Place half on each square of wax paper. Add a little bit of spaghetti sauce to the bottom of each square. Add the chicken and mushrooms, and sprinkle with cheese. Fold over and seal the edges. Cut slits for air to escape. Bake for 8-10 minutes.

Beat butter with an electric mixer until soft and creamy. Add the sugar and beat for 5 minutes or until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and the lemon juice. Sift the flour, soda and salt together. Add to creamed mixture and mix to form dough. Divide the dough into 2 portions. On a lightly floured surface roll out one portion to 1/4 inch thickness. With a 2 inch round cutter cut out circles of dough. Place 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining portion of dough. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly golden brown around the edges. Remove from the oven. Cool on the pan for 2 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool on wire racks completely.

Combine the tuna, celery, and onion in a large bowl. Mix in the mayo. Place a generous amount of the mixture into the bottom of each bun. Top each with a slice of mozzarella. Place the sandwiches in the oven. Bake at 400 degrees for about 5 minutes or until the cheese melts. Remove from the oven. Top each with tomato slices and lettuce. Serve immediately.

Grind coffee beans coarsely. Into a small pot, place coffee grounds, ground cardamom and a pinch of saffron. Add 1½ cups of water and bring to boil on medium heat for 4-5 minutes. Then add the rest of the water and allow to boil for another 4-5 minutes on low heat. Remove from heat and strain coffee into a serving pot or coffee pot. Add 1 tablespoon of rosewater. Add milk. Serve hot or cold.
Prepare the macaroni and cheese according to the instructions on the box. Add the butter and the milk. Add the broccoli cheese soup. Stir in the meat. Bake according to the instructions on the box.

Preheat grill on high. Mix together tomato paste, oregano and 1/2 teaspoon of hot sauce. Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. Brush on the paste mixture and sprinkle on the pepper. Grill for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until the shrimp are cooked through. Remove from the grill and drizzle on the remaining hot sauce and lemon juice. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Combine 1 1/2 cups milk and 1 cup water in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add the rice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and let the mixture simmer until the liquid is nearly absorbed, about 45 minutes. Stir in the remaining 2 cups milk and 3/4 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the liquid is nearly absorbed and the rice is tender and creamy, about 15 minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the butter, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Let the mixture cool for 30 minutes. Whisk the egg yolks in a large bowl. Whisk in 1 1/2 cups of the cream until blended. Pour the mixture back into the saucepan and set over medium heat. Cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon, 3 to 4 minutes (do not boil). Remove the saucepan from the heat and

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions, celery and carrot. Cook until tender. Add the stewed tomatoes, broth, thyme and bay leaves. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Season to taste with the cayenne pepper. Serve immediately.

Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise. Squeeze each half into a bowl. Sprinkle with sugar. Add 1 tablespoon of lemon juice to each tomato half. Repeat with all of the tomatoes. Pour in 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle with the savory. Season with salt and red pepper to taste. Toss gently. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with the slivered garlic before serving. Serve cold.
Combine first four ingredients. Combine remaining ingredients. Spread onto bagels. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375. Beat sour cream and sugar until smooth. Add flour and beat until smooth. Add corn and mix well. Spray 9-inch square baking pan. Arrange 3 or 4 layers of corn. Spread with beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and top with remaining corn. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve with toppings of your choice.

Rinse broccoli, and drain well. In a large bowl, toss together broccoli and onion. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients, stirring well. Pour over broccoli mixture and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight.

Combine warm water, honey and syrup in the bowl of an electric mixerstir in the cinnamon, oatmeal, and the yeast. Let stand for about 5 minutes or until foamy. Combine the 4 cups of the flour and the saltadd to the yeast mixture, mixing at low speed just until moistened. Beat at high speed for 3 minutes. Stir in the raisins. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surfaceshape into an 11-inch-long loaf. Place in an 8-inch square pan coated with cooking spraycover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 35 minutes. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown and a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the pan to cool on a wire rack. Makes one loaf.

In a large pot, brown sausage. Add the vegetables and stir. Add the water and pasta sauce. Bring to a boil and cook for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the garbanzo beans and the bouillon cube and cook for about 10 more minutes. Add the pasta and cook for another 5 minutes or until the pasta is cooked. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Soak the wheat gluten in mushroom stock. Drain and pat dry. Combine the remaining ingredients and add to the gluten. Mix thoroughly and knead for 3 minutes. Divide into 8 parts and roll into logs. Place the logs in a plastic bag with the top closed and refrigerate for 2-3 hours. Slice and pan fry in a small amount of oil. Serve with your favorite vegetables and salad. Serves 8.

In a large soup pot or dutch oven over medium heat, cook the garlic in the olive oil for 3 minutes. Add the broth and salt. Bring to a boil. Add the bread cubes and simmer until the bread is soft. Stir in the egg. Serve hot.

Peel and cook potatoes until tender. Mash while hot. Stir in cream, parmesan cheese, and half of the cheddar cheese. Stir in chives. Spread into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Makes 6 servings. Serve with salad or a green vegetable.

Combine chicken, celery, onion, and salt in a large bowl. Whisk together the remaining ingredients in a separate bowl. Add the dressing to the chicken mixturetoss well. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Before serving, fold in mandarin oranges. Garnish with toasted almonds and serve over a bed of romaine lettuce.

Preheat oven to 175c. Grease tray. Cream the butter and brown sugar together. Add the eggs and beat well. Stir in the dry ingredients and the chocolate chips and milo. Place teaspoons of mixture on tray and bake for about 20 minutes or until golden. Cool on rack.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

In large mixing bowl beat together powdered sugar and margarine until creamy and smooth. Beat in vanilla and marshmallow cream until well mixed. Add in caramels and mix until smooth. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Top with chopped nuts and chill for several hours or overnight. Cut into squares and store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease 13x9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. In a large skillet combine spinach with onion and garlic. Saute until onion is translucent. Add egg, cottage cheese, flour, remaining butter, low fat cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 1 hour.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top. Spread the beans out on the wire rack to dry and toast for about 20 minutes. While the beans are toasting, heat a large pot of salted water over high heat. When the beans have cooled, add them to the pot and cook until tender (about 15 minutes). Drain and rinse the beans. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a boil. Blanch the spinach in batches until tender (about 1 minute), then drain and cool under running water. Squeeze out all of the excess liquid from the spinach and place in a large bowl. Stir in the beans, lemon juice, balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature.

Fry bacon crisp. Remove bacon to drain on paper towels. Add green pepper to drippings remaining in pan. Add chopped tomatoes. Cook over low heat until tender. Add fish. Cook over low heat 5 minutes or until heated through. Whisk eggs. Add to fish mixture. Cook over medium heat until eggs are set. Serve on toast. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut eggplant in half lengthwise. Rub with palm sugar. Sprinkle with soy sauce and salt. Roast in oven for about 45 minutes or until eggplant is soft. In a small bowl, mix chili paste with 1/4 cup water to make a paste. Add eggplant to a food processor with the chili paste mixture. Blend until smooth. Add soy sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar. Serve immediately or chill. Garnish with cilantro leaves.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Trim ends off of asparagus and snap off tough lower portions. Rinse and dry. Cut shiitake into thin slices. In a large bowl, whisk together vinegar and mustard. Add the oil and whisk until emulsified. Add the asparagus, tossing to coat. Add the mushrooms and toss again. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until the asparagus is crisp-tender and the edges of the shiitakes are golden. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

Bring water to boil in 2-quart saucepan. Add oatsstir until mixture is thick and creamy. Stir in condensed milk and coconut. Continue stirring until mixture thickens and begins to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove from heat. Stir in salt and coconut extract. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 200c 400f. Heat a fry pan over high heat add oil and chicken and cook for 3 mins each side or until well browned, set aside. Add leek and cook for 5 mins until golden. Place leek mix, rice and stock in a baking dish, cover tightly with lid or foil and bake for 20 mins. Add chicken and peas to the risotto and cover tightly and bake for further 20 mins. The risotto will be quite liquid at this stage. Stir the parmesan, lemon juice, mint and salt and pepper through the risotto. Stir for 2 mins to thicken then serve.

Place chicken and rice in a large casserole dish. Mix together soup and milk and pour over the chicken and rice. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.
Hey! I’m Kris, and I’m a self-taught baker. I’ve been baking since I was just a little girl, and I can’t imagine life without it. I’ve tried many different recipes and techniques over the years and have found that the best way to learn is to get in the kitchen and experiment. That’s why I’m so excited to share my recipes with you!
I hope you enjoy my recipes and find them helpful. If you have any questions or comments, please feel free to contact me. I’d love to hear from you!
What is the best way to cook chicken breast?
There are many different ways to cook chicken breast, but the best way to cook it depends on the person’s preferences. Some people may like their chicken breast cooked all the way through, while others may prefer it to be juicier and more flavorful.
There are many ways

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and line base and sides of 9x13x2inch cake pan with baking paper. Beat together the butter and sugar until light and creamy. Beat in egg yolks. Sift together flour and baking powder. Stir into egg mixture alternately with lemon juice and rind. Whisk egg whites until foamy. Gradually beat in remaining sugar until stiff peaks form. Stir through yolk mixture. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake in oven 40-45 minutes or until golden and firm to touch. Cool in pan 5 minutes before turning out onto wire rack to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

Cook the egg noodles according to package directions. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the meat in the skillet with the onion and green pepper until the meat is no longer pink. Stir in the garlic powder and cook for 1 minute longer. Stir in the crushed tomatoes and tomato paste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve over hot egg noodles. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water to desired tenderness. Drain well. Heat butter in medium skillet over medium heat. Add the thyme and cook 1 minute. Add the basil and cook 1 minute. Add the parsley and cook 1 minute more. Toss the pasta with the butter mixture. Serve immediately.

Mix dry ingredients and slowly add water until it becomes a firm but not too sticky dough. Roll out to desired thickness and cut into squares with cookie cutter or knife. Bake on lightly greased cookie sheet at 350 for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and store in container with lid.

Combine honey, ginger and garlic in small bowl. Combine in a small bowl and mix well. Remove skin from chicken and cut into bite size pieces. Add oil into frying pan and place on high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until done. Add the honey mixture and cook for another minute or until glaze is thickened and chicken is coated evenly. Remove from heat and garnish with coriander leaves if desired.
Love this site, great info and ideas.
I just made the baked honey garlic chicken and it was awesome! I had some leftover and put it in the fridge and then microwaved it the next day and it was still as delicious as the first day!
Hey there! I've tried many of your recipes and they are all great! I'm not sure if you are still looking for recipes or not but I just wanted to let you know that you can try out my blog and you can try out my recipe for Sweet and Sour Chicken!
I love your site! I'm gonna try the

Sprinkle chicken evenly with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet. Add onion and cook until tender. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes. Add broccoli, garlic salt, and pepper. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in rice. Add soup, milk, and 1/3 cup water. Cook 5 minutes. Sprinkle with provolone. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with additional broccoli.

In a large saucepan, cover the potatoes with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook over moderately high heat until the potatoes are just tender, about 15 to 18 minutes. Drain and transfer to a large bowl. Add the celery and onion and toss. Stir in enough of the dressing to lightly moisten. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Sprinkle with black pepper.

In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the beans and cook for 1 more minute. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Transfer to a serving bowl and stir in 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Stir in 3 tablespoons of white wine vinegar and 2 tablespoons of Dijon mustard. Whisk in the olive oil in a steady stream until emulsified. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately at room temperature or chilled.

Soak soba noodles in water for 10 minutes. Add noodles to boiling water for 30 seconds or until soft. Add spinach and stir. Combine mushroom stock, chicken stock, water, soba noodles, spinach, soy sauce and lime juice in a saucepan. Add the shiitake mushrooms. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add spinach. Serve in individual bowls. Garnish with coriander.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine dressing with garlic. Add sausage and mix well. Remove seeds from squash and cut into 1 inch pieces. In a large bowl toss squash with the sausage mixture. Place into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with oregano and bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with parmesan and serve with italian bread. Serves 4.

In a large saucepan of boiling water, cook rice 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion. Cook, stirring until tender. Stir in rice. Add 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add bay leaf. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Cook 5 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Stir in hot pepper sauce. Add peas. Cook 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.
Crispy crust and sweet cinnamon filling are a winning combo in this delicious treat.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and cinnamon. Cut in shortening until crumbly. Add milk all at once and stir until just moistened.
Turn out onto lightly floured surface. Knead just enough to make a soft dough. Roll dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut

Preheat the oven to 450. Toss the squash with the olive oil. Roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Cool slightly. Add the stock to the rice and bring to a boil. Cook over medium-high heat for 10 minutes. Stir in the squash. Remove from heat. Stir in the onion, cream cheese, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Spray 8x8 glass dish with cooking spray. Pour risotto into dish. Bake until heated through, 30-35 minutes.

Melt chocolate and butter in double boiler. Blend in eggs and condensed milk. Pour into graham cracker pie shells. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Bake at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until set. Cool. Drizzle with caramel topping. Refrigerate.

Sort and wash lentils. Add to 3 cups of boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain and set aside. Brown meat in skillet. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan combine the meat and lentils with the remaining ingredients. Heat until hot. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and cut the potatoes in 1/2 inch cubes. Cook in boiling water for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and return to the hot pot. Add the soup and melted butter. Add the sour cream and mix. Add the onion and cheese and mix. Spoon into a 9x13 inch casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.
Combine first 4 ingredients in small bowlrub onto both sides of tuna steaks. Grill or broil 6 minutes on each side or until desired doneness.

Soak beans overnight. Drain and put in crockpot. Add remaining ingredients and cook 8 to 12 hours. Do not stir.
Name: three dollar baked beans Ingredients: pork and beans, black beans, onion, smoked bacon, catsup, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, white sugar Preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Brown bacon until crisp then drain on paper towels. Cook onions in bacon drippings until translucent. Drain any excess fat from pan. Add beans, catsup, barbecue sauce, sugars and bacon to pan. Stir and pour into a baking pan. Bake for 1 hour.
Name: oven baked beans for 2 Ingredients: bacon, onion, baked beans, ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, prepared mustard Preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. In large skillet, cook and stir bacon and onion until bacon is crisp. Drain off fat

Place lettuce and avocado in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar and the olive oil. Pour over the lettuce and avocado. Toss to coat. Garnish with oranges. Chill 30 minutes before serving. Serves 4.

Place the chicken in the crock pot. Top with the swiss cheese. Lay the ham on top of the swiss. Mix soup, milk, breadcrumbs and seasonings together in a bowl. Spread half of the mixture over the ham. Place the remaining ham and swiss cheese on top. Spread the remaining mixture over the top. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours.

Cut broccoli into small bite size pieces. In a large mixing bowl combine the orange juice and zest and the vinegar. Whisk in the sugar until dissolved. Add the broccoli to the bowl. Gently toss to coat. Add the green onions and the chopped almonds. Toss gently. Let sit for 5 minutes. Add the olive oil. Toss again and serve immediately.

Heat the oven to 180C/350F/gas 4. Line the bottom of a deep 20cm/8-inch round cake tin with baking parchment and grease the sides of the tin with the butter. In a large pan over a low heat melt the white chocolate and golden syrup together. Stir until combined and then add the milk and white chocolate to the melted mixture. Allow to cool for a few minutes. Sift the gluten-free flour and baking powder into a large bowl. Add the eggs and thickened cream and beat until well combined. Add the melted white chocolate mixture and beat until just combined. Pour the mixture into the cake tin. Bake for 50 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Whilst the cake is cooling prepare the caramel sauce. In a small pan over a medium heat melt the butter. Add the brown sugar and golden syrup and stir until
Soak the chickpeas in boiling water for 40 minutes. Drain and mash into a paste. Add the garlic, coriander and cumin. Mix well. Shape into croquettes and deep fry in hot oil. Serve with yogurt.

In a sauce pan heat the butter over medium heat. Add the raisins, sugar, cardamom and cinnamon. Cook for a minute or so until the sugar is melted. Stir in the apples and cook for about 10 minutes or until the apples are tender but not mushy. Serve as is or on top of waffle or pancakes.

In a heavy frying pan heat a small amount of butter and melt until foamy. In the meantime slice ham and cheddar thinly and place on bottom half of bread. Next spread a small amount of chutney on top and place other half of the bread on top. Now place the sandwich on a flat plate and put a small amount of butter on top and then place on the hot griddle and toast until light brown on both sides. Cut and serve immediately, adding a pickled onion if desired.

To make topping, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add flour, stirring constantly, until thickened. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add egg yolks, 1 at a time, stirring constantly until thickened. Season with salt. Preheat grill. Peel off the bottom 1/2 inch of tough skin from each spear of asparagus. Brush the spears on all sides with oil. Grill on a lightly oiled grill over medium-high heat for 3 minutes or until tender. Top with ham. Spoon egg topping over each serving. Sprinkle with parsley.

Mix together yeast, 1/2 cup of the water and 2 tablespoons of the oil in a mixing bowl. Let stand until mixture becomes bubbly, 5 to 10 minutes. Combine the remaining water, sugar, eggs and remaining 1 1/2 cups of the flour in the mixing bowlblend well. Stir in the remaining oil. Stir in the yeast mixture and the remaining 2 cups of the flour, 1 cup at a time, blending after each addition. The dough will be soft, almost sticky. Turn out onto a lightly floured board or countertop and knead for 10 to 12 minutes until smooth and elastic. Lightly oil a large mixing bowl and place the dough in it, turning once to coat. Cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel and let stand for 45 minutes in a draft-free place until doubled in bulk. Punch down the dough. Divide in half and shape each half into a round loaf. Place the loaves on an ungreased baking sheet, cover with a damp towel and let stand
Slice ripe tomatoes about 1/4-inch thick. Put a couple of slices on each of six plates. Spoon on a little of the dressing, and garnish each serving with a sprinkling of capers.

Combine flour, cocoa and baking powder. Add amaretto and blend well. Beat sugar and butter until creamy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture. Spread in a greased 15x10x1 inch baking pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool completely on wire rack. Spread with icing and sprinkle with ground almonds.

Preheat over to 400f. Grease a 10 inch pie plate with cooking spray. In a large skillet brown ground beef and onion over medium heat until browned. Drain thoroughly. In a large bowl combine zucchini, salt and pepper. Spread vegetables in prepared pan. In a small bowl combine bisquick mix, milk and eggs with a wire whisk until blended. Pour over vegetables. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 35-45 minutes or until the center is set. Let stand for 15 minutes before cutting into wedges. Serves 6-8.

Cook potatoes in their jackets in boiling salted water until tender, then drain well. Cut the potatoes into halves and place in a greased casserole with the sliced onion and the remaining ingredients except the breadcrumbs. Mix the breadcrumbs with melted butter. Sprinkle the crumbs over the top of the potatoes and dot with the remaining pieces of bacon. Bake in a preheated moderate oven for about 1 hour. Remove from the oven and stir gently. Sprinkle with a little cheese and return to the oven until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine the first 4 ingredients in a shallow dish. Add chicken breasts and turn to coat. Cover and let stand at room temperature 30 minutes. Coat with crumb mixture and cheese. Bake 35-45 minutes or until no longer pink. To serve, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.

In a quart size plastic bag combine the sugar and cinnamon. Set aside. Cut the biscuits into 4 pieces and then place in the bag with the sugar and cinnamon. Shake until well coated. Then roll the coated biscuit pieces out flat with a rolling pin until they are very thin. Then use the rolling pin to cut each one into a strip of about an inch wide and then roll it into a small spiral or coil. Heat a large non stick skillet over medium high heat until hot. Add the nuts. Stir until lightly browned and then remove the nuts from the skillet with a slotted spoon onto paper towels. Place the coiled biscuit strips into the hot skillet. Cook until they are light brown and then turn them with a fork until they are light brown on the other side as well. Remove the strips from the skillet with a slotted spoon onto paper towels. Continue until all the strips have been cooked. Place them on a cookie tray and then roll them while they are warm in the sugar/cinnamon mixture. Serve warm or let cool.

Separate egg white from yolk. Place egg white in bowl. Beat on medium speed until frothy. Add brown sugar and beat until soft peaks form. Beat in sour cream until smooth. Add coffee and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Stir in 1/2 cup cocoa. Beat until smooth. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup cocoa. Transfer to bowl with lid or plastic wrap. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 200oc. Put the oranges in a small saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer gently until the oranges are tender. Strain and cool. Cut the figs in half lengthwise. Put the figs in a small ovenproof pan and add the oranges. Pour over the marsala and honey. Dot with the butter. Roast for 10 minutes. In a small saucepan over a low heat combine the orange juice and orange blossom water. Stir until the mixture thickens. Spoon over the figs. Serve with a spoonful of the mint leaves. To serve, place the figs on plates and surround with the mint leaves. To make the salad, put the tomatoes in a bowl. Squeeze the lemon juice over them and season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the onion and toss again. Drizzle with the olive oil. To serve, place the tomatoes in the centre of each plate and add a couple of tablespoons of the salad on top. Garn
Cook the rice in the water and onion soup mix until tender and liquid is absorbed. Add margarine and stir until blended. Serve.

Mix cherry pie filling and cherries and put in bottom of 9x13 pan. Cut up bisquick baking mix and sprinkle on top of cherries and mix in brown sugar and nuts. Cut up butter and sprinkle on top of bisquick mix and cherry mixture. Mix together water and cinnamon and pour over bisquick and cherry mixture. Bake in 350 oven for 50 to 60 minutes.

Mix together the whipping cream and sour cream. Add the base and whisk together. Melt the butter and whisk into the mixture. Add the flour and whisk until smooth. Add the juice of the jalapeno and 1/2 the jalapeno and continue to whisk. Taste and adjust seasoning. Add the remaining jalapeno and stir until incorporated. Heat gently until smooth and warmed. Add the cheeses and whisk until smooth. Serve over your favorite dish.

Mix together the butter, egg white, sugar and vanilla until light and creamy. Sift together the remaining ingredients and fold into the creamed mixture. Chill dough for several hours or overnight. Roll out dough 1/4 inch thick on a lightly floured surface. Cut into 2 x 3 inch rectangles using a pizza cutter. Lay the cut rectangles on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 oven for 12-15 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with sliced almonds. Return to oven for an additional 2-3 minutes to melt the almonds. Remove from oven and allow to cool on the cookie sheet for 1 minute before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. These can be stored in an airtight container for up to one week.
Combine first six ingredients in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Stir into tempeh mixture. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, stir together the dry ingredients. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the vegetable oil and sugar until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the cocoa, vanilla and almond extracts. Gradually beat in the dry ingredients until smooth. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool. Dust with confectioners' sugar. Yield: about 5 dozen cookies. Store in airtight container.

Peel the onion and finely chop. Melt the butter in a large pan. Add the chopped onion and fry gently for 2-3 minutes, until softened. Add the curry powder, fry for 1 minute. Add the vegetables and the sausages. Pour over the water. Cover the pan and cook for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are tender. Season with a little more curry powder, if desired. Serve with rice or mashed potato.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and put pasta in a bowl. In the bowl mix together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir the mixture into the pasta and add the cheese. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes or until creamy. Serve.

Bring a large pot of water to boil, and cook the peas for 4 minutes, or until bright green and tender-crisp. Drain the peas and set aside. In a medium frying pan, melt the butter with the chives. Add the snow and green peas and toss well. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the vanilla. In another bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder. Stir into the batter just until blended. Fold in the chips. Spread into an ungreased 8-inch square pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream together 1/2 cup of butter, 1/2 cup of granulated sugar, and 1/2 cup of brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in 2 eggs, one at a time, then stir in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. In a medium bowl, whisk together 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon of baking soda and a pinch of salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture 1/3 at a time, stirring after each addition until blended. Fold in 1 1/2 cups of quick oatmeal and 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts or pecans (optional). Drop batter by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on the cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Bring 1 cup of water to a boil in a pan. Stir in jello and stir until dissolved. Add nuts and stir again. Add cola and dark sweet cherry. Spread into a 9 inch round mold. Refrigerate until set. Unmold onto a plate. Top with cream cheese. Serve chilled.

Bring 3 cups water to a boil. Add all soups. Mix well. Add half-and-half, butter, and garlic. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Stir in frozen broccoli and heat through. Serve over shells. Sprinkle with cheese.

Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add roughy fillets skin side down. Saut for 1-2 minutes. Turn fillets over. Sprinkle with parsley. Saut another minute. Add red pepper. Pour in wine. Add capers, olives, and tomatoes. Bring to boil. Cover. Cook 3 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and saute for 2 minutes or until pink. Remove to a platter. Add the butter, garlic and shallots to the skillet and saute until lightly browned. Add the horseradish and cook until the sauce has thickened. Add the Dijon and stir until the sauce is smooth. Pour the sauce over the shrimp and garnish with the figs.

Sauté onions in bacon fat. Add fresh onion, peas, tomatoes and garlic powder. Cook 5 to 10 minutes. Add seasonings. Stir in hot water to cover. Simmer 30 minutes. Add rice and heat through. Stir in salsa. Garnish with bacon.

Boil the potatoes until they are tender. Drain. Combine the dressing with the mayonnaise. Toss together the celery, green onions, eggs and sour cream. Mix into the dressing mixture. Sprinkle with dry mustard and horseradish. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

In a bowl combine yogurt with sun dried tomatoes and olives. Mix well. Season with herb seasoning, black pepper. Divide into four portions. Top each potato with a portion of the topping. Bake potatoes in a 350 degree f oven 30 to 45 minutes or until baked through. Serve with a side of vegetables.

Spray a nonstick skillet or griddle with cooking sprayheat over medium-high heat until very hot. Spread butter evenly over one side of each slice of bread. Place 1 slice of bread, buttered side down, into skillet or onto griddletop with a slice of mozzarella. Top cheese with 1/4 cup pepper slicesplace remaining slice of bread, buttered side up, over pepper slices. Cook until browned and crispturn sandwich over. Cook until second side is browned and crisptop with basil leaves. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels. Reserve 1 tablespoon bacon drippings. Discard remaining bacon drippings. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet and simmer 10 minutes. Add baconsimmer 5 minutes longer. Remove from heat. Garnish with additional bacon if desired.

Boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain. Mash with butter, 1/2 the milk, and the stuffing mix. Add the remaining milk. In a large skillet cook the onions in 1 tbsp. Butter over medium heat until tender. Remove the onions from the skillet. Add the remaining butter to the skillet. Add the garlic salt and the potatoes. Cook over medium heat until the potatoes are heated through. Stir the cooked onions into the potatoes. Serve with cheese.

In a medium sauté pan heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the bacon. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until crisp. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate to drain. Add the onion to the sauté pan and cook for 3-4 minutes or until translucent. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the savoy cabbage. Cook for 5 minutes or until wilted. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of water. Boil for 2 more minutes. Turn off heat. Drain water from cabbage mixture. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and sour cream. In a large bowl combine the diced bacon, onion, cabbage mixture, 1/2 cup of water, cream cheese mixture, dill weed, and black pepper. Add cooked pierogies and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Skin filets if necessary. Place in a well-greased baking dish. Combine lemon juice, butter and sherry in a small bowl. Pour over fish. Sprinkle lightly with parsley. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees f. For about 15 minutes or until fish is done. Combine soy sauce and egg yolk. Blend well. Remove fish from oven. Drain off any excess liquid. Spoon sauce over fish. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time and the vanilla extract until well blended. Stir in the flour, baking soda and salt until just blended. Fold in the baby ruth candy bars. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until set. Cool on the cookie sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Grate peel from orangessqueeze juice from them and set aside. In large bowl mix grated peel, sugar and eggadd milk. Blend in baking powder, salt and vanilla. Stir in flour just until blended. Stir in nuts. Spoon batter into greased loaf panspread evenly in pan. Bake at 350 for 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack for 5 minutesremove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

Cut chicken into 1-2 inch pieces and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large wok. Add the chicken and brown both sides. Add the green curry paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add the eggplants, simmer until tender. Add the chicken stock or water, fish sauce, brown sugar, Thai chile, and lime leaf. Continue to simmer until the curry thickens. Add the cooked spaghetti and basil. Serve immediately.

Combine milk, nonfat sour cream, butter spread and seasonings in medium bowl. Add potatoes and toss until evenly coated. Place in 13x9 inch glass baking dish. Bake 30 minutes. Sprinkle bacon bits over potatoes. Bake 5 minutes more. Remove from oven. Top each serving with a sprig of chives and 1 tablespoon of bacon bits. Makes 6 servings. 129 calories/serving.

In a Dutch oven cook the meat over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain off any fat. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boilreduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until the noodles are tender. Makes 4 servings.

Sift together dry ingredients and cut in shortening until crumbly. Add egg and milk and knead on lightly floured board 1 minute. Add nuts and mix in well.
