Roll out on lightly floured board and place in greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until done. Cool and cut into slices. To serve sprinkle with chopped pimiento and stuffed green olives.

In large bowl with electric mixer, beat cream cheese and 3/4 cup powdered sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in milk and vanilla. In another bowl combine 2 cups powdered sugar and 1 1/4 cups milk. Beat until stiff peaks form. Fold in 2 cups cool whip. Layer 1/2 the pudding and 1/2 the cool whip mixture on bottom of 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Layer with 1/2 the remaining pudding and 1/2 the remaining cool whip mixture. Top with crushed OREO cookies and remaining pudding mixture. Refrigerate 2 hours. Top with remaining cool whip mixture and drizzle with chocolate syrup, if desired.
This is a great recipe! My family loves this recipe!
I made this for our 4th of July party and it was a hit! I made it exactly as directed with no changes. It is so easy and delicious! Thanks for sharing!
This is such a delicious recipe! I made it for a friends

Butter 4x 23cm round cake pans. In a large bowl combine the breadcrumbs and melted butter. Set aside. In another large bowl whisk together the eggs and sugar until pale and thick. Fold in the melted butter and vanilla. Stir in the breadcrumbs and add the remaining ingredients. Divide mixture among the pans and bake for 45 minutes. Cool. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove to paper towels to drain. Add the sun-dried tomatoes to the drippings in the skillet and cook, stirring for 1 minute. Stir in the alfredo sauce. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet. Stir in the bacon, basil, and pepper. Serve immediately.

Grease a 20cmx30cm baking tray with butter or oil and set aside. Mix desiccated coconut with rice bubbles. Add in margarine. Add glace cherries and mix well. Press mixture into baking tray and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. In a saucepan melt the golden syrup and dark chocolate chips over low heat. Pour over the baked mixture and spread evenly. Place in the fridge for 1 hour until set. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container.

Sift the flour and the semolina together. Add the eggs and the milk and mix well. Add the ricotta and salt and pepper to taste. Let the mixture sit for 20 minutes. Add the flour and the semolina and mix well. Roll the dough into small balls. Boil in salted water. Serve with the tomato sauce and sprinkle with the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a saucepan. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar and vanilla. Pour into baked and cooled crust. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon.

Cut peaches into 4 slices each and place on wax papersprinkle with sugar and a little salt. Place wax paper with fruit in a zip bag and freeze until ready to use. Prepare an ice cream or sherbet according to package instructions and pour into a large bowl. Top with the frozen fruit and serve immediately or place back into the freezer to harden.

Cook sausage in microwave oven or in a skillet until heated through but not browned. Let sausage cool slightly. Combine sausage with remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Chill thoroughly before serving. Serve with crackers.

Fry the potatoes in a saucepan until golden brown. Remove the potatoes from the saucepan and add the oil. Fry the smoked bacon in a small skillet. Cool the potatoes and the bacon. Heat a non-stick skillet. Add the onions and fry for 5 minutes. Add the paprika and fry for 1 minute longer. Add the potatoes and fry for 1 minute. Add the bacon, mix well. Season with salt and black pepper. Add the cream. Place the mixture in a 4 cup (1 liter) baking dish. Beat the eggs. Pour the eggs over the potatoes. Sprinkle with the paprika. Bake for 1 hour until the eggs are set. Serve hot.
This entry was posted in Uncategorized by mocabee. Bookmark the permalink.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine Bisquick mixes, sugar, and egg in large bowl, stirring just until moistened. Stir in milk until smooth. Spoon batter into greased and floured 8-inch square baking pan. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutesremove from pan to cool on wire rack. Sprinkle with walnuts. Yield: 8-inch square loaf.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a saute pan. Add the carrots and onions and cook until softened and brown. Add the quinoa and the oregano and stir. Add the chicken broth and the salt. Bring to a boil and then lower the heat. Cook for 10 minutes until the quinoa is tender. Remove from heat. Add the frozen peas and stir. Add the lemon juice and black pepper to taste and stir. Serve immediately.

Combine first five ingredients in a large bowl. Shape into patties. Brown patties in hot skillet. Place in slow cooker. Add mushrooms and remaining ingredients. Cook on low 6-8 hours. Makes 6-8 servings.

Wash the dried pigeon peas under running water to remove any foreign matter. Soak the peas overnight in water to cover them by 1 inch or more. Drain them the next day. In a large pot of boiling water cook the dried peas until tender. Drain them well and place them in a large bowl. Add the seasoning and the meat and mix well. Add the thyme and marjoram and the cornflour. Mix well again. Add the butter and mix once more. Transfer to a 3-quart ovenproof dish and bake at 350 degrees for one hour until the top is golden brown. Serves 4. Serve this dish hot or cold with rice and bread on the side.

Melt the butter and sauté the onions until tender. Stir in the cake flour and cook until the mixture is smooth and lightly browned. Sprinkle with the curry powder and cook until it is fragrant and well blended. Pour in the water and apple cider vinegar and stir until well blended. Stir the salt and pepper into the sauce and cook for 5 to 6 minutes, or until thickened and bubbly. Whisk the eggs well and pour them into the sauce and continue cooking for an additional 30 seconds or so. Remove from the heat and serve over rice or noodles.
Beat together egg whites, egg, skim milk, and scallions. Cook omelet in a non stick skillet. Cook shrimp and add to omelet. Sprinkle with low fat swiss cheese and let melt. Serve immediately.

Cut squash in half. Clean and roast at 450 degrees until very tender, about 1 hour. Scoop out flesh with spoon and set aside. In large soup pot, saute onions in 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat until tender. Add carrots and cook 5 minutes. Add vegetable stock to cover. Add roasted squash to soup pot and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in baking soda and season with salt and cinnamon. Add half-and-half. Heat through and serve.

Place the fish in a shallow bowl. Pour the orange juice over it. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 2 days. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the tomato paste and the vinegar. Simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes. Add the oil and the sugar and simmer for a few more minutes. Transfer the sauce to a bowl and refrigerate. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and the ginger. In a separate bowl, combine the garlic, the orange zest and the hot pepper flakes. Prepare a barbecue or grill pan. Brush the fish with the spice mixture. Lay the fish on the pan and grill for 6 to 8 minutes per inch of thickness. Serve the fish drizzled with the sauce and sprinkled with the toasted ginger and sugar.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut the potatoes into 1-inch cubes. In a large mixing bowl combine the potatoes with the garlic and season with the salt to taste. Toss well with the olive oil to coat evenly. Place the potatoes on the grill and cook for about five minutes on each side, turning frequently until tender and slightly browned. Serve hot.

Combine basil leaves, butter, garlic clove, hot sauce and tomatoes. Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Add lemon juice. Remove bay leaf. Place fillets on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Brush with sauce. Roast in a preheated 450 degree F oven for 7 minutes. Turn fish over and continue roasting for an additional 3 to 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl beat the egg white until foamy. In another bowl mix together the brown and white sugars with the salt and the cinnamon. Add the water until a paste is formed. Add the pecans and mix well until the nuts are coated with the mixture. Spread the pecans out on a cookie sheet and bake for about 25 minutes or until the mixture is caramelized. Stir once or twice while baking to prevent burning.

In a sauce pan over medium heat, combine the first three ingredients and cook until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and nuts. Allow to cool slightly and pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, onion and garlic. Stirring occasionally, cook until golden, about 10 minutes. Stir in herbes de provence. Add broth and tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Simmer until beans are tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the wine, stirring to loosen any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Stir in the beans. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Place pizza crust on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes or until crust begins to brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Spread pizza sauce over crust and top with bacon and spinach. Sprinkle with black pepper and crumbled pepper jack cheese. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until crust is crisp and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve hot

Preheat over to 350 degrees F. Combine all dry ingredients in large bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients all at once. Mix for 3 minutes on low speed. Pour into greased 9 x 13 pan and bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely before frosting. Cut into squares and top with sprinkles.

Defrost frozen spinach and squeeze out excess water from it. In a saucepan combine all the above ingredients except for the grapeseed oil and the yogurt. Cook for 5 minutes until the ginger and garlic are soft. Add the grapeseed oil and cook for 1 minute more. Add the frozen spinach and cook for another minute or so. Remove from the heat and add the yogurt. Mix well and let cool before serving. Serve with rice or naan bread.

Sift together potato, cheese, egg and salt. Add melted butter. Mix well. Put one heaping tablespoon of mixture into each of 18 ungreased muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Sprinkle veal with salt and pepper. In a skillet heat butter and add veal in small pieces. Brown slowly until juice is drawn out. Add scallions and paprika. Cover and simmer over low heat 2 minutes. Add water and cover and cook 5 minutes until tender. Remove meat from the pan. In the same pan, add the flour and stir for a minute to get rid of the raw taste of the flour. Add the white wine and simmer 3 minutes until thickened. Add the cream and season to taste. Pour sauce over veal and serve over rice.
What's the best way to cook frozen vegetables?
Frozen vegetables are cooked by frying, boiling, or baking.
What's the best way to cook broccoli?
The best way to cook broccoli is by steaming, boiling, frying or baking it.
What's the best way to cook a salmon?
The best way to cook a salmon is to grill it, fry it or bake it.
What's the best way to cook asparagus

In medium bowl beat 2 cups of brown sugar with 1 cup of softened margarine until creamybeat in 2 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon. Add 2 1/2 cups of pecan piecesstir until thoroughly mixed. Combine 1 cup of all-purpose gluten-free flour with 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon of saltadd to the brown sugar mixture. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Spread into an ungreased 8-inch square baking panbake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees. Combine 1/4 cup of oil, lemon rind, 1/4 tsp of salt and 1/8 tsp of pepper in a large bowl. Add the broccoli and toss well to coat. Spread evenly in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned and just tender. Toss the broccoli with the beans and dill. Season with salt and pepper. Place the potatoes in a medium bowl. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of oil and toss to coat. Heat a griddle or large frying pan over medium heat until very hot. Place a few potato slices on the griddle. Cook until lightly browned on one side and flip to cook the other side. Remove from griddle with tongs. Arrange the potatoes on a platter. Toss the goat cheese with the remaining 1/8 tsp of salt and 1/8 tsp of pepper. Sprinkle over the potato mixture. Garnish with the nuts.

To prepare the rice, wash it thoroughly and put it in a pot with 2 cups of water and 1 tsp of salt. Bring to boil then simmer for 40 minutes.Heat up the olive oil in a skillet and cook the sausage, onion and pepper until the meat is fully cooked and the onions are translucent. Add the chili powder and stir for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and the poblano pepper and stir for 1 to 2 more minutes. Add the tomatillos and the wine and stir for another minute. Add the rice and stir well. Serve warm.

Boil or steam squash and onions until tender. Mash, then add salt and pepper. Add butter, egg, 1 cup breadcrumbs and cheese. Mix and place into a greased 1 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with remaining bread crumbs and bacon. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.
the black eyed pea s baked squash is a recipe which is served as a side dish or as a vegetarian main dish. It is made by cooking yellow squash with egg, breadcrumbs, cheese, onions and other spices. This recipe is very simple to make and can be served with any meal.

Wash and dry zucchini. Slice onion into thin rings. Melt butter in saute pan and add onion and garlic and saute about 2 minutes. Add zucchini and cook 2-3 minutes or until tender. Add halibut and cook 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook until heated through. Add parsley and juice of 1/2 lemon. Serve over pasta and garnish with remaining parsley and lemon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place butter in saucepan and melt over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar. Cool slightly. Stir in the egg yolks and almond extract. Beat until smooth. Gradually stir in the flour and mix until smooth. Press mixture into 24 muffin cups. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with 1 tablespoon corn syrup and 1 tablespoon water over the top of each tartlet. Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes. Drizzle the tartlets with remaining corn syrup and place the pecan halves on top. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400. Slice 1/2 lemon into 1/2 inch slices and set aside. Peel off most of lemon zest with a vegetable peeler. Squeeze lemon juice into a small bowl. Slice each duck breast into four pieces. In a small bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, lemon pepper, garlic heads, 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Place duck in a resealable plastic bag with marinade. Squeeze excess air from bag. Seal bag. Turn bag over several times to coat duck. Refrigerate 30 minutes to 2 hours. When ready to roast, place duck on a rack in a baking dish. Bake 10 minutes or until cooked through. Pour remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a small saucepan. Add slices of lemon. Sauté over low heat until softened. Spoon lemon sauce over duck. Serve immediately.
Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour. Slowly add the chicken stock. Stirring constantly. Add the Anaheim Chilies, garlic, and salt. Cook until thickened.

Melt margarine in a skillet over medium heat. Add sliced apples, sprinkle with brown sugar. Cook until tender. Spread margarine on both sides of bread slices. Place in skillet with the apples until toasted on both sides.
name: fried apples and bread slicesingredients: margarine, apples, brown sugar, white breadpreparation:Melt margarine in a skillet over medium heat. Add sliced apples, sprinkle with brown sugar. Cook until tender. Spread margarine on both sides of bread slices. Place in skillet with the apples until toasted on both sides.
name: hot apple pie sandwichesingredients: apples, cinnamon, white bread, medium cheddar, butterpreparation:Combine apples and cinnamon. Place cheese on the outside of 4 slices of toast. Spoon apples onto cheese. Top with remaining bread slices. Brush outside with butter. Broil on each side until golden brown.
name: libbie s apple crispingredients

In a small sauce pan combine first 3 ingredients, bring to a boil, then add cinnamon. Reduce heat to low and cook until thick. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and mix well. Pour over ice cream, bread pudding or crepes etc.
Chocolate Blancmange
Chocolate Blancmange is a classic French dessert made of custardy white bread, dusted with cocoa powder and served with a side of vanilla ice cream
Feaver s Pumpkin Fudge
Feaver s Pumpkin Fudge is a rich dessert made with pumpkin puree, brown sugar, cinnamon, allspice, margarine, and vanilla extract
Pumpkin Fudge is a sweet treat made with pumpkin puree, brown sugar, cinnamon, allspice, margarine, and vanilla extract
Vanilla Sauce For Bread Pudding
Vanilla Sauce For Bread Pudding is a classic dessert made with water, sugar, cornstarch, butter, vanilla extract, and salt
Grandm

In a large bowl, whisk together the first four ingredients. Place over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in brie and chives. Place butter in a 10 inch skillet and heat over medium heat. Pour in batter and cook for 10 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with cayenne and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a skillet cook the pork chops 10 minutes on each side or until done. Combine soup, sour cream, and water and pour into a 2-quart casserole dish. Add potatoes and place the chops on top. Combine dill weed with parsley and sprinkle over top. Bake 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serve with the dill weed/parsley mixture on top.

Heat olive oil in large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in anchovy fillet and crushed tomatoes. Cook 5 minutes. Add tuna and capers and simmer 2 minutes. Toss in spaghetti. Serve sprinkled with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook and crumble ground beef. In a bowl, mix together the crumbled beef and the hash browns. Place in a 9 x 13 x 2 inch pan. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs and the heavy whipping cream. Add the sharp cheddar cheese and mix well. Pour the egg mixture over the beef and hash browns. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until the center is set. Serve warm.
Poke holes into the bottom of the cake with a fork after baking and baking until cool. Drizzle the top with the pudding mixture and the chocolate glaze mixture. Sprinkle with coconut.
Combine all ingredients in a 2-quart casserole. Cover. Bake at 375 f for 45 to 50 minutes or until done. Stir before serving.

Combine all the filling ingredients except for the coconut and mix well. Place the mixture into a 18cmx28cm slice pan and bake at 180 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle over the coconut. Pour over the topping and spread over to cover the slice evenly. Bake for another 10-15 minutes until the topping is golden brown and set. Leave to set completely before cutting into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a 11x17 pan with aluminum foil. In a large bowl combine light brown sugar, self rising flour, eggs, oil & vanilla. Beat well. Spread into pan. Bake for 18 minutes or until set. Cool completely on wire rack. In a small bowl combine morsels and nutsspread over top. Cool in pan on wire rack. Lift out using foil handles & cut into bars. Makes about 6 dozen bars.
Cook the rice as per directions on packet. When boiling add margarine and stir to melt. Add tomatoes with juice, garlic, onion, capsicum and pepper. Stir to combine. Serve hot.

Using a sharp paring knife, remove the pits from the avocados. Peel off the skin and slice the avocados in half. Using a fork, gently mash the avocados and add the lime juice, cilantro, red bell pepper and red onion. Gently stir to combine. Divide the mixture between two serving bowls. Sprinkle each bowl with the jalapeno jack cheese. Add the hot sauce and season with the salt to taste. Serve with freshly made corn chips.

In a medium bowl combine cream cheese and milk until smooth. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Stir in the rest of the ingrediants until well blended. Pour into a 9 x 13 baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and return to oven for 5 minutes longer until cheese is melted.

Combine cereals and dry milk in large mixing bowl. Add dry milk and combine. In saucepan combine honey and brown sugar. Heat to boiling and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add vanilla and peanut butter. Add to cereals and mix. Cool and roll into bars. Cool and cut.

Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed saucepan. Add the onion and garlic and saut for 5 minutes over moderate heat. Stir in the curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add the zucchini and cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Add the potato and cook for another 15 minutes. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Cook for 20 minutes. Remove the soup from the heat. Using an immersion blender or a blender in batches, puree the soup until smooth. Season with the salt. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil, and grease lightly. In a small bowl mix together horseradish and lemon juice, and then spread over fish fillets. Sprinkle fennel seeds on fish. Drizzle fish with oil and bake for 15 minutes. Spray fish lightly with cooking spray and sprinkle with panko breadcrumbs. Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes or until fish is cooked through. Serve with a squeeze of lemon and a sprinkle of parsley and horseradish.

In saucepan, combine carrots and waterbring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-highcover and cook until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Uncover and continue cooking until liquid evaporates, about 4 minutes. Remove saucepan from heatstir in butter and vinegar until butter is melted and mixture is smooth. Serve immediately.

Heat a medium skillet on medium-low heat. Add the mushrooms and a splash of water. Saute the mushrooms until tender. Add the garlic. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the mushrooms. Cover the skillet for a few minutes until the sauce has thickened. Serve as a side dish or an appetizer.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Cream together peanut butter and margarine. Stir in banana and egg until smooth. Stir in flour and Splenda to form a soft dough. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. Yield 52 cookies.
Can you use 1 cup of brown sugar instead of granulated and white sugar?
I don't know if I would use 1 cup brown sugar in place of 1 cup granulated sugar, and 1 cup white sugar in this recipe...I'm afraid that it may make the cookies too sweet and too chewy.
I am also curious if you could replace the white granulated and brown sugars in this recipe with just regular brown sugar (not light or dark). I love peanut butter and bananas but not white or brown sugar!
Hi! I made these cookies and they are delicious! I was wondering if I could substitute brown sugar instead of white?

Cut the tomatoes into small pieces. In a mixing bowl combine the tomatoes, olive oil, garlic and mint. Stir in the cayenne pepper and mix thoroughly. Serve as a side dish with grilled chicken or meat or add to rice to make a quick pilaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a bowl, combine the sugar, eggs and Kahlua until well blended. Stir in the flour and mix until smooth. Fold in the pecan pieces and the chocolate chips. Pour into the unbaked pie shell and bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until set in the middle. Cool before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350f grease a 10-inch tube pan or two 9-inch round pans. Combine dry ingredients. Beat in milk. Add egg yolks. Beat until smooth. Beat egg whites to stiff peaks. Fold into batter. Add apples. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake 45-55 minutes. Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Unmold onto racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine the morsels, sugar and flour. Stir in apples and pecans. Pour mixture into an ungreased 9 inch square baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F/Gas mark 4. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Cook the sausages until browned all over. Transfer to a baking tray. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the pan along with the oregano and fry for 1 minute. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the tomato paste, followed by 200ml water. Season with salt and pepper. Stir for 3-4 minutes more until thickened. Pour over the sausages. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the mushrooms, olives and beef stock together in a small pan for 2 minutes or until hot. Serve with the sausages.

In a medium saucepan, combine broth, wine, cornstarch and pepper. Heat to a boil and simmer for 1 minute. In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add chops. Cook 5 minutes per side. Remove chops from skillet. Add onions to skillet. Saute until tender. Add broth mixture to skillet. Bring to a boil. Stir until sauce is smooth. Return chops to skillet. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large saucepan, saute the vegetables in the oil for about 5 minutes, or until crisp-tender. Stir in the tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes more. Transfer the mixture to a food processor or blenderprocess to make a chunky paste. Return the mixture to the pan and add the cumin and season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cook and stir for about 10 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced to 3/4 cup (175 ml). Divide the mixture among 6 individual shallow serving bowls. Arrange the potato rounds on top of the filling. Cover the top of the pot pies with the chicken breasts and dot each chicken breast with a small piece of butter. Cover the tops of the chicken breasts with the pastry dough. Brush the tops with the egg mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Season the fillets with salt and pepper. Place on a non-stick baking sheet and spread the vermouth all over the fillets. Bake for 10 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Heat the oven to broil. Place the fillets on the top rack of the oven and broil for 1 minute or until the vermouth is evaporated and the fish is browned. Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the almonds and toast for 2-3 minutes until they are browned and fragrant. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and the water to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and cook for 3 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated. Stir in the parsley and serve over the fillets. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375. Wrap beets in foil. Bake for one hour. Cool. Peel. Cut into slices. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the beets, margarine, syrup, lemon juice and zest. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer for about ten minutes or until the liquid is reduced by one third. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine first 7 ingredients. Add bread crumbs and mix well. Divide mixture into 8 portions and form into 1-inch meat loaves. Place loaves onto a baking sheet. Combine barbecue sauce and 1/4 cup water. Pour half of sauce over loaves. Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Brush remaining barbecue sauce over loaves. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until thermometer reads 160 degrees F. Serve hot.

In large saucepan, combine water and concentrates. Cook on high for 30 mins. Remove from heat. Add lime juice and curry powder. Cut tofu into cubes and add to saucepan. Cook for 5 mins on high. Serve over rice and top with scallions and cilantro leaves.

Melt 1 1/2 Tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heatstir in 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add sproutscook until lightly browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a serving dishtop with remaining 1 1/2 Tablespoons butter. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Serve immediately.
Place beans and remaining ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes stirring once or twice. Serve at once.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Beat the eggs with the parmesan, garlic powder and parsley. Season the bread crumbs and parmesan with salt and pepper. Pound the chicken until about 1/2 inch thick. Dip the chicken in the eggs and then in the crumb mixture. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken until it is golden on both sides, about 2 minutes on each side. Arrange the chicken in a casserole dish and top each breast with 2 mushrooms. Top each breast with a slice of mozzarella and bake for 10 minutes or until the mozzarella is golden.

In a medium bowl, mix together the cranberries, apple, and walnuts. In a small bowl, beat the cream with a whisk to soft peaksadd the powdered sugar and beat until the mixture is thick and glossy. Pour the cream over the berry mixture and gently fold together. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight to allow the flavors to meld. Serve with more walnuts if desired.

Heat the oil and butter in a large non stick skillet. Saute the onion and green bell pepper until they are tender. Add the frozen hash brown potatoes and saute until they are heated through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat. Stir in the ham and cheddar cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

In small bowl, combine first 3 ingredients. Place in plastic bag and seal. Remove 1/3 cup mixture for topping. Combine remaining mixture with tuna. Spread evenly over 4 bread slices. Top with remaining bread slices. Spread remaining 1/3 cup mixture evenly over sandwiches. Cut sandwiches diagonally in half.
Melt butter in pan, saute onion and celery until tender. Add tart apple and cook until soft. Stir in flour and curry. Gradually add milk and cook until thickened. Stir in pepper and salt.

Melt butter and dark chocolate together in a double boiler over a low heat. Cool to room temperature. Whisk in the sugar and espresso. Stir in the sifted dry ingredients then fold in the beaten eggs until smooth. Pour into a well greased and lined 20cm x 30cm baking pan and bake at 160 degrees celcius for about 45 minutes or until it is firm to the touch when gently touched in the center. Leave to cool in the pan for 15 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Serves 10-15

In a large saucepan cook the onions in the oil for about 10 minutes or until tender. Add the carrots, celery, apple and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the chicken stock and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes. Stir in the port. Simmer for 10 minutes more. Stir in the parsley. Serve over cooked noodles.

Heat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour 2 9-inch round cake pans. Beat together white sugar, eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Add carrots. Sift together flour, baking powder and cinnamon. Add to mixture. Mix well. Pour into pans. Bake at 325 degrees for about 1 hour or until done. Cool completely. Frost with cream cheese icing.

Preheat oven to 375. Cream butter and sugar. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy. Add dry ingredients alternately with the milk. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Peel and rinse eggs. Discard two yolks. Chop remaining whites and yolks. Mix mayonnaise, mustard and peach jam. Stir in remaining ingredients. Chill.

In a medium bowl toss the tomatoes with the herbs. Toss in the scallions. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the salad on a serving platter or divide among serving bowls. Top each with feta cheese crumbles. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the vanilla. Combine the flour, soda, baking powder and salt. Add to the batter alternately with the milk. Stir in the hazelnuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls on lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Makes 5 dozen.

In a large saute pan, heat oil over moderate heat. Add chard and cook 1 minute. Add scallion and cook another minute. Season with dill, garlic, salt and pepper. Add the chickpeas and cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in feta.

Cook pork with garlic until cooked through. Add the soy sauce, oyster sauce and water. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook for 1 minute. Add the cornstarch mixture and cook until thickened. Add the eggs. Stir until cooked. Sprinkle with green onion before serving. Serves 4.

In a shallow dish combine the flour, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder. Dip the chicken pieces in the batter. Brown in a skillet. Place in crock pot. Mix the soup with milk. Pour over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.

Mix together salt, sugar, bay leaves, garlic, shallots, allspice berry, hot pepper sauce, 3 cups of water. Pour into a shallow baking pan. Lay roast on top. Cover with the rest of the water. Cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least 3 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator one hour before roasting. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn heat down to 325 degrees. Continue roasting for another 1 1/2 hours or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Remove from oven. Let rest 10 minutes. Remove bay leaves. Slice roast. Serve with pan juices.

Place the roast into the crock pot and add the remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 4-5 hours. Remove meat from the crock pot and shred with forks. Place meat back into the crock pot and stir. Serve on French rolls with mustard or horseradish sauce if desired. Serve with Au Jus for dipping.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a large bowl toss the sprouts with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Place the sprouts in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes, or until the sprouts are just tender and lightly browned. In a large skillet over medium heat melt the butter and stir in the sage. As soon as the butter foams, add the brussels sprouts and toss to coat. Transfer the sprouts to a serving plate and sprinkle with a little more salt and pepper if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place tenderloin in a baking dish. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a small bowl and pour over tenderloin. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour. Remove foil and bake an additional 10 minutes. Check with an instant read thermometer to make sure the tenderloin is cooked to 165 degrees. Remove from oven. Let sit for 10 minutes. Slice tenderloin into 1/2 inch thick slices. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Add celery and onion and cook until soft. Increase heat to medium. Add salt and pepper and cook until seasonings are fragrant. Add baby peas. Add cold water and stir. Cook until baby peas are crisp tender. Add pimientos and stir. Add cornstarch and stir. Cook until thickened. Serve over rice or baked potato.
Mix all together in a 9x13-inch baking pan except sausage. Layer sausage over the bread cubes. Mix and pour over all in pan. Refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until done.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Add asparagus and English pea to pasta and toss well. Add tuna, and toss. Add green onion and toss. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add lemon juice and toss. Add tomatoes and toss again. Serve immediately.
Bring broth to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Add gingerrootboil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Toss with spaghetti. Top with green onions and peanuts.

Mix together the chili powder, turmeric and garam masala in a small bowl. Pound the garlic and salt together into a paste. Lay the fish fillets on a tray and rub the spiced paste all over the fish. Pour the vegetable oil in a large non-stick skillet and place the fish into the skillet, flesh-side down. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until the fish is cooked and crispy on the outside. Flip the fish and cook for 3-4 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and flaky on the inside. Sprinkle with the lemon juice and serve with rice or vegetables.
Mix ketchup and italian dressing until smooth. Brush each side of chicken with mixture. Sprinkle with black pepper. Broil until done or grill over medium heat until done.

Heat pan to medium-high. Add sausage. Cook for about 5 minutes or until done. Remove from pan. Cut cabbage into thin strips. Add cabbage to pan with remaining ingredients. Cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Add pasta sauce to mixture. Add mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cooked pasta to mixture. Mix well. Serves 2.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms, leek and a pinch of salt. Saute until the leek is tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Add the tarragon and simmer 10 minutes. Whisk the cornstarch with the water and stir into the sauce. Add the sour cream, lemon juice and season with the pepper. Serve with chicken breasts.
I really enjoy your blog. I am a huge fan of mushrooms as well as anything related to them. I would like to say thanks for the recipes.
The next time you get some great looking mushrooms and have nothing to do with them, give me a call!

Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and stir to dissolve the sugar. Stir in the peppermint oil and green food coloring if using. Allow to cool slightly before stirring in brandy. Pour into a bottle and seal. Tastes best after a couple of weeks.

Marinade overnight in a bag or plastic container. Grill or broil the next day.
This recipe for Pork Chops with Caramelized Orange Sauce, by Diane Mullen, is from The Mullen Family Cookbook Project, one of the cookbooks created at FamilyCookbookProject.com. We'll help you start your own personal cookbook! It's easy and fun. Click here to start your own cookbook!
Drizzle olive oil into a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, season pork chops with paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Once oil in skillet is glistening, brown pork chops on both sides. In a small bowl, whisk together orange juice, brown sugar, orange marmalade and apple cider vinegar. Lower skillet heat to medium-low. Pour liquid mixture over chops and cover skillet. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, occasionally flipping chops and scraping the bottom of the skillet with a wooden spoon to keep them from burning or sticking. Just before serving, increase skillet

Sauté onions and carrots in oil until soft. Add garlic and seasoning and sauté until lightly browned. Add potato mix, water and egg, stirring until well blended. Spread mixture in a greased 9x13x2-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until golden brown and crisp. Yield: 6 servings.

Cut tofu into cubes. In a shallow bowl, mix together slivered almonds, parmesan cheese and garlic powder. Dip cubed tofu into egg and then coat with almond mixture. Place cubes on a baking sheet and bake at 400 for 45 minutes.

Heat a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the brown mustard seeds, cover and cook for 4 minutes. Add the yellow mustard seeds, cover again and cook for 2 minutes more. Pour in the beer and cook until reduced by half. Stir in the white wine vinegar, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric and mace. Stir to combine. Let cool. When cool, place in a jar or bottle. Store in a cool place for up to 4 weeks. To use, shake before using.

Pour rice into a medium bowlwash it thoroughly under running tap water. Transfer rice into a saucepan of cold water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heatreduce the heat to medium-lowcover the potand cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Drain the rice in a fine sievereturn it to the saucepanadd the skim milkstirbring to a boilreduce the heatcoverand simmer until the mixture thickens, about 20 minutes. Remove the pot from the heatstir in the sugarcoverand let stand for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, place the vanilla bean in a small bowladd the hot waterlet steepstrain the mixture through a fine-mesh sievediscard the vanilla beanstir the vanilla syrup into the rice mixturestir in the cinnamoncoverlet stand for 5 minutes. Serve the pudding warm or chilled, garnished with whipped cream or sweetened condensed milk, if desired.

In 3-quart saucepan, whisk together the milk and the egg. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the tapioca. Transfer the mixture to a 6-cup rice cooker. Cook on high for 2 hours. Stir the sugar and vanilla into the cooked tapioca. Cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for up to 2 days. Serves 6.

Heat a large pot over medium heat. Spray with butter flavor. Add beef and onions and saute until beef is no longer pink. Add soup and water and bring to a boil. Add rice. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 15 minutes. Stir in green beans and simmer covered 10 minutes. Stir in parsley and pepper. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Using a sharp knife, score the skin of the ham in a diamond oattern. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, maple syrup, vinegar, worcestershire sauce, coffee granules, and mustard. Spread all over the ham. Place the ham on a rack in a roasting pan. Roast until a meat thermometer reads 170 degrees f or the juices run clear when you insert a skewer into the thickest part of the roast. About 3 hours. Let the roast stand, covered with foil. For 15 minutes. Carve into thin slices and serve with gravy, if desired.
In food processor combine all ingredients and process until smooth and blended. Transfer to a serving bowl and refrigerate until ready to serve with crackers or bread.

Grease an 8 inch pie pan. In a skillet brown the brats. Drain and crumble the meat into the pie pan. Add the sauerkraut and mix well. In a small bowl combine the bisquick, milk and eggs. Pour over the meat mixture. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Serve with mustard or horseradish.
Cook pasta as directed. Drain & rinse. Add ranch mix. Combine. Add milk, mayonnaise & onion. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Stir in tomatoes & olives before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt chocolate with the butter and olive oil in the microwave on high for 2 minutes. Stir until smooth. Add the next 5 ingredients. Stir in the dry ingredients until just combined. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out almost clean. Cool. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
name: cheesecake with a cherry toppingingredients: cream cheese, sour cream, granulated sugar, egg yolks, vanilla, cornstarch, cherry pie fillingpreparation:Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sour cream until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of the granulated sugar and the vanilla and beat until well blended. Beat in egg yolks one at a time. Combine cornstarch and remaining 1/4 cup sugar and add to cheese mixture

Cook pasta according to directions. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini and cook until lightly browned and tender. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds more. Add the sunflower seeds and olives and cook for 1 minute more. Toss the pasta with the vegetable mixture. Top with the pesto sauce and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place potatoes in oven safe dish with water. Bake 45-60 minutes. Potatoes will be tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and return to dish. Mash with butter and green onions. Stir in sour cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375. Layer a 9 x 13 baking pan with polenta. Top with one can of marinara. Sprinkle with half the basil and half the pesto. Layer on 1 cup of the pine nuts. Top with one can of marinara. Sprinkle with half the basil and half the pesto. Layer on 1 cup of the pine nuts. Repeat the layering twice. Bake for 30 minutes. Top with the remaining marinara and cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until cheese is golden. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

Add the powdered drink mix and sugar to hot water to dissolve. Add the cold water. Stir in the unflavored gelatin and mix well. Pour into pop molds and freeze for about six hours. To remove the popsicles, run the mold under warm running water for a few seconds. Store leftovers in freezer.

Blend satay sauce with soy sauce and lime juice. Add 1 TBSP of the blend to the other 1/2 cup blend and reserve. Marinate the lamb in the marinade for at least 1 hour or overnight. Grill over medium-high heat. Coat the lamb with the reserved marinade. Grill for 8-10 minutes or until the meat is no longer pink. Turn once and baste with the remaining marinade. Garnish with chopped cilantro and chopped peanuts.
i am not going to lie. i’ve been making this all the time for dinner lately. it’s such a quick and easy recipe. i’m not sure how it got into my head in the first place, but i’m glad it did.
1. marinate chicken breasts in teriyaki sauce for at least 15 minutes.
2. lightly coat both sides of the chicken with extra virgin olive oil.
3. place on medium-high heat on the grill.
4. cook for 5 minutes on each side or until cook

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and saute 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the cream cheese until melted. Stir in the remaining ingredients until well blended. Divide evenly between the mushrooms. Bake for about 10 minutes, or until hot. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cream together the butter, cream cheese and flour. Mix well. Stop--do not mix any more. Make 3 balls from the dough. Wrap in plastic wrap. Chill for an hour before using. Uncooked dough may be frozen for up to 2 months. Freeze in balls or in pie tins. Makes 10-inch pies. Bake at 450 for about 10 minutes.

Season both sides of the chicken breast with the lemon pepper. Dredge the chicken in the flour and place the coated pieces in the skillet. Saut the chicken until browned on both sides. Stir in the curry powder and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the scallions and cook 30 seconds more. Stir in the salad dressing and lemon juice. Heat until hot. Spoon the chicken mixture onto the avocado halves. Garnish with tomatoes and olives.

Bring 2 inches of water to boil in a large skillet or wok. Add asparagus and cook until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and drain well. Whisk together vinegar and water in a small bowl until blendedadd to asparagus and toss gently to coat. Combine sesame oil and lemon juice in a small bowlstir in sesame seeds and lemon rind and toss with asparagus mixture. Chill until ready to serve. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5-7 minutes or until it is tender. Add flour and stir over medium heat for 1 minute. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add zucchini and cook until tender 8-10 minutes. Stir in roquefort cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add potatoes and boil for about 15-20 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain and cool completely. Cut potatoes into large chunks. Place in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Stir and chill.

Bring white wine vinegar and demerara sugar to a boil in a non-reactive sauce pan. Add the apples and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the apples are tender. Add the ginger and garlic and cook for about 5 minutes more. Add the red chili seeds, cayenne and salt and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the raisins and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Spoon into clean jars and seal.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees f. Spray large roasting pan with cooking spray. In large bowl, combine rice, cooking spray, sausage, green onions and 1-1/2 cups water. Place mixture into roasting pan. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake for about 1 hour or until sausage is no longer pink. Stir mixture occasionally. Remove from ovenstir in cilantro and black sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with wax paper or parchment paper. Break graham crackers into squares. Place in a single layer on baking sheet. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add sugar and stir until completely dissolved and mixture is smooth and carmel colored. Stir in almonds. Spread mixture over cracker squares. Bake about 8 minutes or until cracker squares are lightly browned. Cool on baking sheet before removing from pan and breaking into pieces.

Line bottom of 9x13-inch baking pan with aluminum foil and spray foil with nonstick cooking sprayset aside. Melt 1 cup butter (or margarine) and 2 cups sugar in a heavy 4-quart saucepan over medium heat. Stir until smooth and remove from heat. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla and 1 teaspoon baking soda. Beat with wooden spoon until thick and glossy (about 2 minutes). Add 1 1/2 cups whole pecans and stir until well coated. Spread mixture over prepared pan and chill until firm (about 1 hour). Break mixture into pieces (about 30 pieces) and store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.
Place the lemon juice, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and pepper in a container and mix well. Add the chicken and marinate for 30 minutes. Cook chicken for 30 minutes at 450 degrees. Serve warm.

Heat water to boiling in heavy bottomed saucepan over medium high heat. Add the sugar and salt and stir to dissolve. Remove from heat and add the oil. Beat the egg yolks into the syrup mixture to combine. In a separate bowl, whisk egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Fold the egg whites into the syrup mixture. Stir in the matzo meal until just blended. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes. Heat 2 inches of oil in a deep heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat to 375 degrees F. Using a tablespoon or ice cream scoop or a large spoon, scoop the dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and puffy, about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture or dip the doughnuts in melted chocolate and nuts or powdered sugar, or roll in a mixture of nuts and powdered sugar.

In a sauce pan, combine water, sugar and lemon juice. Bring to boil and simmer until sugar is dissolved. Strain syrup through cheesecloth or coffee filter into bowl and let cool to room temp. Add light rum to taste. Store syrup in refrigerator. Fill glasses with ice. Add 1 shot of light rum to each glass and 2 shots of lychee and coconut syrup to each glass. Garnish with lemon slice and mint sprig.
Cut vegetable oil into the oysters. Mix well. Dip oysters into the batter and fry them. Serve with crackers.

Blanch spinach in boiling water. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Heat butter in large saute pan. Add spinach and saute 3 to 5 minutes. Add 2 teaspoons of the spice mix and saute for 30 seconds. Add onion and saute 1 to 2 minutes. Add rice and remaining spice mix. Stir for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add cooked rice and mix well. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Serve warm.
Combine all but sour cream, chips and avocado in a crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours or high for 2. 5 hours. Serve with toppings.

To make simple syrup, combine sugar and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and cool completely before using. In a blender combine tequila, simple syrup, lime juice, amaretto and orange juice. Cover and blend until smooth. Serve over ice with garnish of lime slices.
1. Pour all of the ingredients into a large pitcher. 2. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. 3. Serve over crushed ice or pour into glasses over ice cubes. 4. Garnish each serving with a slice of lemon.
1. Pour all of the ingredients into a large pitcher. 2. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. 3. Serve over crushed ice or pour into glasses over ice cubes. 4. Garnish each serving with an apple slice.
In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Beat in remaining ingredients until smooth. Chill. Serve with mixed fruit.

Combine marmalade, soy sauce and sesame oil in a bowl. Mix well. In a resealable bag, combine chicken, bacon, marinade and garlic. Turn bag to coat. Marinate 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400 F. Place chicken on a baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes per side or until done. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Place the cutlets in a shallow baking dish. In a small bowl mix the cumin,paprika,turmeric and the salt. Rub each cutlet with the mixture. Heat the olive oil in a small frying pan. Add the spring onion and cook, stirring for 1 minute. Pour over the cutlets. Bake 30 minutes or until tender.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line muffin cups with paper or foil bake cups. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl. In another bowl, beat the shortening and sugar until creamyadd the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla and milk. Stir in the flour mixture alternately with the jam, starting and ending with the flour mixture. Stir in the cinnamon and nuts. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on wire racks.

In a medium bowl, cream together the butter, sugars and peanut butter until light and creamy. Add in the eggs and vanilla and mix thoroughly. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix until incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips and the chopped peanuts. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment paper. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place on cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and let sit on cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes 3 dozen 1 inch cookies.

Brown the ground beef with the onion. Drain the grease. Stir in the soup and let it simmer for about 5 minutes. Then add the vegetables. Spread the vegetables in a 9x13-inch pan. Arrange the tater tots in layers. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400 for 30 minutes or until the mixture is hot.

Preheat the oven to 325f. Line baking sheets with parchment paper. Whisk the dry ingredients together. Set aside. Whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Slowly mix the egg whites with the dry ingredients until just combined. Stir in the pecans. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto the baking sheets, leaving about 1 inch between cookies. Bake for 13 to 15 minutes or until cookies are puffy and firm. Let cool on the pans for 2 minutes, then remove and let cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to one week.

To prepare the base of the bon bon, place the biscuits in a food processor and process until they are finely chopped. Transfer the biscuit mixture to a large bowl and combine with the melted butter. Press the biscuit mixture into the base of 4 x 8-inch (10- x 20-cm) aluminum tray (the mixture will not cover the base of the tray). Place in the fridge to chill while you prepare the cheesecake filling. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and sugar and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in the vanilla and strawberry syrup. Spread the mixture over the chilled biscuit base. Chill for 30 minutes. To serve, spoon the cheesecake into the 4 x 8-inch (10- x 20-cm) aluminum tray. Cut into 12 squares with a sharp knife. Place the squares in a container and refrigerate overnight before serving.
Blend all together in a blender. Pour into freezer containers or decorative plastic containers for serving. Freeze for 2-3 hours to harden.

Cook rice according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook 3 minutes. Stir in next 3 ingredients. Cook 1 minute. Stir in broccoli. Cook until heated through. In a 13x9 inch pan, layer half of the rice on the bottom. Top with half of the chicken mixture. Spread sour cream over. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix all ingredients except bread in a small saucepan. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Pour into small bowl to cool. Dip both sides of pita bread rounds in mixture. Place bread rounds on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until crisp. Cut into wedges. Serve with yogurt and fresh mint leaves. Makes 8 servings.

In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil, worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Place lamb on a platter. Pour marinade over lamb and let marinate in refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours. Remove from refrigerator and let stand for 15 minutes. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Grill lamb for 6-8 minutes per side. Cut lamb into thin slices. Serve with any remaining marinade.

Pour amaretto and southern comfort into a tall glass filled with ice cubes and stir well. Add orange juice and grenadine and stir well again. Garnish with an orange slice and serve immediately.
name: peach punchingredients: 2 cups water, 2 cups sugar, 3/4 cup lemon juice, 3/4 cup peach juice (or 3/4 cup frozen peach concentrate thawed), 1 quart cold club sodapreparation: In a large bowl, stir together water, sugar, lemon juice and peach juice. Cool, then cover and refrigerate overnight. Strain the liquid through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher or punch bowl. Add club soda just before serving. Garnish with frozen peaches (if desired). Serves 6-8.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta until al dente. Drain pasta. Return pasta to pot. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and saute until tender. Transfer mixture to the pasta pot. Add remaining 1/4 cup olive oil to the skillet. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add wine to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice and pepper. Add clams and cook 1 minute. Stir in oregano and parsley. Add to pasta mixture. Toss to blend. Serve sprinkled with parsley and toasted breadcrumbs.

Fill the bottom of a mug with hot water or hot coffee to warm it up. Add 2 tsp of milk. Add 2 tsp of coco powder and 2 tsp of sugar. Add 1 tsp of extra dark chocolate (optional). Add 1/2 tsp of rum (optional). Add 1/4 tsp of pepper (optional). Stir well to dissolve everything. Add 1 tsp of extra dark chocolate (optional). Add 1/4 tsp of pepper (optional).

Heat the oil in a frying pan, add onions and fry till it is light brown. Add ginger, green chillies, garlic and fry for 2 minutes. Add the cabbage and fry till it is soft. Add the turmeric powder and fry for 2 minutes. Add salt and fry for 5 minutes. Remove from fire. Cool down and add coconut. Mix well. Serve hot.

Wash the artichokes well and place them in a large pot. Add 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pot with lid. Cook for about 40 minutes or until tender. Drain. Place the artichokes on an oiled plate. Season with olive oil. Mix lemon juice with sumac, tarragon and red pepper. Pour over the artichokes. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve cold.
name: sauteed artichokes in lemon garlic sauceingredients: artichoke heart, garlic, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper, parsley, white wine, olive oilpreparation:Heat oil in a saute pan over medium high heat. Add garlic and artichokes and season with salt and pepper. Saute garlic and artichokes 3-5 minutes, add remaining ingredients and lower heat to medium low. Simmer about 10 minutes. Serve hot.
name: artichoke and green olive dipingredients: artichoke hearts,

In medium saucepan, combine cranberries, brown sugar and water. Cook over medium-low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture is smooth. Add orange juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until berries burst. Stir in ginger, orange peel and ginger. Remove from heat and let stand until mixture is cool. Refrigerate.
Season fish on both sides. Grill on high heat until fish is cooked through. Whisk together the remaining ingredients and spoon over the fish. Serve immediately.

Combine the sugar and water in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until the mixture is boiling and the sugar is dissolved. Continue to stir until the mixture is amber in color, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the cream and salt. Pour the caramel into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish and let cool. Melt the dipping chocolate in a double boiler. Dip the bottom of the candy into the melted chocolate and place on waxed paper. Sprinkle nuts on the top of each candy and let sit until the chocolate has set.

Cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain. In a 2 quart saucepan melt margarine over medium heat. Add flour and stir until mixture is smooth. Slowly add milk. Stir constantly until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat. Add cheeses. Stir until smooth. Add cooked pasta to saucepan. Stir until pasta is covered. Spread pasta mixture in a greased 2 quart casserole. Bake in 400 degree oven for 25 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

Cut veal into 1 inch strips. Brown in oil in a skillet. Add onion and saute 5 minutes. Add mushrooms. Saute until tender. Add whipping cream and cook until thickened. Stir in wine, lemon juice and sugar to taste. Serve over spaetzle or noodles.

In medium bowl combine apricot preserves with lemons. In small bowl combine butter and liquid honey. Stir together butter mixture and lemon mixture. In small saucepan combine corn syrup and water. Cook over medium high heat until mixture comes to a boil. Pour mixture over butter mixture. Stir until combined and cooled to room temperature. Stir in pineapple. To serve, spoon mixture over chicken or fish. To serve as sauce for fruit or cakes, heat to serve. Serves 6.

In a soup pot over medium high heat, heat the oil. Add the onions and carrots. Sauté for a few minutes. Then add the cauliflower. Add the water. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Add the spinach pasta. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Serve hot. Top off with romano cheese.

Cook carrots until slightly tender. Drain. In same pan, combine Catalina Dressing, butter and maple syrup. Stir until blended. Cook until mixture is hot and bubbly. Stir in pecans. Serve over carrots.

Combine butter and peanut butter in a medium bowl. Beat together until smooth. Add sugars and beat until combined. Add egg and beat until smooth. Stir in oats and baking soda. Fold in morsels. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. Add vanilla and beat again. Combine dry ingredients. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture. Stir in 1 cup pecan halves. Drop by rounded spoonful onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Allow to cool. In small saucepan, combine 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup water. Stirring constantly, bring to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 tbsp vanilla. Let cool for 10 minutes. Drizzle over cooled cookies. Sprinkle with remaining pecan halves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Beat together the butter, sugars, almond extract, eggs, and 1/2 cup of the flour. Add the remaining 2 1/2 cups of flour and the almonds. Divide into 1-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar or cinnamon sugar (1 cup powdered sugar mixed with 1 teaspoon of cinnamon). Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet to cool on wire rack.

In a large saucepan, combine spearmint, tea bags and granulated sugar. Pour boiling water over the mixture. Cover and steep for 5 minutesremove from heat. Stir in lemon and orange juicespour into a punch bowl. Serve immediately over ice. If desired, top each glass with a piece of lemon and orange.

In a soup pot heat the vegetable oil over high heat. Add the green parts of the green onions. After about 1 minute add the mushrooms and carrot and stir for 2-3 minutes. Add the green peas and stir for another 2 minutes until the mushrooms are soft. Add the stock, the egg white and the soya sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for about 10 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Serve hot with the green parts of the green onions and the remaining mushrooms garnish.

Soak 1 cup dried green beans overnight. Drain. Add cold water to cover them by an inch. Bring to boil and simmer for about 1 hour or until tender. Drain. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in pan. Add sliced onions and saut until golden brown. Add tomato paste and saut for about 5 minutes. Add the rest of olive oil and saut for another minute. Add garlic and saut for another minute. Add the drained green beans, salt and black pepper. Mix well. Serve.

Combine dry ingredients. Add butter and cream cheese. Cream until well blended. Add pineapple and nuts. Add egg. Beat well. Add sour cream. Beat until smooth. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake in 375 oven for 15-20 minutes or until well browned.

Heat a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil and swirl it around. Add the onion and saute it, stirring constantly until softened. Add the chickpeas, tofu and kale and continue to saute for about 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and saute it for about 2 minutes. Add the lemon juice and zest and season with salt. Toss everything well and serve in a bowl.

In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese with vanilla, cinnamon and powdered sugar. Add the mini chocolate chips and mix well. Spray each tortilla with cooking spray on one side. Place on a cookie sheet and spread half of the filling on each. Cut into 1 1/2 inch squares. Chill for 2 hours or overnight. Garnish with a cherry. Serve with a toothpick. Serves 8.

Mix dressing ingredients. Add chicken. Toss lightly. Refrigerate until serving time. Add vegetables. Toss lightly. Refrigerate until serving time. Place lettuce leaf on plate. Top with salad. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl, combine onions, lettuce mix, cranberries, oranges and almonds. Sprinkle with blue cheese. Toss gently. Drizzle with dressing. Toss gently. Divide evenly among four salad plates.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and orange zest. Cook until garlic is golden and fragrant, about 4 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place the halved tomatoes in an 8-by-8-inch baking dish. Spoon in garlic butter and bake until golden brown and bubbly around the edges, about 20 minutes. Garnish with parsley before serving.

Preheat waffle iron for 2 minutes before you start cooking the waffle. Add 1/4 cup of batter to the iron and cook the waffle for 3 to 4 minutes or until the waffle is golden brown and crisp. Turn the waffle out onto a plate and top it with 1/3 cup of apple pie filling and 1/3 cup of french vanilla ice cream and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of pecans and a dash of cinnamon powder. Serve immediately.
Name: Banana Bread Pudding Ingredients: 1 loaf banana bread 2 cups milk 3 Tablespoons butter 3 Tablespoons sugar 3 Tablespoons flour 2 Tablespoons vanilla extract 1/2 teaspoon salt Preparation: Cut banana bread into cubes and set aside. In saucepan add milk, butter and sugar. Heat until butter is melted. Remove from heat and add flour and salt. Stir until smooth. Add banana bread cubes and stir until well coated. Pour

Wash the rice until the water is clear. Soak for 30 minutes. Grind the rice in a food processor until it is smooth. Add the ground chicken, oyster sauce, fish sauce, garlic, and coconut milk. Mix well. Season with white pepper. Make a dough by adding a little flour to the rice mixture. Divide the dough into 4-5 pieces. Take one piece of the dough and roll it in your hands to form a ball. Put the balls in the boiling water and cook for about 15 minutes. Serve with a spicy dip made of the same rice mixture but without adding the flour. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
This is a very good dish. It is spicy and delicious.
This is a very good dish. It is spicy and delicious. The shrimp is the star of this recipe. It is tender and very flavorful. The shrimp is cooked in a very flavorful marinade. The shrimp is cooked in a very flavorful marinade. The marinade is made of honey
Mash the avocados with a fork and add the goat cheese, cilantro and pistachios. Add the pepers flakes and stir well. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving. Serve with chips or veggies.
Mix cottage cheese and cream cheese in a bowl until well blended. Add the jello mix and stir until it dissolves. Add the pineapple and the canned milk. Mix well. Chill well before serving.

Mix cornflour with sherry and a little water into smooth paste. Cook dry sherry and water in small saucepan until thickened. Add pineapple chunk and cook for 1 minute. Add tofu, sprouts and onion. Heat through and serve with rice.

Beat the eggs, milk and sugar together. Add the vanilla and beat until fluffy. Cut bread into 1-inch cubes and dip cubes into egg mixturelet stand for 1 minute. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat and arrange cubes evenly in skillet. Cook until golden brown on one sideturn and cook until golden brown on other side and center is firm. Sprinkle with cinnamon and serve with maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 12-cup bundt pan. Beat the butter with the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sugar and beat until well mixed. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the flour, salt and vanilla. Beat on low speed until just blended. In a separate bowl, mix together the coffee and hot water. Add about a cup of the liquid to the batter. Beat until blended. Add the remaining liquid. Beat on low until blended. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Loosen the edges of the pan. Turn onto a wire rack to finish cooling.

Soak the turkey overnight in a mixture of cold water and salt. The next day, boil the water with the thyme and juniper berries and add the turkey. Bring the water to the boil and then simmer for 1 hour, adding a little more water if necessary. Remove the turkey and let it cool. Squeeze the thyme and juniper berries out of the water and discard. Remove the skin from the turkey and remove the breast meat from the bones. Set the turkey aside and strain the stock through a fine sieve into a clean pan. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan and fry the breast meat in it for about 3 minutes on each side until it is lightly browned and crisp on the outside and pink inside. Drain the meat on kitchen paper and set aside. Meanwhile, skim any fat off the surface of the stock. Heat the stock in a pan and add the butter and sage leaves. Simmer gently for about 2 minutes and then add the stock and the turkey breast meat. Bring the stock back to the boil and cook for another minute. Add the

Pour water into blender container. Add drink mix. Blend for a few seconds until it starts to fizz. Add orange juice and blend again for a few seconds. Pour into graham cracker crust. Chill until ready to serve.Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until fluffy. Add orange juice and beat until well blended. Spread over kool aid mixture. Chill until ready to serve.Top with whipped cream just before serving.

In a large stock pot over medium heat saute the onion in the olive oil until soft and translucent. Add the carrot and celery and cook until soft. Add the corn kernels. Add water. Add the parsley. Add sea salt, black pepper, and maple syrup. Simmer over medium heat for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Serve warm.

Combine the flour and egg in a mixing bowl with a pinch of salt. Mix in the butter with the flour mixture with your hands. Add the water by the tablespoon until you can gather the dough into a ball. Refrigerate the dough for about 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 450f grease 10-12 inch round pizza pan. Roll out the dough to fit the your pizza pan or you can just press the dough in the pan. Bake for 10 minutes and remove from oven. Let your oven cool down to 400f spread the crust with mustard and then layer on the tomato slices. Sprinkle the thyme, salt and pepper on top of the tomatoes. Drizzle with olive oil and bake at 400f for 30 minutes.

In a pressure cooker, combine all ingredients except the cooked ham. Add a little water if necessary to cover the ham and beans. Cook under pressure for 25 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Remove ham bone and dice ham meat and return to the pot. Reheat but do not allow to boil. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. In a skillet over medium high heat, heat oil. Season chicken with salt and pepper and cook until browned and juices run clear. Transfer to a baking dish and sprinkle with garlic powder. Top with monterey jack cheese. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm with salsa.

Peel and dice the potatoes. Fry in a frying pan with a little olive oil until they are golden brown. Drain and leave to cool. Combine the mayonnaise, garlic and hot paprika and mix well. Add the parsley and potatoes and toss. Season to taste and serve.
The main dish of this meal is potato. You will find all the possible variants of cooking it.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the potato slices and turn them until they are lightly browned. Add the stock and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover the pan and simmer until the potato is tender. Add the leek and garlic. Cook uncovered for a couple of minutes. Season well.
Boil the potato in a pan of water until they are just tender. Drain the potato and mash it with the milk and a little of the melted butter. Beat in the eggs and season. Add the cheese and mix well. Heat a little of the remaining butter in a large frying pan. Spoon in the potato mixture. Flatten it

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saute mushrooms until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add water, seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Cover and simmer until mushrooms are tender and liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Add zucchini and yellow squash and cook uncovered until tender, about 5 minutes longer. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles. Serves 4.

Beat together egg, egg whites, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Heat 1 cup water in microwave until boiling. Add egg mixture and stir. Cover microwave dish with microwave safe lid. Microwave on high for 45 seconds. Mix well. Microwave 1 minute more or until eggs are cooked through. Makes 2 servings.

Heat oil in large skillet over med-high heat. Add mushrooms and onions. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in light sour cream, sun-dried tomatoes, cooked pasta and bacon. Top with the parmesan cheese.

Combine berries with 1 cup sugar. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes. Combine flour, 1 cup sugar, margarine & nuts. Press mixture evenly over berry mixture. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Drizzle with cream cheese mixture. Spread with cream. Sprinkle with remaining nuts. Makes 12 servings.
Mix all ingredients together and form into meatballs. Spray baking pan and bake at 375 for 15 minutes. Serve in spaghetti sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese.

Preheat broiler. Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and brush lightly with olive oil. Broil until golden brown and crisp about 1 minute per side. Combine tomatoes, garlic and italian seasoning in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper and toss lightly. Spread bruschetta with tomato mixture and serve immediately.

Heat 2 Tbs. olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add potato and cook until lightly browned. Beat the eggs lightly in a bowl, then add them to the pan, breaking up any large clumps. Cook until the eggs are no longer runny but have not yet set. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped parsley if desired. Makes 2 servings.

In a large pot heat the oil over medium heat and saut the onions until soft. Add the rice and stir until it is coated with oil and onions. Add the chicken broth and chicken and bring to a boil. Once it boils cover the pot with a lid and turn the heat down to low. Cook for about 20-25 minutes or until the rice is tender. Let stand for about 10 minutes before serving to allow the liquid to be absorbed. If the dish is too thick add a bit of water until the desired consistency is reached.

In a 4 quart stock pot combine all of the ingredients except for the tomatoes, broth, and italian seasoning. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer for about 20 minutes. Add the tomatoes, broth and italian seasoning. Heat through, then serve in a bowl or in a bread bowl.

Peel potato(es) and slice in half or quarters lengthwise. Place in shallow bowl. Add butter or margarine and milk. Microwave at 50% power for 15 minutes or so or until potato is soft when pricked with fork. Meanwhile, cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain and crumble. Set aside. After the potato is done, scoop out some of the potato pulp from the shells. Add milk, cheese and bacon in the bowl with the pulp. Mix well. Spoon back into the shells or serve in bowl. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugar until smooth. Add vanilla extract and condensed milkmix well. Add dry ingredients, mix well. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet, 2 inches apart. Bake for 12-14 minutes at 350 degrees F. Makes 3 dozen.

Spread 1 baguette with 1 tsp of mustard and 1 tsp of mayo. Sprinkle with 1 tsp of pepper. Layer ham, 1 avocado, 1 slice of swiss on top. Sprinkle with 1 tsp of pepper. Repeat with remaining baguette. Cut into 4 pieces. Serve with lemon wedges.

Mix the first 5 ingredients together thoroughly. In another bowl mix butter, pepper, salt and celery flavorings together well. Slowly add the liquid mixture to the butter mixture while constantly beating until smooth. Refrigerate. This dressing is excellent with your favorite salad greens, potato salad or coleslaw.

Toss together arugula, pecans, cheese, and red onion in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine honey, Dijon mustard, red wine vinegar, and kosher salt. Whisk in olive oil until well combined. Pour over saladtoss to coat. Chop peachtoss in. Serve immediately.

Wash and chop all vegetables. Melt butter in sauce pan and saute vegetables in butter until tender. Add hamburgers and cook over medium heat until light brown. Drain off fat. Add chicken broth and seasonings and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly grease a large baking pan. Set aside. Clean and trim cauliflower. Cut into florets. Spread on pan. Roast 20-30 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. In a saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Add onion and cook 3-4 minutes. Add flour. Cook 2 minutes stirring constantly. Gradually add chicken stock. Mix well.
