Bring to a boil and cook 5-7 minutes or until thickened. Add milk and cream cheese. Stir until smooth. Stir in cooked cauliflower. Heat through. Serve.

Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan over medium heat until it begins to smoke. Stir-fry the mushrooms until they turn a golden color and are softened (about 3 minutes). Add the bok choy, cover the wok or pan, reduce the heat to low, and steam the greens until they are wilted (about 2 minutes). Stir in the water, bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 2 minutes. Season to taste with salt.

Combine peanut butter and canned pumpkin in a small bowl. Spread over both sides of each piece of bread and top with slices of banana and sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice and honey. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook toast, in batches, in the skillet until lightly browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. Serve immediately with warm maple syrup.
Dissolve caramel sauce in hot water and pour over ice in a tall glass. Add espresso and stir well. Add a few tablespoons of milk to make a latte. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve immediately.

Sauté onion until transparent. Add turkey, mushroom, crushed red pepper and garlic. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add tomato sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Mix couscous with water. Spoon into bell peppers. Place meat mixture into bell peppers. Bake at 350 about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix all seasonings together and rub on the chops. Add lemon juice and let sit for about an hour in the fridge. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add the butter and onions and saute until soft and lightly browned. Place the chops in the skillet and add the ketchup and lemon juice, stir and cover and simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes or until juices run clear and the meat is tender. Serve over hot rice.

Mix all ingredients except salmon in a small bowlpour over fish and marinate for at least one hour. Spray fish lightly with cooking spray. Preheat broiler. Broil fish on foil-lined baking sheet for about five minutes per side or until done.

In large bowl beat thickened cream till smooth. Fold ice cream into whipped cream. Pour into ice cream freezer. Fold in 1 1/2 cups of melted caramels. Freeze 1 hour. Melt remaining caramels. Add 1/2 cup of water. Drizzle over ice cream. Freeze 1 hour.
name: hot and creamy cocoa with gooey toasted marshmallows
ingredients: heavy cream, sugar, semisweet chocolate, marshmallows
preparation:Place the cream in a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat slightly so the cream remains at a low boil, and boil for 3 to 4 minutes, until it begins to thicken. Stir in the sugar and chocolate and continue to simmer, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves and the chocolate melts. Remove the saucepan from the heat and set aside to keep warm.
place under your broiler in the oven for 2 to

In a medium size bowl melt the margarine. Add the marshmallows and stir until melted. Add the cereal and cranberries stirring to mix well. Spread mixture into a 13x9x2inch pan. Cool until set. Cut into squares.

In a large pot over medium heat, add the butter and the scallions and saute for 30 seconds. Add the garlic and saute for another 30 seconds. Stir in the flour and cook for about 1 minute. Pour in the chicken stock, scraping the bottom of the pot to get up the brown bits. Add the tarragon, mushrooms and pepper. Bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes. Turn the heat down to a simmer and add the cream. Season to taste with additional salt and pepper.

In a saucepan over low heat, stir together the baking cocoa and sugar. Add water, stirring until smooth. Add the milk and heat just until bubbles form around the edge of the pan. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla. Serve in mugs with a sprinkling of cinnamon and a dollop of whipped cream.

Slice tomatoes into wedges about 1/2 inch thick. Cut cucumber into slices 1/2 inch thick. Combine tomato and cucumber slices. Stir in fat-free mayonnaise until well coated. Sprinkle with onion. Refrigerate at least one hour before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Slice the tofu into 12 equal rounds and press out the excess water with paper towel. Dust the rounds of tofu with flour. Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium-high heat. Fry the tofu rounds in batches for 1-2 minutes on each side until crispy. Meanwhile, make the dressing. Mix all the dressing ingredients together in a bowl. Arrange the fried tofu rounds on a plate and serve with the tangy chilli dressing.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Cut each brussels sprout in half. Toss with olive oil, salt& pepper. Bake for 20-30 minutes on a baking sheet lined with foil or a silicone baking mat. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

Blend together all ingredients in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Cook, stirring frequently until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. If mixture is too thick, gradually blend in warm water until desired consistency is reached.

Grease a loaf pan with a little butter or cooking spray. Preheat the oven to 325f. In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, matcha green tea powder, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, making sure the mixture is smooth after each addition. Stir in the matcha green tea powder until the color is evenly distributed throughout the batter. Add the vanilla extract. Alternately add the dry ingredients and the milk to the batter, starting with the dry and ending with the last of the milk, stirring with each addition until smooth. Stir in the lemon zest and juice. Pour into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool the cake for at least an hour before cutting into it. Drizzle with the glaze once it has cooled completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a large baking sheet by spraying it lightly with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine almonds, paprika and salt. Add the olive oil and toss to coat evenly. Spread almonds in a single layer on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Toss again to coat evenly. Spread almonds in a single layer again. Bake for 15 minutes more. Remove from oven. Toss again to coat evenly. Serve immediately.

Brush both sides of the mushrooms with olive oil. Place on a bbq plate. Grill for about 5 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from the bbq plate. Cut each mushroom into 4 slices. Place on a serving dish. Top the slices with the artichoke, olives, capsicums, tomatoes, feta and thyme. Garnish with a few twists of black pepper.

Combine all the ingredients except the steaks and mix well. Put the steaks in a zip lock plastic bag and pour the marinade mixture over them. Seal the bag and place in the fridge overnight. Grill the steaks over a high heat until they are done to your liking.

In a frying pan heat 2 tablespoons of the butter and brown the chops on both sides. Remove from pan. Add the marjoram and fry for a few minutes. Add the remaining butter. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes until soft. Add the port wine and reduce the sauce. Add the sour cream and heat through. Season to taste. Pour the sauce over the chops and serve.

Wash and drain mustard greens. Combine with water and salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook on low 6 to 8 hours. While greens cook, rinse and pat dry chicken. Combine 1/2 cup water and vinegar. Marinate chicken with this mixture. Place greens and chicken in crock pot and cook 3 hours or more. If using uncooked chicken, add 1/4 cup water.

Squeeze juice from lemons and oranges. Add sugar and enough ice to fill two-thirds full of 16-ounce shaker. Add water to cover ice. Cover and shake. Pour into tall glasses. Garnish with orange or lemon slice.

Saute onion and garlic in oil until lightly browned. Add peppers and ham. Cook until meat is browned. Add tomato juice. Bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute, stirring. Stir in tomato sauce, water, rice, salt, pepper, and oregano. Cook 10 minutes until liquid is absorbed, stirring frequently. Stir in peas. Cook 5 minutes longer, until rice is tender.

In a medium skillet, melt the butter. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Add the salt and pepper. Gradually add the milk while stirring. Bring to a boil. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Add the potatoes. Pour into a 3 quart crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 4 hours. Serve with a side salad and garlic toast.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the tomatoes and cook, turning once until the tomatoes are blistered, about 3 minutes. Transfer the tomatoes to a baking sheet and sprinkle with the thyme and season with salt. Roast until the tomatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the garlic powder and salt and blend well. Rub the mixture evenly over the biscuits. Place the biscuits in the baking pan. In a small bowl, combine the oil and pepper and pour over the biscuits. Bake for about 25-30 minutes, until the biscuits are golden brown and the peppers are tender. Top the biscuits with the mozzarella and Parmesan. Bake for about 10 minutes more until the cheeses are melted. Let cool for about 10 minutes before cutting into the squares.

In a large saucepan over high heat, bring water to boil. Add noodles and cook 6 to 8 minutes until tender. Drain. Melt butter in saucepan. Stir in dill weed and garlic salt. Add cooked noodles. Stir in light cream. Pour mixture into a 1-1/2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with soft breadcrumbs. Bake at 400 for 20 to 25 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400. Mix together the cheeses in a bowl and add the bacon and horseradish. Beat the eggs and milk together and add the flour, salt and pepper and stir to make a soft batter. Pour the batter over the cheese mix and bake for 1 hour or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot or cold with salad or vegetables.

Heat oven to 350. Prepare cake mix as directed for a 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, and lemon zest. Beat with a mixer until well blended. Spread over the bottom of a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine the raspberry pastry filling and the chambord. Spread over the cake. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Before serving, beat the cool whip until soft peaks form. Spread over the pastry cream and sprinkle with raspberries. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a large pot. Add the brownie mix, stirring constantly. Add the sweetened condensed milk and stir to combine. Spread into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until the edges begin to pull away from the pan. Cool completely in the pan. While the brownies are cooling make the frosting by combining the powdered sugar with the milk. Pour the frosting over the brownies. Break the Heath bars into pieces and press into the frosting. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
If youre looking for something to take to a picnic or potluck this is it! This recipe makes a lot of brownies so youll have plenty to share. I had to make this recipe twice in one week! Its sooo good! Ive had this recipe forever and it is amazing! It is very rich and fudgy and the best brownies ive ever had! Ive always used Ghiradelli brownies because i think the chocolate flavor is better, but this recipe is amazing!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg, lemon juice, vanilla and lemon zestmix well. Sift together flour, salt and baking sodaadd to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream. Shape dough into 1-inch ballsroll in granulated sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat the oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Add the shanks and cook for 3 minutes. Add the cinnamon. Stir well. Add the honey, soy sauce and water. Add the garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the beef stock. Add the jasmine rice. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Add the Gai Lan. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve with fresh lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 375. Sprinkle a little salt and pepper onto each side of 2-inch-thick fillet of salmon. Brush with olive oil and arrange in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with dill and herbes de provence. Brush each side of fish with 1 tablespoon mustard. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish is done. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine milk and wine and bring to a boil. Add flour and whisk until thick. Remove from heat. Add butter and stir until melted. Add cheese and stir until cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine eggs, salt and pepper. Beat until combined. Melt butter in a small skillet. Add egg mixture and cook until set. Fold in Canadian bacon. Arrange Canadian bacon on english muffins. Spoon sauce over top. Sprinkle with more cheese and bake until the cheese is bubbly and browned.

Wash apples, core and cut into slices 1/4 inch thick. Spread cheese on apples, sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Roll up starting at the bottom of each piece of apple and roll up toward the stem of the apple until you get to the top of the apple. Wrap a piece of apple with a piece of bacon. Lay bacon wrapped apple roll on dehydrator trays. Bake at 155 degrees until bacon is crisp (8 hours). Repeat until all the apples are done. Makes 5 to 6 servings.
Fall is my favorite time of the year. I love all the beautiful colors of the leaves. I love the crisp cool air in the morning. I love the smell of fall. I love the fall foods! I love pumpkin spice everything and warm apple crisp with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. My favorite fall recipe is this one for pecan cheesecake. I have made this recipe for several years now. The first time I made it was when my brother got married 5 years ago. I made

Peel and cube potatoes. Add water to a saucepan over medium heat until boiling. Add potatoes and cover. Reduce heat to low and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and mash with a potato masher. Stir in dill and chives. Add butter and mix until just blended. Season with pepper. Garnish with parsley.
This entry was posted in Food and tagged dinner recipes on August 8, 2018 by Yami.

Sift together dry ingredients. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add egg and milk. Mix well. Stir in berries. Form into ball. Flatten on lightly floured surface. Cut into wedges. Bake at 425f for 15 minutes. Makes 12 scones.

Cook noodles in boiling water 12 to 14 minutes or until tender. Drain. Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in flour. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture is light brown. Add sherry and chicken broth. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and almonds. Cook and stir for 3 more minutes. Stir in noodles. Pour into a 3 quart casserole. Combine cheese and pimento. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9x5x3 inch loaf pans. In a small saucepan combine the carrots and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until carrots are soft. Mash carrots and reserve liquid. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredientsflour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a separate bowl combine the carrots and reserved liquidbeat until smooth. Add the beaten eggs, oil and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and blend thoroughly. Divide between the two prepared pans. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans. While the cake is cooling, combine the icing ingredients and beat until smooth. Spread between the layers and on top and sides of the cake. Decorate as desired. Serves 10.

Whip the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in the sugar until stiff peaks form again. Add the saltine crumbs and mix well. Divide into 4 equal parts in four 9-inch round baking pans that have been sprayed with cooking spray. Press mixture firmly into pan with fingers or spoon. Chill overnight in refrigerator. Soak gelatin in water for 5 minutes. Combine coconut milk with gelatin mixture and stir until smooth. Remove one pan from the refrigerator and pour about 1/3 of the coconut milk mixture into the pan. Smooth it out evenly with a spoon. Repeat with the other three pans and refrigerate again for 1 hour or until firm. Garnish with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium bowl, combine all dry ingredients and mix well. Add egg whites and beat until frothy. Add apples and stir until well combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on rack 5 minutes and serve warm.

Heat oil in a pressure cooker over medium-high heat. Add roast. Sprinkle with salad dressing mixes. Brown roast for 5 minutes. Stir in broth and cover. Cook 25 minutes at high pressure. Quick release pressure. Skim fat from liquid. Pour liquid through a sieve. Stir in gravy mix. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve roast and gravy over mashed potatoes.

Cook the bacon in a skillet until crisp. Remove the bacon from the skillet, leaving the drippings behind. Cook the onions in the drippings until softened. Add the Brussels sprouts and cook until tender. Stir in the sour cream and heat through. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with bacon and serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine the rinsed lentils, 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil and the ginger. Mash the mixture with the back of a spoon. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the ground turmeric and cayenne pepper and stir to blend. Add the mashed lentils to the saucepan and stir to combine. Add the salt and the onion flakes. Cover the saucepan and cook over low heat for 30 minutes. Uncover the saucepan. Add the cumin seed. Cook for another minute or two. Serve immediately.

Cut the angel food cake into 1-inch cubes and place in a large glass bowl or serving bowl. Stir together the fat-free cool whip, strawberries, chocolate chips and a dash of chocolate syrup. Add to the cake cubes and mix well. Chill at least two hours. Top with whole berries before serving.

Mix the first 5 ingredients in a bowl. Add the milk and stir with a fork just till moistened. Do not overmix. Drop by level teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or till golden brown. Serve with butter or buttermilk

In a medium-sized bowl, combine milk, cocoa, and sugarstir well until smooth. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, melt canola oilstir until smooth. Add oil to cocoa mixturestir well. Add peanut butterstir well until smooth. Add oatsstir well. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto wax paper. Let cool 20 minutes or until firm. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

In a skillet, cook ground beef and drain. Add peppers, onions, barbecue sauce, salt to taste. Add chili beans and heat thoroughly. Grease a 2-quart casserole dish. Blend dry muffin mix with enough milk to make a soft dough. Shape into 20 balls. Place one ball of dough in the bottom of each of four 2-quart casserole dishes. Top with about 1-1/4 cups of meat mixture. Top with 1 can of corn. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until muffin tops are golden brown.
Mix all together in a microwavable bowl. Cover tightly with a microwave-safe plate. Microwave on high for 2 minutes. Stir. Microwave on high for 2 more minutes. Cool. Serve on toast or bread.

Place all ingredients except cheese in slow cooker. Stir and cover. Cook on low setting for 5-6 hours or high for 3 hours. Stir before serving and sprinkle with cheese. Serves 6.
name: pork skillet supperingredients: onion, vegetable oil, condensed cream of celery soup, milk, worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, cooked pork, potato, frozen peaspreparation:In a skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Stir in soup, milk, worcestershire, salt and pepper. Mix well. Add pork, potatoes and peas. Heat through.
name: bacon topped meatloafingredients: chili sauce, eggs, worcestershire sauce, onion, cheddar cheese, dry breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, lean ground beef, baconpreparation:In a bowl, combine the first eight ingredients. Crumble beef over mixture and mix well. Shape into a loaf in an ungreased

Combine warm milk and oil in a large bowl and whisk in fast rise yeast. Add sugar, 1 cup of the flour and the salt and eggs and beat on low speed for 1 minute. Add enough remaining flour to form a soft dough that is no longer stickyknead in the cornmeal and let rest for 5 minutes. Roll dough to desired thickness and cut with desired pizza cutter and bake on cookie sheet at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Brush with pizza sauce and top with desired toppings and return to oven until desired crispness is reached.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Flatten each chicken breast between two pieces of wax paper. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Dip the chicken first into the beaten eggs, then into the bread crumbs. Place the chicken pieces on baking sheets. Bake for about 45 minutes. When done, remove from oven and keep warm. In a saucepan melt the butter. Add the brandy, cream, the juice of the lemon and the basil. Heat over low heat until the sauce thickens. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Serve with potatoes.

In a large frying pan, fry bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon to paper towel to drain and set aside. Add the chopped tomatoes to the frying pan with the cooked bacon fat and cook for 2 minutes. Add the crushed garlic and cook for another minute. Add the herbs and season with the salt and pepper to taste. Add the mascarpone to the pan and stir well until smooth. Add the cooked pasta to the pan and toss well to coat with the sauce. Garnish with bacon.

Brown ground beef and drain well. Stir in onion and kidney beans. Add rice and stir well. Add water and salsa and stir well. Place in a greased casserole dish and top with shredded cheese. Bake uncovered for about 45 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Combine water and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add raspberries and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lime juice. Pour mixture into a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Pour mixture into a 10- by 15-inch baking dish. Freeze for 2 hours. Scrape mixture with a fork into small pieces. Freeze until firm. Repeat until mixture is frozen. Stir in champagne. Serve immediately.
17. Sweet & Spicy Pork With Peaches & Raspberries
a sweet and spicy glazed pork chop with peaches and raspberries.
http://www.recipeshop.com/recipes/sweet-and-spicy-pork-with-peaches-and
Sweet & Spicy Pork With Peaches & Raspberries
Recipes Shop Recipes Forum ...
Recipe Type: Main Course
1/4 cup Sweet Peach Jam 1 1/4 cup

Cook bacon in wok or large frying pan over medium heat until crisp. Remove with slotted spoon to paper towels. Saute onion in drippings until tender. Add pork to pan. Stir in vegetables and cook 1 minute. Add garlic, cook 30 seconds longer. Add soy sauce. Stir in rice. Heat through. Serve with frozen peas.

Break up ramen noodles and set aside. Tear apart the coleslaw mix and place in a large serving bowl. Sprinkle in the seasoning packet from the ramen. Add the almonds and sunflower seeds. Crumble in the green onions and stir well. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and whisk well. Dress the salad just before serving.

In a large bowl beat the eggs and add in the cream cheese. Beat until smooth. Fold in the dill and other ingredients. In a large skillet over medium-low heat, melt a small piece of butter. Add a few tablespoons of the egg mixture to skillet. Cook until set. Flip with a spatula. Cook until set. Remove from pan. Repeat until all the egg mixture is cooked. Serve with toast or on a piece of rye bread.

Place the ice into the shaker. Pour in the vodka and liqueur. Add the lime and simple syrup. Shake and strain into an ice-filled martini glass. Top with the cranberry juice. Garnish with the raspberries and rosemary sprigs.

Place lentils and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat to medium and cook, uncovered, for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain the water from the lentils and rinse with cold water to stop cooking and remove any excess starch from the lentils. Set aside to cool. Whisk together balsamic vinegar and olive oil and drizzle over the lentilstoss to coat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Arrange the grape tomatoes and avocado slices over the lentil salad and garnish with the mango. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate and serve cold.
Toast oatmeal. Melt fat and mix in cheese. Add flour, spices, baking powder. Stir in oatmeal and fat. Chill. Roll in balls. Fry in hot fat. Turn. Serve hot.

Boil carrots in water. When they are soft enough to pierce with a fork, remove from water. Peel and cut into cubes. Mix carrots with sugar, coriander seed, black pepper and chili powder. Let stand for 30 minutes. Add white vinegar and mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Toss before serving. Serve with mayonnaise.

Combine the first three ingredients in a mixing bowltoss well. Stir in the remaining ingredientstoss well. Spoon into a lightly greased 13x9 inch baking dishsprinkle with topping. Bake at 425 degrees F for 45 minutes or until topping is golden brown. Cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours. Stir well before serving. Makes 8 servings.
name: raspberry apple crisp
ingredients: raspberries, apples, brown sugar, rolled oats, flour, cinnamon, butter
preparation:Preheat oven to 350f.
Toss together berries and apples, spread evenly over bottom of 8x8 baking dish. In medium bowl combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and oats. Using pastry cutter work butter into oat mixture until crumbly. Spread over fruit, pressing down lightly. Bake 40-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Cool before serving.

Line baking trays with baking paper. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat in well. Fold in the milk and the sifted flour. Stir in the vanilla. Pour into prepared tins. Bake for approximately 25-35 minutes.
The first time I made these cookies was in my mother-in-law’s kitchen. I was trying out an old recipe I had found in an old recipe book. It was a recipe that my husband’s family used all the time. I was very excited to try this new recipe. I was also very excited because this was the first recipe I had made that had come from my in-laws.
This recipe is very simple. It is just a few simple ingredients that you will find in your kitchen. The recipe calls for butter, caster sugar, eggs, vanilla essence, self raising flour and milk. I used vanilla extract instead of vanilla essence. I also used the same amount of flour that the recipe called for. I used self rising flour because that is what I had in my pantry. I

Brew tea using family size tea bags in a large teapot or dutch oven. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add frozen lemonade concentrate and stir until dissolved. Add remaining water and stir again until dissolved. Serve over ice with ginger ale.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook pasta as directed, drain and return to the pot. Cook the tuna in a small amount of oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until lightly browned and crumbly. Add the flour and stir until well blended and lightly browned. Add the milk and cream. Cook and stir until thickened. Add the asparagus and the tuna. Season to taste with salt, pepper and hot pepper sauce. Pour over the pasta. Top with sour cream and curry powder. Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until heated through.
Whisk together all of the ingredients except for the blue cheese in a small bowl. Season with salt to taste. Garnish with blue cheese crumbles just before serving.

In a large skillet with cover on high heat add 1/2 cup of olive oil. When the pan is hot add 2 garlic clove. Saute until the garlic begins to brown. Add the chicken breasts and stir to coat. Add 1 cup of water to the skillet. Cover the pan and cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Add the tomato paste and stir until it melts. Add the soy sauce and lemon juice. Continue stirring until the sauce thickens. Sprinkle with the fresh parsley. Add the pasta shells and toss to coat. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. Serve immediately.

Prepare cornbread-muffin mix as directed on box. Spread batter into lightly greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 f for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with cheddar cheesebake an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with ham slices. Serve warm.

Heat a dutch oven or heavy pot over medium heat. Add half of the butter. When butter is melted and foamy, add half of the chicken pieces. Brown thoroughly on one side, about 5 minutes. Turn and brown on other side. Remove from pan and repeat with remaining butter and chicken. Remove the pan from heat. In a small bowl, combine the dressing and caraway seeds. Toss carrots and potatoes with dressing and spread evenly in the bottom of the pan. Arrange chicken pieces on top of potatoes. Top with remaining butter and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Cover and bake for one hour. Check to make sure potatoes are cooked through. If not done, bake uncovered for another 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve in bowls.

In a large pan add the oil and the garlic and cook over low heat until fragrant and golden, about 20 minutes. Add the linguine and the balsamic vinegar and cook, tossing until the pasta is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. Add the brown sugar and toss well. Transfer pasta to a serving bowl. Add the butter and the parmigiano-reggiano and toss well. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 425 F. Lightly coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl. Rub lamb with 1/3 of the mixture. Reserve remaining mixture for basting. Thread lamb onto 8 bamboo skewers, leaving 1/2-inch space between each piece. Place lamb onto prepared baking sheet. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes. Baste with remaining mixture. Roast lamb 15 minutes.

Preheat a wok or stir-fry pan over high heat. Add the carrots and broccoli and cook until just tender crisp. Add the seitan and cook for 1 minute. Add the noodles and cook until heated through. Remove from the heat. Add the teriyaki sauce and the sesame oil. Stir to combine. Transfer to a bowl. Top with the chopped green onion.

In a large saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the flour and cook over moderate heat, stirring constantly, until a pale gold paste forms. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Add the cheese, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until smooth. Add the broccoli florets and stir. Simmer over moderate heat until the florets are tender and the soup is thickened, about 10 minutes. Season the soup with salt and pepper.Ladle the soup into bowls and sprinkle with the paprika.

In a tall glass combine the lime juice, sugar and mint. Mash and stir until the sugar dissolves. Add the rum and fill glass with ice. Top off with pomegranate juice and soda water. Garnish with a mint leaf.

Peel, wash, cut into large chunks, and boil until tender. Drain, mash well. Add onion cut up to taste and seasonings to taste. Add flour to thicken. Put in buttered casserole dish and dot with butter. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Melt shortening in skillet. Drain squash and add to skillet with onion and seasonings to taste. Cook until tender. Cool a little if desired and pour over potatoes. Bake 15 minutes more.
name: bacon potato bundlespreparation:Place the potatoes on four pieces of greased heavy duty aluminum foil. Place onion and green peppers between potatoes to quarters. Top with bacon. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap in foil. Grill, covered. Over med-high heat for 40-50 minutes or until potatoes are tender, turning once.
name: chava s thin and crispy potato kugelpreparation:Grate potatoes in the food processor. If you can grate with a large hole, use

In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add potatoes, onions, salt, sugar, and pepper. Reduce heat to simmer, cover partially, and cook until vegetables are tender. Add clams and cream. Stir well. Heat through. Do not boil. Serve hot.
Mix all together and refrigerate overnight. Best served at room temperature.

Beat eggs until light. Add sugar and beat until blended. Add water. Add oil. Beat until smooth. Add pumpkin. Mix well. Add salt. Add flour. Beat until well mixed. Add spices. Spoon into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for one hour. Makes 1 loaf.

Peel and dice the onions. Heat the vegetable oil in a saucepan and fry the onions for about five minutes. Add the lentils and fry for another five minutes. Add the water and bring to the boil. Simmer until the lentils are cooked through. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.

Prepare egg noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles. In a large skillet brown the meat in hot oil. Add sauerkraut. Add 1 tablespoon caraway seeds, the Swiss cheese and dressing. Cook until heated through. Pour into a 2 quart casserole dish. In a medium bowl beat together milk and mustard. Spread the mixture over the top of the meat mixture. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Uncover for 5 minutes. Sprinkle top with remaining caraway seeds. Melt the butter in a small skillet. Add the pumpernickel crumbs. Cook until lightly browned. Remove from heat. Spoon over top of the casserole. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a baking dish with melted butter. Place chicken in baking dish and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Bake for 30 minutes. In the meantime, combine the instant mashed potatoes, milk, egg, and parmesan cheese in a bowl until blended. Pour the mixture over the chicken in the baking dish and bake for another 30 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl, combine cauliflower and carrots. In a smaller bowl, stir together the rest of the ingredients. Pour dressing over cauliflower mixture and stir to coat. Serve as a side dish or a main dish.

Lightly grease a 13 x 9 x 2 baking dish. Place chicken in dish and sprinkle with chipotle. Pour picante over the top. Cover and bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with cheese. Broil 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with green onion and serve.

Combine the shallots and sherry in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the mixture is syrupy, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Whisk in the vinegar. In a large bowl combine the spinach with the pecan halves and the sherry vinaigrette. Toss to mix well. Let the mixture stand at room temperature for 5 minutes or until the spinach is wilted. Add the gorgonzola and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Slice and saute the onion in the butter until tender. Sprinkle with flour, salt, and pepper and cook for a minute or so stirring constantly. Add the fresh green beans and cook for 5 more minutes. Melt the sour cream and add to the vegetables. Stir until the vegetables are coated and heated through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with the cheese and crumbs. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes.

Cut bread in half horizontally and spread mustard on each slice. Layer each sandwich with one slice of ham and one slice of cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and cut each sandwich into two triangles. Return to oven and bake until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Remove from oven and let cool. Whisk together the eggs, skim milk, and pepper. Fill each sandwich with half of the egg mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese and bake for another minute.

Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the remaining butter and the 1 1/2 cups of the milk. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add 1 cup of the grated cheese. Stir until melted. Cool. Sift the remaining 1 1/2 cups of flour with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Cut in remaining 1 1/2 cups of butter until mixture is crumbly. Stir in cheese mixture. Divide dough in half. On lightly greased baking sheet, shape each half into 8 inch square. Prick with fork. Brush with beaten egg. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Bake in 375 degree oven 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.
name: peppery cheese biscuitingredients: flour, pepper, butter, cheddar cheesepreparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees.

Cut off the dark green tops of the leeks and discard. Trim the roots off the bottom of the leeks and slice in half lengthwise. Rinse the leeks well. In a 4-quart heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the leeks and onions and saute until the vegetables are golden. Stir in the garlic and cook 2 minutes longer. Add the water and boil over high heat for 10 minutes. Reduce the heat and add the potatoes and salt and cook until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the tarragon and cream and simmer until the cream thickens, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Ladle the soup into bowls and top each serving with 1 tablespoon yogurt and sprinkle a few fresh tarragon leaves on top.
This is a very simple recipe for a side dish. It is great served with pork loin or ham.

Heat chutney in saucepan and add milk. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add cream cheese and curry powder. Add the snap peas and cook for a few minutes until warm and the snap peas are tender but not overcooked. Serve with the roasted peanuts sprinkled over the top.

Beat the eggs lightly. Add the beer and stir until blended. Add the beer, and stir until blended. Add the beer batter. Whisk together until the batter is smooth. Heat the oil in a deep fryer or large heavy-bottomed frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Dip the halibut pieces into the batter and fry for about 2 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with remaining halibut. Serve hot.

Prepare the vinaigrette by whisking together the wine, mustard and hazelnuts. Set aside. Cut the honeydew melon into bite-sized pieces and place in a medium bowl. Toss the melon with the vinaigrette and sprinkle on the blue cheese. Place the asparagus on a platter and top with the melon and blue cheese mixture. Sprinkle on the orange zest and serve immediately.

Heat oil in a skillet. Brown steak. Add bacon. Add onion. Cook until steak is done to your liking. Add lime juice. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with salsa, avocado, and shredded cheese on corn tortilla.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onion in oil for 5 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook until tender. Stir in the black beans, corn and the remaining ingredients and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and transfer mixture to a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Spoon about 1/4 cup rice mixture down the center of each of the 6 halved peppers and place on top of the rice mixture. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until cheese is melted and filling is heated through. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400. Beat together the first five ingredients. Stir in the dry ingredients and stir just until smooth. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake for about 20 minutes or until done. Makes 18 muffins. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.
Melt margarine and saute onions and garlic in saucepan. Add rice. Add vegetable broth. Cook for approx. 20 minutes.

Mix all ingredients except pie crusts. Divide mixture equally between the three pie crusts. Top with roasted peanuts or graham cracker crumbs, if desired. Freeze. Leave out or refrigerate to soften a bit before cutting. Store leftover in freezer.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season steaks with salt and pepper. Add steaks and cook until browned and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side. Transfer steaks to a plate. Add onion and cook until softened and golden brown. Stir in sugar, vinegar, and whiskey. Cook until mixture comes to a boil and thickens slightly. Reduce heat and simmer until reduced by half, about 10-15 minutes. Whisk in flour and butter. Stir until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Serve sauce over steaks.
Mix the raisins, carrots and oil in a bowl. Sprinkle with the spices. Cool in the refrigerator. Serve topped with the yogurt.

Combine the first four ingredients. In a bowl beat the egg, add the margarine, cinnamon, milk and vanilla. Add to the dry ingredients. Spoon into a greased 13x9x2 pan. Combine the topping ingredients and sprinkle over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Serves 8-10.

Combine cabbage and scallions. Refrigerate until ready to toss. Brown noodles, almonds and sesame seeds lightly in butter. Set aside. Bring to a boil in a pan the vinegar, oil, sugar and soy sauce, just enough to dissolve the sugar. Cool dressing completely. Combine all ingredients and toss just before serving.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix dry ingredients in a bowl. In another bowl mix wet ingredients. Mix wet and dry together. Pour into muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes.

Cream the vegan margarine in a mixer until soft. Add the sugars and vanilla and mix well. Add the water and beat well. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the old fashioned oats and mix well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit or 190 degrees celsius. Beat the margarine and sugar together until creamy and well blended. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the pumpkin puree and mix until just combined. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead to form a ball. Roll out into a circle about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned. Let sit for 5 minutes before removing from the cookie sheets to a wire rack to cool completely.
I love the pictures! They are so pretty!
I love the pictures on your blog! I think I like the ones with the kitty the best!
Your pictures are great! I like them all but the ones with the kitty are my favorite!
I love the pictures on your blog! I think they are all great but I like the ones with the kitty the best!
I love the pictures on your blog! I like the ones

In a 13 by 9 baking dish, combine cooked angel hair with tuna and italian seasoning. Spread 1 cup cracker crumbs over the top. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Drizzle over top. Sprinkle with remaining cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until the crumbs are lightly browned.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. In separate pan add 2 cups water, 1/2 cup milk and 1 tablespoon sugar. Bring to boil. Stir well. Cook until well blended, 2 minutes. Serve with cooked pasta and remaining 3/4 cup milk. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar if desired.
name: a sauce for a dull food
ingredients: butter, flour, salt and pepper, sugar, hard-boiled eggs, milk, lemon juice
preparation:Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and stir 1-2 minutes to make a roux. Add the salt, pepper, sugar and chopped egg, mixing well. Gradually add the milk and stir until mixture thickens, about 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and serve. This sauce can be used to give an attractive flavour and appearance to foods such as fish, old vegetables, and so on.
name: chopped egg sauce
ingredients: butter, flour, whole milk,

Sauté the onions in the oil until tender. Add the potatoes and cook for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the roast beef, bacon and seasonings. Pour into a 13 x 9 x 2 inch greased pan. Top with the sour cream, chives, bacon bits and cheddar cheese. Bake at 350f for 20 to 25 minutes.
Place all ingrediants in crock-pot except for the tortilla chips. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Garnish with tortilla chips.

In a large soup pan, brown the sausages in the vegetable oil. Add the onions and continue cooking until they are soft. Add the chicken broth and cook for a few minutes. Add the potatoes and cook until soft. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from the heat. Stir in the heavy cream and season to taste. Serve immediately.

Slice rye cocktail bread into small squares, about 2 1/2 inches by 2 inches. Put small amount of grape jelly on each square of rye. Top with pork sausage and cheese mixture, then another slice of rye. Melt butter in 2 quart saucepan over low heat until melted but not brown. Pour over rye squares to cover bottom of pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and browned on top. Serve warm with additional grape jelly.

In a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Add onions to the fat in the pan. Cook and stir for 1 minute or until tender. Add garliccook and stir for 30 seconds. Stir in beans. Add water and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 20 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in bacon and parsley. Serve hot.

Peel and seed the avocados and place them in a serving bowl. Sprinkle the lime juice and a little salt over the avocados and mash with a fork. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix gently until the guacamole is slightly chunky. Serve with tortilla chips or raw vegetables.

In a large bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients. Add the celery, scallion, parsley, avocado, and tomato. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide the mixture among four plates. Top with the shrimp. Garnish the salads with the red onion. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 425 F. Pat the chicken dry and sprinkle with the seasonings. In a small bowl combine the orange juice and cornstarch. Add the mustard and mix well. Place the chicken in a shallow baking pan. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve with the cooked rice and the sauce poured over it.
I made the orange sage sauce with a pork roast. It was really good.
I used the marinade for the Citrus Chili Chicken and my husband and I thought it was delicious.
I used the Maple Glazed Chicken for my chicken breasts. I added some brown sugar to the sauce. It was really good.
I made the Maple Glazed Chicken last night and it was delicious.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Slice the onions as thinly as possible. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring occasionally until caramelized. Remove the skillet from the heat. Cut the pork loins in half lengthwise. Sprinkle the loins with salt and pepper. Layer the onion slices on top of the loins. Wrap the loins in aluminum foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Unwrap the loins, increase the heat to 450 degrees. Baste the loins with the pan drippings. Cook for 5 minutes per side. Slice the loins on a diagonal and serve. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season fish with salt and pepper. Lay in a shallow baking dish. Add onion and garlic and saute until softened. Add wine. Stir in tomatoes. Add olives, chilies and pimentos. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake 20 minutes or until fish is cooked through. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine 1/4 cup of the orange juice, the orange rind, nutmeg, and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt in a small bowl. Cut the onions in half lengthwise. Arrange the fillets in a shallow baking dish. Brush the fillets with 1 tablespoon of the remaining 3/4 cup of the orange juice. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the orange-juice mixture. Bake the snapper uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup of the orange-juice mixture. Bake for about 5 minutes more. Serve the snapper with the remaining 1/4 cup of orange-juice mixture.

In medium sized mixing bowl combine 2 cups of flour with 1/4 cup of sugar. Add butter and work it in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add eggs, beaten, milk and salt. Work mixture until smooth, adding enough additional flour to make a firm dough. Divide dough into 15 parts and roll each part between palms of hands to form 3 balls about 1 inch in diameter. Place balls of dough on plum halves or slices of plums and fold dough over plums to form dumplings. Place dumplings on grease pan with sides or on a cookie sheet with sides. Bring to boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered 10 minutes or until dumplings float to surface. Remove from heat and drain well before serving. Drizzle with confectioners sugar or syrup if desired. Serves 6 to 8 as main dish or 12 as side dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Add creamed corn and mix well. Add wet ingredients and mix until well blended and smooth. Pour batter into a greased loaf pan or a greased muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees until browned on top and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve with butter and jam.

Heat the oven to 350f. Mix together the refried beans and taco seasoning. Pour half of the mixture into a greased baking dish. Top with half of the ground beef and sprinkle with half of the colby-monterey jack cheese. Repeat with the remaining mixture. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Top with the jalapeno and serve with tortilla chips.

Melt together the margarine and semi-sweet chocolate chips in a large saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and icing sugar. Quickly stir in the rice krispies until well-coated with fudge. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Refrigerate until firm. Break into pieces to serve.
Combine all in a casserole dish and bake uncovered at 350f for about one hour or until heated through. Serve hot.

In saucepan combine coffee, cinnamon and chocolate bar. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Remove from heatlet cool for about 5 minutes. Stir in milk, vanilla extract and salt. Chill thoroughly. Serve over ice with whipped topping and additional cinnamon for garnish.
I love my coffee, but I'm not sure what's so special about it that you can't just make it in your own kitchen? I've seen that in most cases it's really just more expensive coffee beans that make a difference. But if you love your coffee, I can see why you'd want to go out of your way to get your fix.
I have to admit that I've never been to Starbucks in my life!
I'm with you - I'm not sure why people go crazy about their coffee! I drink it everyday, but I wouldn't be so upset if I couldn't have it for one day!
I'm not a big fan of Starbucks (their prices are through the roof!) but I do like their holiday drinks!
I've

Preheat oven to 350. Cut 1/2 inch off top and bottom of each chicken breast. Flatten each breast to 1/4 inch thick. Combine Bisquick and milk. Add chicken and coat both sides. Fry in hot oil until lightly brown. Remove and drain on paper towel. Combine chicken and 1/4 cup of enchilada sauce in a 3 qt. baking dish. Add onion and corn and top with remaining sauce. Combine remaining Bisquick with 1/2 cup milk and pour over. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 35 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips and toppings of choice.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut the squash in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and scrape with a fork until strands are formed. Place cut side up on a baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile saute bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Beat egg substitute in a small bowl until frothy. Stir in milk and nutmeg. In a serving bowl toss together the squash, bacon bits, and egg mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a pitcher combine mint and 1/2 cup of lime juice. Add 3/4 cup of sugar and 3 cups water. Stir and let stand until flavors are infused, about 15 minutes. Add blueberries. Just before serving stir in 1 1/2 cups lemonade. Divide among 6 glasses. Add 2 oz. light rum and 1 oz. dark rum to each glass. Top with club soda. Serve with a sprig of mint and a slice of lime.

mix dry ingredients in 1 cup canning jar or other airtight container. When ready to make dip or salad dressing, combine 1 cup mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon dry mix. Whisk well. Serve with crackers or salads. Makes 2 cups dip or 1 cup salad dressing. Womans day home cooking around the world.
Parsley is an herb commonly used in Italian cooking and its flavor is often described as a mild mixture of celery and herbs. It is also used as a garnish on many Italian dishes. The herb is usually added at the end of the cooking process so its flavor and nutrients aren't destroyed by high heat. Parsley is a good source of vitamin C and vitamin K and is also an excellent source of vitamin A and folate.

Beat salt & pepper into the egg. Melt the butter in the pan on low-medium heat. Add the egg mixture. Cook the egg til it is the way you like it. Eat with a piece of the white bread. I like mine over easy or just barely done. I am not sure why you would want to cook the egg for more than 3 minutes. I like mine over easy or just barely done. I am not sure why you would want to cook the egg for more than 3 minutes. You would have to eat them really fast since the egg will start to get hard if you try to cook them for too long. I think this would be better eaten at room temperature. This is the best way to eat soft boiled eggs! It is so easy, so quick! If you don t like the taste of soft boiled eggs you need to try this way. You will love the taste of these boiled eggs.

In a large saucepan bring the cider, raspberry concentrate and sugar to a boil over high heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat, add the cinnamon stick, cover and steep for 30 minutes. Strain through a fine mesh sieve into mugs or a punch bowl. Garnish with whole raspberries or mint sprigs.

Cut up the apple and add to a mixing bowl. Add the peaches and pineapple. Add the orange juice concentrate, milk and pudding. Stir in the mandarin oranges. Chill thoroughly. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

In a heavy skillet heat the olive oil and saut the onions and chili peppers until softened. Stir in the rice. Slowly add the stock, stirring constantly. Bring to a boil and cover. Simmer for 25 to 30 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Stir in the baby spinach and cook just until tender. Stir in the yogurt and season with salt. Serve hot. Garnish with dill sprigs.

In a 3 quart saucepan, combine the margarine and the flour. Cook over low heat until brown. Add the tuna and the canned milk. Continue to cook and stir until the mixture is hot and smooth. Add the peas and the mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately over cooked egg noodles.

In a bowl combine key lime juice, 1/2 the tequila, cilantro leaves, lime juice, and chopped onion. Skewer 3-4 chicken breast halves onto each of 4 skewers. Place skewers onto a baking sheet or broiling pan. Pour the key lime mixture over the chicken. Broil until chicken is cooked through. Remove from broiler and brush with remaining tequila. Sprinkle with lime zest and serve.
Dip livers into beaten eggs. Coat lightly with flour. Brown lightly in hot oil. Remove from pan. Add oregano. Pour lemon juice over livers. Serve hot.

Place wings in a bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover wings with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours or until wings are tender. Place vegetable oil and unsalted butter in a pan and place over medium-high heat. Cook the wings until the skin is crisp and golden brown on each side. Drain the wings on paper towels. Combine the hot sauce and white vinegar and brush the wings with the mixture. Serve with blue cheese dressing for dipping.

Combine the milk, chocolate chips, and schnapps in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the chocolate is completely dissolved. Transfer to a large heatproof bowl or pitcher. Garnish each serving with a marshmallow. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease 2 9-inch round cake pans. In a large saucepan over low heat, combine the butter, sugar and water. Cook until mixture boils, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Whisk the egg yolks into the cooled mixture. Fold in the lemon juice, all-purpose flour and lemon zest. Divide evenly into the two cake pans. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. In the meantime, beat the egg whites on high speed until they form soft peaks. Add the 1/2 cup of sugar and beat until the egg whites are glossy and stiff. Remove the souffles from the oven and immediately spoon the egg whites over each one. Bake for 5-8 minutes longer or until the souffles are golden brown on top. Serve immediately while still warm with the sauce or whipped cream. To prepare the sauce, stir together the milk and cream with the lemon juice until blended. Season with the salt to

Brown the onion in butter until tender. In a large skillet, place the sliced sausage in the skillet with the onion and the rest of the ingredients except the water. Cook over medium heat until the liquid boils and the onion is soft. Stirring occasionally add the water until the mixture is smooth. Heat until the mixture boils then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over cooked noodles or rice.
Cook beef and drain fat. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Heat in microwave for a few minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the onion, celery, carrots and garlic cloves in the butter until tender. Stir in the flour. Gradually add the stock. Add the cheese and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Stirring frequently, cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the beer and heat to serving temperature. Serves 8.

Cook bacon in a skillet until crisp. Drain and crumble into small pieces. In a medium bowl, combine bacon, cheddar cheese and pimentos. Add mayonnaise and mix well. Add seasoning and mix again. Refrigerate overnight to blend flavors. Serve with crackers or celery sticks.

Melt the fat in a large frying pan and fry the onions until softened. Remove from heat. Season with salt, pepper and a little grated cheese. Place the fried onions in a greased baking dish. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Dot with butter. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the breadcrumbs are browned. Serve hot.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken halves and cook until done. Meanwhile combine water, seasoning mix and taco shells until soft and pliable. Roll out shells into circles. Spoon chicken mixture into each shell. Serve with sour cream and your favorite toppings.

Cook linguine according to package directions. Heat oil in a large non stick skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini. Cook 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in garlic. Cook 1 minute or until fragrant. Add broccoli, red pepper and chicken broth. Cook 4 minutes. Stir in linguine. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and hot pepper flakes. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan cheese.
I love this recipe for a light summery side dish. It's great with a hearty steak or chicken dish.
2. Dice zucchini into 1/2-inch pieces.
3. Combine zucchini and onion.
4. Place in a large mixing bowl.
5. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.
6. Mix well into zucchini.
7. Spread out evenly on a foil lined baking sheet.
8. Bake 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated through.
9. Remove from oven. Remove

Sift together the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Beat the shortening and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the beaten egg yolks. Add the boiling water. Beat for 2 minutes. Add the vanilla. Add the dry ingredients alternately with the buttermilk. Beat the egg whites stiff. Fold into the batter. Pour into 2 greased 9-inch round pans. Bake at 350 for about 25 minutes or until done. Cool in pans for 5 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool completely. Frost with chocolate icing.

Preheat the oven to 375. Lightly coat the pork with the oil. Sprinkle generously with the garlic powder. Mix in the dried rosemary. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Mix the white wine with the lemon juice in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the pork. Continue cooking in the preheated oven until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part registers 155 degrees F. Remove from the oven. Let the meat rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve the meat drizzled with the pan juices. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Mix vegetable broth with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the green beans on a rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with the broth mixture. Roast for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the remaining tablespoon of olive oil with the lemon juice. Season the slivered almonds with salt. Add the almonds to the broth mixture. Roast the almonds for 5 to 10 minutes, or until browned. Remove from the oven. Add the almonds to the baking sheet. Toss the broth mixture over the top. Sprinkle the green beans with the almonds. Serve warm.

Season fish with salt and pepper. Saute onion, mushrooms, zucchini and garlic until soft. Add tomato and simmer until liquid evaporates. Add fish. Simmer for a minute or two until fish is cooked through. Add white wine. Cover and bake at 350 until fish is done. This takes about 10-15 minutes. Add fresh herbs and lemon juice to taste. Serve with steamed rice or quinoa.

Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Butter one side of each slice of bread. Top one slice with ham and cheesetop with remaining bread. Cook until bottom is browned, about 3 minutes. Turn sandwich over and brush with mustard. Top with roasted red pepper. Cook until bottom is browned and cheese is melted, about 1 minute longer. Serve immediately.
