Wine Clubs in the South Bay
Happy New Year to all my South Bay Readers!
South Bay Restaurant Reviews

Preheat oven to 175 degrees celsius. Combine butter, sugar, egg and vanilla in a bowl and beat well. Stir in sifted dry ingredients then mix in sultanas, corn flakes and coconut. Mix in choc chips. Roll mixture into balls then place on baking trays lined with baking paper. Bake for about 25 minutes or until golden. Allow to cool on trays then store in an airtight container.

Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add kielbasa. Cook until browned. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise, egg, and pepper. Spread the mayonnaise mixture over the onion rolls. Top with the kielbasa, monterey jack cheese and pepper. Melt the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Place the sandwiches in the skillet and melt the butter. Top with sliced onions and serve.

Wash rice thoroughly until water runs clear. Soak glutinous rice for 3 hours or overnight in the coconut milk. Cook in a saucepan until the liquid is absorbed. Add the brown sugar, coconut cream, butter & vanilla extract. Cook for another 5-10 minutes or until the mixture thickens to your liking.

Mix together the flour, salt& pepper. Coat both sides of each breast in the flour mixture. Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the onions and cook until tender. Add the garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add the chicken. Brown on both sides. Pour in the wine& stock. Add the Marsala. Cook until the chicken is done.
Beat eggs lightly and combine with pumpkin, corn syrup, milk, and spices. Pour into pie crusts and bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Reduce heat and continue to bake until center is set. Serve chilled.

Brush the outside of the panini with pesto. Layer the mozzarella, parmesan and bell peppers on the panini. Drizzle the panini with olive oil. Close the sandwich. Brush the outside of the sandwich with pesto. Grill the sandwich until the mozzarella has melted. Serve hot.

Rinse the shrimp and pat dry with paper towels. Add the shrimp, salt and black pepper into the bowl of an electric mixer. Mix well for about 30 seconds. Heat the oil in a heavy based pan and add the shrimp and saute over medium heat for about 30 seconds or until opaque. Turn off the heat and set aside. Heat another pan with oil and saute the garlic until fragrant but not browned, then add the shrimp along with its cooking juices. Add in the dried chili and saute until fragrant. Pour in the wine, stir in the parsley and season with black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
name: prawns with chilli and garlicingredients: prawns, garlic, bay leaves, dried red chilies, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepperpreparation:Preheat a grill to moderate high. Place the prawns, bay leaves, chillies and garlic in one large or two medium sized oven proof serving dishes. Pour the olive oil over

Preheat oven to 350F. Spray 4 (8-ounce) ramekins with pam. Peel and slice russet potatoes 1/2 inch thick. In a large bowl, combine sliced potatoes with swiss cheese and green onions. Season with salt and pepper. Divide among prepared ramekins. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until potatoes are tender. In a small bowl, whisk together cream and flour until smooth. Stir in 1/2 cup of parmesan. Top individual gratins with mixture and bake 2 to 3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a jar and shake well. Slice tomatoes and combine with the rest of the vegetables. Drain the vegetables and pour the dressing over the vegetables. Refrigerate. Serve on lettuce leaves.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cover the potatoe s with chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until the potatoes are fork tender, about 15 minutes. Remove the cover and mash with a fork until the potatoe s are smooth. Stir the pesto sauce into the mashed potatoe s. Season with salt. Serve immediately.

Bring chicken stock to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Add brussels sprouts, butter and flourstir until flour is incorporated. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered for 30-40 minutes or until sprouts are very soft. Puree soup in a blender in batches until smooth. Return to pot and stir in milk, nutmeg, Tabasco and heavy cream. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 2 servings.

Cream cheese, butter, sugar, chocolate, and cool whip. Crush oreos in food processor. Place half of the crushed cookies in the bottom of a 10 inch springform pan. Spread half of the filling on top. Repeat.

Scald milk. Add brown sugar and bacon drippings. Cool to lukewarm. Dissolve yeast in water. Combine yeast mixture, eggs, and milk mixture. Sift flours together. Add to liquid mixture. Beat until smooth. Cover and let stand one hour or more in a warm place. Batter will be light and bubbly. Stir down batter. Bake on greased griddle.

Combine cereal and boiling water in a bowl and set aside for 5 minutes. Preheat oven to 350f. In another bowl whisk together yogurt, sugar substitute, banana and egg. In a third bowl combine flour, baking soda and salt. Mix the dry ingredients into the wet until just combined. Stir in the soaked cereal. Spoon batter into muffin cups or greased muffin pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool on a rack. Yields 12 muffins.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steak and cook for 4 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness. Remove from the heat and let stand 5 minutes. Combine the broth and wine in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add the mustard and stir well. Remove the mixture from the heat. Stir in the pepper. Serve the sauce with the steak.

Combine the coriander, sugar, chili powder, cumin and lime juice in a bowl. Add the salmon fillets and coat with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for about 3 hours. Drain the fish and reserve the marinade. Prepare a medium-hot charcoal or gas fire. Brush the salmon with the marinade and place it on a hot grill. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with the reserved marinade and the lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season the inside of the chickens with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the outside with salt and pepper. In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, honey and juice. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Stir in the tarragon and pour over the chickens. Bake the chickens for 45 minutes or until the juices run clear and the meat is no longer pink. Meanwhile, in a bowl combine the ricotta and olives. Serve the stuffing with the chickens.
Pour 1 shot of peppermint schnapps into a mug. Fill with black coffee, and then add 2 to 3 tablespoons of sugar. Stir well. Top with a dollop of whipped cream and a few chocolate shavings.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the onion and cook gently for 3 minutes. Add the courgettes and cook for 5 minutes until just tender. Add the garlic, and cook for 1 minute. Add the passata and stir to combine. Simmer gently for 3-4 minutes to reduce the sauce. Toss in the drained pasta, and sprinkle over the cheese. Serve immediately.
A great way to incorporate veggies into your pasta dish!
Though I wouldn't consider myself a veggie lover, I do enjoy the taste of some of them in my food. I find that using veggies in my cooking makes it more appealing to me. And this recipe has a lot going for it! I like the idea of using the tomato and courgette in a pasta. And I think the pine nuts add a bit of crunch. This recipe is simple to make.
I just tried this recipe last night. I thought it was pretty tasty. I would add a bit more of everything though. I thought there were too few courgettes in the reci

Boil the corn. Drain the corn, and set aside. Boil the potatoes. Drain the potatoes, and set aside. Remove the seeds from the green bell peppers, cut into small pieces. Chop the scallions into small pieces. In a mixing bowl, combine the sour cream with the hot chili pepper. Add the boiled corn. Add the chopped scallions, chopped green bell peppers, boiled potatoes and the lemon juice. Add the ground cumin. Mix well. Chill. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Follow package directions to prepare tart shell. In a medium bowl, combine the applesauce, apple juice concentrate, lemon juice concentrate, white sugar and cinnamon. Add the prepared crust and mix lightly to combine. Transfer to the baking dish and arrange the apple wedges on the filling evenly. Top with raisins. Dot the topping with the butter. Bake for 30-35 minutes until filling is bubbly and topping is golden brown. Cool on a wire rack for 1 hour before serving.

In a small pan over medium-high heat melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add 2 tablespoons white wine and cook until reduced to 1 tablespoon. Stir in 2 tablespoons Dijon and cook until reduced. Stir in 1 tablespoon of maple syrup and 1 teaspoon of black pepper. Pour over frozen Brussels sprouts and toss to coat. Bake at 375f for 30 minutes.

Boil water in a vessel. Add the whole squash to the boiling water. Let the squash cook for 10 minutes. Drain the water and keep it aside. Add ghee in a non stick pan. Fry cumin seed and let it crackle. Add the cooked squash with all the water it has. Add salt and all the spices. Cook for 2 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

Dry halibut fillets with a paper towel. Dust flour on both sides of each fillet. In a large skillet over medium heat, add olive oil and saute halibut for 3 minutes. Add water to cover halibut. Turn heat down to low. Add balsamic vinegar, dried rosemary, and crushed garlic. Cook for another 3 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

In a large bowl, toss the potatoes, brussels sprouts and shallots with the olive oil. Season with the salt and pepper. Spread evenly on a baking sheet. Roast for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the bacon and lemon zest. Continue roasting until the vegetables are tender and the bacon is crisp -- about another 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the lemon juice and more bacon, if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In small bowl, combine ketchup, chili sauce, cider vinegar, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar and garlic. Remove skin from chicken pieces if desired. Place chicken in shallow baking pan. Pour sauce over chicken. Bake in preheated oven for 45 to 50 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Serve warm. Makes about 4 cups.

Mix everything well in a large bowl. Pour into 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan which has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake in a 325 degree oven for about 40 minutes or until crisp and golden. Let cool in pan for about 1 hour. Cut into 1 inch squares and serve.

Mix all dry ingredients together sift with nutmeg and cinnamon add lemon juice and milk and beat til smooth add butter and cut to size of small peas. Pour into a greased pan with peaches on top. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes. Serves 6-8.
Peach recipes are easy to follow. Just follow the recipes and make the recipes at your own home without any hesitation.

In a 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Season the pork with hot pepper sauce. Brown the pork in the skillet. Remove from the skillet. In a medium bowl, combine the coconut milk, soy sauce and parsley. Pour the mixture over the pork. Arrange the pineapple tidbits on top. Bake in a 350-degree oven for 1 hour. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the goat cheese, scallions, italian seasoning, roasted red peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, fresh spinach and olive oilmix together well. With a sharp knife cut the center of the london broil at a 45 degree angle to form a pocketstuff the center with the goat cheese mixturefold the meat back over the filling and use the tip of the knife to seal the edges of the pocket shut. Place the stuffed london broil in a shallow roasting pan with the top of the meat facing upbake for approximately 1 hour or until the meat reaches 140 degrees f on a meat thermometer. Remove from the ovenlet rest for 10 minutes before carving the meat away from the bone to serve.

In a large bowl, whisk together 2 eggs & 1/2 cup milk. Beat until well blended. Slowly add 1 cup white sugar & 1/2 tsp salt, beating constantly. Beat until mixture is smooth & slightly frothy. Pour filling into tarts. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees celcius. Cool before serving.
I have tried a few of these recipes so far and they are awesome!!!!
I haven't tried any of these yet because I have a gluten intolerance. But I am definitely going to try them!
I'm going to try these!!

In a large crock pot combine the broth, soup and onion powder. Add the potatoes and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Stir in the chilies. Remove the potatoes and mash them. Mix the mashed potatoes back into the crock pot along with the cream cheese. Add the cheese. Mix the mixture together and cook for another 30 minutes. Top with the tortilla strips. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 5 minutes. Serves 6.
My first cookbook was the Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook. My mom gave it to me when I moved out on my own and I still use it. The only recipe I use from it is for fried chicken.
I had a recipe book that my mother in law gave me. The last time I looked in it was over 15 years ago and I just threw it away. I didn't even want to keep it because the recipes were so bad!
I'm going to go out on a limb and say my best cookbooks are all the ones I have written. The reason I think they are my best is

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Season chicken with seasoning. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in large frypan over medium high heat. Add chicken, cook for 2 minutes per side. Transfer to baking sheet. Drizzle with lemon juice, sprinkle with herbs. In same frypan, saute fruit for 2 minutes. Transfer to baking sheet. Bake until done, 30 minutes. Serve chicken with fruit.

Place pasta on to boil. Heat butter and garlic over medium heat, add prawns and cherry tomatoes. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Season with black pepper and lemon zest. Serve with the cooked pasta. Garnish with flat leaf parsley. Drizzle with a little more lemon.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly beat eggs in a medium bowl. Place flour in another medium bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Dip the fish into the eggs and then coat in the flour mixture. Place the coated pieces on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove to paper towel to drain, serve hot.
Recipe of the day for: fish

Combine first three ingredients in large bowllet stand for 2 minutes. Beat on low speed until smooth. Fold in half the whipped topping. Spread over cake in 13x9 pan. Top with remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until serving time. Sprinkle with candy bars. Serve with your favorite ice cream.

Bake pork chops in the oven at 350 for 20 minutes or so. Take the chops out of the oven and set on the stove top (if you have an electric stove that is). Add the onion to the drippings on the stove top and cook for about 3 minutes or so. Add the 2 soups to the onions and let it come to a boil. Pour the sauce over the pork chops and serve.

Peel and cut the potato into thin matchsticks. Peel the carrots and cut into thin matchsticks. Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the potato, carrots, and half the ginger. Cook until the potatoes are lightly browned. Add the remaining ginger and the green onion. Stir. Cook 2 minutes longer. Stir in the ponzu sauce. Cook for 2 minutes more. Serve.

Combine the garlic powder and seasoning salt. Rub the mixture evenly over the chicken pieces. Heat the oil in a skillet and brown the chicken on all sides. Place the chicken in a crock pot. In a bowl combine the spaghetti sauce mix and the white wine. Pour over the chicken. Cover and cook on high 4 to 5 hours or low 6 to 8 hours. 30 minutes before serving add the zucchini.

Sift together the dry items. In a mixing bowl, combine the molasses and milk and microwave for about 1 minute. Add the butter and vanilla. Add the dry items and mix well. Drop by teaspoon on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen.

Combine all sauce ingredients in a small sauce pan and simmer until thickened and reduced to 1/3 cup. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place salmon in an 8-inch square glass baking dish and brush with olive oil. Roast for 8 to 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. To serve, pour sauce over salmon and garnish with parsley.

Combine the buttermilk, cilantro, garlic, pepper and salt in a large bowl. Add the chicken legs and toss to coat. Let marinate in refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 190c. In a small bowl, combine the coconut and 1 tablespoon of water and set aside. Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake until cooked through and golden on top, about 45 minutes. In the final minutes of baking, toss the chicken legs in the coconut mixture to coat. Serve hot or room temperature.

Cook the carrots until tender and just beginning to lose their shape. Drain the cooking liquid and return the carrots to the pan. Add the butter, cream and brown sugar and toss until creamy and glazed. Season to taste with salt and pepper and garnish with chives.

Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place potatoes in the dish. Cook ground meat with taco seasoning mix and salsa until browned and seasoning mix is well distributed. Stir in water and warm. Spread meat over potatoes and top with cheese. Bake at 350f for one hour. Serves 10.
. I was going to make this in the morning and cook it later in the day. It says to bake for one hour. What do I do with it if it's not done in one hour?
I would like to know how long these should cook.
Hi there! I'm glad you liked the recipe. I'm not sure why your recipe is so runny...maybe too many eggs? I've used up to three whole eggs per pound of hashbrowns and it's been fine.
This is a great recipe. I use it all the time. I make it in the morning and bake it later in the day. I'm always looking for good recipes for using up leftover mashed potatoes. Any suggestions?

Cut the squash into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large saute pan over high heat. Add the squash and saute until browned on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes total. Transfer the squash to a serving plate and add the remaining 2 teaspoons of the oil to the pan. Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of the lemon juice and the basil and simmer for 2 minutes. Season with the sea salt. Pour the dressing over the squash and serve.

Make batter. In separate bowl, combine water and flour. Stir until smooth. Add 2 tbsp water at a time. If batter is too thick, add more water. Beat egg yolks. Add to batter and mix thoroughly. Beat egg whites until foamy. Add to batter and mix thoroughly. Beat batter until it becomes thick. Dip veggies in batter and drop in hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain and serve.

In a mixing bowl combine oats, brown sugar, corn syrup and butter until crumbly. Press into an 11 x 7 inch greased baking dish. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups of coconut. Bake 3-5 minutes more or until lightly browned. Spread with cherry pie filling. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of coconut and bake 3-5 minutes more or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack. Store tightly covered.

Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan and simmer over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Increase the heat to medium and boil until the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly.

Preheat oven to 325 deg f. Combine all ingredients except ricotta in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer. Blend well. Fold in ricotta with a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Place mixture in a greased 8 inch square pan and smooth top. Bake 30 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cool 5 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack to cool. Remove from pan. Cut into 8 slices. Makes 8 servings.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large pot, saute onion in olive oil until tender. Add chicken broth, diced tomatoes with juice, italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Add carrots and celery ribs. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add beans. Simmer another 20-30 minutes. Stir in pasta shells and heat through.
I am not sure why you would want to use a frozen spinach when you have fresh available but this is a good recipe for a quick soup.
Such a good and easy soup. I added fresh mushrooms to this soup as well. I would probably add a little more tomato next time as I didn't feel like there was enough.
This soup was really delicious and easy to make. I am going to make this again for my husband's work potluck.
I loved this soup. It was very easy to make and so good.

Combine the rice flour, water and baking powder together. Beat until the mixture is smooth. Add the salt and sugar. Pour the batter on a heated pan and cook on each side until crispy. Let cool before serving.

In a large skillet brown the chicken, onion, garlic and seasoning over medium heat until chicken is no longer pink inside and the onions are soft. Mix together the beaten egg, milk and flour in a large bowl. Add the chicken, onion mixture into the egg mixture along with the seasoning and stir to combine. Shape into small croquettes. Dip the croquettes into the egg mixture then roll into the bread crumb mixture. Place into hot oil and fry until golden brown. Remove from fryer and place onto paper towel lined plate to drain excess oil. Makes 12-15 croquettes.

Chop green onions. Cook bacon in skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Chop broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces. Toss broccoli, sunflower seeds, green onions, cashews and cranberries together in a large bowl. Mix together mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar and pepper. Toss broccoli mixture with dressing. Gently stir in crisp bacon and serve chilled or at room temperature.

In a large bowl, combine the salmon, mushrooms, breadcrumbs, egg, cheese and onion powder until well mixed. Add the lemon juice and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a greased 8 x 8-inch glass baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two loaf pans with cooking spray. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Mix in the egg yolks one at a time. Add in the mashed bananas and mix well. Add in the sour cream, vanilla, and baking soda and mix well. Sift together the dry ingredients (flour, cocoa powder, and salt) and mix well. Add the dry mixture into the wet mixture and mix just until combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour the batter evenly into the two loaf pans and bake for about one hour and ten minutes. Cool before removing from pan and enjoy!
I love this recipe. I make this often for breakfast or as a snack.
This recipe is absolutely delicious. I made this for my children and they loved it. I will definitely make it again and again.
I am so glad I found this recipe! This was very simple to make and the taste is out of this world! I can't wait for my daughter to come home from college so I can share this with her
In a bowl mix together grapes, blue cheese and walnuts. In a small bowl mix together honey, vinegar and oil. Pour dressing over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.

In saucepan, combine cocoa, sugar & hot water. Bring to a boil over medium heat & cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat & add vanilla. Refrigerate & freeze in ice cream maker according to manufacturer&aposs directions. Serve & enjoy!

In a large skillet cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain. In a medium bowl combine ricotta cheese and egg. Stir in the pasta. Add 1 1/2 cups of the sauce. Spoon into a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining sauce and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the Parsley. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Cut chicken breasts into 2 inch cubes. Combine the yogurt and curry powder and add the chicken. Marinate the chicken for 2 hours in the refrigerator. Place the chicken in an ovenproof casserole and add the vegetable stock cubes. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Add the carrots and the green chilies. Bake for another 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the coriander and the mint. Serve with steamed basmati rice.

Dissolve yeast with sugar and warm water for about 10 minutes in large mixing bowl. Add egg and beat until smooth. Add cinnamon, butter and vanillamix until smooth. Add salt and about 4 cups of the flour. Beat until smooth. Add remaining flour, 1 cup at a time, beating until smooth after each addition. Cover and let rise for 2 hours or until doubled in bulk. Heat oil in deep fryer to 375 degrees f. On lightly floured surface, roll dough to 1/4" thickness. Cut with donut cutters and fry 1-2 min or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Cool and serve or decorate as desired with icing or sprinkles.

First wash strawberries. Cut the tops of the strawberries then cut in half. In large bowl put strawberries with sugar and mash until desired consistency. Cut bananas in small pieces and add to strawberries. Stir gently. Place shortcakes and spoon berry mixture then add whipped cream. Serve immediately.

Cut bottom half off rolls and remove some bread to make room for filling. Combine dressing and mayonnaise. Dip top halves in dressing mixture and arrange meat in bottom halves in this order: meat, tomatoes and onion. Cover with slices of pepper jack cheese. Place top half on sandwich and cut in half diagonally. Bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 4 sandwiches.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil and butter and then saute onion until translucent. Add remaining ingredients and cook until heated through. Remove from heat and add turkey breast. Transfer mixture to crock pot and cook on high for 2-3 hours or low for 6-8 hours until turkey is cooked through. Serve on toasted bread or rolls.

In a large bowl combine the apple juice, lime juice, cornstarch, and bouillon cube. Stir until the cornstarch is dissolved. Add the chicken breast halves to the liquid mixture, making sure all pieces are well coated. Place the marinated chicken in a shallow baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes to an hour. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl combine onion, garlic and herbs. Add the merlot. Add the lamb chops to the bowl and turn to coat them. Let them marinate for a couple of hours. Prepare the grill to medium heat. Grill the meat for 3-5 minutes on each side. The meat is done when it is a dark pink inside. If you like the meat well done let it cook a little longer. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Slice potatoes 1/2 inch thick. Heat butter and 2 tablespoons sugar in a large skillet over medium heat until butter is melted. Add fennel seeds and allspice and cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Add potatoes and cook, stirring constantly until they are coated with sauce and heated through. Spread potatoes on baking sheet. Roast 20 minutes. Stir and roast 20 minutes more or until tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Combine water and chicken quarters in a pot. Bring to a boil and cook until chicken is tender. Remove chicken from broth and chop. Stir in cucumber and next 7 ingredients. Serve with rice.

Separate the croissants and remove the centers with a spoon or spoonula. Mix together the beaten eggs, half and half, milk, vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg. Arrange the croissants in a baking dish and pour the mixture over them. Bake in pre-heated oven for about 20 minutes or until the custard is set and the croissants are golden brown. Slice the peaches and sprinkle them over the top of the french toast. Place the baking dish under the broiler for about a minute or until the peaches are lightly browned. Serve with the honey nut cream cheese and butter.

In a large mixing bowl, combine cabbage and red bell peppers. Set aside. In the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade, process the jalapeno, cilantro and olive oil until smooth. Add the lime juice and cumin. Pour over the slaw. Toss gently.

Combine sugar & cold water in a 2-quart saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil over medium heatcook until syrup is deep amber & bubbling, stirring constantly to prevent crystallization, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat & stir in chocolate, butter & scotch. Add cream & stir until smooth. Serve fondue with poundcake & fruit. Makes 3 cups. Can be made 1 week aheadcover & refrigerate. Reheat fondue in a double boiler or microwave to a smooth consistency.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease a baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the apricot preserves with low sodium soy sauce and minced garlic. Remove woody ends of the asparagus. Lightly spray the bottoms of the asparagus with cooking spray. Place them cut side up on the baking sheet and pour the soy sauce mixture evenly over the spears. Roast for about 10 to 15 minutes or until the asparagus is crisp tender. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl mix all dry ingredients. Mix in starter and milk until dough comes together. Knead dough a few times on a lightly floured surface until it is a smooth dough. Divide dough in half. Roll each half out on a lightly floured surface to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut with biscuit cutter. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

Cook the pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and stir in the flour. Gradually add the milk to the mixture and cook until thickened. Stir in the cheddar cheese until it is completely blended. Add the cooked pasta and mix well. Transfer the mixture to a greased casserole dish and sprinkle the top with the crushed saltines. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree f oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until the top is browned and the mixture is bubbly. Serves 4 to 6.

In a heavy bottom pan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the red and yellow onions. Saute the onions until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Turn heat to low. Add the blue cheese. Saute until melted. Transfer to a bowl. In a large saute pan over high heat, heat oil until almost smoking. Sprinkle both sides of steaks with salt and pepper. Add to pan. Sear until browned on both sides. Transfer to a cutting board. Add the dijon mustard to the pan. Whisk until smooth. Add the steaks to the pan. Turn to coat. Return steaks to the cutting board. Top with the onion mixture. Slice steaks. Spread the bottom halves of the buns with mayonnaise. Place the steak slices on the buns. Top with lettuce. Add the top halves of the buns. Serve immediately.

Cut the string cheese into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Beat the egg and milk in a shallow bowl. Place the flour and bread crumbs in separate shallow bowls. Dip each slice of string cheese into the egg mixture. Coat with flour, then dip into the egg mixture again. Dip in the bread crumbs and shake off the excess. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Fry the mozzarella sticks, turning occasionally, until golden brown all over--about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Serve immediately.

Brown hamburger with onion and garlic in large skillet. Drain fat and stir in barbecue sauce and brown sugar. Heat until bubbly. Pour into 12 small muffin cups. Sprinkle each with cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven 10-15 minutes or until bubbly.

Place 1 cup of water and 1 tablespoon of oil in small pot over high heat and bring to a boil. Add couscous and stir until well coated and mixture boils again. Cover and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until garlic is golden (about 1 minute). Add hot sauce and stir well. Toss in parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut 6 slices of bacon into bits. Dip chicken parts in eggs& coat with seasoning mixture. Put in an oiled baking pan& bake uncovered at 350 for 15 minutes. Turn once& bake another 10 minutes or until done. Drain on paper towel. Sprinkle with bacon bits. Serve with mashed potatoes.
name: crispy chicken the best and easiestingredients: plain flour, salt, pepper, smoked paprika, garlic salt, chicken piecespreparation:Place flour, salt, pepper, paprika and garlic salt onto a plate and stir. Change the seasonings to your taste. Open out the chicken pieces and coat both sides with the flour mixture. Place coated chicken pieces onto a wire rack over a baking tray. Place into a medium oven. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn the pieces over. Bake for another 15 to 20 minutes until cooked and very crispy skinned. Yes, that is it. Now enjoy.
name: chicken in sour cre

Place breadcrumbs in a plastic bag. Add pesto, salt, pepper, garlic salt, italian seasoning, and parmesan. Shake bag until well blended. Dip each chicken breast in egg. Dip in bag mixture. Place in greased pan. Bake at 400f for one hour or until juices run clear. In the meantime, fry mushrooms in butter or cook in microwave. When cooked, place over chicken. Place a slice of provolone cheese on top of each cutlet. Melt in oven for approximately three minutes.

Heat oven to 450 degrees. Pat pork dry with paper towels. Rub with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake in a roasting pan for 20 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 degrees and bake for an additional 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove pork and let rest for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl stir together hoisin sauce and orange juice. Drizzle with broth and stir in toasted sesame oil. Slice pork and top with hoisin sauce. Serve with green onions.

Cut the avocado in half and remove the seed. Scoop the meat of the avocado into a bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork until it is creamy but not completely smooth. Add the salsa, garlic salt, and pepper. Mix thoroughly. Serve immediately with tostitos bite size rounds tortilla chips or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Sprinkle lamb with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bay leaf and lamb. Brown for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring to crumble. Add the cabbage and water, cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Remove the bay leaf and add the parsley, stirring to combine. Serve immediately with sour cream.

Combine all ingredients except chocolate and nuts. Stir well and press into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes at 375 degrees. Let cool for 20 minutes and then cut into bars. Drizzle with melted chocolate and sprinkle with nuts. Let set for 1 hour before cutting into bars. Store in refrigerator.

In a glass add the lime juice, rum, and simple syrup. Muddle the basil and lime juice together. Add the orange and ice cubes to the glass. Stir to combine. Top off with soda water and garnish with an orange wheel.

Cook carrot in sufficient water just to cover until tender-crisp. Drain. Remove from pan. Keep warm. In same pan, over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in brown sugar and mustard until combined. Stir in carrot. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until carrot are glazed. Sprinkle with parsley.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef, season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until browned. Remove meat to a plate. In the same skillet heat the remaining tablespoon olive oil. Add the onion and cook 2 minutes. Add the spaghetti sauce and stir to combine. Add the meat, spinach, cheese and pasta. Stir to combine. Spread into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the top with the mozzarella cheese. Bake the casserole 20-25 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a salad.
name: greek style ravioliingredients:frozen cheese raviolilean ground beefdiced tomatoes with basiloreganoand garlicbaby spinachsliced ripe olivesfeta cheesepreparation:cook ravioli according to package directions. meanwhilein a small skilletcook

In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, spinach, and parsley. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining ingredients. Add the dressing to the salad and toss well. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours.

Slice apples and place in a bowl with 2 tablespoons water. Microwave for 5 minutes or until apples are tender. Drain apples reserving the liquid. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add the red cabbage and continue sauteing for 2 minutes or until the cabbage is lightly browned. Add the apples, reserved liquid, vinegar, brown sugar and the reserved liquid from the apples. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes or until the apples are tender. Stir in the reserved liquid from the apples. Mix the cornstarch with 1 tablespoon water in a bowl. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the saucepan and bring the mixture to a boil over medium high heat. Cook for 1 minute or until the mixture is slightly thickened. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Serve with pork or poultry.

Cut the avocados lengthwise and remove the pit. Cut each half into 4 slices and place on a plate. In a small bowl mix together lime juice and olive oildrizzle over avocado slices and toss gently to coat. Top each slice with a few slices of ham and a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese. Toast bread on both sides. Spread both sides of each slice with a little softened butter or margarine. Place 4 slices of bread on a baking sheet and top with 1 slice of avocado and ham mixture and 1 slice of bread. Broil until ham is crisp and cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Combine meat and crumbs. Shape into small meatballs and place in a shallow baking pan. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meatballs. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

Cut tuna steaks into strips. Boil the noodles according to directions. Drain the noodles and toss with the tuna strips, wasabi paste, soy sauce and a squeeze of lemon. Divide between bowls. Top with scallions and arugula. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
Drain the sardines and chop fine. Combine with other ingredients in a small bowl. Chill for 2 hours or until well blended. Spread on toast points or crackers. Serve with carrot sticks.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add cornstarch. Stir until smooth. Return to medium heat and cook until mixture thickens. Season to taste. Serve immediately with cubed bread.

Combine milk and cornstarch in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat and cool. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into cooled mixture. Fold in the whipped cream, vanilla, and banana. Pour into pie shell and refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a small saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and cook over medium-high heat for 10 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes. Add the sausages and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the chives.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. In a large dutch oven over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onions and cook until golden, about 5 minutes. Add the sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add the parsnips and cook for 5 minutes. Add the beef and cook until browned all over. Add the tomatoes and juices and bring to a boil. Stir in the beef broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Transfer to the oven and cook for 2 1/2 hours. Stir in the fresh dill during the last 20 minutes of cooking. Serve with the fresh dill sprinkled over top.

In a bowl, combine butter, sugars, egg, vanilla, and peanut butter until blended. Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to the first mixture and mix well. Divide the dough in half. Press one half into the bottom of a greased 9-inch square pan. Place the peanut butter cups evenly over the dough. Cover with the remaining dough. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into 1-inch squares.

Cut avocados in half around the pit. Separate the halves. Pop out pit with spoon, then scoop flesh of avocados into a bowl. Squeeze the juice of a lemon over the avocados. Add the other ingredients to the bowl. Mash and mix the ingredients into a chunky dip using a fork. Serve with corn tortilla chips.
I have just recently started making my own guacamole. I used to love it when we went to a Mexican restaurant but I don't like to eat out as much anymore. My husband and I just love this dip. I had to go get the recipe after I tried it so I could share it with everyone.
The best guacamole I ever had was at a Mexican restaurant in Texas. I'm not sure if the recipe is the same but they were big fans of jalepeno peppers.
I was lucky enough to get to eat some real homemade guacamole in Mexico. I'm not sure what the secret is but I have never tasted anything that was better.
I love to make my own guacamole

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a 2-quart saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Continue to cook and stir 2 minutes or until thickened and slightly pasty. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer’s instructions. In a medium bowl, combine the next 7 ingredients and the cooled cornmeal mixture. Beat until smooth. Spray waffle iron with cooking spray. Spoon batter onto waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Repeat with remaining batter. Makes about 12 waffles

Combine water, sugar, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add flour and beat until mixture forms a ball. Add egg yolks and beat until well mixed. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold whites into mixture. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for several hours. In the meantime, heat oil to 350f in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pot. Fry 1/4 cup batter at a time until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with sugar immediately. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Combine cornstarch and lemon zest in a saucepan. Stir in the milk until smooth. Add the pears and cranberries. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Spoon the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pie crust. In another saucepan, mix the sugar and ginger. Stir in the lemon juice and cornstarch. Mix in the water and the dried cranberries. Cook and stir over medium heat until thick. Remove from heat. Pour the cranberry topping over the pear filling. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Combine granola cereal, chow mein noodles, salted peanuts, margarine, raisins, banana chips, apple chips, semi-sweet chocolate chips, mini marshmallows and cocoa mix together. Add more banana chips and raisins if you like a little fruit. Spread on wax paper until cool enough to handle. Remove from wax paper and put into plastic bags for storage.
Name: Mom's Meltaway Cookies Ingredients: 1 cup of walnuts 1 cup of coconut 1 cup of chocolate chips 2 cups of flour 1 cup of sugar 1 tsp of vanilla 1 tsp of baking soda 1 egg 1/2 cup of margarine 1/2 cup of white sugar Preparation: Cream together sugar, margarine and vanilla until light and fluffy. Add egg beaten with baking soda and mix well. Add nuts and coconut. Stir until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets

Mix all ingredients except nuts in medium bowl until smooth. Shape into 1 ball or 10 to 12 smaller balls or into desired shape. Roll balls in nuts. Cover and refrigerate 1 to 2 hours until serving time. Serve with crackers or assorted vegetables and celery sticks.

Combine chicken bones with 2 liters of water. Simmer for 2 hours. Add ginger, green onions, celery ribs, carrot, yellow onion, white peppercorns, szechwan pepper. Simmer 2 hours or more. Strain stock into bowl. Let cool. Use 1/2 of the stock to make chicken stock. Save remaining stock in fridge. When ready to use, add 1 tsp. of chicken stock to 8 cups of cold water. Add 1 tsp. of baking soda. Bring to boil. Turn off heat. Let sit 5 minutes. Strain. Store in fridge or freezer.

Rinse grapes and place in a serving bowl. Cut pear halves in half lengthwise. Place in same serving bowl. Slice each cream cheese slice into 20 small pieces. Arrange on grapes and pears. Mash together cream cheese, cream and seasonings until smooth. Spread mixture over grapes and pears and serve at once or refrigerate until serving time.

In a small bowl, combine dry ingredients (except cornmeal). Add milk and water, stirring well. Stir in butter. Add 1/2 cup of the flour to form soft dough. Add more flour as needed to make soft dough. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead lightly until smooth and elastic, about 1 minute. Coverlet rise in warm place until doubled, about 45 minutes. Punch down doughdivide into 6 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 7-inch circle on a lightly greased surface. Place each circle on a greased baking sheet, leaving about 1/2-inch between each circle. Coverlet rise until doubled, about 45 minutes. Bake at 400 for 18-20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 6 loaves.

Heat 1/2 cup margarine, stirring constantly, till melted and foamy. Remove from heat and stir in flour, then stir in chicken bouillon. Return to low heat and stir till thickened and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolk. Serve with vegetables or meat.

Wash and dry the tomatoes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper inside and out. Slice a thin slice off the bottom of each so they will stand on their own. In a small bowl mix together the sugar and thyme. Stir well and place 1-2 teaspoons in the cavity of each tomato. Place them on a cookie sheet in a single layer. Drizzle the olive oil over the tops of each tomato. Roast for 3-4 hours in a 250-300 degree oven. Check periodically to make sure the tomatoes are not sticking to the cookie sheet. Turn the tomatoes over and cook for another 1-2 hours until the skins are wrinkly and the insides are very soft. Serve at room temperature.

In a medium bowl, combine the butter, powdered sugar and cream cheese. Mix well and press into the bottom of an ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack.In a large bowl, combine the milk and the pudding mix. Beat for 2 minutes or until thickened. Beat in the cream cheese mixture. Spread over the crust. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or until ready to serve. Top with the Cool Whip and sprinkle with the miniature chips. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Slice mushrooms. Saute in oil until tender. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add nonfat dry milk powder. Add onion flakes and parsley flakes. Bring to a boil. Add flour. Add sherry wine. Stir. Add salt and pepper. Serve with green onion tops.

Mix all the marinade ingredients and marinate the fish for 15 minutes. Thread the pieces of fish on skewers and grill them. Serve with the salsa.
Mix all the salsa ingredients together and serve with the kebabs.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Line a baking sheet with foil. Whisk the yogurt with the garlic powder. In a shallow bowl or plate, combine the paprika, parsley flakes and soy sauce. Pound the chicken pieces until they are an even thickness. Dip the chicken in the yogurt mixture. Dip the yogurt coated chicken in the paprika mixture. Dip the yogurt coated chicken into the flour. Place the floured chicken pieces on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake until the chicken is golden and no longer pink in the middle about 45 minutes. Serve with your favorite side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Trim fat from bear steak and cut meat into strips about 1/2-inch thick. Crumble salt pork and place in baking dish with onions and tomatoes. Place steak strips over the top. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meat and vegetables. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Turn meat over and bake another 30 minutes longer. Serve on hot buns.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Saute garlic until soft. Add chicken and cook until browned. Drain fat. Add soup and water, stirring well. Heat to boiling. Spread half of the mixture in the bottom of a greased 2 quart casserole. Cover with half of the remaining mixture. Repeat layers. Top with remaining mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and bake uncovered for an additional 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Blend first five ingredients in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in the egg yolks until well blended. Pour into a 9 inch unbaked pie shell. Bake for 30 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake for another 20 to 25 minutes. Cool thoroughly on a wire rack. Sprinkle the top with the chopped pecans.
Slice each sandwich in half and place on a serving platter. Top with whipped cream and sliced bananas. Drizzle with the magic shell and sprinkle with nuts.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine eggs and onions in a bowl and set aside. Cook pasta until tender and drain. Combine egg mixture with cottage cheese and nutmeg in a bowl and mix well. In another bowl, combine spinach and salt. Heat spinach and water in a pan until spinach is thawed and wilted. In a large bowl combine cottage cheese mixture and spinach. Stuff pasta with cottage cheese mixture and place in a greased casserole dish. Top with spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Serve hot.

In a blender or food processor combine the pine nuts, basil, and spinach. Pulse until finely chopped. Add the garlic and pulse until well mixed. Add the lemon juice and a few tablespoons of the mineral water. Process until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the Parmesan and season with black pepper. Pulse until it is well blended. Add more mineral water if necessary. Pour into a jar or other container and store in the refrigerator. Makes about 1/2 cup of pesto.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a 9 x 13-inch baking pan. Combine cake mix, water, and oil. Mix on low for 30 seconds. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Meanwhile, combine pudding mix and milk. Beat with a whisk for 2 minutes. Spread over hot cake. Sprinkle with pecans and english toffee bits. Cool completely. Store at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top. Coat the rack with nonstick spray. Sprinkle cod on both sides with salt and pepper. Place on wire rack. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and sprinkle cheese evenly over the top. Bake for 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove from oven and drizzle with cream and remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Top with chives, if desired, then place under the broiler for 1-2 minutes to brown the top, watching carefully to prevent burning. Serve with tomatoes on the side.

Put 3 cups water and 1/3 cup honey into a small pot. Simmer 15 minutes. Meanwhile, split vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out seeds with the back of the knife. Add vanilla and nutmeg to pot. Simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat and strain into a large bowl. Stir in 1/4 cup brandy. Cool to room temperature. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Put 2 to 3 cinnamon sticks and 2 to 3 whole cloves into each small mug. Pour liqueur over top. Garnish with lemon zest.

In a 2-cup measuring cup combine warm water, yeast, and sugar. Set aside. In a small bowl combine mashed potatoes with heavy whipping cream. Set aside. Add bread flour to pan of bread machine. Add yeast mixture to pan. Select dough cycle. When cycle is complete, remove bread from pan. Cut bread into 4 equal pieces. On a clean surface, sprinkle bread with instant mashed potatoes. Sprinkle with onions. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 for 15 to 20 minutes.

Thaw lobster tails and cut in half. Place in 2 quart baking dish. In a medium saucepan combine the broth, cream, and white wine. Simmer until thick and smooth. In another saucepan, melt the unsalted butter. Add the flour and stir. Cook until smooth and thick. Add the white pepper and white wine. Cook for another minute or so. Stir in the heavy cream and cook until thick. Add the lobster broth. Stir in the lobster and the chives. Pour over the lobster in the baking dish. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Melt butter in a large sauce pan over medium heat. Add mozzarella. Stir until cheese is melting. Remove from heat. Add eggs and water. Stir until mixture is well combined. Add flour and cornstarch. Mix well. Add garlic salt and spices and mix thoroughly. Place mozzarella mixture in refrigerator. Mix panko and parmesan. Place in separate bowl. Remove mozzarella mixture from refrigerator and let stand for about 5 minutes or until it is easy to handle. Form mixture into small balls. Dip balls into flour mixture and then into panko mixture. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8 minutes or until crispy. Serve hot.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In a large saucepan melt butter and saute shallot until golden brown. Add bacon and cook 2 minutes more. Add rice and stir until well coated with fat. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the flame to low and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Season with salt and serve hot.
Blend yogurt and cream cheese until smooth. Mix in sugar and vanilla extract. Spoon into crust and freeze for atleast 4 hours. Top with fresh strawberries and serve immediately.

Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil. Add the potatoes and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes. Peel the potatoes and mash with a fork. In a bowl combine the mashed potato with the other ingredients. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Using a spoon or small icecream scoop, scoop the potato mix onto the pan and flatten slightly. Cook for about 2 minutes each side or until golden brown. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Serve hot or at room temperature with the sour cream.
Bacon Egg Potato Casserole Recipe
Mashed Potato Salad With Bacon And Eggs Recipe
Ham And Potato Casserole Recipe
Ham Potato Casserole Recipe
Potato Salad With Hard Boiled Eggs Recipe
Ham Potato Casserole Recipe Potato Casserole With Ham And Cheese Recipe Potato And Ham Casserole Recipe Potato Casserole With Ham And Che

Grease jelly roll pan. Beat eggs in large bowl until fluffy. Add brown sugar and beat until well blended. Add milk and beat again until well blended. Add flour and mix well. Add spices and beat again. Heat oven to 400f and melt butter in jelly roll pan. Spread batter in pan and sprinkle with apples. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown on top. Serve with syrup or honey.

Soak 3/4 cup shredded wheat for 1 hour. In large mixing bowl mix 3/4 cup warm water with 1/3 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons molasses. Sprinkle the fresh yeast cake on top of the liquid. Let sit for 5 minutes. Stir with wooden spoon until dissolved and foamy. In another medium sized mixing bowl combine 1 1/2 cups warm water with 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 cup molasses. Stir and let sit for 5 minutes. Dissolve the fresh yeast and stir it into the mixture with the wooden spoon for 3 minutes. Add the hot water and stir for 1 minute more. Add the remaining ingredients and stir for 1 minute more. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Form into a ball and place into a lightly oiled bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled size about 1 hour. Divide dough into 2 pieces and shape into round loaves. Place loaves into 2

Cook potato in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender. Drainreturn to the pot. Add the milk, butter, and garlic. Mash until smooth. Add the eggs and blend well. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Add the bacon and cook until crisp. Stir into the potato mixture. Heat the tortillas in a skillet over medium heat or in a microwave. Fill with the potato mixture and roll. Place the burritos in a greased 2-quart shallow baking dish. Cover with the enchilada sauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncovertop with the shredded cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more or until the cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces and place in a large bowl. In another bowl combine the zest, ginger, nutmeg, and pepper. Add the apple juice and mix well. Drain and rinse the potatoes. Pat dry and cut into 1-inch pieces. Pour the apple juice mixture over the potatoes and mix well. Place the potatoes and the chicken into a baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the chicken is done. Serves six.

Mix together first six ingredients in a bowl. Cut meat into 1/2 inch strips and place in bowl. Turn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator at least 1 hour. Drain beef and reserve marinade. Heat large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinade and broccoli. Bring to boil and cook 2 minutes. Add beef and toss to coat. Cook 5 minutes or until beef is no longer pink. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlicsaut 2 minutes. Add carrots and saut 5 minutes more. Add beans, cumin and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes or until beans are tender. Add more water if you prefer a thinner soup. Stir in parsley and serve.
name: creamy carrot puree
ingredients: carrots, garlic, chicken stock, salt, pepper, ground ginger, whipping cream, fresh parsley
preparation:Peel carrots and cut into coins. Put the carrots, garlic, stock, salt, pepper, and ginger in a pan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the carrots are tender, 25-30 minutes. Uncover and simmer until the liquid is evaportated, about 10 minutes more. Puree in a food processor. Add the cream and process until smooth. Transfer to a casserole dish. Cover and heat at

Cut pumpkin in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds and set aside. Cut flesh from rind, place in a large saucepan with butter, dried herbs, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Cover with water, bring to boil and simmer for about 30 minutes or until pumpkin is tender when pierced with a fork. Drain pumpkin, discard herbs and butter. Mash with a potato masher until smooth or place in a food processor and process to desired consistency. Stir in chicken stock, sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Serve warm or cold with butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine potatoes, zucchini, roasted garlic, onions and seasonings in large bowl. Add eggs and mix well. Add flour and mix until well blended. Divide batter into 6 small pie plates. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cut each kugel into 6 wedges. Return wedges to oven for 5 more minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Stir together soup mix, sour cream and mayo until well blended. Stir in spinach, water chestnuts and green onion. Spread tortillas with dip, not quite to the edges. Roll up tightly. Slice into 1-inch pieces. Arrange on serving platter and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Season the pork chops with the seasoning salt. Brown the pork chops in a skillet. Add the broth and the seasoning salt to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Add the green bell pepper and the pineapple tidbits. Cover the skillet. Reduce the heat and simmer for 25 minutes. Combine the ketchup with the white vinegar in a bowl. Add enough water to make 1 cup. Mix together the cornstarch with the cold water. Add the cornstarch mixture to the vinegar mixture. Stir over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Add this mixture to the skillet. Simmer for 1 minute. Serve over rice.
The most popular pork chop recipes of all time.

Combine dry ingredients. Add buttermilk and mix well. Spray bread pan. Pour into pan and smooth top. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 55 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on rack.
Mix the tuna, hard-boiled egg, red onions, and mayonnaise together in a small bowl until well blended. Add the celery seeds and mustard to taste. Chill until ready to serve.

Combine soup, cream, velveeta cheese in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add pasta shells. Boil 5 minutes. Stir in butter. Remove from heat. Add garlic powder and onion powder to taste. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serves 6.
name: italian meatballs with spaghettiingredients: ground beef, spaghetti noodles, onion, green bell pepper, celery, tomatoes, meatballs, italian seasoning, milk, mozzarella cheesepreparation:brown meat in skillet. drain grease. add onion, green bell pepper, celery. cook until tender. add tomatoes. bring to a boil. reduce heatsimmer 15 minutes. add meatballs. cover. cook 30 minutes. remove from heat. add milk. simmer 5 minutes. spoon over spaghetti noodles. top with mozzarella cheese. bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
name: turkey meatballs with

Slice tofu into 1/2 inch slices. Combine water, tamari soy sauce, molasses and star anise in a medium bowl. Dip each slice in mixture and place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with 5-spice powder. Bake 30 minutes. Turn over, sprinkle other side with 5-spice and bake another 30 minutes.

Combine first 3 ingredientsrub onto both sides of chicken. Place onto a greased broiler pan. Broil 4-5 inches from the heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until done. Drizzle with lemon juice and garnish with lemon slice.
i need a recipe for a good chili recipe. it doesn’t matter if it has beans or not.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Place fish on foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together the olive oil, vinegar, mustard, paprika and pepper. Pour mixture over fish. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily.

Cook kumara with margarine in saucepan of boiling water until tender. Drain well. Mash kumara with milk and butter or margarine. Heat oil in a large non-stick pan over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic for 5 minutes. Add lamb and cook for about 10 minutes. Add zucchini and squash and cook for 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for a further 5 minutes. Serve lamb and vegetables with kumara and garnish with parsley.

Place the potatoes in a bowl. Pour the olive oil and spices over them and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spread the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, to make the dip: In a food processor combine the avocados, sour cream, lime juice and cilantro. Puree until smooth. Serve the dip with the potatoes and serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil. Stir in couscous. Reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes. Add scallions and plums. Stir gently and continue to cook for 5 minutes or until couscous is tender and water is absorbed. Turn off heat. Stir in goat cheese and mint. Drizzle with honey and balsamic vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm or cold.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the cooking oil. Sprinkle the pork chops with the salt. Add the pork to the skillet. Cook the chops, turning once or twice, until well browned. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the green pepper and cook until crisp-tender. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook over low heat until heated through.

Cream the butter, brown sugar, egg and milk. Add the dry ingredients. Mix in the oats. Stir in the raisins and peanuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes.
The other day i made these delicious oatmeal bars.
It is a recipe i got from my sister.
They are so good. So much so that i wanted to share them with you.
They are so moist and chewy.
If you try them let me know what you think.
Mix the first 7 ingredients together until crumbly.
Spread half the mixture into a lightly greased 13x9 inch pan.
Spread apple butter on top.
Cover with remaining crumb mixture.
Cool and cut into squares.
This is a recipe i have been wanting to try for a while now.
I made them yesterday for a luncheon i was attending.
They were so good. So much so that i wanted to share them with you.
They are so

Cut the potato into quarters or sixths so they are about 1 to 2 inches wide. Heat the oven to 400 degrees F and arrange the potato pieces on a baking sheet. Drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with the herbs, black pepper and salt. Toss to coat and spread the potatoes evenly on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until the potatoes are crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve within three days.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushroom caps and cook until they begin to brown. Sprinkle with flour and stir for 1 to 2 minutes. Add thyme. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and apple cider vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper and gently reheat over medium-low heat.

Microwave a tortilla for about 4 seconds on each side to soften it up a little and make it easier to roll up. Spread with a little bit of softened butter then sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar and roll up the burrito style. Wrap in foil and place on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 for about 20 minutes until it starts getting crispy. Remove from the oven and let cool for a minute or two then unwrap and enjoy while it is still warm. To make the icing whip together some cool whip and honey until smooth. Drizzle it over the top of the tortilla and add chocolate chips for garnish. Enjoy!
Brown meat in a skillet. Drain fat. Add can of soup mix and can of diced tomatoes with juice. Stir well. Add macaroni. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until noodles are tender.

Combine first four ingredients in medium bowl until blended. Stir in chili powder and baking soda. Stir in remaining ingredients until blended. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 6-7 minutes or until puffed and set. Cool for 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheet and place on cooling rack. Cool completely. Makes 4 dozen bites

Boil cauliflower florets for 30 minutes. Drain. Add the oil and garlic. Saute for 5 minutes. Add cauliflower florets. Saute for 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Add 2 cups hot cooked pasta. Mix. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper.
These are just a few of the many recipes that use crushed red pepper. You can easily make your own or buy it in a bottle at the supermarket. Either way, it is a versatile seasoning that can add flavor to a variety of foods.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Halve the english muffins and lay them in a 13 by 9 baking pan. In a small bowl combine the eggs and the cream. Season with worcestershire sauce and pepper. Spoon the filling over the halved english muffin halves. Top with the ham and then the cheddar. Bake the sandwiches until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet cook the onion in butter until tender. Stir in barley and cranberries. Add broth and cook over low heat for 30 to 40 minutes. Stir in almonds and sage. Cook for 5 minutes longer. Heat the oven to 350F. Spray a 13 x 9 baking dish with cooking spray. Spoon the barley mixture in the baking pan. Lay the turkey breast over the barley mixture. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Combine the parsley and garlic pepper seasoning. Spoon the mixture over the turkey. Bake 5 minutes longer.
Bring stock to a boil. Add bok choy and carrot and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Divide stock among bowls and top with wontons. Top with sesame oil, white pepper, and salt to taste.

In a 9x13 dish or casserole, layer the potatoes. Then add a layer of cheese. Sprinkle a little bit of salsa on top. Repeat the layers. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven and top with a final layer of cheese. Return to oven and broil on high for 2 to 3 minutes. Serve hot.
Beat together cream cheese, eggs, sugar, and vanilla until well blended. Add Frangelico and blend well. Pour into prepared pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Combine ground chicken, dry breadcrumbs, egg, lemon juice, sun-dried tomatoes, basil, oregano, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Divide mixture into four parts. Form each portion into a thin patty about 3 inches in diameter. Place patties in the oven for about 15 minutes or until cooked through. Top each patty with feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Mix together first six ingredients until smooth. Pour into a premade pie shell. Bake for 1 hour. Mix together flour and water until smooth. Pour over hot pie. Bake for another hour. Cool. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve with whipped cream.

Cook the ground beef and pork until completely done. Drain fat. Add the other ingredients and simmer until thick. Remove from heat and add cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Top with fresh parsley and serve.

Pre heat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Beat together 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 cup margarine until smooth. Add one egg at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla extract. In a seperate bowl combine the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt). Stir in the dry ingredients to the beaten mixture alternately with the sour cream and the cream cheese, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Stir in the nuts. Spoon into the loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour or until the cake pulls away from the sides of the pan. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out on a wire rack to cool completely.

Mix together the butter and sugar in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time and then the vanilla. Combine the dry ingredients and mix in the wet mixture until well blended. Use a small ice cream scoop to drop the dough onto parchment paper lined baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes. Let cool and dust with powdered sugar.

Combine all ingredients except rum& butter in saucepan. Bring just to boiling. Remove from the heat. Pour into warmed mugs. Place a pat of butter on top of each serving. Serve immediately.
