I’ve been wanting to make some homemade hot chocolate. Yours sounds delicious!
I would love the hot chocolate!
I love the sound of the hot chocolate

Rinse and pat dry the racks of ribs. Spread evenly on a foil lined baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Combine all the spices in a small bowl. Rub spices evenly onto both sides of each rack of ribs. Wrap each rack of ribs in foil and bake for 3 hours. Remove and let rest for 5 minutes. Cut each rack into 2-inch pieces.
Grate the cucumber. Place into a large bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and toss. Serve immediately or chill for a few hours. Sprinkle with roasted peanuts just before serving.

Beat together coconut, sugar, eggs, vanilla until well blended. Add hot milk gradually. Pour into a buttered custard cup or individual cups. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until firm in center. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine feta and ricotta. Combine cream cheese and egg. Lightly butter phyllo dough squares. Spoon 1 tablespoon of filling on each square. Fold sides in and then roll to make triangles. Cut the triangles into strips. Place on an ungreased pan. Sprinkle with a little extra feta and bake until golden brown. Serve warm.
Name: Breakfast Casserole With A Biscuit Crust
Biscuit dough, Sausage, Mozzarella Cheese, Eggs, Milk, Salt, Pepper
Ingredient keywords: biscuit
Name: Jane And Michael Stern S Broccoli Casserole
White Bread, Eggs, Milk, Butter, Cheddar Cheese, Salt, Sugar, Broccoli
Name: Cheesiest Macaroni And Cheese
Macaroni, Milk, Cheddar Cheese, Mozzarella Cheese, Flour, Butter, Onion, Salt and Pepper
Ingredient keywords: cheddar
In a medium bowl combine apples, celery and grapes. In a separate bowl combine mayonnaise and lemon yogurt and mix well. Gently fold into fruit mixture. Garnish with kiwi fruits and walnut pieces.

Cook spinach in 1 tablespoon water in 8 inch skillet over med high heat until wilted. Drain well. Crumble into a large mixing bowl. Beat the egg in another large mixing bowl. Combine the two mixtures and stir in the basil, oregano, cheese and salt and pepper to taste. Roll dough out on lightly floured surface to desired thickness. Sprinkle remaining mozzarella cheese on top. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven for 20 to 25 minutes.

Dissolve yeast in warm water and leave for a few minutes to froth. In a large bowl combine the yeast water with the rest of the liquid. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes. Form into a loaf and place in a greased bowl. Cover and leave in a warm place to rise for about 45 minutes. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for about 30 minutes. Makes 1 loaf.
Mix together all ingredients except meat. Add to crock pot. Cover. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove meat from crock pot, allowing juices to thicken. Remove meat to a platter. Serve with rice.

Soak the dates in boiling water until tender. Drain and cut lengthwise in half. Remove pits and stuff with filling. Coat each date with ground almonds and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Yield: 24 servings.

Place broth in a large stock pot and bring to a boil. Add the chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper. Reduce the heat and simmer until the breasts are fully cooked and tender. Remove the breasts from the pot and shred with a fork. Add the pasta to the broth and cook until done. Add the vegetables to the pot and cook until soft. Add the chicken back to the soup and add the garlic and the salsa. Add the cayenne pepper to taste. Serve in bowls with grated cheese.

In a Dutch oven, saute onion and garlic until soft. Add the carrots and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the beans and the broth and simmer for about 25 minutes. Add the stewed tomatoes and cook for 5 more minutes. Season with oregano and cayenne. Serve over cooked couscous or rice. Makes 4 servings.
In small bowl combine tomato, onion, cilantro and lime. Refrigerate at least 30 min. To blend flavors. Salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips or vegetables. Makes 10 servings.

Cut the top off the pepper and remove the seeds. Set aside. Mix the remaining stuffing ingredients in a mixing bowl. Season with more pepper if desired. Stuff the mixture into the bell pepper. Set the lid aside. Heat a little olive oil in a large non stick frypan. Add the stuffed peppers. Brown the peppers on all sides. Add the reserved top. Cover with a lid and cook for 5 minutes over a low heat. Check to see if the mixture is cooked through. If not cook for an additional 5 minutes. Serve the peppers hot or cold.

Combine cabbage and seasoning in a large bowl and chill. In another bowl combine dressing and set aside. Melt butter in skillet and add ramen noodles and onion. Saute until crisp and golden. Drain and cool. Add to slaw mixture. Refrigerate for a few hours before serving. Garnish with additional almonds and parsley.

Combine biscuits and hazelnuts in food processor. Process until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Transfer to bowl and add almonds, rice flour, nutella and hazelnuts. Stir until mixture forms into dough. Divide dough into 15 portions. With wet fingers roll each portion into ball. Roll each ball in hazelnuts then roll again in dark chocolate. Dip in frangelico. Let stand until chocolate hardens.
1. In a saucepan, combine water and pineapple juice. Bring to a boil and then add cranberries.
2. Cook for 5 minutes on medium-low heat.
3. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract and salt.
4. Serve warm or refrigerate for later.
1. In a small saucepan, combine water and pineapple juice. Bring to a boil and add cranberries.
3. Place in a small bowl or cup and serve warm.
1. In a saucepan combine water and pineapple juice. Bring to a boil then add c

Bring the water to a boil and add the margarine, rice and dry onion soup mix. Simmer until the mixture is tender and the water is absorbed. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brown the center-cut pork chops in a skillet and place them in the bottom of a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Cover the chops with the rice mixture and sprinkle with the sherry. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the pork is done.

In a skillet over medium heat combine 2 cups water and 1 tablespoon salt. Add rice and cook according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a separate skillet cook the peppers and onion in a small amount of oil until tender. In a large bowl combine rice, peppers and onion and shredded chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet and place a flour tortilla in the oil. Cover and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain and place the tortillas on a plate. Spoon the chicken mixture onto the tortillas and top with shredded cheese. Fold over and place the chimichangas in a greased shallow baking dish. Cover and bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 minutes longer or until heated through and the cheese is melted. Serve with picante sauce.

Dissolve cherry gelatin in the boiling water. Stir in the milk and the pudding mix. Stir in the cool whip. Pour into an ungreased 9 by 13 inch pan. Chill until firm. Cut into desired shapes. Melt the almond bark and dip the cutouts into it. Sprinkle with the coconut. Refrigerate until set.

In a bowl, combine the wine vinegar, sesame oil and lemon juice. In a small jar with a lid, combine the salt and pepper and shake well. Add to the bowl with the vinegar mixture. Add the sugar and garlic powder and blend well. Pour into a plastic bottle with a cap. Add the cap and shake well to blend. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place chops in a 10 inch cast iron skillet. In a small bowl combine the butter, bacon, sauerkraut, onions and garlic clove. Spoon over chops and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Pour over beer. Cover skillet tightly with foil. Bake for 1-1/4 hours. Uncoverstir. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes longer or until pork is tender. Yield: 4-6 servings.

Season the fish lightly and dredge in seasoning salt. Dip the fish into the egg yolks and then into the flour. Fry in the butter until golden brown. Remove the fish from the skillet and pour the butter off of the pan. Add the lemon rind and the parsley. Mix in the egg whites and heat until thickened. Serve the souffle on top of the fish.

Cut the kefalotyri into 1/4 inch slices. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the kefalotyri slices and cook until the slices begin to brown and the cheese begins to sizzle and brown. Remove from the heat. Squeeze the lemon juice over the sizzling cheese and sprinkle the salt over the top. Serve hot with a piece of toasted french bread.

In a small bowl combine garlic with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and spread the mixture on both sides of lamb chops. Marinate for 1 hour. Combine the honey and balsamic vinegar in a small bowl and set aside. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over high heat. Sear the lamb for 2 minutes on each side. Remove from the pan and brush with the honey mixture. Return the lamb to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Prepare and cook hash browns according to package directions. In a large bowl combine sour cream, soup, butter and onion. Add hash browns and cheese. Pour into a greased and floured 13x9 inch baking dish. Mix the Rice Krispies and melted butter. Sprinkle over the top. Bake at 400 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.
Place chops into crock pot. Add water and soup mix. Add sliced onion on top. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9 inch square baking pan with cooking spray, or rub with 1 tablespoon of butter. Cut each biscuit into quarters and place in bottom of baking pan in a single layer. In a small bowl, combine garlic, butter and mozzarella cheese. Spread evenly over top of biscuits. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove foil and bake an additional 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown and thoroughly baked. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into 12 squares.

Preheat grill. Mix together the yogurt, honey and a few pinches of cinnamon. Arrange the figs on the grill. Drizzle with a little light olive oil. Grill the figs until lightly marked. Serve each grilled fig with a dollop of the yogurt mixture. Sprinkle with a little honey and a few chopped hazelnuts.

Place sliced peaches in an 8 inch square pan. Mix together all dry ingredients. Mix in butter. Spread over top of peaches. Bake at 425 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 400 degrees and continue baking until golden. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Cook fettuccine as directed on package. Add peas and onion during last few minutes of cooking. Drain and set aside in shallow bowl. Melt butter in skillet. Add onion and cook about 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in heavy cream and cook until boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add ham and peas. Pour over pasta and mix well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Place graham crackers in a food processor and process until it resembles fine crumbs. Add the margarine and process for about 2 minutes until it is moistened and resembles wet sand. Press into the bottom of a 9x11 baking dish and set aside. In a large bowl mix together the cream cheese and sugar until fluffy and well combined. Add the gelatin and mix until it is well blended. Add the milk and syrup and mix until everything is well combined. Gently fold in the whipped cream and pour it over the prepared crust. Gently fold in the blueberries and spread out evenly over the filling. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until well set up. Garnish with fresh blueberries before serving if desired.
Brew espresso in espresso machine. Heat milk in microwave or on stove. Add syrup. Pour espresso into mug, fill half with steamed milk. Sprinkle with cocoa. Serves 1

Preheat the oven to 400-degrees. Cut the top off each bell pepper. Remove the seeds and membrane. Fill the peppers with the olive oil and season with the hot sauce and worcestershire sauce. Roast on a baking sheet until the skins are blistered and the peppers are tender, 30 to 40 minutes. Let the peppers cool and then cut them into 1-inch strips. In a bowl, toss together the bell peppers, vinegar, and garlic. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, sprinkle the feta cheese over the salad and toss gently.
This recipe is a favorite of my husband and I. It's so easy to make and very flavorful. The kids love it too!
This recipe is a great example of a simple recipe that can be made so much better with a little bit of effort. I started with a pork chop recipe that was not very flavorful, and added a little bit of this and a little bit of that. The result was a flav

Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Add butter to pan. When butter is melted add garlic and parsley. Saute until fragrant. Add bread to pan and toast until crisp. Meanwhile, grate cheeses and melt them together in a microwave. When bread is toasted, place in pan and top with cheeses. Bake in 350 degree f oven until cheeses begin to melt. Cut into triangles.

Combine dry ingredients. Add the shortening. Mix well. Add the milk. Spoon the batter into the Easy Bake oven wells. Bake according to the instructions that come with the oven. It will take between 15-20 minutes. I usually check it at the 15 minute mark. Bake until the toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool before removing from the pan. If you want to frost these, you could use a frosting that is made of just milk or cream (no butter or powdered sugar) or you could use chocolate frosting. These are very easy to make and very good. I think the kids would like to make their own desserts this way. It is also fun to decorate the tops with candies. I hope you like this one.

Combine water, lemon juice and sugar in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in half-and-half. Cool and strain the syrup through a cheesecloth-lined sieve into a large bowl. Stir in the crushed pineapple and refrigerate the mixture for 3 hours or until cold. Beat the cream until thick and fold into the fruit mixture. Pour into a freezer-safe bowl and freeze overnight or until firm. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 10 inch tube pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the butter, light brown sugar and peaches and toss to coat. Spoon into the bottom of the prepared pan. Combine the cake mix and the pudding and pour over the peaches. Bake 50-60 minutes or until done. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan. Invert the pan onto a plate and allow to cool completely. Drizzle the top with a little sour cream and sprinkle with chopped pecans.

Place acorn halves cut-side up in baking pan. Add 1/4 inch water. Bake in 375 degree oven for 50-60 minutes. Remove from oven. Pour 1/2 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon flour into each acorn half. Return to oven until topping is golden brown. Meanwhile, prepare filling. Combine remaining 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and orange rind. Add nuts. Spread filling into each acorn half. Return to oven for 25-30 minutes or until filling is hot.

In a large skillet, brown the turkey kielbasa. In a dutch oven, brown the onion, green pepper and celery. Add the rice and cajun seasoning. Add the turkey kielbasa and bay leaf and cover with water. Add the stewed tomatoes and the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook uncovered for 25 minutes. Remove the bay leaf and serve.

I have this cookbook. I love it.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. In a large, deep skillet over medium heat, warm the oil, then add the onion and chiles with a pinch each of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 8 minutes. Add the zucchini, oregano, and a pinch more salt and peppercook until the zucchini is tender, about 5 minutes more. Stir in the grape tomatoescook until the liquid has evaporated and the tomatoes are tender, about 3 minutes more. Stir in the pasta. Sprinkle with the cheese before serving.
name: penne with chicken liversingredients: penne pasta, chicken livers, butter, heavy cream, dry white wine, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, parmesan cheesepreparation:In a 4-quart saucepan, melt the butter over moderate heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute more. Stir in the chicken li
Boil potatoes. Let cool. Mix together sour cream, mayo, dill, salt and pepper. Add in chives. Mix in cooled potatoes. Refrigerate overnight. Serve.

Bake chicken breast in preheated oven at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes. Cool and chop into bite size pieces. In a bowl combine chicken, neufchatel cheese, onions, dry sherry, mayo, lemon juice, hot sauce and nutmeg. Season with paprika to taste. Serve with crackers or toast points. Makes about 2 cups.

Place pine nuts and 2 tablespoons of olive oil in small saute pan. Cook over medium heat until pine nuts are toasted. In a large saucepan of boiling water, cook asparagus until crisp-tender. Drain and cool under cold running water. Peel off skin and cut into 2-inch lengths. Cook pasta in large saucepan of boiling water until tender but firm to bite. Drain. In large bowl combine pasta and asparagus. Add remaining 1/2 cup olive oil, garlic, and pine nuts. Toss well. Add lemon juice and season with lemon-pepper seasoning and coarse salt to taste. Toss well to combine. Serve immediately.

Bake first layer. Prepare second layer and spread over the baked layer. Prepare third layer. Spread over the second layer. Cut candy bars in half. Spread over the third layer. Refrigerate. Garnish with powdered sugar.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in parsley. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Arrange 4 slices bacon in a single layer in a 9x13-inch pan. Spread half of meat mixture over bacon. Place remaining 4 slices bacon over meat mixture. Spoon remaining meat mixture over top of baconspread evenly. Cover with foil. Bake for 40 minutes. Uncoverbake 10 minutes or until done. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut crosswise into 4 equal slicesserve with sauce. To prepare sauce, combine all ingredients in a small bowlstir well. Makes 4 servings.

Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Place one tortilla flat on the cookie sheet and spoon some of the refried beans on top. Sprinkle onion over the top of the beans then add cheese. Fold the sides in then roll the tortilla up. Place on cookie sheet seam side down and repeat for the rest of the tortillas. Bake for about 1015 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with taco sauce or salsa.

Cut zucchini and yellow squash into thin rounds. Mix with the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese and seasonings. Add the eggs and stir until well combined. Let the mixture stand for about 15 minutes. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Drop the mixture by heaping tablespoons and cook until golden brown on each side.
name: breaded n baked zucchini chipsingredients: zucchini, egg, milk, garlic, italian breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley, black pepperpreparation:Preheat oven to 450. Combine egg, milk and garlic in a shallow dish and set aside for about 15 minutes to let flavors combine. Combine breadcrumbs, cheese, parsley and pepper in another shallow dish. Dip zucchini slices into egg mixture, then into crumbs and place on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for 10 minutes, then turn over and bake

In a large mixing bowl combine all of the above ingredients and blend well. Line a 9x13 inch baking dish with aluminum foil and coat with cooking spray. Divide the mixture evenly in the dish, pressing down with your fingers. Bake for about 1 hour or until done. Cool for about 15 minutes before serving.

In a 2-quart casserole dish or freezer bag brown the hamburger and add the onion and garlic. Cook until done. Add tomato soup and tomato sauce, bring to a boil. Add the cream of chicken soup. Stir until well blended. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Add the egg noodles. Cook until done. Remove from heat and add the cheddar cheese. Mix well. Cook in a 375 degree oven for 20 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. In a bowl, combine the kosher salt and black pepperrub over both sides of the pork. Sprinkle with the onion powder, garlic powder, thyme, and ginger. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and place the roast in a slow cooker. Stir the pineapple chunks and juice, the soy sauce, and cranberries togetherpour over the roast. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Turn the roast and the sauce over and continue cooking for another 4 hours. Transfer the roast to a cutting board and let stand for 10 minutes before carving and serving.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add ramen noodles and cook per package instructions. Drain the water and set the noodles aside. In a separate pot bring the water to a boil once again and add the bread to the water. Boil for 3-5 minutes and remove from heat. Drain the water and set aside the bread cubes. Combine the ketchup and american cheese in a small bowl and microwave on high for 30 seconds. Serve the noodles in bowls with the ketchup and american cheese on top. Enjoy!
The best way to describe this is it is like a mac and cheese with ramen noodles instead of elbow macaroni. It is quick and easy. You don’t even need to boil the noodles!
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the broccoli florets and boil for 4 minutes. Drain the water and set the broccoli aside.
In a large bowl combine the cheese sauce and the broccoli. Add the broccoli and cheese mixture into a

In a medium saucepan, combine all but the greens. Heat to boiling and simmer over medium-low heat for 45 minutes. Add collard greens and cook 10 minutes more. Toss in salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Cream together the butter and sugars. Beat in the eggs and vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Mix the dry ingredients into the wet. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop the cookie dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on the cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Then transfer to a wire rack and cool completely. Store in an airtight container for 1 week.

Mix all ingredients except the beets and onions into a well-seasoned hamburger. Shape into balls (about 2 inches in diameter) and flatten into patties. Fry them in lots of butter. Serve on toast or in a bun with fried potatoes or mashed potatoes as a side dish. You can also put a fried egg on top of the hamburgers.

Place pork chops into a 9X13 casserole dish. Mix together the soup and milk into a bowl. Pour over pork chops. Bake for 1 hour at 325 degrees. Bake for another 10 minutes uncovered to brown. Serve over rice or noodles if desired.

Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the onion in hot oil until tender. Add the chorizo and cook for 3 minutes. Add eggs and cook until just set. Stir in the half-and-half. Season to taste with oregano. Serve immediately.

Mix together red onions and olive oil. In a large nonstick skillet over high heat, saute onions until they are translucent, about 15 minutes. Add 3 to 4 tablespoons water and continue cooking until liquid evaporates and onions are golden brown. Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons of butter with 1 tablespoon of lemon rind and capers and set aside. Cut chicken into 1/2 inch strips. In same skillet over high heat, saute chicken until it is no longer pink. Add butter mixture and cook over high heat until heated through, about 2 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon lemon rind and basil. Serve with steamed rice.

Grease cookie sheets. Beat butter and sugar until light. Add egg and mix. Add flavoring. Add dry ingredients and mix until well combined. Roll dough into a ball and chill for about 1 hour. Roll dough in confectioners' sugar and place on prepared cookie sheet. Bake until lightly browned.

Toss the asparagus with the black pepper. In a skillet, melt a small amount of butter over high heat. Add asparagus spears in an even layer. Cook until lightly browned and tender. Remove and keep warm. Melt remaining butter in skillet. Add fillets. Cook over medium-high heat until browned. Remove fillets and keep warm. Whisk together the avocado dip, mayonnaise, and lemon juice in a small bowl. Arrange the lettuce on a platter. Spoon the avocado mixture over. Top with asparagus spears. Arrange fillets over. Garnish with nasturtiums. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl, combine the egg and the buttermilk. Add the brown sugar, margarine, and vanilla. Stir to mix well. In a small bowl combine the quick-cooking oats, flour, baking powder, and baking soda. Stir to mix well. Add to the egg mixture and mix well. Fold in the blueberries. Spoon into prepared muffin cups and bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool on wire racks.

In a large bowl add the shredded cabbage and grated carrots. Stir in the chopped onions. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the sesame seeds, ramen noodles and almonds. Stir until crisp and set aside. In a small bowl whisk together the oil and rice vinegar. Add the sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Add the dressing to the cabbage and carrot mixture. Gently fold in the toasted sesame seed mixture and the toasted almonds. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

Saute onion and garlic in butter until onions are soft. Add the flour and stir over medium heat for 1 minute. Slowly stir in the hot water. Add the meat and bouillon granules. Bring to a simmer and cook 10 minutes. Add the sour cream and the noodles. Cook for a few minutes more until the noodles are tender. Stir in the pepper. Serve immediately.

Cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the insides with a spoon. Leave the bottoms intact so the tomatoes will stand up when they are placed in the baking dish. Place a slice of garlic and 1/2 of an olives inside each tomato. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil until the cheese is bubbly and the tops are brown and crispy, about 5 minutes.

Crush the cookies. In a small bowl, combine the crushed cookies with the butter. Press the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan to form a crust. Freeze for 15 minutes. In a food processor, pulse the ice cream until it forms a ball. Place the ice cream in the crust. Cut the peanut butter cups in half. Lay the halves on the ice cream. Melt the fudge sauce in a small saucepan over low heat. Drizzle the sauce over the ice cream. Serve immediately or freeze. To serve, heat the coffee in a saucepan over medium heat until it reaches a simmer. Add the liqueur. Stir well. Drizzle the coffee over the ice cream. Garnish with the nuts. Serve immediately.
Cream butter and sugar. Add in dry items. Shape into balls and press with fork. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In medium bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, salt and baking soda. In another bowl, combine milk, eggs and sugar. Stir together dry and wet mixtures. Add applesauce. Pour batter into greased 9 inch square pan. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until golden. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into squares. Makes 9 servings.

In a food processor combine the pine nuts, garlic and basil. Process until it resembles a thick paste. With the motor running add the olive oil in a steady stream until it forms a thick paste. Season to taste. Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package. Drain the pasta reserving 1/4 cup of the cooking water. Add the pesto to the pasta. Add the reserved water and the diced tomato. Toss to coat. Serve immediately sprinkled with cheese.

Cut stewing meat into bite sized pieces. In a crock pot brown meat with oil. Add sultana. Salt and pepper to taste. Add chopped onion and cook 10 minutes. Add chili powder. Cook 5 minutes longer. Add remaining ingrediants. Cover. Cook 10 hours or until meat is tender. Serve over rice or noodles.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Peel and core pears and cut into 1-inch slices. Arrange in a 1-quart shallow baking dish. Combine lemon juice and next 7 ingredients (through scotch) in a small bowl, stirring well with a whisk. Pour over pears and bake 50 minutes. Serve warm or room temperature. Garnish with additional pears if desired.

Soak bread in cold water for 5 minutes. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add bread squeezing out excess liquid. Knead lightly. Add more milk if needed. Roll into small balls about the size of golf ball. Boil in salted water for 15 minutes. Serve with your favorite meat.

Place a nonstick pan or a large cast iron skillet over medium heat. Pour in a small amount of cooking oil to coat the bottom of the pan. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the pan and tilt the pan in a circular motion so that the batter spreads into a thin layer and covers the bottom of the pan. Cook for about a minute or until the underside is golden brown and the top is set. Flip and cook the other side for a minute or so more. Sprinkle the cocoa over the top and serve with fruit or ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix the cracker crumbs with the butter and the parmesan cheese. Add the remaining ingredients, mix well, then pour into a shallow baking dish. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is a golden brown. Serve hot.
I think that I've had this before but I can't be sure. It is pretty good. The only problem I have with it is that it is a little salty.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Grease a cookie sheet or line with wax paper. In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add the vanilla, mix well. Blend the dry ingredients together and add to the creamed mixture. Mix well, then stir in the white chocolate chips. Drop the dough by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until just barely starting to brown around the edges. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Store tightly covered.

Preheat oven to 425. In large bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. In small bowl, combine egg and next 3 ingredients. Stir egg mixture into dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Divide batter evenly among greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out with moist crumbs. Immediately spoon 1 tablespoon caramel topping in each cup. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until topping is set. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes. Invert muffins onto wire rack. Cool completely.

Beat together cream cheese, condensed milk, orange juice concentrate and 2 tablespoons of the Cool Whip until smooth. Spoon into crust. Top with remaining Cool Whip. Store in refrigerator.
2. In a food processor, process 1 cup of the pecans until finely ground.
3. Add the ground pecans to the cookie mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips.
4. Press the mixture evenly into the prepared pan.
5. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm. Cool completely on a wire rack.
6. In a medium bowl, combine the icing ingredients.
7. Spread the icing over the brownie.
8. Sprinkle the top with the remaining 1 cup of pecans.
9. Refrigerate the brownie for 1 hour. Cut into squares.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Taste for seasoning.
Place penne into boiling water. Cook 7-8 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Place in a large bowl and toss with the remaining ingredients. Serve at room temperature. Serves 6.

In a large skillet or Dutch oven cook onions in olive oil over medium heat until soft and translucent. Add ground beef and brown. Drain fat. Add elbow macaroni and cook for 1 minute. Stir in kidney beans and tomato sauce. Season with chili powder and salt. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until pasta is tender and mixture is thickened. Top each serving with a spoonful of cheddar cheese.

Spread one side of tortilla with cream cheese. Spread ranch dressing on other side. Place jalapeno pepper on ranch dressing. Fold in sides of tortilla. Roll up and eat. I cut off a corner to eat first. You can also cut them into sections and add some shredded lettuce if you like.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heatadd shallots and scallions and saute until tender (approximately 5 minutes). Add celery and saute another minute or two until tenderadd chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutesadd potatoes, fresh rosemary and nutmegsimmer about an hourremove from heat and allow to coolremove bay leavesadd half-and-half cream to tasteblend until smoothseason with salt and pepper to taste. Makes about 6 cups.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. In a mixing bowl, combine the cornmeal, buttermilk and cream cheese until smooth. Beat in the egg and butter. Add the salt, pumpkin pie spice and brown sugar. Beat in the eggs and stir in the raisins. Divide the batter evenly among the wedges of the pumpkin. Bake until the tops are browned and the custards are set, 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer the pumpkin wedges to a rack. Stir the chutney into the hot filling to warm and serve with the stuffed pumpkins.

Peel and core red apples. Dip each apple in corn syrup then roll in a mixture of sugar, red food coloring and ground cinnamon until well covered. Insert a wooden skewer into the top of each apple. Place in refrigerator to set before serving.

Rub the meat with olive oil and salt and pepper. Heat a barbecue. Cook meat for 15 minutes. Turn meat over and place a few pieces of rosemary on top. Cook for a further 10-15 minutes. Remove meat from barbecue and place in a baking dish. Drizzle with a little red wine. Sprinkle with soy and barbecue sauces. Return meat to oven for a further 15 minutes.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat and add the ginger, turmeric and cardamom. Stir until the butter is aromatic and the ginger is soft. Add the onion and garlic and stir until the onion is soft. Add the spices and stir until fragrant. Strain through a fine sieve. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cube your chicken breasts. Mix mayonnaise with italian seasoning. Place a layer of the doritos in a baking dish. Add a layer of the chicken on top. Follow with more doritos. Then top the dish with the remaining chicken. Top with the remaining doritos. Drizzle with the mayonnaise mixture. Bake for 30 minutes.

Combine ricotta cheese with yogurt. Beat with whisk. Stir in walnuts. Add the butter, garlic, and pepper. Mix well. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 3 days. Serve over cooked pasta. Top with parmesan cheese. Garnish with fresh parsley and basil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan. In a large bowl combine the turkey stuffing mix with the eggs. Add the ground turkey and the vegetables to the bowl with the stuffing and egg mixture, stirring until well combined. Spread evenly into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until cooked through.
name: leftover turkeyingredients: butter, celery, onion, turkey, water, turkey gravy mix, milk, flour, saltpreparation:In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add celery and onion and cook for 5 minutes or til tender, stirring occasionally. Add turkey. Blend water, gravy, flour, and salt. Pour over turkey. Stir. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes serve over rice.
name: mini turkey loavesingredients: ground turkey, apple, onion, old fashioned oats, dijon-style mustard, dried

Bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add tea bags, 4 teaspoons of sugar, and the grated fresh ginger. Steep for 15-20 minutes. Strain into a large pitcher. Stir in the remaining 8 cups of cold water. Add the sliced lemons. Let sit for 1 hour. Add the lemon slices.

Crumble cookies and set aside. Beat heavy cream to soft peaks. Beat in sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks form. Fold in walnuts and set aside. Soften ice creams. Spread coffee ice cream on bottom of glass pie dish and top with chocolate ice cream. Spread cream mixture on top. Sprinkle with cookie crumbs. Drizzle with chocolate topping and top with whipped topping and walnuts before serving.

Mix together yogurt, dill, vinegar and garlic. Let sit for at least one hour. Preheat broiler. Coat haddock with mayonnaise. Spread each fillet with 2 tablespoons of the yogurt mixture and sprinkle with paprika and 1/4 teaspoon of the dill. Broil 4 inches from heat until fish is opaque and flakes easily when tested with a fork, about 3 minutes per side. Makes 2 servings.

Mix together romaine lettuce, apple, green onions and red onions. Add peas and raisins. In a small bowl whisk together cashew butter and lime juice. Drizzle dressing over salad and toss. Sprinkle with cilantro and cashews.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add dressing to the skillet. Stir in enough broth to make the sauce pourable. Add peppers. Toss to coat. Add cooked pasta to skillet. Add mozzarella. Toss to combine. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with croutons. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Line a baking tray with parchment paper or coat it with a non-stick spray. Peel the skin off the potatoes and cut them into wedges about half an inch wide. Toss the potatoes in the olive oil until they are well coated, then sprinkle the seasoning on them. Bake the potatoes for about 30 minutes until they are browned and tender when poked with a fork.
Mix all ingredients together and marinate overnight. Heat over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is thickened. Serve on top of steaks.

Preheat oven to 375. In a small bowl combine the fennel bulb and the onion. Drizzle with oil and toss to coat. Spread in 1 layer on 2 baking sheets. Bake 10 minutes. Add the squash to the same baking sheets. Drizzle with oil and toss to coat. Sprinkle with spices and toss again. Bake 20 minutes, stirring once. Add the red onion and toss. Return to the oven and bake 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
The recipe is as follows:1/2 cup all purpose flour2 Tablespoons brown sugar2 Tablespoons ground flax seed1 Tablespoon vanilla extract1/4 cup oil2 eggs1 teaspoon baking soda1/4 teaspoon baking powder1/2 teaspoon cinnamon1/2 teaspoon pumpkin spice1/2 teaspoon nutmegPreheat oven to 350. Combine dry ingredients in small bowl. Combine wet in

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a bowl combine barbecue sauce, zest and juice. Place the chicken breasts in the bowl and turn to coat. Place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Bake the chicken for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the grill. Grill the vegetables according to the package directions. Toss the vegetables in the italian dressing. Serve the vegetables on top of the chicken.

Prepare the cabbage leaves by removing the center rib. Wash and dry the leaves. Mix the meat, onion, garlic and seasonings. Divide into portions and place about 1/4 cup of mixture on each leaf. Roll up tightly and place seam side down in the slow cooker. Pour the liquid over the cabbage rolls. Cover and cook on high for about 1 hour and on low for about 4 hours. Serve over the rice.

Combine first six ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Spread in a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan. Sprinkle with the ritz cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until the center is set. Let cool. Cut into squares.

Mix the water into the jell-o and let set. Whisk together the eggs, sugar and butter then fold in the walnuts. Spread the mixture into the pie crust then pour the jell-o mixture over it. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
In a large pot of boiling water blanch eggs for 30 seconds. Cool eggs in ice water. Peel eggs. Place in jar. Cover eggs with brine. Refrigerate.

Cook rice in 4 cups milk and 1 tsp salt. Drain off water. In a saucepan combine 2 cups milk, cornstarch, egg yolks and 1 tbsp sugar. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add 1/2 cup half-and-half. Cool slightly. Stir in rice. Add remaining half-and-half and 2 tbsp sugar. Heat to boiling. Cook 1 min. Remove from heat. Add remaining 2 tbsp sugar and vanilla. Serve topped with crushed pineapple and pecans.

In a large bowl, combine the first 3 ingredients. Add the ribsturn to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove ribs from marinadediscard marinade. Grill ribs over medium heat 20 minutes or until done, turning often and brushing with sauce. Broil 1 minute on each side.

Prepare the sourdough starter as directed. In a large bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. In a medium bowl combine the sugar, cranberries and orange zest. In a large bowl combine the starter, milk, egg and vanilla. Gradually stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients just until blended. Stir in the orange and cranberries. Fill the muffin cups about 2/3 full. Bake for 20 minutes or until the muffins are golden and spring back when touched in the center. Remove from the pan and cool on a wire rack.

Combine all the vinaigrette ingredients in a small bowl and set aside. Slice the heirloom tomatoes and place them in a bowl. Pour in the vinaigrette and toss gently to coat the tomatoes. Let sit at room temperature while you prepare the bread. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the bread and toast for 2 to 3 minutes. Turn the bread over and toast on the other side for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and cut the bread into 1 inch cubes. Toss the bread into the tomatoes and let sit at room temperature for at least 1 hour. Just before serving, garnish with basil. Serve with feta cheese.

Sauté onions and squash in a little oil. Remove from skillet. Combine onions and squash with beaten egg. Add seasoning and mix well. Form into patties. Dip in flour, egg wash, and flour again. Fry in oil until golden brown.

Cook as directed on box of soup. Melt cheese topping on top of the bread cubes, do not mix the two together. After cooking the soup add dry mustard to taste to the soup then add the beaten egg to the soup mixture. When the egg is added to the mixture mix the mixture together and then add the egg mixture to the cheese topping on top of the bread cubes. After all the ingredients are mixed together place into a baking dish and bake for approximately 35 minutes at 350 degrees.

Cut the flank steak into 2-inch cubes. Place the cubes in a large bowl. Add the lime juice. Sprinkle in the fish sauce and the peppers. Let stand for 10 minutes. Add the garlic and the red onion and mix well. Add the cucumber and the cilantro and toss to combine. Divide the salad among 4 plates and garnish with the scallions and the lettuce. Serve with rice.
Line a jelly roll pan with wax paper. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler over hot water. Stir in peanuts. Spread on wax paper. Sprinkle with crackers and marshmallows. Chill. Cut into bars.

Spread olive oil on one side of bread. Spread mayonnaise on other side of bread. Spread turkey evenly on bottom half of bread. Top with sliced roasted red peppers. Top with a thick slice of taleggio. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Top with watercress. Top with other half of bread. Slice in half & serve.

Cream butter and sugars in a large mixing bowl for 2 to 3 minutes. Add egg and vanilla and beat until combined. Sift together remaining dry ingredients and add to wet ingredients. Stir until combined and dough forms. Stir in the puffed rice cereal and form into 1 inch balls with your hands. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and press with a fork to make the traditional design of the cookie. Bake for 7 to 9 minutes in a preheated 350 degree oven until the edges are golden. Let cool on the pan for 30 seconds before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. These are best when eaten on the same day that they are made. They freeze well wrapped in plastic wrap or aluminum foil and reheated in a 200 degree oven for 30 minutes.

Mix egg whites & sugar until thick & glossy. Stir in spices. Add nuts & stir until well coated. Form into balls & place on parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes. Cool before removing from cookie sheet.

Brown meat. Drain fat. Add all remaining ingredients. Simmer 20 minutes. Serve with your favorite toppings.

YUM! I will have to try this recipe. I make something similar but add canned green chilis to my beans. Yum!
I made this for my family today. It was delicious! I used less corn than the recipe calls for because I only had a can of it. It was still good. I would suggest adding some cumin to the recipe. I added it and it really made it better!
I made this last night for dinner, it was very good. The only change I made was that I added a can of chopped green chiles to the dish. I also added a bit more water.

Bring water to a boil in a medium-sized saucepan. Add the berries, lemon juice and cinnamon stick. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the berries are tender. Remove the cinnamon stick. In a small bowl, combine the granulated sugar and the maple syrup. Pour the mixture into the simmering berry mixture and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until the mixture thickens and the berries begin to pop (about 20-25 minutes). Serve warm. Serves 4.

In a large saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter. Stir in the shrimp and cook over moderate heat until the shrimp are firm and no longer pink, 3 minutes. Stir in the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter and the garlic and cook until the butter is bubbling and the garlic is golden, 2 minutes. Add the whole milk and cook over moderate heat until the mixture is thickened and the sauce begins to coat the back of a wooden spoon, 4 minutes. Off the heat, stir in the cream cheese and basil and cook over moderate heat until the cream cheese is melted. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until just tender. Drain. Toss the pasta with the shrimp and sauce and sprinkle with the Parmesan.
In a blender combine ice and the remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
Blanch spinach and squeeze out water. Dip in egg white and roll in crumb mixture. Heat oil in a wok. Fry the balls in hot oil till they turn golden brown. Serve hot with red chilli and rock salt.

Boil potatoes until tender drain and mash. Add corned beef and onion soup mix, mash well. Add eggs and seasoning mix and stir well. Place in greased dish and top with grated cheddar cheese. Bake at 350f for about 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat 1 teaspoon of the oil in heavy-duty skillet over high heat. Season the meat with the ginger, curry powder and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Add the meat and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned on both sides. Transfer the meat to a plate. Add the remaining 1 teaspoon of the oil to the skillet. Add the onion and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened. Add the sugar and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato sauce and the water. Season the sauce with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Return the meat to the skillet and simmer over moderately low heat until the meat is tender, about 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast in a small bowl. Let it sit for 5 minutes or so until the mixture begins to foam up. Add 3 cups of the flour and mix to combine (it will be lumpy). Cover with a towel and let sit in a warm place for 20 to 30 minutes or until doubled in size. Add in the rest of the flour 1/2 cup at a time until it forms a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Add in the butter, 1 tbsp at a time, until it is just barely incorporated. Place in an oiled bowl and cover with a towel. Let it rise in a warm place for 10 minutes or until doubled in size. Shape the dough into an 8x8 rectangle. Cut 8 inch strips and twist them until you have 2 8 inch long braids. Place onto a parchment lined sheet pan and let rise for 20 to 30 minutes or until puffy. Br
In large bowl combine first 4 ingredients. Add chips and mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper-lined baking sheets. Let stand 1 hour or until firm. Roll into ballsroll in coconut

Wash cukes and cut them into halves or quarters. Slice onions and peppers and mix with cukes. Put in bowl and sprinkle with 1 tsp of canning salt, cover with cold water and let stand for about 1 hour. Drain well. Combine 1 tsp of canning salt with 2 tbsp of white sugar and 1/2 tsp of celery seed. Blend with 2 cups of vinegar. Pour over vegetables and add enough water to cover. Refrigerate 24 hours before serving.

Grease bottom of 15x10x1-inch jellyroll pan. Heat honey, peanut butter, butter, marshmallows, and vanilla in large saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly, until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in oats, rice cereal, and coconut. Press mixture firmly into jellyroll pan. Cool completely. Cut into 1-inch squares. Place in plastic bagseal bag. Store at room temperature. Makes about 24 1-inch squares.
My 3 yr old son loves these! I usually double the recipe to ensure I have enough left over for him to eat the next day.

Lightly beat the egg and dip the chicken in the egg and then coat with the crumb mixture and put in a baking tray. Place in the oven for about 35 minutes or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through. Melt the butter with the garlic and pour over the chicken. Garnish with the parsley and serve hot with vegetables or salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin cups. In a large bowl, combine the first five ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the next five ingredientsstir well. Stir into the flour mixture just until moistened. Spoon batter into the prepared cups. Combine the topping ingredientssprinkle over the batter. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 1 minute before removing from the pans to cool on wire racks. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Boil water for rice-a-roni according to package directions. Brown chicken in oil. Add celery, bell pepper, onion, mushrooms and continue to brown. Add remaining ingredients. Cook over low heat until heated through. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve over rice-a-roni.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add molasses and egg. Stir in dry ingredients. Refrigerate 1 hour. Roll into 1 inch balls. Press 2 or 3 balls together to make 1 cookie. Place on greased or non-stick cookie sheet. Bake 375f for 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugars. Add the egg and vanilla and beat to combine. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet until combined. Fold in the chocolate chunks. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoons 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden and the center is set. Let cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Mix together the concentrate and water. Add the garlic and ginger and let sit for 10 minutes. Combine hoisin sauce and sugar in a small bowl and set aside. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.Place the wings in a shallow bowl and pour the concentrated orange juice mixture over them. Toss to coat. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the wings and pat dry with paper towels. Dip each wing in the sugar and hoisin mixture and place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, turning halfway through the cooking time. Serve with the green onions on top of the wings.
Place all ingredients except nectar in medium saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Add nectar. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine the first four ingredientsmix well. Place 1/2 of the mixture in a small zip-lock bagreserve remaining mixture for another use. Add the cauliflower and close the bag. Massage the bag gently so that the mixture coats all of the pieces of cauliflower. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes and up to 2 hours. Remove from bag and serve. Serves 4

Heat oil in a medium saute pan over medium heat. Add leek, stirring to combine. Cook for 5 minutes or until leek is tender. Add spinach and cook for 1 minute or until wilted. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 200 degrees C. Roll out 1 pastry sheet to 3mm thickness. Use to line an 18cm pie dish. Spread spinach mixture over base. Whisk eggs in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Add sour cream. Pour into pie dish. Combine tasty cheese and breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over the top. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden. Allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Steep tea bags in hot water for 5-10 minutes until desired strength is reached. Remove bags from water. Boil the water with sugar for about 15 minutes until it thickens slightly. Place bags back into pot and add ginger. Strain through a coffee filter or fine mesh strainer into serving bowl. Cool to room temperature. Fill tall glasses with crushed ice. Pour ginger tea over ice. Top with evaporated milk, then stir.

Bring quinoa and water to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until most of the water has evaporated. Season with lemon, olive oil, pepper and pistachios. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Add parsley and mint. Place in serving bowls. Top with tomatoes and Lebanese cucumber. Serves 4-6.

Combine parsley and water in blenderblend until parsley is well chopped and mixture is smooth. Strain through fine sieve into large pitcherdiscard parsley solids. Add lime zest and 3 tablespoons of the lime juicestir. Taste and add more lime juice to taste (about 1/2 cup more) and more sugar if desired (1/4 cup more). Divide mixture evenly among 8 glassesadd 2 tablespoons club soda to each glass and stir until foamy. Garnish with remaining lime zest and remaining 1/2 cup of club soda and serve immediately.

Dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup of warm milk. Let stand in warm place until frothy. Dissolve sugar in 3 cups of warm milk. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the yeast mixture, 2 tablespoons melted butter and the cottage cheese, mixing well. Let stand until double in size, about 2 hours. Stir in the egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Strain through a wire strainer. Combine the cornstarch with the remaining 1 cup of milk, add the rum and lemon rindheat over low heat until thickened but do not boil. Remove from heatcool. Fold into the cheese mixture. Butter a 9-inch springform pan or deep-dish pie plate, line with crushed graham crackers or gingersnaps, press down firmly. Pour in the cheese filling, level the top with a knife dipped in cold water. Cover the pan loosely with aluminum foil or plastic wrap. Place in a warm place for 1 hour or until double in size. Pre

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook pasta according to package directions. Cook meat in skillet over medium-high heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in pasta sauce. Add pasta and 1 cup of the cheesetoss to coat. Spread in 13x9x2-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 20 minutes or until heated through.

Wash carrots thoroughly. Cut off the top and bottom of each carrot. Peel them with a vegetable peeler. Cut each carrot into four slices lengthwise, then cut each slice into quarters crosswise. Place the sliced carrots in a skillet with about 1/3 cup of water and the caraway seeds (if using). Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to medium low and cover the pan. Cook until the carrots are tender, about 10-15 minutes. Add the butter, the brown sugar and the ginger root. Stir to combine and cook until the glaze thickens slightly. Stir in the orange peel and cook until the peel is crisp (about one more minute). Stir in the orange juice to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning with the salt and pepper.

Preheat a grill pan or a grill over medium-high heat and brush the grill with some olive oil. Rub each piece of fish with some olive oil and place it on the grill. Brush the fish with lemon juice and dill every few minutes until cooked through and lightly browned. Serve with lemon slices and a green salad.

Place dried beans in large bowl and cover with water by 4 inches. Soak overnight. Drain beans and discard soaking water. Cover with 8 cups of fresh water and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 1. 5 hours or until beans are tender. Drain and cool. Heat oil and saute onions until tender. Add rosemary and balsamic vinegar. Stir in beans and season to taste. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Beat together 1/2 cup butter & 1 cup white sugar until light and creamy. Beat in 2 eggs 1 at a time. Stir in 1 teaspoon of vanilla & 1 teaspoon of almond extract. Sift together 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour & 1 teaspoon of baking soda. Stir into butter mixture 1 cup sliced blanched almonds. Drop by rounded teaspoon on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 9-11 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Store in airtight container. Makes about 5 dozen.

Peel avocado and place in food processor. Add 1 cup of the chicken broth. Process until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of the remaining chicken broth. Process until smooth. Add the garlic cloves. Process until smooth. Add the lime juice. Process until smooth. Add the remaining 2 cups of chicken broth. Process until smooth. Add the heavy cream. Process until smooth. Refrigerate until cold. Serve with a wedge of lemon. Prep time does not include refrigeration time.

Mix soy sauce and wine together. Heat oil in wok or saute pan over high heat until very hot. Add the chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 6 minutes. Add the soy sauce mixture and cook about 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with green onions and serve immediately. I love this recipe because it only uses 3 measuring cups which is easy to remember and I usually have everything on hand! I added a little red pepper flakes for more flavor.

Bring water to a boil. Add salt to taste. Blend egg with water and flour. Drop by teaspoonful onto boiling water. Cook 4 minutes or until tender. Drain and serve with melted butter and parsley or your choice of sauce.

Cream together peanut butter and sugar. Beat in egg. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 to 14 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Store in tightly covered container. Makes about 4 dozen.
Bring cocoa powder to room temperature.
Sift in flour and cocoa.
Roll in to 1 inch balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake 10 minutes.
Let cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 x 13 casserole dish. Layer stuffing evenly over bottom of dish. Top with meat and cheese. In a large bowl beat together eggs and milk. Pour over meat and cheese and spread to cover the surface of the dish. Bake for 55-65 minutes.
Leftovers can be transformed into something delicious and easy with this Leftover Thanksgiving Casserole.
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
2. Place the leftover dressing in the bottom of the dish and spread into an even layer.
3. Spread the leftover turkey and leftover veggies evenly on top of the dressing.
4. Combine the egg, cream of chicken soup, and cream of celery soup in a mixing bowl and stir well.
5. Pour the cream of chicken soup mixture over the dressing and veggies in the

Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

Mix together the cream cheese and the garlic and spices and mix well with a spoon or by hand. Spread a little bit of this mixture on a bologna slice and top with a piece of pickle and a bit of cheddar cheese. Wrap with a piece of bologna and secure with a toothpick. Store refrigerated or freeze for up to 6 months and reheat in the microwave for 30 seconds when ready to serve.

Heat olive oil in saucepan on medium-low heat. Saut onions and garlic until softened, about 5 to 8 minutes. Add wine. Cook for 2 minutes or until most of the liquid has evaporated. Add broth and season with pepper and salt. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Add collard greens and thyme. Cook for 20 minutes or until greens are tender. Add great northern beans. Cook 10 more minutes or until heated through. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with crusty bread.
Combine all the salad dressing ingredients in a jar with a lid. Cover and shake to mix thoroughly. Let stand at least 2 hours to blend seasonings. Shake well before using. Wonderful on greek salad.

Cut turkey into bite sized pieces and place on a salad plate. Top turkey with lettuce and the fruit. In a small bowl combine the cranberry sauce and frozen concentrate. Stir until well blended. Pour over the salad. Garnish with the nuts and serve.
In a medium bowl combine all the ingredients and blend well. Mash the mixture together until it is a fine paste. Store in the refrigerator until ready to use. Serve on sandwiches or use on your favorite meat or fish dish. Makes about 1/2 cup.
Combine the first six ingredients and stir until well blended. Form into patties and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 15 minutes. Serve on a bun or roll. Makes about 6 servings.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Beat first 4 ingredients together until well blended.
Combine all ingredients except the apples. Spread on toast or crackers. Sprinkle with chopped apples.

Grind bacon and speculaas into a powder. Heat a pan and add bacon/speculaas powder. Add ground beef. Cook until done. Add butter. Remove from heat. Add ketjap manis, sambal bajak and spices. Mix until evenly distributed. Form into balls. Fry in butter until golden brown. Serve with steamed rice.
Meatballs in tomato sauce. Photo by Nathalie Marche.

In a large bowl, combine chicken thighs with hoisin sauce, honey, lime juice and soy sauce. Stir to coat. Let sit for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Remove chicken from marinade and place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with cumin and paprika. Bake until golden brown and cooked through, about 25-30 minutes. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and serve.

Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ginger and garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add Szechuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds more. Add chicken and stir-fry for 5 minutes until browned. Add rice wine and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add 1/3 cup water, honey and soy sauces. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, until the chicken is tender and the sauce is thickened, about 30 minutes. Remove the star anise before serving.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add green onions and cook for 3 minutes. Add peas and cook for 2 minutes. Drain peas and green onions. Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add peas & green onions & saute briefly. Sprinkle with chopped chives & serve immediately.

Heat a skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil. Season the scallops with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and the pepper. Add the scallops to the hot skillet and cook for 30 seconds. Add the remaining oil and turn the scallops over. Cook for 30 seconds on the other side. Transfer the scallops to 4 plates and sprinkle with the chives. Serve immediately.

Grease 12 muffin cups or tins with softened butter or margarine. In a large bowl combine the brown sugar, granulated sugar, flour and saltcut in the shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the egg and milk until dough is evenly moistenedknead lightly until dough holds together. Press the dough into the prepared cups. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F oven for about 12-14 minutes until lightly brownedcool completely. In a large bowl combine the confectioners sugar and the milk until smoothadd the extract and beat well. Fill cups with the fillingtop with the chopped nuts. Makes about 2-1/2 dozen.
My family has been making this recipe for decades and we still love it! We make the filling with chopped pecans and bake the crust separately as an option for a more traditional pecan pie.

Cut the water chestnuts in half lengthwise. Wrap one half around each slice of bacon. Secure with a pick. In a bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over bacon wrapped water chestnuts. Marinate for several hours or overnight. Place in a roasting pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 425 for 30 minutes.

Cook the rice according to the directions on the package. Melt the butter and olive oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and saut until the onions are translucent. Add the chicken and saute until lightly browned. Add the carrots and peas and saute for 2 minutes. Add the eggs and stir until they are set. Add the rice and stir to combine. Stir in the soy sauce and sesame oil and mix well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Toss the sweet potato cubes in the paprika, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and light brown sugar until evenly coated. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add the sweet potato cubes and cook for 3 minutes per side, turning once. Arrange the sweet potato cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring once halfway through the baking time. Serve hot.

Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Slice the tops off of the mushrooms leaving the stems intact. Remove the stems and set them aside. Slice the pepper into thin strips and place them in a small bowl. Add the goat cheese and stir to combine. Season with the pepper and a few drops of the olive oil. Stuff each mushroom with the mixture. Place the tops of the mushrooms back on the stems and grill for about 4 minutes per side or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is starting to bubble through the top of the mushroom.
Brown the sausage and ground beef. Drain the fat. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place chicken in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan. Bake 20 minutes. In a large bowl, combine honey, orange juice, ginger and black pepper. Drizzle 1/2 cup over chicken. Bake 10 minutes more. Stir remaining 2 tablespoons honey mixture into corn flakes. Sprinkle over chicken. Bake 5 minutes more or until juice is thickened and chicken is done. Garnish with parsley if desired.

In a small bowl stir together the first six ingredients. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Spoon a portion of cheese mixture on the bottom half of each bun. Top with a slice of ham, a slice of cheese and a tomato half. Cover with the top half of the bun. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Beat together the first 3 ingredients. Stir in the crab and next 6. Spread into 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle with cheddar. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly. Cool. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a 5 quart dutch oven or heavy pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add broccoli. Cook about 8 minutes or until tender. Stir in potato. Cook about 5 minutes or until tender. Add onion and carrots. Cook about 5 minutes or until tender. In a small bowl, stir together chicken broth and cornstarch until smooth. Stir into broccoli mixture. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Cook about 5 minutes or until mixture thickens. Stir in milk. Cook about 5 minutes or until heated through. Add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with cheese before serving.

In a medium saucepan combine the cranberries, water and sugar. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until thickened, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Toward the end of the cooking time use a potato masher to mash all of the berries. Reduce heat to low, add brandy and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. To serve, top each poundcake slice with cranberry sauce and whipping cream. Garnish with slivered almonds and mint sprigs.
Making the sauce: In a medium saucepan combine the cranberries, water and sugar. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until thickened, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Toward the end of the cooking time use a potato masher to mash all of the berries. Reduce heat to low, add brandy and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature.
To serve, top each poundcake slice with cranberry sauce and whipping cream. Garnish

Wash and soak the beans in water overnight. Drain and rinse. In a large soup pot combine the ham bone and water. Bring to a boil and add the beans and ham bone. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 hours or until beans are tender. Add the bay leaf. Remove the ham bone and shred. Return the ham bone to the pot and stir in the vegetables. Simmer for an additional 15 to 20 minutes. Season to taste. Serve hot.
Place ice cream in the container of your blender. Add milk and yogurt. Add 4-6 large marshmallows. Blend on low until just smooth. Serve immediately.

Preheat your grill. Whisk all the ingredients in a small bowl until blended. Place the chicken in a large resealable plastic bag. Add the yogurt mixture. Seal the bag and turn to coat the chicken. Place the bag in the refrigerator and allow to sit for 3 to 24 hours. Grill the chicken, turning once and brushing with remaining marinade until done. Serve with a simple green salad.

Combine first five ingredients. Rub into fish. Place on grill over medium heat. Cook for 10 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork. Remove from heat. Spoon butter-pepper mixture over fish. Sprinkle with cheese. Return to grill and brown on both sides.

Combine all ingredients except cheese and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer 15-20 minutes or until heated through. Stir before serving. Top with shredded cheese if desired. Serve with sour cream.

Peel and cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Place in a small saucepan and cover with water. Cook over high heat until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and set aside. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the cayenne and cook for 3 minutes. Add the heavy cream and bring to a boil. Add the potatoes and cook until heated through. Season to taste with sea salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Reduce heat and add the tomatoes. Cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add the apricots and raisins. Stir and cook 1 minute. Serve over rice.
Combine all ingredients in a small sauce pan and heat until simmering. Brush over ham for last 20 minutes of baking time.

Cut tenderloin into 1/4-inch slices. Place in a single layer in a shallow pan. Combine butter, cream and chutney. Heat to boiling in a saucepan. Pour mixture over slices. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Remove slices from refrigerator. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place slices in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and set aside. Serve slices with steamed rice and garnish with chopped green onion.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together butter and sugar. Add egg yolk. Add in vanilla. Slowly add in the flour mixture. Add in peppermint extract. Form into 1 inch balls. Roll in miniature chocolate chip. Dip in red food coloring. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-9 minutes. Remove from oven. Place on cooling rack. Makes 40 cookies.

In a saucepan, add cream cheese and milk, stir until melted. Add diced green chilies and seasonings. Heat until warmed through. In a glass baking dish, place crescent rolls side by side in pan, overlapping each other as you go down the pan. Pour cream cheese mixture over crescent rolls, top with diced green chilies and corn chips. Bake at 400 degrees for about 12-14 minutes or until crescent rolls are browned and rolls are set and no longer soggy.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt 6 tablespoons of butter. Add carrots and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of salt, bring to a boil, cover and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Uncover and continue to cook 5 minutes more or until tender crisp. Stir in 1 cup of ginger ale and bring to a boil. Cook until liquid is reduced by half. Stir in 1 tablespoon of chili powder and cook 1 minute longer. Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

Blend together cream cheese, sour cream and mayonnaise. Chill for 1 hour. Spread mixture evenly into an 11 inch x 7 inch glass baking dish. Top with enough seafood cocktail sauce to cover the dish. Chop enough canned shrimp to scatter around the dish. Top with mozzarella cheese, chopped green peppers and onions and chopped tomatoes. Chill for 2 hours before serving. Serve with assorted crackers.

Cook the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until it is brown. Drain and put back into the skillet. Add the pizza sauce and the other ingredients except for the cheeses. Cook until the sauce is thick. Place a spoonful of the meat mixture onto the bottom of each of the hamburger buns. Sprinkle the cheeses on the meat and place the top of the hamburger buns. Place in the oven at 350 for about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cook potatoes whole in a large pot of boiling water for about 20-30 minutes or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain and cool completely. Dice the potatoes and place them into a large mixing bowl with enough room for stirring. Add mayonnaise, soy sauce and brown sugar. Stir well. Add water chestnuts and scallions and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve. This can also be served over greens or rice.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in the sugar until it has dissolved and then add the honey. Simmer until mixture is a little thick. Remove from the fire and add the cornflakes. Spread onto a greased baking tray and allow to cool. Cut into squares or shapes of your choice.
In a bowl, combine turkey with onion and tomato. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roll up in a tortilla. Serve and enjoy.

Place walnuts in a food processor. Add soy sauce, cumin, garlic and lemon juice. Puree until smooth. Place in a serving dish. Place greens in the dish. Sprinkle the pureed mixture over the greens. Sprinkle with cilantro, green onions and season with pepper. Serve in tacos.
Soak onions for 1/2 hour. Cut and cook cabbage. Combine the remaining ingredients and add to vegetables. Toss lightly. Serve on lettuce.

In a large mixing bowl combine all the ingredients except the oil. Mix thoroughly and form into 6 patties. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Fry patties until browned on both sides. Serve on a bun with lettuce, tomatoes or as desired.
I like the idea of mixing up the bread crumbs and the hot peppers. I think I will try this recipe next time I cook some chicken.

Pour half of the bread cubes in bottom of 9 inch pie plate. Top with half of ham. Sprinkle with half of cheese. Make egg mixture with remaining bread cubes, ham, cheese, eggs, milk and seasonings. Pour egg mixture over bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
I am going to make this for Christmas morning!
I'm going to make this for Christmas morning!
I have made this several times. I always make it in 2 pans so I can have one for now and one for later. I also add some chopped celery and mushrooms to the filling. My husband doesn't like celery so I add it to his pan and then I make it without to my pan. He loves it!
I made this today for the first time. The house smells wonderful! It's in the oven right now. I can't wait to try it!
I made this recipe. It was very good. I doubled the recipe and baked it in two pans. I am taking it to work for my co workers to try.
I made this recipe for Christmas.

In medium saucepan bring water to boil and stir in the cornmeal. Stir in the cheeses. Continue stirring over medium heat until mixture thickens and pulls away from side of pan. Turn into baking dish and cool for about 1 hour. Serve with grated cheese and salsa for dipping.

Cream butter and syrup together. Add ginger. Add flour and oats. Stir in dates and coconut. Form into balls and roll in a little extra coconut. Place on greased trays and bake at 160 degrees for about 20 minutes.
My grandmother and mother were the main cooks in the family when I was a child. My mother was an excellent cook. She had a very good memory and would often use recipes she had learned from other family members, friends or neighbours. She was a good cook and liked to make delicious food for her children. She would often prepare something special for us to eat when we visited her house. We were always excited about what she would serve us for dinner or supper. When we were little kids and would come home from school we would always run to her house and wait for her to open the door. We were always looking forward to seeing what she had cooked. My grandmother was also a good cook. She was very patient and would always take the time to prepare a meal for us. She was very creative and would often use different spices and herbs to give the food a

Preheat oven to 180c/gas mark 4. Roll out two circles of dough and place one in each of two 23cm (9-inch) tart pans. Blind bake with weights until lightly golden. Beat together egg yolks and syrup, add ground spices and beat until smooth and shiny. Pour over baked bases and bake until just set - about 15 minutes. Cool completely, then top with whipped cream and sprinkle with brown sugar before serving.

Mix together honey, sugar, and butter in a saucepan over medium heat until well blended. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. In a large bowl, beat the eggs until blended well and then add the cooled honey mixture and beat well. Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Let cool and then top with chopped pecans. Serve and enjoy.

Prepare Rice Krispies treats per box directions. Melt butter in sauce pan. Stir in cinnamon and sugar. Boil for 3 minutes stirring constantly until mixture is bubbly. Remove from heat. Add egg noodles and stir to coat noodles with mixture. Mix in cream cheese until smooth. Add milk and eggs and beat until smooth. Pour over rice krispies treats and spread evenly. Sprinkle with raisins and bake at 350 for 1 hour or until lightly browned. Cool 1 hour or until completely cool. Makes 9x13 pan.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Heat the oil in an oven-proof skillet or baking pan large enough to hold the chops. Brown the chops about 3 minutes on each side.
