Remove the chops from the skillet or pan. In the same skillet or pan combine the remaining ingredients. Simmer for 1 minute. Pour over the pork chops. Cover the skillet or pan and bake 45 minutes. Uncover, bake 15 minutes longer. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook chicken according to package directions. Drain excess fat from pan and add cream cheesestir until melted. Add milkstir until smooth. Stir in chicken, salt& pepper. Cook 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Unroll crescent roll dough into a 14x8-inch rectanglepress perforations to seal. Spread chicken mixture down center of dough rectangleroll up jelly-roll style, starting with a short side. Place, seam side down, on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into 6 pieces to serve. Serve with ketchup or your favorite sauce.

In a skillet over medium heat, brown sausage. In a bowl, combine sausage with 1 package of wonton wrappers. In a skillet over medium heat, melt 1/4 cup butter or margarine. Unroll remaining package of wrappers and brush with remaining 1/4 cup butter or margarine. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Arrange wonton cups on a cookie sheet. Spoon sausage mixture into each cup. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with ranch dressing.

Season the pork chops with the salt and pepper. In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the minced garlic. After 15 to 30 seconds the garlic should be fragrant and lightly browned. Add the pork chops to the pan and brown for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove the chops to a plate. In the same pan, add the apple juice and cranberry sauce and mix well. Bring the mixture to a boil and cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until the sauce has reduced by half. Meanwhile, add the applesauce to the pan and bring to a boil. Cook for 2 minutes. Return the chops to the pan. Add the ground cloves and stir well. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking for 5 minutes. Serve the chops and sauce immediately.

Heat oil in a 12-inch skillet. Add onion and saute until translucent. Stir in tomatoes and cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in prosciutto and cook 1 minute longer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with capers. Serve over pasta or use as a sauce for chicken breasts.

In a shallow bowl, combine Bisquick baking mix and milk until soft dough forms. Stir in cinnamon and vanilla. Dip each slice of bread in mixture so it is soaked through. Brown on both sides in margarine over medium heat. Let cool on cooling racks completely. Once the slices have cooled completely, retuns to bread bag alternating with wax paper to avoid the slices sticking together. Freeze until ready to eat. Reheat in toaster when ready to eat.
I made these last night and they were a big hit. They were really good and so easy to make. I had a lot of left over batter and I made about a dozen regular sized muffins out of it so there was something for everyone.
I made this recipe and it was yummy!
This recipe is so easy and so good!
I made these and they were so good! I made them for my kids and they gobbled them up! I was really suprised at how good they were!!
This is a really good recipe and very easy.
I made these a few times now and they are great and easy.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, combine egg yolks, cream, flour, nutmeg and salt. In a 9x13 pan, melt the butter in a pan. Spread the 8 sheets of filo in a circular pattern. Sprinkle with half of the parmesan. Pour egg mixture over this. Sprinkle with the remaining parmesan. Top with the 8 remaining sheets of filo. Brush with melted butter. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into 1x1 inch squares. Arrange 1 square on each slice of hard boiled egg. Garnish with spinach.
In a blender combine sweet peppers, feta cheese, vinegar, granulated sugar, cayenne. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to use. Serve with pita chips or vegetables.

Make each of the 3 gelatin recipes according to package directions. In a large bowl combine strawberry gelatin, orange juice and cold water. Chill until firm. In another large bowl combine peach gelatin, cold water and peaches. Chill until firm. In a third large bowl combine lemon gelatin, cold water, and cold water. Chill until firm. Divide strawberry mixture among 6 to 8 cups. Divide peach mixture among 6 to 8 cups. Divide lemon mixture among 6 to 8 cups. Top each with grapes, strawberries or peaches, or cool whip. Chill until ready to serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the vegetable oil. Add scallions, gingerroot, garlic, and cook for 1 minute. Add sea salt and peppers. Increase heat to high and bring to a boil. Add shrimp and cook for 3 minutes or until pink. Add chile, if desired. Drain off excess liquid. Serve topped with cilantro.

In a small saucepan combine the sugar and evaporated milk. Cook over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Cook for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the butter. Pour into an 8 x 8 glass pan. Mix the chocolate chips and the marshmallows in a bowl. Pour over the hot mixture. Cool for 1 hour and serve.

Place the beans in a 4 quart saucepan. Cover with water and boil for 1 hour. Add the vegetables and boil for 1 hour more. Add the noodles. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the ham and the cream. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine first five ingredients in saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils. Boil one minute. Remove from heat. Beat in vanilla. Stir in oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Chill. Just before serving roll in powdered sugar.

Melt the butter in a large pot and add the seasoning salt. Add the cereals and toss to coat. Add the nuts and toss to combine. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour. Cool for 15 minutes before serving.

soak beans overnight. In a large pot combine ham and sausage with water to cover and boil 10 minutes. Remove ham and sausage and set aside. Add beans to pot and cover with water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer 1 hour or until tender. Remove beans to a bowl. In a large skillet fry cabbage and onion in butter until tender and remove to a bowl with beans. Cook pasta until done and add to beans and cabbage mixture with ham and sausage and seasonings. Add carrots and tomato and cook 5 minutes more and serve.

In a saucepan cook the spinach and mushroom in the butter over medium heat until wilted. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl combine the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Beat well. Fill each pie shell with a thin layer of the spinach and mushroom mixture and sprinkle with thyme. Top with the egg mixture and sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake at 425 until puffed and golden. Cut into wedges and serve warm.

Toast the peppers under the broiler until blackened. Rub off any loose skin with your hands. Then rub the charred peppers against the inside of the work bowl of a food processor until the skins fall off. Work the rest of the peppers down into the work bowl. Pour in the olive oil and garlic. Pulse the processor until smooth but not liquid. Season with salt and pulse again until smooth but not liquid. Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt if necessary. Use at once or store covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Makes 3/4 cup (200ml).
I love peppers! This is an incredible selection of recipes. Thanks!
I love to eat them. I would love to try your recipes.
Thank you for your comment! I do love them too!

Brown hamburger and drain. Add onion soup mix and flour and cook until mixture is lightly browned stirring constantly. Add water and tomato paste. Cook until thickened. Serve over egg noodles with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Separate crescent rolls into individual triangles. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, cinnamon, and melted butter until well blended. Spoon the mixture over each triangletop with an apple wedge. Fold the bottom edge of the triangle over the apple wedgefold up the sides of the triangle over the apple. Fold the top point over the applepress together gently with the tip of a fork or your fingers. Place the triangles in the prepared baking dish. In a small bowl combine the juices from the can of pie filling with the apple cider or waterstir in the brown sugar until dissolved. Pour the mixture over the top of the triangles. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until the edges of the triangles are golden brown. Cool for about 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Coat a 12 cup muffin pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl stir together the flour, cinnamon, and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl combine the sugar, egg, and oil. Beat well. Stir in the vanilla and pears. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Sprinkle the tops of the batter with the nuts. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove the muffins from the pan. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Prepare cranberry sauce by combining all ingredients in saucepan and simmer until cranberries burst. Let cool before assembling tassies. Beat cream cheese until creamy, add remaining ingredients and beat until smooth. Spoon cranberry sauce onto bottom of each tassie and top with cream cheese filling. Bake at 375 for about 15 minutes or until filling is set and pastry is browned. Sprinkle with pecans and serve warm.

Lightly toast 4 slices of bread on both sides and sprinkle with apple butter. Place a slice of swiss cheese on each slice of bread and top with one apple slice and the remaining slice of swiss cheese. Broil for 3 to 5 minutes until cheese is melted and lightly browned.

In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in the flour using wire whisk until the flour is absorbed. Gradually stir in the milk and cook and stir with a wire whisk until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the salt, black pepper and dried oregano. Serve with pasta.

Preheat broiler to high. Lightly coat 2 baking sheets with cooking spray. Steam cauliflower for 10 minutes. Arrange on the baking sheets. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes until crisp-tender and lightly browned. Transfer to a large bowl. Combine the anchovies, olives, and capers in the bowl with the cauliflower. Add garlic, herbs, olive oil, and vinegartoss well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature.

Combine lime rind, lavender flowers and 3 cups of the boiling water in a large potlet sit for 10 minutes, then strain through a fine-mesh sieve. Add the peaches, 1/4 cup of the lemon juice and 1/2 cup of the sugar, then return the pot to the heat and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the liquid is reduced to 1/2 cup and the peaches are soft, about 20 minutes. Let cool slightly, then stir in the remaining lemon juice and the pectinreturn the jam to the heat and cook until it reaches the gel stage. Ladle the jam into sterilized jars, wipe the rims with a damp paper towel, then seal with the lids. Process in a boiling-water bath for 10 minutes, then remove the jars from the canner and let cool on a rack for 12 hours before storing the jars in a cool, dark place for up to 1 year.

Place spareribs in slow cooker. In medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Pour over spareribs in slow cooker. Cover with lid. Cook on high 4 to 5 hours or low 8 to 9 hours. Turn ribs once after 2 hours. Remove ribs from liquid. Keep liquid warm for serving. Place ribs on serving platter. Pour liquid over ribs. Serve with rice.

In a blender puree the olive oil, vinegar, mustard, basil, coarse salt and pepper. If you can puree it well it will be a smooth dressing. If it seems to thick add a bit more vinegar. If it seems to thin add a bit more olive oil. If you want to serve this dressing warm to room temperature then you can cook it in a sauce pan. Bring dressing to a simmer. Cook until it thickens a bit. Pour over the tomatoes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Toss gently to combine. Serve warm.

In a food processor combine garlic and basil. Process until smooth. Add walnuts and pulse until the nuts are finely ground. Add parmesan cheese and pulse again until finely ground. Add lemon juice and pulse to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Use on chicken or pork chops.

Into the bread pan of your bread machine place the following ingredients and set on dough cycle: warm water, egg white, vegetable oil, sugar, salt, bread flour, fast rising yeast. When cycle is complete, remove from machine and shape into desired rolls or loaf. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Mix the white wine, olive oil, lemon juice and lime juice in a large plastic bag. Add the meat and squeeze out as much air as possible. Close the bag and let the meat marinate in the refrigerator for 12 to 24 hours. Just before you cook the meat, squeeze out the air and discard the marinade. Rub the beef with the remaining marinade mixture. Roast the beef in a pre-heated 350 degree Fahrenheit oven for about one and a half hours. Turn the meat after 45 minutes and baste with the remaining marinade.
Slowly heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until it is soft, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the garlic and saute until it turns golden. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the cumin and saute for 1 minute. Stir in the potatoes and saute for 1 minute more. Add the chicken broth and simmer for 20 to 30

Cut cabbage and onions into small bite size pieces. Slice sausage and bacon into small pieces. In a large skillet, brown sausage and bacon with margarine. When well browned, add cabbage and onions. Cook until tender. Add salt, pepper and sugar. Serve with cooked white rice.

Toast the sunflower seeds in a dry pan over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown and fragrant. Combine quinoa and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until all the water is absorbed and quinoa is tender. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling wrap for 10 minutes to steam the quinoa further. Meanwhile heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute or until golden brown, then add lemon juice and season well with salt and pepper. Transfer the quinoa to a large bowl and add cooked carrots and parsley. Add the dressing and stir gently to combine. Sprinkle sunflower seeds over the top. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4.

Heat grill or broiler to medium-high heat. Cut each potato in half lengthwise and each onion into thirds crosswise. Toss the vegetables with the mustard and thyme and season with the salt and pepper. Coat the cut sides of the vegetables with nonstick cooking spray. Fold the vegetables in half and place on the grill or broiler pan. Grill or broil until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned, about 10 minutes per side for the onions and 18 minutes per side for the potatoes. Serve hot.

Beat cream cheese and butter with mixer until smooth. Add powdered sugar and beat until combined. Stir in brown sugar and vanilla extract. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour. To serve, spoon dip onto a plate. Top with graham cracker crumbs. Drizzle with honey. Serve with pretzels or apples.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Line 13x9x2 inch baking dish with 6 tortillas, overlapping as necessary. Sprinkle half the ground beef over top and spread to cover. Top with remaining tortillas and remaining ground beef. Mix milk and salsa until combinedpour over top and sprinkle with cheese. Bake 1 1/2 hours in the preheated oven. Cool slightly before cutting into squares to serve.
Prepare tortillas. Blend all other ingredients until smooth. Reheat and serve garnished with parsley. Serve with tortilla chips.

Sift together dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix well. Heat frying pan or griddle. Put 1/4 cup of mixture on griddle for each pancake. Flip pancakes when bubbles appear. Serve with syrup, jelly or honey.
Place cooked rice in slow cookeradd milk, eggs, sugar, almond extract, salt and dried cherriesstir well. Cover& cook on low heat setting for 4 hours. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375. Scrape seeds from acorn squashcut in half lengthwise. Cut each half into 4 wedges. Peel sweet potatoescut into 1/2-inch wedges. In large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add leekscook 5 minutes or until tender. Add potatoescook 3 minutes. Add squashcook 3 minutes. Stir in marmaladecook 1 minute. Add broth, orange juice and hoisin sauce. Bring to boil. Add thighscover. Bake for 40 minutes or until chicken is done. Mix maple syrup and arrowroot in small bowl until smooth. Add to panstir until thickened. Serve over rice.

In a medium bowl, combine milk and chips. Place bowl in microwave oven and cook on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Cook for 30 seconds longer, stirring. Continue cooking until chips are melted. Stir until mixture is smooth. In a large bowl beat the whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold chips mixture into whipped cream. Spread over ice cream. Sprinkle with miniature marshmallows. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cream together the butter and sugars. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and beat until light and creamy. Combine the dry ingredients. Add the dry ingredients, and mix well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop the cookie dough in rounded spoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 9 to 10 minutes. Cool on the pan for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks. Store the cookies in an airtight container.

Heat the oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for about 5 minutes per side until cooked through. Add the carrots and broth. Bring to a boil. Stir in the mustard and honey. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Stir in the cornstarch and cook until thickened. Garnish with fresh parsley.

In a medium saucepan bring water to a boil. Add the orzo and cook until tender, 8-10 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, combine the lemon juice, marjoram, mustard, and 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large bowl. Whisk in the lemon zest. Add the cooked orzo and stir until evenly coated. Add the feta and the remaining 1 tablespoon oil and toss to combine. Add the scallions, olives, and tomatoes. Toss to mix well. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Brown the meat and seasonings in a large skillet. Stir in the onions and bell pepper. Add the refried beans and heat through. Spread mixture on the flour tortillas and roll up. Place the tostados in a greased baking dish and sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Bake in a preheated 350f oven until the cheese is melted. Makes about 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line 2 large cookie sheets with parchment paper or lightly grease. In a medium bowl combine the ground flax seeds with the water. Set aside for 15 minutes. In a large bowl combine the all-purpose flour, ground flax seeds and the baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine the sugars, butter and egg until light and fluffy. Add the flax mixture from step 1. Add the vanilla. Add the all-purpose mixture from step 2. Mix until just combined. Fold in the peanut butter. Using a rounded tablespoon, drop the dough onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 11 to 13 minutes until set. Cool for 2 minutes on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

In a wok over high heat, add the oil. When the oil is hot add the onions. Saute the onions until they are soft and translucent. Add the mangoes, vinegar and orange juice. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the banana. Add the ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Add the raisins. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the brown sugar. Cook for 1 minute. Add the serrano chili. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove the chili. Serve.

Combine oats, water and salt in a sauce pan. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute, stirring often. Add banana and cook another minute or two longer, stirring occasionally. Add rum and splenda and stir well. Cook another minute or two longer stirring constantly until the banana is cooked through and the liquid is absorbed by the oats. Serve warm or cold. Garnish with whipped cream and brown sugar and a few sliced bananas.

Cook noodles as directed. Drain and place in greased baking dish. Add butter. Saute onion and ham in same skillet until onions are tender. Add caraway seeds. Combine and add noodles. Heat thru. Serve as a main dish or a side dish.

Cut the white cabbage into wedges, then into chunks. In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat, then add the chopped onion to the pan to cook until softened. Add the ground allspice to the onions for a minute or two before adding the bacon. Continue to cook the bacon for about 10 minutes before adding the cabbage to the pan. Cook the cabbage until softened, then add the bacon back in. Salt and pepper to taste, then serve with toasted bread, if desired.

Combine the vinaigrette dressing and cream cheese in a food processor. Process until smooth. Set aside. Combine the tomatoes, basil and pine nuts in a bowl. Toss well. Cook the angel hair pasta according to package directions. Drain well. Add the shrimp to the hot pasta. Toss gently to coat. Add the tomatoes. Add the dressing mixture. Stir until well combined. Serve hot.

Place the brisket in a large pot along with the onions. Add the bay leaf, garlic clove and red potatoes. Add the paprika and the water. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly. Add the barley. Cook at a slow boil for 1 hour. Remove the bay leaf. Serve the stew with the vegetables and the potatoes.

Preheat the broiler. Toss the mushrooms in the shallots, garlic, olive oil, peppers and herbs. Broil on a foil lined baking sheet for 10 minutes until golden brown. Top the slices of crostini toast with the cheese and the mushrooms. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Drain celery, peppers and onions. Place in large bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle top with buttery crackers. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.

Grease a 8 inch square cake tin. Put the butter and sugar in a large bowl and beat well until light and creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the lemon essence and zest. Fold in the self raising flour. Mix well. Pour the mixture into the tin and bake for 40 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Leave the cake in the tin. Drizzle the icing over the cake and cut into squares.

Place flaked coconut on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees F for about 5 minutes. Remove from oven and cool on wax paper. In a mixing bowl combine 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup melted butter, 1 beaten egg and 1 tsp. vanilla extractdip one slice of white bread in this mixture then dip into coconut, turning to coat both sides. Repeat with remaining bread. Place on wax paper and cool. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Dip chicken in flour, then dip in egg and then dip in breadcrumbs. Heat oil over medium high heat. Fry chicken until golden brown. Remove to paper towel lined platter. Combine mustard and vinegar and pour over top of fried chicken. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain off any excess liquid.

Rinse and drain collards. In a large stock pot or dutch oven, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook until transluscent. Add collards and cook until wilted, about 10 minutes. Add barbecue sauce and cook for another 5 minutes. Add maple syrup and stir until blended. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Bring cold water to boil. Add bratwursts, boil for 5 minutes or until they begin to float on top. Drain and cool. Brown sausage pieces on all sides. Add butter, flour, and salt to bratwursts and continue to cook for another minute. Add enough cold water to cover bratwursts, bring to boil, cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes or until tender. Add sour cream, bring to boil and cook 1 minute longer. Serve over noodles or rice or potatoes.
I have been working on the sour cream dough recipe since last night, but I've given up for the night. I'm thinking it might be a combination of too much flour (I was trying to make a thicker dough to make the strudel) and not enough sour cream (I thought 1/2 cup would make a difference). I have been trying to make a thicker dough than the recipe called forI'm thinking that may have been a mistake too!
I will try it again tomorrow morning. I've read that the d

Heat apple juice and broth to a boil in saucepan. Stir in cornstarch and water. Stir until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat. Add mustard. Cut slits in roast. Insert garlic into slits. Place roast in 2-quart casserole dish. Pour sauce over roast. Cover and bake at 350 degrees F for 2 hours. Uncover and continue baking until tender when pierced with fork, about 40 minutes longer. Yield: 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Spray a large jellyroll pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine potato slices and seafood seasoning. Arrange potato slices in an even layer on the pan. Bake 10 minutes. Carefully turn potato slices over. Cut salmon into 8 even slices. Place each slice of salmon on one of the potato slices. Bake 10 minutes or until salmon is opaque.

In a shallow bowl or dish, combine olive oil, lemon-pepper seasoning and oregano. Add the steaks and turn to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour. Preheat broiler to high. Grill or broil until desired degree of doneness. Remove from the heat and let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.
You can easily search for recipes by entering your search term/s into the search box which is located at the top of this page or you can also use the Advanced Search function to search by ingredient, cook time or by recipe collection. You can also use the Recipe Finder to find recipes by their collection or by keyword or ingredient.

Shred the red cabbage. Slice the carrots. Place both in a bowl. Add the cilantro and lime juice. Squeeze the apple cider vinegar over the mixture. Toss well. Season with salt. Add the chili powder. Toss again.
I love to make different cole slaw recipes. I don't think I'll ever get tired of trying new ones.
I love cole slaw. I use to make a different recipe every time I would make it.
I love to make different cole slaw recipes. I don't think I'll ever get tired of trying new ones. I love to use different cole slaw recipes for potluck dinners. I'm always asked to bring a dish.
I've always wanted to try the sweet and sour red cabbage salad.
I love the chilies chutney recipe. I'll try it soon.
I'll be making the danish pickled red cabbage roedkaal.

In a heavy saucepan, saute the onions and garlic in the oil for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the greens and stir-fry for a minute. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes until the greens are tender but still crisp. Remove from the heat and puree with a stick blender. Return to the pot and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat the bacon drippings in a large skillet over medium heat. While the bacon cooks, wash the mushrooms and cut into slices. Saute the mushrooms in the drippings until they are softened. Remove the mushrooms from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside. In the same skillet saute the chopped onion in the drippings until the onion is transparent. Break the eggs into the skillet, add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper, and cook for 5 to 10 minutes until the whites are set. Sprinkle the cheese over the top of the eggs and place in the oven until the cheese is melted. Serve with whole wheat toast or biscuits.

In a large bowl, combine the green beans, onion and cheese. In a small bowl combine the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Pour over the green bean mixture and toss to coat. Cover the bowl and let marinate for at least 1 hour. Sprinkle with pecan pieces and serve.

Line 8 x 8 inch baking pan with foil. Spray foil with oil. Drain cherries reserving juice. In a large bowl combine maraschino cherries and maraschino cherry juice. Press into prepared pan. Melt semisweet chocolate morsels in a double boiler over low heat. Stir in sweetened condensed milk. Pour over cherries. Melt bittersweet chocolate squares in a double boiler over low heat. Spread over cherries. Sprinkle with nuts. Chill. Remove from pan and cut into squares.

Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain it well. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the broccoli and sugar snap peas and cook until crisp-tender. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the zucchini and cook until crisp-tender. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, lemon juice and 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper. Season the broccoli mixture with 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Add half of it to the skillet and stir until it is heated through. Add the pasta, toss to combine. Add the remaining broccoli mixture and the lemon cream cheese sauce. Stir until heated through. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
The Pasta dishes are delicious! I am a vegetarian so I am excited to try some of these recipes. Thanks for the ideas!

In a medium bowl, combine milk and buttermilk. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. In another medium bowl combine eggs, cornmeal and dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and blend well. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium high heat. Pour batter into the hot skillet. Bake for about 30 minutes or until done. Allow to cool for a few minutes. Slice and serve.

Peel and core 4 apples. Cut into 8 wedges. Place in a crock pot. Add 1 cup juice, 1 cup boiling water and 1/2 teaspoon each of cinnamon and vanilla extract. Cook on low for 6 hours. Stir occasionally. Serve warm or chilled.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the roast beef and cook until evenly browned. Add the vegetables and continue cooking until the vegetables are soft and the roast beef is no longer pink. Add the salsa and cook for 30 seconds more. Place 1 slice of each of the breads cut side down onto a cookie sheet. Spread about 3/4 cup of the roast beef mixture over each slice of bread. Sprinkle each with 1/4 cup of the cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the bread is golden and crisp and the cheese is melted. Serve warm. Serves 2.

Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic and mushrooms. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add the beef bouillon cube to the pan. Stir to blend. Add the beef broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the sour cream. Simmer for 1 minute. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle the toasted chopped nuts over the top. Serve immediately.
Melt chocolate chips and peanut butter together. Add rice krispies. Drop by spoonful onto wax paper. Can be made into bars. Let stand until firm.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saut the onion and garlic until the onion is translucent. Add the rice, curry powder, salt and pepper. Stir to combine thoroughly. Slowly add the coconut milk, stirring to combine thoroughly. Cover and cook for 20 minutes, until the liquid has mostly evaporated. Meanwhile, rinse the lentils in a fine-mesh strainer under cold running water to remove excess starch. Stir the lentils into the rice mixture, along with the frozen spinach and salt to taste. Transfer the mixture to a 9 by 13-inch baking dish. Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Uncover and bake for another 10 minutes, until the liquid has evaporated. Serve hot with lime wedges.

In small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Beat at low speed until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for several hours to blend flavors. Combine salad ingredients in large bowl. Serve with dressing.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft and translucent. Add green beans and stir to coat with oil. Cover and cook for 3 minutes more, stirring once or twice. Meanwhile, prepare the rice according to package directions. When the beans are tender, add the rice and stir to combine. Add basil and pepper to taste. Stir in the tuna and cherry tomatoes. Heat until the tuna is warm and the tomatoes are softened.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut the french baguette into 1/2-inch thick slices and spread with pesto sauce. Layer with bacon, tomato slices and lettuce. Sprinkle with pepper and salt. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine blue cheese and sour cream in a small bowl until smooth. Spread evenly over both sides of the steak. Grill or broil for 5 minutes per side for medium rare. Top with additional blue cheese before serving if desired. Serve with your choice of side dishes.

Beat together cream cheese and spring onions. Add ham, cheddar and black pepper. Mix well. Fold in macadamia nuts. Pat into a rectangle about 10 x 6 inches. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Slice into small pieces and serve. Serves 4 to 6 as an appetizer.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, jalapeno and rice and saute until the rice is lightly toasted. Stir in the beans and thyme. Add the coconut milk and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil over high heat, then cover the pot. Reduce the heat to medium low, and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes. Serve topped with green onions and black beans, if desired.
Mix together the garlic, green onions, jalapeno, avocado, and lime juice. Add the chili powder, salt, and tomato. Mix well. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 200c. Cut chicken into 4 portions. Wrap each piece of chicken in a piece of bacon. Arrange on a roasting tray. Heat half the olive oil in a frying pan and cook the capsicums for 4 minutes until lightly browned. Add cherry tomatoes, garlic and remaining oil. Cook for 5 minutes or until tomato juices run clear. Transfer to a serving dish. Arrange potato slices on top of capsicum mixture. Arrange chicken on top of potatoes. Bake for 40 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with capsicum mixture.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat together eggs, milk, sour cream, salt and pepper until smooth. In a medium bowl, combine the shredded cheese and the green onions. Grease 12-cup shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Pour half of the egg mixture in the dish. Top with 1/2 the cheese mixture. Spread the remaining egg mixture over the cheese. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-40 minutes until puffed and lightly browned.
name: southern egg scrambled breakfast
ingredients: eggs, sour cream, cheddar cheese, ham, onion, fresh mushrooms, green bell pepper, salt and pepper, butter
preparation:In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add mushrooms, bell peppers, and onions. Saute until onions are translucent and tender. Add diced ham and stir until steaming. In the meantime, in large mixing bowl, crack and add the dozen eggs, salt and pe

Place pork chops in skillet with oil, pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Sauté until pork is browned on both sides. Add tomatoes, stirring occasionally. Cook until thickened. Add pasta and toss until coated. Serve with grated cheese on top if desired.

2 cups flour 1/2 teaspoon of salt 3/4 cup shortening 3/4 cup butter 2 tablespoons of water Mix together. Divide half of this mixture. Set aside for one minute. Add one egg yolk to 3 tablespoons of water and mix until smooth. Add 1/2 cup ice water to remaining mixture. Mix until smooth and not crumbly. Add yolk mixture to other mixture and mix together. Roll out on lightly floured board and use as desired.

In a large saute pan saute the onion and garlic in the olive oil. Add the sweet potato and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the spices and cook for about 5 more minutes. Add the chili and cilantro and mix. Serve in flour tortillas with sour cream and cheddar cheese.

Soak dry broad beans in water overnight. Drain. Cover with water in a pot. Bring to a boil then reduce to simmer. Cook until tender. Mash with a potato masher. Add yogurt and molasses. Add dry mustard, brown sugar, and salt. Stir to combine. Simmer in pot until hot. Serve.
Combine the veggies in a large bowl. Pour the dressing over the veggies and mix well. Thread the veggies onto skewers. Serve with your favorite dip.

Peel 3 medium russet potatoes and grate coarsely. In a bowl combine grated potatoes, 1 egg, 1/4 cup whole milk, 1 teaspoon sugar, 1/4 teaspoon white pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt. Mix well. Heat a heavy skillet or griddle over medium heat. Rub with butter. For each cake pour 1/4 cup of batter into a circular shape in skillet or griddle. Fry for 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve hot with butter or maple syrup.

Place the baby red potatoes in a large bowl and toss with the italian seasoning, parsley flakes, onion powder, garlic powder, kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add the olive oil flavored cooking spray to a 10x10x2 inch baking dish and spread evenly. Add the baby red potatoes and toss until well coated. Bake for 40 minutes or until the baby red potatoes are tender and golden brown. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350. In large bowl, combine the chicken with the onion, chilies, broth and soups. Set aside. Layer half the tortillas in bottom of greased 9x13 pan. Spread with half the chicken mixture. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered 30 minutes.

Bring white vinegar to a boil and add dry mustard. Stir until dry mustard is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Meanwhile, in a blender combine egg, sugar and onions. Add to mustard and blend until smooth. Stir in horseradish, lemon juice and spices. Put into a container and refrigerate. Will keep for 3 weeks in refrigerator.

Combine the cornstarch with the water, stirring until smooth. Place the pineapple in a shallow casserole dish. Add the chicken and marinade. Combine the mustard and rosemary in a small bowl. Brush on both sides of the chicken. Place the dish in the oven. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with cherries and serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile in large skillet brown sausage and drain. Add sauerkraut and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in onions. Drain any excess liquid. Pour into a 11x7x2 inch baking dish. Mix cream of mushroom soup with water. Pour over sausage mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and bake 5 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut the banana slices into quarters. In a small bowl combine the banana slices with lemon juice. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the slices and saute until golden brown. Cut the phyllo dough into 16 pieces. Heat in the oven for a few minutes until the pieces are slightly softened. In a shallow bowl or plate, combine the hot fudge topping and the caramel candies. Dip each phyllo pastry triangle in the caramel mixture. Arrange the pastry triangles on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Top each pastry triangle with a sauteed banana slice. Wrap each pastry roll in a piece of phyllo dough and roll to cover the banana. Place the pastry rolls on the parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake in the oven until golden brown. Roll the pastry rolls in the caramel mixture and garnish with the chopped pecans.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut the squash into 1-inch cubes. In a large saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the squash and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally until tender, about 10 minutes. Add the garlic and cook an additional 1 minute. Add the pecans and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the vanilla, sugar and parsley. Mix well. Pour into a 1-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 teaspoon of parsley. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cool slightly. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the egg, milk, sugar and baking powder. Beat until smooth. In another large bowl combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drop the batter by the tablespoon into the skillet. Cook for about 2 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Serve with syrup.

Cut up the cucumbers into small chunks, about 1/2 inch in size. Chop the onion in small chunks. Cut the red pepper into small squares. Drain the juice from the vegetables. Combine the cucumber mixture with the chopped onion, red pepper, 2 tablespoons of sugar, the flour and ginger. Mix well. Add the rest of the sugar, the salt, the turmeric, the celery seed and the vinegar. Mix well. Bring the mixture to a boil, and boil for 1 minute. Remove the mixture from heat and let cool. Put the relish into jars to can. It will keep for 1 year if canned correctly.

Thaw puff pastry according to package instructions. Cut pastry into 9 squares. Arrange a layer of feta and a layer of sun-dried tomatoes on each square. Top with a layer of spinach. Combine the egg and milk and brush over each square. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until puffy and golden. Serve warm.

Bring water and sugar to a boil in a small heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium high heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Add the cinnamon sticks and pumpkin pie spice and cook for another 5 minutes or until the flavors meld. Remove from heat and add the vanilla. Let cool completely. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. Use to flavor coffee or tea or any other drink.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease bottom and sides of pie pan with cooking spray. Beat butter and cocoa in large bowl until smooth. Add eggs and beat well. Stir in vanilla, flour and saltmix well. Spread in prepared pie pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Beat together powdered sugar and milk until smooth. Drizzle over cooled brownie pie. Sprinkle with nuts, if desired. Yield: 1 pie.

In a heat-proof bowl or pitcher, pour boiling water over the tea bags. Let stand for 10 minutes. Remove tea bags. Strain the tea into a large pitcher, and add apple juice. Add allspice and stir. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. Add lemon slice to each glass before serving.

Cover each hen with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover. In a small saucepan, combine onion and butter. Cook and stir until onion is tender. Add soy sauce and apple. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Remove from heat. Place 1 cup of apple mixture on each hen. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

Mix together 1 cup powdered sugar and 1/2 cup powdered egg whites. Add 1/2 cup warm water, stirring until smooth and well mixed. Add a few drops of food coloring if desired. Tint icing to suit your tastes. Spoon icing into a pastry bag fitted with a #110 decorating tip and pipe on wax paper. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place hotdogs and rolls in shallow pan. In small bowl, combine mustard and pepper. Brush each roll with some of the mustard mixture. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until rolls are golden brown. Meanwhile, grill the hot dogs. Serve with hotdogs and rolls. Top with remaining mustard mixture and cheese.
In a large bowl combine all the ingredients. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 375. Line a baking sheet with foil. Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowladd shrimp and toss well. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Spread the shrimp mixture in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through. Sprinkle with green onion before serving.
Sassy Barbecued Shrimp is a simple, easy shrimp recipe. These shrimp are cooked with a sweet and savory sauce that has a spicy kick from the chili paste. The shrimp are baked in a foil-lined baking sheet with the sauce and then sprinkled with green onion before serving.
Shrimp are cooked with a sweet and spicy sauce in Sassy Barbecued Shrimp.
Sassy Barbecued Shrimp is a simple recipe made with shrimp and a sweet and spicy sauce. The shrimp are baked in a foil-lined baking sheet with the sauce and then spr

In a large heavy saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the brown sugar, light cream, cocoa, butter and vanilla. Bring the mixture to a full rolling boil. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the pecans, salt and vanilla extract and stir well to blend. Quickly drop the mixture by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet. Place in the refrigerator while you prepare the chocolate coating. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler over low heat or in the microwave according to the package directions. Quickly dip the praline balls into the melted chocolateplace back on the wax paper. Repeat with the remaining balls of dough. Allow the chocolate-coated pralines to stand in the refrigerator for a few minutes to set before serving. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 6 months.
Pralines are a confection of North American origin that is made by cooking down sugar with a small amount of fat, such as butter,
Combine apple juice, fruit, and honey in a blender or food processor container. Coverblend until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend until slushy. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 4 hours.

Cream sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Add egg and milk and beat until smooth. Add flour, oatmeal, baking powder, and salt and mix well. Add raisins and nuts and mix thoroughly. Form into balls with wet hands and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Combine coconut and oats. Add quick-cooking oats. Add whole wheat flour. Add all-purpose flour. Add baking powder, baking soda and salt. Mix. Add egg. Mix. Add mashed bananas. Add softened butter. Mix. Add raisins. Mix. Add chopped nuts. Mix. Scoop into muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool.
The best banana nut bread recipe and other great tasting recipes with a healthy slant from SparkRecipes.com.
I really wanted to like this recipe. I made it with brown sugar and honey (no white sugar). I also added some flax meal and added extra oats and nuts. It came out tasting more like banana bread. It was okay. I think my mistake was adding the bananas at the end. I think it would have been better if I had mixed them into the wet batter.
I made this for my family on New Years Day and we all loved it
Peel and cut carrots and parsnips into thin slices. Steam them for 5 minutes. Mash together the vegetables and butter. Stir in the nutmeg and season to taste.
Pour all ingredients in blender. Blend well at high speed. Pour into glasses and serve with lime slices if desired.

While broccoli is still hot from blanching, heat the butter and extra virgin olive oil in a pan until a light brown colour. Add roasted almond flakes and toss. Place blanched broccoli in pan. Pour over with juice of the lemon, and use seasonings to taste. Serve.

Boil the spaghetti in plenty of salty water until al dente. Drain and place in a large bowl. Mix together the olive oil, chilli, garlic and parsley in a small jug. Add seasoning to taste. Pour over the pasta, mix well and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325. Beat 1 cup of cake mix in large bowl with 1 cup margarine and 1 egg. Press into bottom of a 10x15 pan. Beat remaining 2 eggs and cream cheese until smooth. Stir in powdered sugar and coconut. Spread over crust. Bake at 325 for 40-45 minutes until golden brown. Cool. Cut into squares.

Sprinkle both sides of cutlets with sage and pepper and dredge cutlets in flour and shake off excess. Whisk eggs in a shallow bowl. Put bread crumbs in another shallow bowl. Dip each cutlet in eggs, then in the crumbs to coat. Heat 1/4 inch oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, fry cutlets in hot oil for 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook chicken. Cool. In a small bowl, combine chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, green beans, yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, and pepper. Chill. Serve on lettuce leaves.
Celery stalk is a vegetable that is used in many recipes. It is an excellent source of vitamin A and vitamin C. Celery has many benefits. It is used for medicinal purposes as well. Celery stalk is a good source of fiber. Fiber is essential for proper functioning of the digestive system. It also helps reduce cholesterol levels. Celery contains flavonoids called coumarins. Coumarins are anti-inflammatory agents. They help reduce inflammation in joints. Celery contains phytonutrients called luteolin. Luteolin is known to improve immunity. It also helps reduce blood sugar levels. Celery contains polyphenols called caffeic acid. Caffeic acid is known as anti-oxidant. It helps protect cells against damage caused by free radicals. Celery contains phytochemicals called phen
Brown pork with onion and garlic. Add seasonings. Brown slightly. Combine with tomatoes and simmer till almost gone. Add pasta. Serve with cheddar cheese on top.

Pound the cube steak to thin. Slice the broccoli into small pieces. In a bowl, combine the marinade ingredients. Add the meat and marinade for about an hour. Cook the meat in a skillet until it is browned. Add the broccoli and cook until tender.

Cook pasta in boiling water. Drain and run cold water over noodles to stop cooking. Drain and set aside. In large bowl, combine tidbits, lemon juice and eggs. Mix flour and saltsprinkle over tidbits and mix. Heat to boiling. Add sugar. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add pasta. Add fruit and cool whip. Refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, sprinkle with colored marshmallows. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and lightly flour 10 inch tube pan. Cream together butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla. Blend in flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt. Add milk as needed to bring to spreading consistency. Pour into prepared pan. Bake 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes in pan on wire rack, then remove from pan to cool completely. Prepare topping by combining cinnamon and pecans. Stir until well blended. Sprinkle over cake. Makes 1 10x2 inch cake.
Place all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Serve in chilled glasses and garnish with chai tea leaves and mint sprigs.

In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt. Cut in the cold butter with a pastry blender or two knives until the mixture resembles a coarse meal. Add the cream cheese and stir with a fork until just combined. In a small bowl combine the milk and egg, whisking well. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixturestir until just combined. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead gently until the dough is no longer crumbly but still slightly shaggy, about 3 or 4 turns. Roll the dough out into a rectangle about 1 inch thick. Cut into 10 or 12 2-inch squares. Place the squares onto a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Bake until the edges are lightly browned, about 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and transfer the scones to a wire rack. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together the margarine, butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat until smooth. Combine the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt). Add to the creamed mixture alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until the dough is smooth, but don't over mix. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Roll the dough on a lightly floured board or piece of wax paper into a log about 1 1/2 inches thick. Wrap the log well with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 12 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut the log into 1/4-inch slices and place on ungreased baking sheets about 1 inch apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly golden on the edges. Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks. These cookies can be frosted or iced

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the spinach, stirring frequently until the leaves are wilted. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the breadcrumbs and parmesan. Spread 2 cups of the mixture in an ungreased 12 inch pie pan. Mix together the Bisquick, eggs, vegetable oil, oregano, salt and pepper until combined. Spread the remaining mixture over the first layer. Bake for 20 minutes or until the crust is lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm.
Heat oil in skillet over med. Add cabbage, cook until soft. Add celery and green pepper. Cook until crisp tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Can use leftover bratwurst.
Cook sausage in skillet over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain well. Add reserved pineapple juice, sugar, cinnamonheat to boiling. Stir in bananasheat through. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat the oven to 350F. In a medium bowl, beat together the milk and eggs until frothy. Add the chicken wings and soak for 30 minutes. Drain the wings and pat dry. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, cayenne, and salt and pepper. Dip the wings in the flour mixture to coat. Dip into the egg mixture and allow excess to drain. Coat in the breadcrumbs. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Melt the butter and mix in the sesame seeds. Pour over the chicken and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Place 1 tortilla on work surface. Spoon 1/4 cup of red chili sauce onto center of tortilla. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of cheese and onion over red chili sauce. Roll up tightly. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Place seam-side down in 2-quart baking dish. Pour remaining red chili sauce over enchiladas. Cover. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve with warm lettuce salad.

In a large bowl combine the chocolate chips, butter and condensed milk until melted. Cool for about 20 minutes or until thickened. Add almond liqueur and the almonds. Mix until the almonds are coated with the mixture. Form the mixture into one inch balls and roll the balls in the cocoa. Place on a wax paper lined cookie sheet. Refrigerate until firm. Store refrigerated or freeze to keep fresh.

Wash and dry the chilies and remove the seeds. Blend the remaining ingredients together, and mix in the blended chilies. Transfer the mixture to an air-tight container and store in the refrigerator for up to a week. Use it to add zest to soups, stews, and casseroles.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and stir until golden but not browned. Add the spinach and stir until wilted. Add the almonds and pine nuts. Stir until combined. Transfer to a platter. Drizzle with the lemon juice. Toss well. Add the ham. Sprinkle with the salt. Serve.
name: spinach with raisins and pine nuts
ingredients: raisins, fresh spinach, olive oil, garlic cloves, pine nuts, salt, pepper
preparation:Place the raisins in a small bowl, add very hot water to cover and soak till plump, 10-15 minutes. Drain well and pat dry with a paper towel, and set aside. If using fresh spinach - rinse but do not drain spinach, place in a medium saucepan over medium heat and cover the pan. Cook the spinach in the water that clings to the leaves till wilted 4-5 minutes, stirring a few times. Transfer the spinach to a

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add leek, curry powder, and ginger. Cook until softened. Add peas, carrots, celery, broth and seasonings. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer until peas are tender, about 20 minutes. Working in batches, purée in a blender until smooth. Add milk, heat through, and serve.

Place green onions in a bowl. Add the cherry tomatoes and toss to combine. Add the oil, vinegar, garlic and herbs. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Serve with a drizzle of balsamic glaze and olives.

Boil potatoes until tender. Mash potatoes with butter. Add salt and pepper to taste. Heat oil in frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until lightly browned. Add mashed potatoes to onion mixture and gently mix well. Serve hot.

In a large skillet cook green pepper and onion in butter over low heat until tender. Add kidney beans. Cook 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, chili powder, hot dogs and cook over low heat until heated through. Serve over corn chips. Top with sharp american cheese.

Mix peanut butter, 1/4 cup milk, and pudding in large bowl at least 2 minutes or until well blended. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup milkspread into 13x9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate 1 hour or until set. In small microwave-safe dish, melt butterstir in powdered sugar and cocoa. Microwave on high 1-2 minutes or until meltedstir until smooth. Drizzle over top of peanut mixture. Sprinkle with grahamscut into bars. Store covered in refrigerator. Serve chilled.

In a saucepan combine butter, honey, brown sugar and corn syrup. Boil gently for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the oats. Allow to cool for 15 minutes. Mix the nuts into the oats. Using a teaspoon spoon the mixture into a greased tin. Bake at 180c for 15 to 20 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 400f. Lightly brush 8×8 baking dish with olive oil and coat with a light dusting of salt and black pepper. Layer cauliflower florets into baking dish and lightly sprinkle with more salt and black pepper. Roast in oven until golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork, about 25-30 minutes. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour and cook, stirring frequently, until lightly browned and bubbly. Slowly pour milk into flour mixture and whisk until thickened and smooth. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Remove from heat and stir in Gruyere cheese. Pour cheese sauce over roasted cauliflower and bake uncovered until bubbly, about 7-8 minutes. Sprinkle with more freshly grated cheese and serve hot.

Spray muffin pan with cooking spray and set aside. Preheat oven to temperature as stated on carton. Roll out biscuits on a lightly floured surface to make a 14-in circle. Fold circle in half and press together along the edges, making a ring shape. Place one ring at a time in muffin pan. Press around edges of ring. Brush top of rings with melted butter. Sprinkle with sugar. Bake as directed on carton. Cool for a few minutes. Place 1/2 cup of whipped topping on each shortcake. Garnish with a handful of berries.
Wash, peel and slice the carrot. Fry them with the butter and salt in a saucepan until they are done and turn golden brown. Pour the marsala wine on top of the vegetables before serving.
Mix all ingredients together and serve with crackers.

Cook beef, onion, and green pepper in 1 tablespoon butter until meat is brown. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in cooked rice and mix well. Pour into 9x13x2-inch pan coated with nonstick cooking spray. Melt remaining butter in 1 tablespoon hot water in a small bowladd bread crumbsmix well. Sprinkle over meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 1 minute more or until cheese is melted.

Prepare marinade by combining first 3 ingredients. In a small bowl stir together remaining ingredientsset aside. In a large shallow dish combine salmon with marinade and turn to coat. Marinate salmon in refrigerator at least 1 hour. Remove salmon from marinade. Grill salmon over medium-hot coals 3-4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. Garnish with scallions.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add wontons. Cook for 1 minute or until floating. Remove with slotted spoon. In a small saucepan, combine chicken broth, gingerroot, and straw mushrooms. Simmer for 15 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Place wontons in serving bowl. Pour hot broth mixture over wontons. Garnish with green onions.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Season the meat with salt and pepper. Dredge the meat in the all-purpose flour. Heat the butter in an ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the meat for about 5 minutes per side. Add the honey to the pan with the porkcook for another minute or two, until the honey is bubbling. Transfer the skillet to the oven for about 20 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through. Sprinkle with toasted pecans before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and lightly flour 2 9-inch layer pans or 1 13x9-inch pan. Blend together cake mix and sour cream. Add oil and water. Beat 3 minutes on medium speed. Add egg whites and beat 3 minutes. Add vanilla and beat 30 seconds more. Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 30-35 minutes until done. Cool 10 minutes then remove from pans. Cool completely before frosting.

Preheat over to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly spray a large baking pan with cooking spray. Place spears on pan, standing up. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for about 10 minutes until just tender. In a small bowl, combine shallots, light butter and balsamic vinegar. In a small bowl combine butter, balsamic vinegar and shallot. Spread mixture on toasted bread or crackers. Serve hot with roasted asparagus.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Grease a 10-inch pie plate with 1 teaspoon olive oil. Beat eggs with salt and pepper until foamy. Add hash browns and mix well. Pour into pie plate. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, add onions and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Return to oven and continue baking until puffy and golden brown, another 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Let sit for 5 minutes before slicing into wedges to serve. Serve with fruit salad.

Mix gelatin and boiling water. Stir until completely dissolved. Add cold water. Stir in cool whip with a wire whisk until smooth. Refrigerate until mixture is thick and can mound well. Spoon into a glass.

Slice avocados in half and remove pit. Scoop out pulp into a bowl. Add onion, cilantro, garlic, lime juice, mayonnaise and hot sauce. Mash with fork. Add chopped tomatoes. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened. Add the red lentils and cook for a few minutes. Add the water, bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Add the hot red chili and the ginger. Cook for a further minute or two. Add the spinach, lemon juice and seasoning. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the spinach is soft. Serve sprinkled with the coriander. Makes 4 servings.

Drain the navy beans then place in a large pot with 7 cups of cold water. Add all the veggies and cook for 1 hour or until everything is tender. Add the olive oil and salt. Cook for another 10- 15 minutes. Cut the eggs in half and add to the bean mixture. Toss the salad lightly. Just prior to serving sprinkle cubed feta cheese and olives over the top of the salad. Sprinkle with some extra dried oregano and sea salt if desired.

Mix together hamburger, egg and rice crispies. Add salt, onion and pepper. Roll into balls and place in casserole dish. In saucepan combine ketchup and catsup with tomato soup and mustard and cook until thickened. Pour over hamburger balls and bake at 350 for one hour. Serve with lettuce, tomato and mayonnaise.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add salt to the water. Cut the stems off the bok choy leaves. Add the stems to the boiling water. Blanch for 2 minutes. Remove the stems from the water and rinse with cold water. Set the stems aside. Bring another pot of water to boil. Add the leaves to the boiling water and blanch for 3 minutes. Drain the leaves and set aside. Heat the sunflower oil in a wok. Add the ginger and stir fry for 1 minute. Add the stems and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the leaves. Toss for 1 minute. Add the soy sauce, fish sauce and red chili. Toss until well mixed. Serve immediately.
name: baby bok choy and garlic in sweet chili sauce
ingredients: oil, garlic cloves, ginger, baby bok choy, sweet chili sauce, salt and pepper
preparation:Heat a large saut pan over medium-high heat. Add oil, garlic and ginger. Cook until fragrant but not

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Arrange the tomatoes in a single layer in a small shallow pan and pour in the vinegar and a few pinches of the salt substitute and pepper. Drizzle the tomatoes with the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil and sprinkle with the remaining pinches of the seasonings and the basil and the garlic cloves. Cover with foil and bake until the tomatoes are just tender when pierced with a fork. Uncover and stir the tomatoes gently with a wooden spoon, then transfer them to a serving bowl and serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat grill. In a small bowl combine yogurt and garlic. Remove and discard giblets from chicken breasts. Combine yogurt mixture and soup-mix. Rub mixture over chicken breasts. Grill for 15 - 20 minutes or until done. Remove from grill and serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. In small bowl combine flour, baking soda and salt. In a large bowl combine butter and sugars. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Add egg whites and beat until combined. Add the flour mixture and beat to combine. Add the cocoa and mix until just combined. Stir in the chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons on to ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until just beginning to brown around the edges. Transfer to cooling rack. Cool completely. Yields 36 small cookies.

Combine all the marinade ingredients except the oil in a blender and process until smooth. Add the oil and blend briefly until just combined. Remove the marinade from the blender and pour over the flank steaks. Place the steaks in a large zip-top bag and marinate for 4 hours at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator. After marinating, preheat the oven to 375f degrees. Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat and add 1 1/2 tablespoons of the oil. Sear the steaks for 1 minute per side. Transfer the steaks to an ovenproof dish and bake for 5 to 6 minutes for medium rare. Slice the steaks across the grain and serve immediately with warm tortillas and guacamole. Serves 4

Put the dried fruit in a bowl with 2 tablespoons of tea. Pour over the brandy and mix well. Leave overnight. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a loaf pan with greased paper. Sift together the flour, tea, baking powder, salt, mixed spice and butter. Beat in the eggs and add the dried fruit mixture. Spoon into the loaf pan. Bake for 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours or until well-risen and golden brown. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out to cool on a wire rack. Dust with icing sugar. Serve warm with butter.

In a large saut pan or skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add green beans and saut until bright green and lightly browned. Remove from heat and set aside. In the same pan add the shallots and bell peppers and saut until softened and lightly browned. Return the green beans to the pan. Add the garlic powder and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine and serve.

In a large heavy saucepan over medium-high heat, heat olive oil and add onion and cook until lightly browned and softened, 4 to 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until mushrooms are softened and liquid has evaporated. Stir in bay leaf and cook for 1 minute. Add carrot and celery and cook 1 minute or until carrot is coated with mushroom mixture and softened slightly. Pour in broth, bring to a boil and simmer 10 minutes or until carrots are tender and mushrooms are cooked through. Stir in lentils and bay leaf and cook 20 minutes or until lentils are softened and mixture is thickened. Stir in salt and pepper and serve hot with a sprig of fresh rosemary on each serving.

Bring all ingredients to boil except the butter. Reduce heat & simmer until sauce thickens. Add butter & let it melt & thicken a little bit more. This sauce can be served over pork chops & other meats & on pancakes or waffles for breakfast. This sauce is great on fresh apple slices & on ice cream.

Combine the tomatoes and the basil in a saucepan. Cover and simmer on low heat for 15 minutes. Cook the linguine according to package directions. Drain the pasta, reserving the pasta water. Add the cooked pasta to the tomato mixture. Stir in the spinach. Add the olive oil. Season the pasta to taste with the salt and the pepper. Add some of the pasta water if you need to thin the sauce. Serve immediately.

In a bowl combine tuna with the celery, parsley and capers. In another bowl beat together the mayonnaise with lemon juice and the seasonings. Stuff the tuna mixture into the hollow of the tomato halves and cover with the mayonnaise mixture. Sprinkle the tomatoes with parmesan cheese and broil until the cheese melts and turns brown. Serve with crusty italian bread

1. Peel, core and slice the apples and place in a saucepan with the lemon juice and zest and the maple syrup. Simmer until the apples are soft. 2. Remove the apples from the saucepan and place in a bowl. Add the dates and the sesame seeds and mash together until well combined. 3. Stir in the lemon balm and place in the refrigerator to chill. Serve with almonds.

Cook wax & green beans in boiling water for 3 minutes. Drain & rinse with cold water. Mix with kidney beans, onions & green peppers. Combine vinegar & sugar. Add celery seed & minced garlic. Toss with vegetables. Chill.

Prepare an oven-proof 8-inch square baking dish by coating the bottom with cooking spray and then dusting with a mixture of 1/2 cup confectioner's sugar with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Beat the egg whites with the salt and the vinegar until foamy. Gradually beat in the confectioner's sugar. Continue beating while adding the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt until the mixture is very thick. It should be stiff enough to hold its shape when dropped from a spoon. Spread the mixture evenly in the prepared dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn the oven off and let the meringue cool completely inside the oven with the door closed for about 1 hour. To serve, spread the meringue with whipped cream, then top with the fruit or whatever toppings you like.

In a medium size skillet heat the oil. Sprinkle the season salt and pepper over the chicken. Saut the chicken in the pan for 5 minutes on each side. Remove the chicken to a platter. In the same pan add the mushrooms and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Stir in the white wine and simmer until the liquid evaporates. Add the capers. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

Mix granola and tapioca together. Add brown sugar and butter. Mix well and add cherries. Spread in a greased pie dish. Sprinkle with more granola and bake at 350 for about one hour or until the top is golden brown. Let cool and serve.
Cook spaghetti and drain well. Add corn. Add butter and mix together. Add mozzarella cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes.

Place the sugar and corn syrup into a 3 quart saucepan. Heat on medium heat. When mixture comes to a boil, stir in the chocolate and continue stirring. When mixture comes to a full rolling boil and cannot be stirred down, remove from heat. Add the rest of the ingredients and beat until mixture loses its gloss. Pour into a buttered square pan and when cool cut into squares.

In a stockpot or dutch oven over medium heat, add olive oil and saute onion, garlic and jalapeno until onion is softened, about 10 minutes. Add beans and continue to cook and stir for 1 minute. Add vegetable broth and cook for another 3 to 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Season with the cumin and oregano. Add additional seasonings to taste if desired. Serve with cilantro and sour cream.

Cook meat with onion in skillet until meat is browndrain and add taco seasoningadd salsa and stirfill shells with mixture and arrange in shallow baking dishtop with sour creambake at 350 for 15 minutes or until bubbly and hottop with olives, tomato, slices of avocado (optional) and shredded cheeseserve with head of lettuce

In a large pan combine the broth and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil over high heat and simmer for 10 minutes. In a large bowl mix the egg yolks and 1 tablespoon of flour. Add 2 cups of the hot broth. Slowly add the egg mixture into the pot whisking constantly. Bring the mixture back up to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Add the remaining broth and the egg whites. Bring back up to a boil. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the cheese and bread crumbs.

Cut each loaf of bread lengthwise into three pieces. Spread on both sides with butter and place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Combine remaining ingredientsspread evenly over the top of each piece of bread. Bake until the top is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly, about 10 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve warm.

In a heavy skillet saute the jalapeno chile, scallions and garlic in the butter for about 2 minutes. Add the broth and the thyme. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the shrimp. Cook for 3 minutes or until the shrimp is done. Serve the shrimp on the sauce.

Peel and cube 2 pounds of potatoes and place them into a large saucepan of cold water with a dash of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce the heat to a simmer to continue to boil for 15-20 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain the potatoes and return them to the saucepan. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher and add the ricotta cheese and 1/4 cup of butter along with a dash of salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine. Add the finely chopped kale and stir to combine well. Serve immediately.

Melt 4 tbsp of the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and stir to combine. Cook until the mixture becomes light brown and nutty smelling, about 3 minutes. Whisk in the warm milk, heavy cream, and 2/3 of the remaining 4 tbsp of the butter. Bring to a simmer and cook for 1 minute. Add the smoked gouda cheese and stir until it is completely melted. Stir in the paprika and nutmeg. Season to taste with the salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients and bake as directed on package. Let cool. Drizzle with glaze. Glaze: Combine powdered sugar, 2 tablespoons water, and extract.

Add honey, shortening and salt to the container of the bread machine. Add the wheat flour and the white flour. Add the milk and the yeast to the container of the bread machine. Select dough cycle and press start. Let the dough rise for 10 minutes and then punch it down and knead it for 2-3 minutes. Divide the dough into two pieces and shape into loaves. Place the loaves into two greased loaf pans and let the loaves rise until doubled in size for 10 minutes. Bake the loaves at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the loaves are lightly browned and sound hollow when tapped on the bottoms.

Beat the eggs in a bowl and add the lemon juice, the honey and the zest of the orange. Beat again. In a bowl mix the flour with the salt and the pepper and sprinkle over the chicken pieces. Dip each piece of chicken in the lemon juice mixture and coat with the mixture of flour. Brown the pieces in a heavy nonstick skillet in a little butter. Cook over low heat until done. Add the soya sauce and the juice of the orange. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve hot.
Line deep dish pie shell with foil. Line foil with frozen broccoli. Top with bacon. In a bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients and pour over the bacon. Bake at 400 for one hour. Cut while warm.

Preheat oven to 400. Coat a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Sprinkle chicken with thyme and salt and pepper. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine preserves, ketchup, vinegar and tabasco sauce. Bring to a boil and boil 1 minute. Turn off heat and pour over chicken. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until no longer pink.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease muffin tin or line with paper liners. In large bowl, mix together eggs and vegetable oil until light and foamy. Add apple and carrot and mix well. In separate bowl sift together whole wheat and all-purpose flours, baking powder and salt. Fold dry mix into egg mixture until just moistened. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake until golden brown and springs back when touched in center, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes and remove to wire rack to cool completely. Store in an air-tight container for 2 to 3 days. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 425f. Peel and slice 5 or 6 apples and place them into a 9-inch pie pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup flour, 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Dot with 1 tablespoon of butter. Place the pie pan on a cookie sheet and place into the oven. After 20 minutes, add 1/2 cup of oats and 1 tablespoon of butter. Bake another 10 minutes and sprinkle with 1/2 cup flour and 1/4 cup brown sugar. Bake for an additional 10 minutes until crust is golden and the fruit is tender and bubbling. Let cool for 20 minutes and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray 6 round mini tart pans with cooking spray. In a large skillet brown the ground beef with the onion. Drain. Add the remaining ingredients except the eggs. Stir to combine. Divide mixture evenly among the prepared tart pans. Bake for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Remove from oven. Crack an egg into each tart pan. Bake for 3 to 4 more minutes. Serve immediately. Makes 6 tarts. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.
Boil potatoes until fork-tender. Drain and toss with oil. Sprinkle with zest and juice of the lemon. Add salt to taste. Add cilantro, scallions and serve with fish or meat.

Prepare graham cracker pie crust. Beat together sugar and egg yolks. Add flour and salt. Stir in blueberry pie filling and almond extract. Fold in beaten egg whites. Spread into graham cracker pie crust. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until done. Cool and then refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Serve cold.

Cook the bacon, drain off the excess grease, and set aside. In a Dutch oven or large pot, combine the broccoli florets with the potatoes, carrots, onions, kielbasa, water, and seasonings. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are done. Stir the broccoli into the potatoes, and then add the reserved bacon to the top of the casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and browned. Serve immediately with crusty French bread for dipping. Serves 4 to 6.

Place the egg yolks and water in a double boiler fitted with a whisk or a wire whip. Put the whisk or whip over the simmering water and beat the yolks vigorously for about 5 minutes or until they are thickened. Place the butter, cut up into small pieces, in a small saucepan over low heat or very low heat. Cook it until it is melted. Pour the melted butter into the double boiler, add the lemon juice and whisk briskly for about 1 minute or until the sauce is thickened. The sauce should be thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon with a thin film that holds its shape when lifted. Season with the cayenne, salt and white pepper to taste. Serve immediately over vegetables or fish.

In a large heavy skillet, over medium heat, melt butter. Add onions and saute until soft. Add white wine vinegar and thyme. Let simmer for about 15 minutes until caramelized.
