Meanwhile, boil potatoes until tender. Mash with half and half, horseradish, and the remaining thyme. Salt and pepper to taste. Stir in onions and serve.

Shred the cabbage and grate the carrots. Bring the boiling water to a boil. Add the scallions and cook for 1 minute. Cool for 5 minutes. Toss the cabbage with the scallion mixture. In a bowl mix together the white vinegar and the water. Add to the cabbage and mix well. Add the jalapenos and salt to taste. Let marinate for 1 hour.

Preheat broiler. In small bowl, stir together soy sauce and mustard. In another small bowl, combine the onions and the honey. Lay onion slices in single layer on a foil-lined baking sheet. Broil 2-3 inches from the heat for 3-4 minutes on each side or until grill marks appear on the onions. Brush onion slices with the glaze during broiling.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine dry ingredients. In a seperate bowl combine all wet ingredients. Blend wet into dry and pour into a greased 8x8 pan. Top with jalapeno pepper slices. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve warm.

Spread mustard on one side of each piece of bread. Place a piece of ham and one tablespoon of cheese on one piece of bread. Top with another piece of bread to make a sandwich. Spread butter on the outsides of the assembled sandwiches. Heat in a heavy skillet until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted. Repeat with the remaining bread. Serve immediately.

In a large plastic bag or container, combine pork tenderloin with vegetable oil. Seal well, then refrigerate overnight. Remove tenderloin from marinade. Heat vegetable oil in heavy skillet or dutch oven. Add tenderloin. Cook over medium heat until browned on all sides. Remove from skillet. Add wine. Bring to a boil. Return tenderloin to skillet. Add lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper. Reduce heat. Simmer until tenderloin is tender. Garnish with paprika. Serve immediately.

Place chicken in the bottom of the crock pot. Combine onions with butter in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the onions are transparent. Add to the crock pot along with the lemon juice, fresh parsley, thyme, paprika, salt & pepper. Add enough water to cover the chicken. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Turn the chicken over half way through.

Brown the meat and drain. In a 13x9-inch baking dish combine the meat, half the can of milk, the chilies and the soup. Combine the remaining milk and the sour cream and spread over the meat mixture. Sprinkle with the cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until bubbly.

Mix together first 4 ingredients. Beat at medium speed with electric mixer until well blended. Add next 3 ingredientsbeat until smooth. Stir in peanut butter. Combine flour and next 3 ingredientsstir into peanut butter mixture. Divide dough in half. Wrap each half in plastic wrapchill 30 minutes or until easy to handle. Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Press with tines of a fork to form a patternsprinkle with coarse sugar if desired. Bake at 350 for 7-9 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheets 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheets to wire rackscool completely. Store in airtight containers. Makes about 4 dozen.

Place salmon fillets in a shallow dish. Whisk together 2 tablespoons sweet chili sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, ginger, and pepper. Pour mixture over filletsturn to coat. Marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons sweet chili sauce. Add snow peascook 2 to 3 minutes. Add bok choycook 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in peas. Spoon vegetables over ricetop with salmon. Sprinkle with green onions.

Prepare miniature fruitcakes according to package directions. Place cakes on a baking sheet and bake. Cool. Dip fruitcakes in brandy and sprinkle with nonpareils or colored sprinkles. Dip fruitcakes in melted white chocolate to coat. Place on waxed paper to dry. Garnish with decorative candies if desired.

Place the sliced mushrooms in the bottom of a large salad bowl. In a small bowl combine the salad oil, the wine vinegar, lemon juice, salt, fresh ground pepper to taste. Pour over the mushroom slices. Arrange the onion tops on top. Serve immediately.
Mix together all ingredients until well blended. Press into a greased baking pan and bake at 350 f for about 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and cut into bars.

Marinate tuna in olive oil, salt, and pepper in plastic bag in refrigerator 2 hours. Remove from bag and pat dry. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill on medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until desired doneness. Arrange on platter and drizzle with balsamic vinegar, orange juice, and olive oil mixture. Serve immediately.
Mix together all ingredients in a plastic bag and add steak. Refrigerate and marinate for 4 to 8 hours, flipping the steaks occasionally. Remove steaks from refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling. Drain and discard marinade from steaks. Grill over medium heat until steaks reach your desired doneness. Remove from grill and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
In small bowl stir together the soy sauce, garlic, pineapple juice and ginger. Place the tune steaks in a shallow dish and pour half the marinade over them. Flip to coat both sides. Place the peppers

Place the water in a coffeemaker and add the coffee. Brew according to the manufacturer’s instructions. While the coffee brews, combine the sugar and half-and-half in a blender. Cover and blend at high speed until smooth. Combine the coffee and half-and-half mixture in an electric drink mixer and blend until smooth. Stir in the chocolate syrup and ice and blend until frothy. Serve in a tall glass and sprinkle with cinnamon.

Marinate salmon in sake and soy sauce for 1 hour in refrigerator. Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine miso and rice vinegarwhisk until smooth. Stir in brown and granulated sugars and gingerroot. Heat until mixture is hot but not boiling. Place salmon in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Coat fish with 1/2 of the hot miso mixture. Bake for 15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. Combine panko and remaining miso mixturesprinkle over baked salmon. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until panko is golden brown. Serve hot with steamed white or brown rice and steamed green beans or asparagus.

In a nonstick skillet, cook chicken in broth over medium heat for 5-8 minutes or until no longer pink. Cut into bite-size pieces. Cook pasta in boiling water 7-10 minutes or until tender. Drain and combine with broccoli, pasta and the broth. Add the cheese product and stir until melted. Stir in the chicken. Heat through and serve immediately.

Crush crackers and combine with lemon and herb seasoning. Place sea scallops in a small bowl. Add the crushed crackers and dijon mustard. Season with salt and cayenne. Shape into patties. Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet. Cook scallops 2 minutes per side or until brown and just opaque. Serve with lemon.

Preheat oven to 350F. Butter an 8-inch square baking pan. In large bowl combine cranberries, sugar and cinnamon. Toss well then pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until thickened and most berries have popped. Stir occasionally during cooking to prevent burning. Remove from oven and stir in lemon juice and marmalade. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts and return to oven for another hour or until very thick and saucy. Cool completely before refrigerating. Makes 4 cups.

Place littleneck clams in a stockpot and cover with 2 inches of cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until clams open. Remove from heat and strain clams through a colander. Reserve the cooking liquid. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and jalapeno. Cook until translucent and add 3 tablespoons of the cooking liquid from the clams. Add the clams and reserved cooking liquid. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the dried red pepper flakes and tomato puree. Bring to a simmer and add the scallions and lemon juice. Toss and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat.

Saute onion and garlic until soft. Stir in the mushrooms and cook until tender. Combine eggs and milk. Blend well. Add the mushroom mixture. Pour into a greased skillet. Bake at 425 degrees for about 15 minutes or until eggs are set and golden brown. Cut in wedges and serve.

Steam cod in a steamer basket or colander over boiling water for 7 minutes. Remove and discard liquid from the steamer. Sprinkle the cod with salt and pepper. Cut scallions in 1-inch-thick slices and arrange on a platter. Add the ginger and pour the vinegar and soy over the top. Top each serving of the steamed cod with the scallions and ginger and serve immediately.

Place the chicken in a large baking dish and stuff inside the cavity: 4 garlic cloves, halved, and the halved lemon (squeeze out any juices). Rub all over with smoked paprika and drizzle with about a tablespoon of olive oil and butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and sprigs of thyme. Bake for about an hour or until the internal temperature is about 75C/170F. Once cooked, remove from the oven, cover with tin foil and leave to rest for a good 30 minutes before carving.

Fry the onions and bacon in the butter until lightly browned. Add the lentils and stock and simmer for 25 minutes. Add the tomatoes and simmer for a further 10 minutes. Season to taste. Pour the soup into a jug or pitcher. Chill in the fridge for a few hours. Whisk in the double cream just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the first six ingredients. Shape into 2 loaves and place in 9×13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with capsicum and herb. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Add the tomato sauce and sprinkle with the cracked black pepper. Bake until heated through, about 10 minutes. Serve with your favorite sides.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place potatoes in a large bowl. In a seperate bowl combine the remaining ingredients and beat well. Pour the egg mixture over the potatoes and mix. Transfer to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven and continue to bake for another 10-15 minutes or until golden and crisp. Serve hot with your favorite ketchup or tartar sauce.

Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the eggs and beat until mixed. Add the flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well. Pour into a greased 8 x 8 inch pan. Sprinkle the chocolate chips and the pecans on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Tear up angel food cake into small pieces and place into a 9x13x2 pan. In a bowl mix together pudding and milk as directed on box. Pour over cake and mix well. Add crushed heath bar and spread out evenly over top of cake. Spread evenly with 1 container of cool whip. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Mix together dry ingredients and cut in butter with pastry blender or two knives. Add milk and mix to form soft dough. Pat out to desired thickness and cut into rounds with 2 1/2 inch round cutter. Bake 8 to 10 minutes on ungreased cookie sheet. Makes about 3 dozen biscuits.
In a large skillet, saute the onion and green pepper in oil until tender. Add to the skillet, the remaining ingredients. Cook covered over low heat for 1 hour.

Soak pinto and kidney beans overnight in water. Cook according to package directions, adding kielbasa and pork and beans about halfway through cooking time. When cooked, add cooked white rice and stir to mix. Heat through. Add seasonings and salt and pepper to taste. Serves 6-8 as main meal. Serve with corn bread or cornbread muffins and salad.

In a small bowl, mash the chile and garlic with the back of a spoon into a paste. Add lemon juice and stir to combine. Heat the peanut oil in a small saucepan until very hot but not smoking. Remove from the heat and stir in the chile paste and a pinch of salt and pepper. Let sit 10 minutes. Rub the mixture all over the shrimp. Let sit at room temperature until the sauce thickens a bit, about 15 minutes. Grill the shrimp until opaque and cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Place chicken in slow cooker. In a small bowl combine the first 4 ingredients. Whisk together well. Pour over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or on high for 2-3 hours. Combine the second group of ingredients in a small bowl. Stir in a small amount of water until smooth. Pour over the cooked chicken. Cook on high for 15-20 minutes or until thickened. Serve over rice.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Wash shallots well under cold waterpat dry. Toss shallots and oil together in a large bowl until well coated. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheetsprinkle with balsamic vinegar, herbs, and salt and pepper to tastetoss to coat. Roast until tender and lightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes.

Mix shortening, sugar and eggs. Add the well-drained mashed bananas. Sift the flour, baking soda and salt together. Add to the mixer and beat 1 minute at low speed. Add nuts, beat 1 minute at low speed. Pour batter into 3 greased loaf pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 55 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Wrap cooled loaves in plastic wrap or place in plastic bags. Store at room temperature.
name: banana nut muffinsingredients: sugar, vegetable oil, egg whites, cinnamon, mashed bananas, self-rising flour, nutspreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream together sugar and vegetable oil until smooth. Beat in egg whites until frothy. Add mashed bananas. Combine dry ingredientsadd to creamed mixture just until dry ingred

Preheat oven to 425. Cut each sweet potato in half lengthwise. Place cut side down on a baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the butter and honey. Toss the potatoes with the cayenne, cumin and paprika. Drizzle with the honey mixture and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Roast for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serve sprinkled with orange zest.

In a medium saucepan combine milk, chocolate syrup and bourbon. Bring just to a boil. Remove from heat and add eggnog and nutmeg. Serve in a punch bowl or small cups. Top with marshmallows or whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray an 11 x 17-inch pan with the cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, coconut, and sesame seeds. In another medium bowl, combine the turkey with the egg whites and salt. Add the turkey mixture into the breadcrumb mixture. Stir until well combined. Shape into 24 patties. Spray a baking sheet with the cooking spray. Place the patties on the baking sheet. Bake until golden and cooked through, about 30 minutes. Serve with your favorite sauce.

Cook rice according to directions on package. Add dried cranberries in last 10 minutes of cooking. Cool slightly. Chill. Drain well. Mix the celery in just prior to serving. Toss well. Combine the dressing ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over the rice mixture and toss well. Serve at room temperature.

Cut catfish into serving size pieces. Rinse fish and pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Combine 1 cup cornmeal with 1/2 cup flour. In a large heavy skillet heat enough oil to cover the bottom of pan to about 1/2 inch deep. Dust fish with remaining cornmeal/flour mixture, shaking off any excess. Fry fish about 5 minutes per side or until golden brown.

Mix together the sweet potatoes and soy sauce in a large mixing bowl and mash until smooth. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the butter and mix thoroughly. Form patties about 1/2 inch thick and 2 inches in diameter and coat lightly with butter or cooking spray. Cook in a hot skillet over medium heat for 4 minutes or until browned and crisp on both sides. Drizzle with honey and serve immediately.
Awesome stuff as always. Keep up the good work!
Melt the white chocolate in a double boiler over hot water. Stir in the brewed coffee and the evaporated skim milk. Stir in the vanilla extract. Serve immediately over a sprinkling of cinnamon.

In a small bowl, combine the first three ingredients and set aside. In a separate bowl combine the remaining ingredients and set aside. In a glass dish or in a zip top bag, place the lamb and marinate in the fridge overnight, turning once or twice to coat evenly. Preheat the oven to 375f and line a shallow roasting pan with foil and place a rack on top of the foil. Place the lamb chops on the rack and roast for 10 to 15 minutes or until the desired doneness is achieved. Remove the lamb chops from the oven and brush with the marinade on the second step. Place back in the oven and roast a further 5 minutes or until the lamb is lightly browned and slightly glazed. Allow the lamb chops to rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Combine dry ingredients and mix well. Stir in the grated coconut and the melted vegetable oil. Add milk and vanilla and mix well. Pour into two well-greased loaf pans. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Brown the ground beef with the seasoning. In a large bowl, stir the beef and the cream of celery soup together. Spread half of the mashed potatoes in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Spread the beef mixture over the potatoes. Cover with the remaining mashed potatoes and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until the top is brown and the mixture is hot and bubbly. Cut the crescent rolls into quarters and place into the baking dish over the top of the shepherds pie. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until the crescent rolls are browned. Let cool for at least 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a side salad and garlic bread.

In a large bowl, beat together the peanut butter, brown sugar, egg and vanilla until smooth. Stir in the baking soda. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for a few minutes before removing from the pan. Store in an airtight container.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute chicken in oil until browneddrain and set aside. Add the pasta and cook until al dente according to package directions. Drain and return to the skillet. Add the salsa con quesomilk and saltmix well. Stir in the chicken and onions. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese and tomatoes and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Scrub new potatoes with stiff brush under cool running water to remove dirt or soil. Pat dry. Rub each potato with cut side of garlic clove. Combine oil, rosemary and salt in small bowl. Brush oil mixture all over potatoes. Arrange in single layer on jellyroll pan. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes or until tender when pierced with fork. Meanwhile cook bacon in heavy skillet over medium heat until crisp. Crumble when cool. Stir in scallion, chives and parsley. Remove from heat. Divide potatoes among serving plates. Sprinkle with bacon mixture. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350. In a shallow bowl, blend together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. In a small saucepan, heat butter and garlic over very low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Brush chicken pieces with garlic butter, then roll in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place chicken skin side up on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together any remaining crumb mixture and butter and sprinkle over chicken. Place in oven and bake 1 hour.

Mix together the caster sugar and golden syrup in a large saucepan. Heat gently to dissolve the sugar and syrup together. Bring to the boil. Cook for a further 3-4 minutes over a moderate heat, without stirring. You can test if the mixture is ready by dropping a tiny bit of mixture into cold water. If it forms a hard ball then it is ready. Remove from heat. Pour the mixture onto a large tray lined with greaseproof paper. Allow to cool for at least one hour. Cut into squares whilst still warm. Allow to cool completely. Melt the butter and water together in the microwave. Drizzle the melted butter over the tablet. Scatter the chopped walnuts over the top. Leave for a further hour or so to set. Once set cut into small pieces.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Stir in sour cream and dressing mix. Add salt and pepper. Serve.

Boil the corn in the water until tender. Drain. Cut the kernels off the cob. Add the remaining ingredients. Toss gently. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.
name: best ever fresh sweetcorn salad
name: ww caprese rice salad
name: tomato topper for burgers
name: fresh tomato and roasted garlic salad dressing
name: cucumber tomato salad
name: herbed cherry tomatoes
name: green bean and basil salad
name: summer corn salad
I love the summer corn salad! I don't know what it is about it but I just love it!

Melt butter in skillet. Add chicken, sliced into cubes. Cook until no longer pink. Drain fat and add soup and sour cream. Heat until hot. Add peppers and heat until hot. Add roasted red peppers and heat until hot. Heat frito corn chips according to directions. Grease a baking pan with pam cooking spray. Put a layer of the frito corn chips in the bottom. Add a layer of the chicken mixture. Add a layer of cheese. Continue to layer until all the frito corn chips are used up. Top with the rest of the cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the radish and cook, stirring frequently until the radish is just tender and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 1 minute. Add the wine and cook until the alcohol smell has evaporated, about 1 minute. Add the tomato paste. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cream. Cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the penne. Cook until the sauce thickens slightly. Stir in the parmesan.

Cut the cod into 1/2 inch strips. Dust lightly with the flour. Mix together the water, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Beat until smooth. Dip the cod strips into the mixture and place into hot oil. Fry until golden. Drain on paper towel. Serve with lemon wedge and chili sauce.

Cut the onion into half-inch pieces. Heat a cast-iron skillet or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the oil and the onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add the sausage and cook until the meat is crispy. Add the milk, stirring to break up the sausage. Add the pepper and the salt. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Gently crack the eggs into the skillet one at a time. Cook over medium-low heat until the whites are cooked but the yolks are still runny. Top with the cheese. Serve with your favorite salsa.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add onion and green pepper. Cook over low heat until tender. Stir in garlic. Add barley and broth. Cook over low heat until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in parsley and salt and pepper.

In a medium size bowl combine onion, vegetables and water. Cook over medium heat until vegetables are tender. Meanwhile, cook hamburger over medium heat until thoroughly done. Drain well. Combine with vegetable mixture. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add seasoning packet from noodles. Cook 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in cooked noodles. Cook 1 minute or until heated through.
As you can see, you can get some pretty good meals out of some of these little packets of seasoning. I really do like the stuff. It's quick and easy and the flavors are pretty good. I'm pretty sure you could combine a few different flavors and come up with some other good ideas for meals.
Have you tried it? What is your favorite flavor?
I love the Chicken Flavor Ramen Noodles with the Seasoning Packet. I cook them up and add some chicken breast and broccoli. It is a fast and delicious meal.
I had chicken ramen for the first time today. I am now a fan. I can't wait to try some of these recipes.

In large skillet, saute onions and celery in butter until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Break off florets and cut into bite size pieces. Put the florets into a large bowl. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and stir until light brown and bubbly. Gradually add milk and cook until thickened and smooth, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks, one at a time. Add seasonings and cheese and stir until smooth and thickened. Pour over cauliflower and stir gently to coat evenly. Pour into greased casserole dish and sprinkle with crumbs. Dot with butter and cover with foil. Bake at 350 for one hour. Uncover and bake for 30 minutes longer or until crust is brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut the serrano ham in half and wrap each half around the bundle. Place on baking pan. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes.
Asparagus and avocado are both great sources of folate, so pair them together for a flavorful and nutritious spring salad.
A quick and easy recipe for a creamy soup that will warm you on a chilly night.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat butter and sugars together until well blended and creamy. Add the egg and mix thoroughly. Sift together the dry ingredients and add them to the wet ingredients. Stir until well blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the center is still slightly undercooked. Cool for two minutes then move to wire rack to finish cooling.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream the butter and sugars together in a large bowl. Add the eggs and milk, and mix well. In a separate bowl sift the flour, baking powder and soda. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Add the marshmallows. Batter will be thick. Pour into greased 12 cup muffin pan. Bake for about 25 minutes. While still hot, sprinkle with the chocolate chips. Allow the muffins to sit for about 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut chicken into 1/2 inch strips. Combine hot sauce and next five ingredients in a bowl. Place the strips of chicken in the bowl and toss to coat. Spoon into a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish, and cover with foil. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the foil and continue baking for 10 minutes more. Serve with the blue cheese dressing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the vanilla wafers, butter, and 3 tablespoons sugar. Mix until the mixture is crumbly. Press into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup sugar, the egg white, and 1 teaspoon liqueur until smooth. Beat in the cream cheese until well mixed. Spread over the baked crust. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely before serving. Drizzle with liqueur and sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons liqueur. Serve cold or at room temperature. Store any leftovers in the refrigerator.

Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Season to taste. Keep refrigerated in a jar or airtight container for up to 1 week. Serve as a pasta sauce or with chicken or fish. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Heat butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrot and celery rib. Cover and cook until soft. Add potatoes, turnips. Cover and cook until soft. Add stock. Cover and simmer until vegetables are very tender. Mash vegetables with potato masher or process with immersion blender. Add garlic and honey. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

Melt Wesson oil in Dutch oven. Sauté onions and celery until tender. Add green pepper and cubed ham. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add Wesson oil and continue cooking. Add uncooked rice and cook until liquid is absorbed. Add canned tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste. Cook until rice is done. Serve.

Place the tomato slices on the bottom half of the bread and top with the lettuce and the bacon. Spread the reduced-fat mayonnaise on the top half of the bread and place over the lettuce-tomato mixture and top with the remaining bacon.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook and crumble the meat. Add onions, velveeta cheese and the remaining ingredients. Cook until melted and heated through. Spread onto slices of bread. Cover with wax paper and place in a freezer container. When frozen place in a ziploc bag and store in the freezer until ready to use. Bake at 325 for 15 - 20 minutes.

Cook the carrots for 4 minutes in a large saucepan of boiling water until tender. Add the zucchini and cook for a further 3 minutes. Drain. In a bowl combine the cooked veggies, garlic, scallions, olive oil and lemon juice. Add salt & pepper to taste. Garnish with basil leaves.
Made this today for the first time. I did not have cherry tomatos so I used grape tomatos. I used less water because I did not have cherry tomatos. It was very good. I will make it again.
I made this today. I had never used cherry tomatoes so I did not have any. I used grape tomatos. I used less water. It was very good. I will make it again.
I made this today. I had never used cherry tomatoes so I did not have any. I used grape tomatos. I used less water. It was very good. I will make it again. I had to add about 1/4 cup of water because the sauce got too thick. I love the flavor of the cherry tomatoes in this

Preheat oven to 200c. Peel and chop tomatoes and place in bowl. Cut off the ends from the orange and squeeze the juice over the tomatoes. Add the chopped onion and the rind and leave to marinate for about 30 minutes. Place the fish fillets into 2 greased baking trays and sprinkle the chilli powder over them. Spoon the marinated tomatoes and juice over them and sprinkle with the thyme. Drizzle over the olive oil and bake for about 25 minutes until the fish is cooked through. Remove from the oven and sprinkle over the basil leaves. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Drain the sauerkraut, rinse well with cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Cube the cooked sausage. Combine the sauerkraut, apples, apple juice, brown sugar, salt and pepper in a crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 5 hours. Stir in the polish sausage. Cook for 30 minutes longer. Serve with rye bread.

Mix together sugar, cocoa, and milk in saucepan. Stir in butter and cook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly--about two minutes. Add vanilla and old fashioned oats and stir until well combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper and allow to cool.
I've always loved this kind of cookie so I was glad to see it on the site. I've made it several times and each time I like it more and more! It's very tasty!

Cut the garlic cloves in half and place them in a bowl. Add 3/4 cup of the water, vinegar and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt to the bowl. Stir. Cover the bowl and refrigerate overnight. Drain the garlic and arrange the cloves in a single layer on a baking sheet. Place the pan in the preheated oven and roast until the garlic is golden brown on the edges and soft, about 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and drizzle the honey and lemon juice evenly over the garlic. Sprinkle evenly with the pink peppercorns. Return the pan to the oven and roast until the honey is bubbling and the garlic is crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and let cool to room temperature. Store the marinated garlic in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

Place pecans in ungreased pie plates and toast in 350 oven for 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine butter and light karo syrupheat over low heat for 10 minutes until butter is melted and mixture is bubbling and golden. Remove from heat and add sugar and saltbeat until smooth. Add eggs and lemon juice and beat until thickened. Pour over toasted pecans and bake in preheated 350 oven for about 40 minutes until set and top is golden brown.

In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil and cook the shrimp until just barely pink in color. Drain the shrimp and set aside. In the same skillet, add the flour and stir constantly until golden brown. Pour in the wine and let it cook until it thickens and the flour disappears. Add the butter and stir until melted and smooth. Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and add the lemon juice. Stir until the shrimp is completely coated in the sauce and turn off the heat. Stir in the heavy cream and parsley until thoroughly combined. Serve immediately.

Measure all ingredients into bread machine pan, in order that they are listed. Set machine for dough cycle and start. At end of dough cycle, remove dough to lightly floured surface and shape into loaf. Place in greased loaf pan, cover and let rise until bread is 1 to 2 inches above edges of pan. Be patient, sourdough without the addition of commercial yeast can take up to several hours to rise. Bake at 375 degrees f for 40 to 50 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Top can be brushed with butter for a soft crust, if desired. This is what develops the characteristic sour flavor and the longer the proof, the sourer it will be. If you start with 1 cup of starter and feed it 1 cup each of water and flour, you should have enough to make your bread and save the rest to start your next batch.

Beat ricotta cheese until smooth. Add the 3 eggs and mix well. Add the 2 cups of sugar and mix well. Add the 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla and mix well. Add the instant pudding mix and mix well. Add the 1/2 cup of milk. Mix well. Pour batter into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until firm. Cool cake completely. Make the icing by combining the fudge marble cake mix with the non-dairy whipped topping. Spread icing over cake. Chill for 1 hour. Decorate with fresh strawberries or raspberries. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 400f. Prepare potatoes according to package directions, adding garlic and chives during the last few minutes of cooking time. Beat the potatoes with the ricotta cheese until smooth. On a baking sheet lined with wax paper or parchment paper, place one egg roll wrap on its side. Using your finger or a pastry brush, brush the edge of the wrap with water and place about 1 tablespoon of the potato mixture near the center of the wrap, about an inch from the edge. Fold the wrap over the potato mixture, being careful not to tear the wrap, forming a half-moon shape. Brush the edges of the wraps with water and seal the edges by pressing them together. Place the sealed side of each ravioli up. Bake for 10 minutes or until browned and bubbly. Serve warm.

Mix cornflour with dark soya sauce. Add stock, stirring to make smooth mixture. Add sweet chili sauce. Heat oil in pan. Cook beef steaks, turning once until cooked. Remove to plate. Add bok choy and onions to pan. Cook 2-3 minutes. Add stock mixture to pan. Bring to the boil. Add the beef to the pan. Heat through. Serve with boiled rice.

Prepare grill. Combine first 8 ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. Pull husks back from corn, and scrub silks. Brush butter over corn. Sprinkle with spice mixture. Place corn on grill rack. Grill 12 minutes or until done, turning occasionally.
Combine all ingredients and stir well. Add chicken pieces and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours. Remove from marinade and broil or grill.

Place peas in a food processor and pulse until a paste is formed. Place in a bowl with cornstarch and plain flour. Sift in the baking powder and mix well. Add milk and egg and mix well. Stir in halloumi cheese and mint. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep saucepan until it reaches 190C. Fill an ice cream scoop with the mixture and press down so they are flat on top. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Drain and serve on a plate with a lemon wedge and a dollop of hummus.

Preheat oven to 350. Roll out dough and top with light cream cheese. Add chicken, sour cream and garlic and mix well. Spread toppings in order listed. Bake for 15 - 20 minutes or until crust is golden and toppings are bubbly. Sprinkle with parmesan. Serve with salsa or ranch dressing.

Grate peel of 1/2 lemon. Squeeze the juice of the 1/2 lemon. Grate peel of 2 to 3 oranges. Squeeze the juice of the 2 to 3 oranges. Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour over ice cubes. Garnish with orange peel. Serve immediately.

Cut off bottoms and trim stem ends from each sprout. Cut in half lengthwise. In a 12-inch skillet heat 2 teaspoons oil over medium high heat until hot. Add onion and cook about 2 minutes or until softened. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons oil to the skillet. Add the garlic, ginger and curry powder to the skillet and cook about 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the sprouts to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook 5 minutes or until sprouts are crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve immediately.

Cut into each chicken breast half lengthwise and place flat between two pieces of wax paper. Pound each breast half until flat and about 1/2 inch thick. Brush chicken with lemon juice. Place on grid over medium heat. Grill 8 minutes, turning once. Transfer to plate. Combine oranges, pineapple juice, lemon juice, jalapeno pepper, and cayenne in small bowl. Season to taste with salt. Serve chicken with salsa. Makes 4 servings.

In a large plastic bag combine the dressing, salsa, sour cream, bacon and spices. Add the chicken legsturn to coat. Refrigerate overnight. Remove the bag from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking. Heat the oven to 350°F. Place the chicken in a shallow baking dish. Bake uncovered 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Rub pumpernickel bread with chocolate and place in serving bowl. Place a layer of bread on bottom of bowl, then a layer of berries. Sprinkle a layer of bread on top, then a layer of berries, then a layer of bread, and so on until bowl is full. Pour cherry juice over top. Stir in chambord. Refrigerate at least 6 hours or overnight. Stir whipped cream and yoghurt together and serve over bread and fruit.

Remove green beans from freezer bag and rinse in cold water. Place in a medium saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until tender but still firm to bite. Drain. Combine orange rind, honey, and cranberries in a small bowl and stir until well blended. Cooking green beans with rind of one orange gives them an appealing color as well as flavor. Pour over drained beans and toss lightly until evenly coated. Spread on a baking dish and sprinkle with bacon bits or crushed pork cracklings. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Saute onions in oil. Add in the chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add whole kernel corn. Season with oregano, mexican chili powder and salt/pepper. Divide among tortillas. Top with sour cream.

In a large bowl combine the egg substitute and pumpkin until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir until well combined. Pour into paper lined muffin cups and bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until a tester comes out clean. Cool cupcakes on a cooling rack and then frost with your favorite frosting.

In a large saucepan cook the bell pepper, jalapeno and onion until soft. Drain off any liquid. Combine the vegetable mixture, cider vinegar, sugar and cayenne. Bring to a boil and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in the Certo. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and pour into hot jars leaving 1/2 headroom. Adjust lids and process for 10 minutes in a hot water bath. Cool before storing.

Cook salad shrimp in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain. Combine mayo, ketchup, garlic salt, worchestershiresauce, pepper, old bay seasoning and tabasco sauce. Stir in cooked shrimp. Chill. Serve in lettuce cups.
A collection of recipes for Cajun shrimp and shrimp dishes.

Combine all but the orzo in a large mixing bowl. Beat the egg in the cornstarch mixture to make a paste. Add the egg mixture to the fruit mixture. Mix thoroughly until thickened. Chill for about 3 hours. Before serving stir in the orzo pasta. Serve chilled.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Mix the chicken, chilies and salsa in a small bowl. Mix the salt and half-and-half in a large shallow dish. Heat the oil in a frying pan over med-high. Fry the tortillas one at a time for a few seconds until they start to blister and turn soft. Immediately dip each one in the half-and-half. Put a large dollop of the chicken mixture on each tortilla and roll it up. Place it in a ungreased baking pan, flap side down. When all of the tortillas are done, pour the remaining half-and-half over them and sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or so, until they are thoroughly heated.

In a sauce pan, melt margarine over low heat. Add marshmallows. Stir until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter. Cool. Press into corn flakes. Melt chips with 1/2 teaspoon of milk or margarine. Spread over corn flakes. Refrigerate. Serve from refrigerator.

Stir-fry raw shrimp in a wok or large skillet with 2 tbsp. of vegetable oil over medium heat until cooked and pink. Remove shrimp from pan. Heat vegetable oil in a small bowl in microwave until very hot. Add 2 tbsp. of water, soy sauce and honey. Stir until mixture boils. Add shrimp and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Add lemon juice and cilantro. Serve over hot rice. Garnish with green onions if desired.

Brown the sausage in a skillet and drain. Add diced onion and stir-fry until lightly browned. Add the eggs and stir-fry until almost set. Stir in the milk and sour cream. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until set.

Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool. Use to frost cake or layer cake with chocolate icing between layers.
This site contains all information about Chocolate cake icing recipes.

Cut the angel food cake into cubes. In a large bowl combine the cake cubes with the prepared vanilla pudding mix and milk. Allow to set for about 10 minutes. Line the inside of six parfait glasses with the prepared cake mixture. Next, place one or two slices of strawberries in the parfait glasses, alternating the layers with the prepared cake mixture. Fill with a dollop of whipped cream in each glass. Drizzle with red food coloring for a festive touch. Serve chilled.
Angel Cakes recipe has been read 6338 times
Brown hamburger and onion until browned. Pour in boiling water and add hamburger gravy mix. Stir until thickened. Add noodles and stir until cooked. Salt and pepper to taste.

In a heavy saucepan over medium-high heat combine dried apricots, sherry wine and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until fruit is tender and sauce thickens. Stir in sugar and honey, cook until sauce thickens. Add fresh cranberries and cook until they pop. Remove from heat and let stand until cool. Chill. Serve at room temperature.

Mash the bananas. Add brown sugar, vanilla essence and the margarine. Melt the margarine in the microwave. Beat the egg slightly then add it to the mixture. Slowly add the skim milk to the mixture while continuously stirring until smooth. Combine the self-rising flours and bicarbonate of soda in a small bowl. Sift it over the mixture. Stir lightly to combine the two mixtures. Fold in the chopped nuts. Spoon the mixture into a muffin tray. Bake in the pre-heated oven for 20 to 25 minutes until lightly brown.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Place tilapia fillet on a plate or on a piece of foil that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Season fish with a little salt and pepper. Drizzle with a little butter. Lay tomato halves, green onions, fresh basil leaves and sliced garlic on top of fish. Sprinkle with some monterey jack cheese. Cover with a lid or cover with foil. Bake for approximately 12-15 minutes or until fish is white. Serve with hot cooked rice or potatoes if desired.

Peel carrots and cut into small pieces. Heat water and add carrots. Simmer for 10 minutes or until carrots are soft. Add lemon juice. Heat until carrots are glazed. Add 1/4 cup chopped peanuts. Garnish with parsley and pepper. Serve.

Put the raisins in a small bowl and pour boiling water over them. Let soak for 30 minutes. Prepare the dough by combining the flour, yeast, salt, raisins, apple and the boiling liquid in a large bowl. Add the milk, beaten egg, butter or margarine and the sugar. Beat well to form a soft dough. Add enough water to make the dough workable. Knead the dough in the bowl for about 10 minutes or until the dough is smooth and elastic. Put the dough in a well greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise in a warm place for about one hour or until doubled in bulk. Punch down the dough. Divide into four equal portions. Roll each portion into a rope about 2 inches in diameter and place them in well-greased loaf pans. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in bulk. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until the rolls are golden

Cut chicken breast halves in half. In a shallow baking pan combine the spinach, the salt and the pepper. Add the chicken breast halves and turn to coat. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Mix the remaining ingredients and pour over the chicken. Return to the oven and bake 30 minutes longer. Serve hot.

Brown ground beef and onion. Drain fat. Add mushrooms and 1 28 oz. can of cream-style corn. Add soup. Stir well. Cook until hot. Stir in black olives. Cook until hot. Add egg noodles. Stir well. Cook until hot. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350 degrees or until cheese is melted and browned.
Melt butter in a saucepan and add onion. Cook until tender. Add soup and milk. Stir and heat through. Add cooked rice and broccoli. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cut cabbage into 1/2 inch strips. Cook with oysters and onion in a small amount of water. Add egg and flour. Mix well. Add milk. Cook until thickened. Stir in more milk to desired consistency. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with green onion.
Melt corn oil in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Stir in all other ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until thickened. Serve over baked chicken.

Beat together eggs and sugar. Add the dates and vanilla. Cook over medium heat in a 9-inch fry pan until mixture comes to a full boil. Boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick and comes to a full boil. Remove from heat and stir in the crisp rice cereal and both kinds of cherries. Cool. Shape into balls and roll in the desiccated coconut. Store in a sealed container.

In a medium saucepan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the spices, coconut milk and 2 1/2 cups of the stockbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the lime leaves. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup stock and serve.

Pound out the chicken to 1/4″ thickness. Season with coarse salt. Heat wok oil over medium high heat. Cook the chicken until golden brown on one side. Turn. Add white vinegar to the pan and cover. Cook 5 minutes. Add chicken broth to the pan. Cover and cook until chicken is done. Remove from the heat. Whisk together the curd and hot water to make the sauce. Toss the chicken with the sauce. Top with scallions. Garnish with lemon zest.

Wash the barley under running water until water runs clear. Place in saucepan with 4 cups of water for every 1 cup of pearl barley. Add 1 tsp of salt. Bring to boil then reduce heat to low. Cook 10 minutes or until tender. Drain liquid from pan then add 2 tbsp olive oil. Cook 2-3 minutes then remove from heat. Add lime juice and salt to taste. Serve warm or chilled with butter or plain yoghurt.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in the marshmallows and water until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in the cheese, the dry ingredients. Add pecans and stir until well blended. Drop mixture by teaspoon onto greased baking sheet. Press pecans lightly into mixture. Bake at 400f for 8 minutes or until lightly browned.
Mix all together and form into 4 patties. Brown in a skillet. Turn once. Drain off fat. Serve with deviled ham or egg salad. Serve with horseradish sauce if desired.

Beat cream cheese until softened. Stir in gently crushed pineapple, bell pepper, green onion, lemon pepper, seasoned salt and one cup of chopped pecans. Roll the mixture into a ball and wrap it up tightly in plastic wrap. Place it into the refrigerator for 2-4 hours or until firm and roll the ball in the remaining chopped pecans.

In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and chili until smooth. Stir in the green onions and the green chilis. Spread 1/2 of this mixture in a 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with the remaining chili mixture and the 1 cup of cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until the mixture is hot and the topping is lightly browned. Makes 8 servings.

Cook bacon until crispy in a large saucepan. Drain on paper towels, reserving grease. Add potatoes, water, Italian dressing, paprika, garlic powder, ground red pepper, sugar and bacon grease to the same saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes into a colander. Add celery, green onions, bacon and red peppers. Toss lightly.

Melt butter with oil in a medium saucepan. Add peanuts. Cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add chili powder, cumin and white pepper. Sprinkle with salt and oregano. Add cayenne. Stir well. Transfer to a bowl. Add cherries. Store in an air-tight container for up to 2 weeks.

Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add bananassaute until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove bananas from panset aside. Combine cornstarch with water and add to bananascook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Add brown sugar, raisins, and lemon juicemix well. Pour mixture over bananassprinkle with nuts. Serve immediately or cool.

Peel bananas. Cut in half lengthwise. In a small saucepan, combine orange juice and honey. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Serve with sour cream. Arrange fruit on fruit platter. Pour warm juice over fruit.

Combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Cream butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla until fluffy. Mix together. Roll dough into balls and bake for 8 minutes. Remove from the oven and press a hershey kiss into the center of each cookie.

In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and milk with a hand mixer until combined. Add sugar and pudding mix and mix well. Spoon into pie crust and top with remaining pudding and cool whip. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

In a skillet, heat 1/4 cup oil over medium-high heat. Season the chicken with 1/4 teaspoon of each the cumin and the black pepper. Cook until golden brown on both sides and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Add the remaining 1/4 cup oil to the skillet and heat over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until golden brown and caramelized. Add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and 1/4 teaspoon cumin. Add the orange juice and the lemon juice. Cook until reduced to a glaze. Add the chicken and any drippings from the plate. Cook over medium heat until the sauce is thickened. Stir in the orange zest and capers. Serve over rice.

In a food processor, combine horseradish and soy sauce and whiz to a smooth paste. Add garlic and process until finely minced. Season with salt and pepper. On a plate or in a shallow bowl combine sour cream and mayonnaise. Stir in basil and lemon juice. In a shallow bowl combine horseradish mixture and salmon fillets. Coat fillets on both sides. Grill fillets 5 to 7 minutes per side, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve salmon with sour cream mixture.

In medium skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Drain off all but 1 tablespoon fat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in pepper and cook 1 minute longer. Add cooked rice and heat through. Stir in tomatoes and cook 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon. Serves 4-6.

On a hot griddle or skillet melt butter. Place 1 slice of swiss and 1 slice of american on the skillet. Spread with mustard or mayo and place ham on the sandwich. Cook until cheese is melted and ham is hot. Remove from skillet and place on a plate. Repeat with the remaining slices of american and swiss cheese. Cut the sandwiches with a cookie cutter into shapes such as stars, circles, etc. Use the scraps to make more sandwiches or put in a ziplock bag and put it in the freezer for another day.

In a medium bowl combine the cottage cheese and parsley. Add in the lemon juice and 1 t. Of the Tabasco. Mix in the salt and pepper. Add in the carrots. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. In another medium bowl combine the spinach and cottage cheese mixture. Mix in the remaining 1 t. Of Tabasco. In a small bowl combine the almonds and 1 t. Of the Tabasco. Add the almonds to the salad. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Prepare broccolini according to directions on package. Place broccolini in a large bowl. For dressing combine the olive oil, vinegar, mustard, lemon juice and zest, sugar and salt in a large jar or shaker. Shake well. Pour over the broccolini and toss until well coated. Serve immediately.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add shallot and cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add remaining ingredients and whisk together. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a bowl, cover and refrigerate until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel the skin from the eggplants, cut in half lengthwise. In a small bowl combine the marinara sauce with 1/2 cup water. Spoon the mixture over the top of the eggplants. Sprinkle each half with 1 teaspoon of basil. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown.

Cut the mushrooms into small pieces and saute in the butter until golden brown. Remove from pan and set aside. Add the chopped onion to the mushroom pan with a little more butter if needed and saute until softened. In a separate pan saute the mushroom pieces again with a little more butter and season with the lemon juice and ground black pepper. Mash the boiled and cooled potatoes and mix in the lemon juice and ground black pepper. Add the sauteed mushrooms with the mashed potato and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the mixture into an 8" deep dish pie plate and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until heated through. Cool for a few minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Separate dough into 6 rectangles. Spoon 1/4 cup pasta sauce in the center of each rectangle. Top with 3 meatballs. Roll up. Pinch ends together. Place on greased baking sheet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 10-12 minutes.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Add the bay leaves, cumin seeds, green chilies, cabbage, salt and sugar. Cook uncovered until the cabbage is tender, 10-15 minutes. Sprinkle the dried coconut on top. Serve warm.

Cut meat into bite sized pieces. Add all the remaining ingredients to a bowl. Add meat and toss to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Thread meat onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until meat is cooked through. Serve with pita bread.

In a bowl combine peanut butter, sugar, and brown sugar. Mix well with an electric mixer until creamy. Add the egg and vanilla, beat until smooth. In a seperate bowl, combine the flour and baking soda and stir together. Add this mixture to the peanut butter mixture and mix together with the electric mixer. Add the chocolate chips and mix by hand with a spoon until just combined. Place a little less than a tablespoon of dough in the palm of your hand and roll it into a ball. Place the dough balls on a greased baking sheet about an inch apart and gently press each one down with your fingertip. Bake for approximately 9 minutes or until the bottoms are lightly browned and the dough is set around the edges. Let cool on the pan for a few minutes and then remove to a cooling rack for further cooling.

In a small bowl, combine the chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Rub evenly over both sides of chicken. In a large skillet or saucepan, cook the chicken in the oil over medium heat for 4-5 minutes per side or until no longer pink in center. Remove from pan. Add the remaining ingredients to the pan. Stir. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Serve with chicken.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line an 8x8 inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving overhang on two sides for easy removal. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until creamy (about 2 minutes). Add the vanilla extract and continue to beat for 30 seconds more. Add the eggs one at a time, beating until each is incorporated before adding the next. Sift the flour, baking powder, and sea salt into the bowl and stir until just combined. Add the lemon zest and stir until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Bake for 25 to 28 minutes or until set. Cool completely on the counter top before slicing into 9 pieces and serving with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

Place 1 chicken breast between 2 pieces of plastic wrap and pound to 1/2" thickness. Season with salt and pepper. Combine lime juice, olive and onion. Add 1/2 teaspoon cumin. Add 1 teaspoon parsley. Refridgerate 30 minutes. In a shallow bowl mix 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon parsley and 1/4 teaspoon paprika. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dip each chicken breast into the flour mixture and then into the lime mixture. Place in hot skillet and cook 2 minutes on each side until no longer pink. Wrap in tortillas and serve.

Heat 2 tbsp. of the butter over medium heat in a skillet. Cook peas according to package directions. Draindo not rinse. Pour 1 tbsp. honey over the peastoss to coat well. Place the peas in a serving bowlsprinkle with the remaining honey and the nutsserve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook and drain pepperoni. Remove crust from pie shell. Add the swiss and mozzarella cheeses and the drained pepperoni. Beat eggs with milk. Add oregano and garlic powder. Pour over cheeses and meat. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Let sit for at least 30 minutes before cutting.

Heat oil in skillet. Add onions and garlic. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add jalapeno and cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook and stir 1 minute. Add squash and cook and stir until crisp tender. Add corn and cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with chili powder and salt and pepper. Sprinkle with cheese.
Awesome post. I used to be checking constantly this weblog and I am inspired! Very useful information particularly the remaining phase :) I maintain such info much. I used to be seeking this certain information for a very lengthy time. Thank you and best of luck.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a mixing bowl add flour, salt, baking powder. Cut in butter with a pastry blender. Add egg. Add milk and vanilla. Stir in applesauce. Bake for about 25 minutes. Makes 8 pancakes. Serve warm.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the green beans and saute until crisp tender. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil, the sesame seeds and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Season to taste with the salt and black pepper. Serve at once.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet. Add leeks and stir fry 3-4 minutes until tender but not browned. Add carrots and stir fry 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender. Add orange juice, ketchup, brown sugar, soy sauce, garlic salt and pepper. Stir well. Bring to boil and cook 2 minutes or until carrots are crisp-tender. Stir in peanuts. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in skillet. Brown chops on both sides. Remove from skillet. Saute celery and onion until soft. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and water. Heat to boiling. Stir in egg and pepper. Return pork chops to skillet. Heat through. Place biscuits in skillet around pork chops. Bake in preheated 350 degree F. oven for 20 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.

In a large saute pan over medium-high heat, add olive oil, onion and celery and saute until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add carrots and saute 1 minute. Add pecans and saute 1 minute. Add wild and brown rice and saute 2 minutes to toast the grains. Add mushrooms and saute 1 minute. Add broths and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cover tightly. Simmer for 45 minutes or until rice is tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chopped parsley.

In a bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add the eggs and milk and beat until smooth. The batter will be very thin. Stir in the cinnamon and fruit. Grease a hot griddle with a little oil. Spoon the batter onto the griddle and cook until small bubbles form on top of the pancakes. Turn and cook until golden brown. Serve with real maple syrup.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Place the potatoes and cherry tomatoes in the center of the baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil. Season the potatoes and cherry tomatoes with the oregano, rosemary, salt and pepper. Bake the potato and cherry tomatoes until they are tender when poked with a fork, about 20 minutes. Pat the chicken thighs dry and sprinkle them generously with the salt and pepper. Place the chicken in the center of the baking sheet. Roast until the chicken is cooked through, 35 to 40 minutes. Top each piece of chicken with a piece of lemon. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.

Bring a medium saucepan of water to the boil. Add the quinoa. Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes. Drain. Toss the quinoa with the remaining ingredients. Season with the sumac and pepper. Serve with rocket.
name: tzatziki dipingredients: cucumber, extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, yogurt, garlic clove, dill, of fresh mintpreparation:In a bowl, combine the yogurt, lemon juice and 1/2 cup water. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with the cucumber and chop. Stir in the yogurt mixture. Stir in the mint and serve.
name: chickpea salad with orange and currantsingredients: chickpeas, extra virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic clove, orange zest, orange juice, currants, fresh mint leaves, red bell peppers, flat leaf parsleypreparation:In a bowl combine chickpeas,

In pressure cooker, combine mustard, water, salt, pepper and paprika. Cut the ribs into serving pieces. Add beer. Cut the onion into large chunks. Add the onions. Place the pork ribs into the pressure cooker. Cook at high pressure for 45 minutes. Cut the top of the pressure cooker off. Remove the ribs with a slotted spoon. Serve with more beer.

Heat oil in a skillet. Add onion and garlic. Cook until lightly browned. Add zucchini and pepper and cook until crisp-tender. Stir in tomatoes, salt and pepper. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan. You can add rice to this and make it a casserole. You can also add shrimp and make it a meal.

Heat olive oil in a large frying pan. Add onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and continue sauteing for another 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, and cook for another 5 minutes or until thick. Season with salt and pepper. Break eggs into pan. Cover pan. Cook until egg whites are set and yolks are cooked to desired consistency.

Form a 1/2 inch thick patty out of beef and cook on skillet on medium-high heat for 2 minutes on each side for medium doneness. In a small bowl mix together 1 teaspoon of dried oregano with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Press onto both sides of meat. Top with a slice of feta and a kalamata olive and continue cooking for a few minutes longer until desired doneness is reached. Serve on a pita round with tzatziki on top and sprinkle with more oregano for garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 deg F. In small bowl stir together graham cracker crumbs and 1 tablespoon of the sugar. Press into 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake for 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely. In small saucepan combine the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/2 cup pineapple juice. Bring to boil over medium heat. Add the pineapple and the marshmallows. Stir until marshmallows are melted. Pour over the cracker crust. Chill until set. Before serving spread with Dream Whip. Garnish with pineapple pieces and marshmallows if desired.

Place a pot over medium heat and melt the butter. Add the wine, water, parsley and hot pepper sauce. Add the clams. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedge.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut baked potatoes into 1/2-inch slices. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, add vegetable oil. Add potatoes and onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes. Add bell peppers, seasonings and garlic powder. Continue to stir. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Transfer mixture to a baking dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes.

Place dates in saucepan and cover with 2 cups of hot water. Let soak overnight. Remove dates and pulse in blender until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients and blend until completely smooth and creamy. Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator. Serves 4 as dessert or snack.

In a medium sauce pan over low heat add the milk and the two cans of milk chocolate chips. Stir continuously until smooth. Once smooth add the peanut butter and marshmallow creme. Continue stirring until the mixture is smooth and thick. Remove from heat and pour into a fondue pot or other serving vessel. Serve with a bag of miniature marshmallows and a box of graham crackers. Cut the apples into wedges and dip the apples into the fondue and then roll in the crushed crackers.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin and set aside. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients and mix well. In another large bowl combine the apples, pears, and skim milk. Stir in the egg whites and yogurt and mix well. Stir the fruit mixture into the dry mixture just until moistened. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 18-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes and then remove from the pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy. Stir in oil, mayonnaise, tomatoes, green onion, and stuffing mix. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and the mushrooms. Stir and cook until the mushrooms are tender. Add the eggs. Stir and cook until the eggs are set. Spoon into a greased 8-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Wash the sweet potatoes, and pat dry with a paper towel. Prick the potatoes with a fork, and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until very tender. Cut the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise, and remove the flesh from the peels with a spoon. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the sweet potato flesh, heavy cream, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanillamix well. Cook until the mixture is very thick, stirring constantly. Season with salt to taste. Serve hot.

Cut the peppers in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds and membranes. Place in a small saucepan. Add the onion, garlic, bay leaves and enough water to cover the vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer until the vegetables are tender. Cool slightly. Remove the bay leaves. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the vegetables. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are dry. Stir in the tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer uncovered for 15-20 minutes longer or until the mixture is thick and shiny. Serve hot or at room temperature. Garnish with parsley.

Boil potato and mash. Allow to cool. Cut up and cook eggs. Place yolks in a mixing bowl and add potato and the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Spoon mixture into egg whites. Sprinkle top of each egg with smoked salmon.

First, marinate the chicken for about 1 hour with ginger paste, garlic paste, tomato puree, salt, red chilli powder & black pepper powder. In the meanwhile heat the oil for deep frying the chicken. Dip the chicken pieces into the batter and deep fry till golden brown. Take out the pieces on kitchen paper to remove the excess oil. In a saucepan mix the yogurt with some water and bring to boil. Cook for about 2 minutes till it thickens into a paste. Add the cooked chicken to the paste and cook for 2 more minutes on low flame. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or any indian breads of choice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Mix together egg yolks and orange juice. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Sift together cake crumbs, starch, eggs, zest and lemon juice. Add the egg yolk mixture and stir until thoroughly combined. Fold in egg whites gently. Spread batter evenly into an ungreased 10 x 15-inch baking pan. Sprinkle walnuts evenly over top. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until done. Cool completely. Dust with confectioners' sugar before cutting into squares to serve.

Butter all four sides of the bread. Heat skillet on medium heat, the add the 2 slices of bread butter side down on skillet, add cheddar cheese, then turkey. Top with the other pieces of bread butter side up. Cook for about 3 minutes until toasted well but not burnt, flip and cook the other side for another 3 minutes or so. Cut in half and serve.

Cook rice in 3 cups of water in a saucepan. Add the slivered almonds when rice is done. Remove 1 cup of the cooking liquid and set aside. In a large skillet, saute the mushrooms and onion in 2 tablespoons of the olive oil until softened and lightly browned. Add the tomato, 1/2 cup of water and 2 tablespoons of the reserved cooking liquid and cook until thickened. Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl and toss well. Spread 1/2 cup of the tomato mixture over the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Arrange half of the wild rice mixture over the tomato mixture. Spread 1/2 cup of the tomato mixture over the rice and repeat with the remaining tomato mixture and rice. Top with the cheese and bake for 20 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In a mixing bowl combine quinoa, rice flour, peanut butter, honey, vanilla, and nuts. Beat in margarine. Add the baking soda and salt. Mix well. Drop dough by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten with a fork. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool for 1 minute on cookie sheets, then remove to wire racks.

Shell the shrimp. Set aside. In a 10-inch cast-iron skillet heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add the garlic and saute 30 seconds. Add the shrimp to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 3-4 minutes until the shrimp are pink. Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the cream to the skillet. Stir until the cream is absorbed into the shrimp. Stir in the feta cheese. Spoon onto plates. Serve with the green onion and tomatoes.

Heat oil in heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add onioncook 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in garliccook 1 minute. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 minutes or until water is reduced to 1/2 cup. Add cream. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Serve topped with cilantro.

Mix together the dressing, water and soy sauce in a medium size bowl. Pour over the chicken in a large plastic bag. Toss to coat the chicken well. Pour off the excess dressing that has not been absorbed by the chicken and place the coated chicken on the bottom rack of the grill. Cook for 15 minutes on each side. After the chicken has been cooked, top each piece with two slices of bacon, two slices of tomato and one tablespoon of catalina dressing. Cook until the cheese is melted on top and the bacon is crispy. Serve with rice and green beans.
Place spinach and berries in a large bowl and mix with the dressing. Add the toasted almonds and toss to coat well. Serve over mixed greens and topped with goat cheese bruschetta.

In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, white sugar, graham flour, and baking powder. Mix well, then add melted shortening. Blend well. Beat in sour milk and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet, spacing them well apart. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Cut into 2-inch squares. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

Mix all ingredients together in large bowl. Toss wings in bowl until they are fully coated. Place wings on cookie sheet or large baking dish. Bake for 1 hour. Turn wings half way through cooking process. Cook to desired tenderness. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow baking dish, combine crushed pineapple, brown sugar, lime juice, mustard and soy sauce. Add chicken pieces and turn to coat. Cover and bake for 1 1/2 hours. Uncover and bake for additional 30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onions and garlic and saute for 5 minutes. Add green bell pepper and andouille sausage. Cook and stir for 10 minutes. Add chicken and diced tomatoes. Season with Cajun seasoning and celery salt. Simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Combine the first 6 ingrediants in a small bowl. Combine the last 4 ingrediants in another bowl. In a medium bowl combine the first 6 ingrediants. Place the chicken in the bowl with the marinade. Toss to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 4 hours. Thread the marinated chicken on skewers alternating with the mozzarella. Grill on a preheated grill for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Baste with the reserved marinade during the last 3 minutes of cooking. Serve with the reserved marinade.

Combine first 6 ingredients in a Dutch oven over medium heat and cook for 5 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Add chicken and turn to coat. Cook for 10 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Add cornstarch mixture and gingercook and stir over medium-high heat until thickened and bubbly. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat the oven to 180C/gas 4. Grease two large loaf tins. Beat the eggs with the mashed bananas, brown sugar and buttermilk. Sift together the self-raising flour and plain flour. Add the baking powder, cinnamon and a pinch of sea salt. Stir this into the wet mixture. Stir in the strawberry jam. Spoon the mixture into the loaf tins and place in the oven. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack. Leave to cool completely before slicing and serving.

In a small saucepan, combine the milk, brown sugar and margarine. Bring just to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the oats. Cover and let stand for at least 1 hour. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, toss together the apples and the dried cranberries. Stir in the walnuts. To serve, pour the oat mixture into individual bowls or a large platter. Top with the apple mixture and serve.

Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Add the potatoes, reduce the heat and simmer until tender. Drain well and return to pan. Mash with the remaining ingredients until smooth. Taste and add more seasoning if desired. Serve immediately, garnished with rosemary leaves and roasted garlic cloves.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and stir to make a roux. Add chicken broth and whisk well to blend. Add chicken and green chili and garlic powder and season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium-low heat, covered for 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and liquid has reduced and thickened slightly. Serve warm with a sprinkling of shredded cheese and sour cream.
A couple of years ago I saw my neighbor out back with his shovel digging up his yard, which was covered with several inches of snow at that time of year.
A few years ago when I was living in Chicago, there was a blizzard and we were snowed into our homes for several days.

Mix together the lean ground beef, onion soup mix, egg and cracker crumbs. Shape into meatballs. Brown in a skillet with a little olive oil. Pour off grease. In a small bowl combine jelly, wine and ketchup. Pour over meatballs. Simmer in skillet 10 minutes. Makes 10-12 meatballs.

Heat oven 160c. Grease baking tray. Combine muesli and sultanas in large bowl. Combine remaining ingredients. Bring together dough. Roll tablespoons of dough in hands. Place on tray. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool on trays.

Beat together mayonnaise, horseradish, worcestershire sauce and seasoning salt. Stir in pepper. Place 2 slices of the deli ham in the center of each tortilla. Spread with a thin layer of the mayonnaise mixture. Roll up tightly. Chill 1 hour. Slice in half. Serve with remaining mayonnaise mixture.
Mix together cake mix and heavy cream and place in a greased 9x13 pan. Add the rhubarb and sugar and bake at 350 for 45-60 minutes or until a knife comes out clean and the middle is set.

Combine first four ingredients. Beat in eggs and pudding. Stir in flour and milk chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes. Makes 5 dozen.

I am trying to find the recipe for the very best Chocolate Chip Cookies.
I have been looking for a recipe for some time now. I am looking for a recipe for Chocolate Chip Cookies that I saw on the Food Network.
I am looking for a recipe for a really good Chocolate Chip Cookie.
