I need a recipe for a delicious Chocolate Chip Cookie that I saw on the Food Network.
I need a recipe for a very good Chocolate Chip Cookie.
I need a recipe for the very best Chocolate Chip Cookie ever

Heat olive oil and butter in a soup pot over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add basil and cook until fragrant. Add crushed tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in croutons, cook 5 minutes. Stir in water. Bring to a boil. Add noodles and cook 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Ladle into bowls. Top with cheese and croutons.
How To Cook Pasta - The Easy Way!
Pasta has become a staple in American cuisine. Everyone loves pasta. If you are the cook in your household you know that pasta is easy to make. However there are a few things you should know about pasta if you want to make it the right way.
When you are cooking pasta you should always use a large pot of water. If you want to boil more than one pasta type you should cook them separately. The reason for this is that each type of pasta needs a different amount of time to cook. If you do not have enough room in your pot for all the pastas you

Melt margarine in heavy pan over medium heat. Add sugar and stir. Add milk and stir again. Add peanut butter, vanilla and stir. Add icing sugar and stir. Remove from heat and pour into pan lined with parchment paper. Allow to cool and then cut into squares.

Spray a 10 inch pie plate with cooking spray. Cook asparagus and onions until tender. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl stir together buttermilk baking mix, dried vegetable flakes and pepper. Beat in eggs and milk just until smooth. Add ham and cooked vegetable mixture. Spoon into the pie plate. Bake at 350 for 35-45 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 375. Place chicken and poultry seasoning in a large plastic bag and shake to coat. Remove and place on a rack to drain. In a non-stick skillet, cook chicken for 4-5 minutes per side or until juices run clear. Place 1 slice of cheese and 3 bacon slices on each piece of chicken. Top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake 1-2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Place lettuce, tomato and dill pickle slices between bottom and top of each bun. Place chicken and cheese on top and bottom of bun. Serve.

Halve the squash lengthwise and remove the seeds with a spoon. Put the halves face down on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes or until tender enough to pierce with a fork. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. Once cooled, scoop the flesh out of the skin with a spoon and place it in a blender or food processor. Add the water and the butter. Blend until pureed, then add the maple syrup and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or cold.

Combine the neufchatel and cream cheeses in a food processor or blender. Add the remaining ingredients and process until smooth and well-blended. Serve with crackers or chips and extra salsa if desired.

Bring the water to the boil in the saucepan. Add the bay leaves and lentils. Simmer for 30 minutes or until the lentils are soft. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a frying pan and cook the onions and carrots over a medium heat for 10 minutes. Stir in the button mushrooms and cook for a further 10 minutes. Heat the beef stock cube in 300ml (1/2 pint) water and stir to dissolve. Add to the lentil mixture and continue to simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the potatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Stir in the corned beef and heat through for 2 minutes. Serve with the vegetables.

In a small mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, milk and cherry peppersset aside. In a food processor fitted with steel blade, puree jalapeños with milk until smooth. Combine with cream cheese mixture. Chill thoroughly before serving with tortilla chips. Yields 4 cups.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the oil and onions. Cook and stir until the onions are tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the carrots and apples and cook for about 5 minutes more, or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in the broth and seasonings. Simmer for about 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. In a separate container, whisk together the milk and flour until smooth. Gradually add the milk mixture to the soup mixture and bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 5 minutes or until the soup thickens. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Makes 8 servings.
Recipe for: Vegetable soup with chicken broth.
Recipe for: Carrot and apple soup.

Place the Toffee Bars in a large microwave-safe bowl with the peanut butter and the marshmallows and microwave on high for about a minute or two until the marshmallows are melted and the mixture is thoroughly combined and slightly runny. Add the Rice Krispies and stir until thoroughly combined. With oily hands, shape the mixture into balls about an inch in diameter and place them on a wax paper lined baking sheet. Cool the balls in the refrigerator until set. When the balls are firm enough to handle, melt the chocolate chips and the canola oil together in the top of a double boiler over hot water. Using a fork, dip each ball into the melted chocolate mixture and coat well with the chocolate. Place the balls back on the wax paper and let them cool. Store the balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.

Brown turkey. Add mushrooms and continue to brown. Add water, cover, and cook until tender. Mix 1/2 cup milk with 1 package cavenders greek seasoning. Pour into turkey mixture and stir well. Simmer until heated. Serve over toast.

Halve the radishes lengthwise and place on a plate with the cut sides down. Slice the goat cheese into thin disks and place on the radishes. Sprinkle with coarse salt and serve on a cracker or baguette slice.

Thaw berries according to package directions. Mash berries to a smooth puree in a blender or food processor. In a small bowl combine cornstarch with granulated sugar. Stir in cold water. Add lemon juice. Stir to combine. Add cornstarch mixture to berry puree. Stir until mixture is smooth. Pour mixture into 2 10-ounce custard cups or 1 10-ounce custard cup with 1 4-ounce custard cup. Cover with foil. Place in a 13 x 9 baking dish. Fill dish with hot tap water to reach halfway up sides of cups. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Remove foil. Serve immediately topped with slivered almonds.

Melt margarine in microwave. Cook diced onions until soft. Add half and half and melt. Add seasoning and stir. Stir in cooked and diced ham or cooked and diced bacon. Add shredded cheese. Stir in cooked frozen hash browns. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with cooked and crumbled bacon bits. Serve hot.

Cut the cauliflower into small florets. Rinse well. In a small bowl, combine the onions, cauliflower, pickling salt, sugar, vinegar, mustard and hot pepper. Cover and let stand at room temperature for 2 hours. Rinse well. Pack into sterilised jars. Seal immediately.

Pour 2 cups of milk into a medium bowl. Add the pudding mix. Beat with an electric mixer for 1 minute. Spread evenly into the crust. Beat the cream cheese, sugar substitute and 1 tablespoon of milk with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold in the topping on low speed. Spread over the chocolate mixture. Sprinkle with chocolate, if desired. Cover with dome. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

Slice all bread in half and spread a thin layer of strawberry jelly on each bottom half. Add ham to two pieces of bread, turkey to two others and cheese to two others. Heat a large non stick skillet or grill to medium heat. Butter each side of each piece of bread. Place two sandwiches on skillet and cook for 3 minutes or so or until toasted well but not burnt. Flip and cook other side for another 3 minutes or so. Cut in half and serve.
In a large pot, add all ingredients except for tortilla chips. Cook over medium heat until cheese is completely melted. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cream together first 4 ingredients. Add remaining ingredients and beat with a wooden spoon until smooth. Pour into buttered 8x8x2-inch dish. Refrigerate to set. Cut in squares to serve. Makes about 24 pieces.

In blender container combine the mint jelly and raspberry jam until smooth. Add the vegetable oil, lime juice, garlic, salt, dry mustard, and black pepper. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until serving.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the broth, mustard and lemon juice. Cook until just simmering, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Place in a large mixing bowl. Add the broth mixturestir gently. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Combine the mayonnaise and sour creamstir into the chicken mixture. Stir in the apples, grapes and almonds. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Serve chilled. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. In large bowl combine cake mix, butter, 1/4 cup water and 1/2 cup melted margarine. Beat until smooth. Pour into greased 9-inch square pan. Bake 30 to 35 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack. In small bowl combine frosting mix, 2 tablespoons water and 1/4 teaspoon margarinebeat until smooth. Spread over cooled cake. Cut into 48 squares.

Mix all dry ingredients together with the wet ingredients, except the cheeses. Add the cheeses and mix well. Divide dough into 12 pieces. Roll each piece into 4 inch cylinders. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 400f for about 10 minutes or until crisp. Serve warm or cold with your favorite topping.

Place orange and lime juices in a glass bowl and add the garlic. Peel the skin off the cilantro and add to the juices. Add the fish and sprinkle the fish on both sides with the salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.

Mix together flour, 1/3 cup sugar, 2 teaspoons of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a bowl. Add milk and stir until dry ingredients are moistened. Stir in vanilla and beat until smooth. Drizzle in 2 tablespoons of melted butter and stir until incorporated. Set aside. In a small saucepan, combine remaining 2 tablespoons of butter with 1/2 cup of maple syrup and bring to a boil. Pour into a large bowl and add the dry ingredients. Stir to combine. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Divide dough into 16 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place balls on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium bowl combine all ingredients except raisins and pecans. Spread in an even layer on large baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes until golden brown and slightly crunchy stirring occasionally. Cool completely then stir in raisins and pecans and store in an air tight container. Makes about 10 cups granola

Slice avocados in half around the pit. Remove the pit and scoop the flesh into a large bowl. Squeeze the juice from the lime over the avocados. Add the kosher salt and spices and mash the avocado with a fork. Stir in the rest of the ingredients and serve.

Steam the beans 3-4 minutes or until crisp-tenderdrain and set aside. In a large saute pan over medium heat, saute the garlic in the olive oil 1 minute or until lightly browned. Add the beans along with the wine and lime juicestir to coat. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle the manchego over the top. Cook over low heat until the sauce reduces and coats the vegetables evenly. Garnish with additional manchego if desired.

Cut off excess fat from roast. Sprinkle roast with ranch dressing mix. Brown the roast on all sides in a small amount of olive oil or butter. Place roast into bottom of crock pot. Chop up the portabella mushrooms and sprinkle over the top. In a small bowl combine the rest of the ingredients. Pour over the top. Cook for 6 to 8 hours. Carve the roast into thin slices and serve.

Cook the beans in a pot of water until they are tender. Drain the water. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the cilantro and stir for about 30 seconds. Add the drained beans to the pan and toss to mix. Add the salt and mix well. Sprinkle with the crushed garlic. Mix again. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. To make the sandwich layer the ham, onions and tomatoes onto the bagel halves. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top of the sandwich and drizzle lightly with olive oil. Season with basil and black pepper, to taste. Wrap the sandwich halves together in foil and bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Unwrap the sandwich and serve.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Spray pie pan with nonstick spray. Cook sausage in skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, breaking it up with a spoon and stirring occasionally. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl, beat eggs with milk and biscuit mix until just combined. Stir in sausage, cheese and green chilies until blended. Pour into pie pan and bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with hot salsa.

Bring the water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the tea and mint leaves and reduce the heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture steep for 20 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large pitcher or serving bowl. Add the lemon juice and stir well. Chill thoroughly before serving. Ladle into tall glasses filled with ice and garnish with the mint leaves and lemon slices. Makes about 4 cups.

Heat hazelnut and flaxseed oil over medium heat. Add chopped green beans and cook until tender. Add balsamic vinegar and grainy mustard and continue to cook until balsamic is reduced. Serve hot or warm.

Cut roast into chunks. Place in 3-quart slow cooker. Mix remaining ingredients. Pour over meat. Cover. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove meat from cooker. Shred. Mix with sauce in cooker. Serve with buns.

In small bowl combine cream cheese, horseradish and mustard. Spread onto each tortilla. Arrange spinach in center of each. Top with roast beef. Sprinkle with cheddar. Roll tortillas like jelly rolls. Slice each in half on a diagonal. Serve with additional horseradish and/or mustard if desired.

Measure water into a saucepan. Bring to boil. Add gingerroot and lemongrass. Simmer for 5 minutes. Strain into cup or teapot. Add herbal tea, lemon, and honey to taste. Strain into cup. Garnish with lemon slice. Serves 1.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook the onions in the butter until translucent, about 4 minutes. Stir in the potatoes and squash with the stock. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are tender about 20 minutes. Add the spinach and cook 5 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Pour soup into bowls. Serve with the green onions and vinegar to sprinkle on top if desired.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the water, lemon zest, lemon juice, peppercorns, thyme, bay leaves, and salt. Bring to a boil, lower the heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. Carefully remove the bay leaves before transferring the mixture to a blender or food processor. Add the olives and pulse to a coarse mash. Spoon the mixture into a jar with a tight fitting lid and refrigerate for at least 3 days before serving. Makes approximately 3 cups.

Cook spaghetti according to package. In a large skillet heat oil. Add onion and saute. Add pasta sauce and capers. Cook until heated through. Add olives and tuna. Stir to mix. Season with salt and red pepper flakes. Serve.

Brown the chops on both sides. Add the onion and cook until soft. Remove the onions from the pan and set aside. Add the potatoes to the pan with the chops and cover with the soup and milk. Stir in the onions, cover again, and cook until potatoes are tender. Cut the cheese into small cubes and sprinkle over the casserole. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, mix together the oats, flour, brown sugar, baking powder, butter and lemon zest. In another bowl, mix together the apples, lemon juice and brown sugar. Layer half of the apples in the bottom of the baking dish, then sprinkle on half of the oatmeal mixture. Repeat the layers. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with ice cream or frozen yogurt.

Spread each of the four tortillas with a tablespoon of cream cheese. Top each with a slice of pickle. Divide the remaining cream cheese into equal portions and spread over the pickle slices. Arrange one of the slices of ham on each tortilla overlapping the cream cheese. Top each with a slice of cheese. Roll up the tortilla tightly and place seam side down in a buttered casserole. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Cover and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional five minutes. Serves four to six.

Beat egg whites and salt in bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until foamy. Gradually add sugar, beating constantly on high speed for 6 minutes or until stiff and glossy. Fold in wafer crumbs and nutsstir in chocolate and vanilla. Spread in ungreased shallow dish. Bake in 400f oven for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Refrigerate leftover pie in airtight container for up to 1 week or freeze in airtight container for up to 1 month. To serve, top with frozen non-dairy topping and chocolate shavings.

Beat together all dry ingredients except nutmeg until combined. Add in butter and beat until crumbly. Beat in buttermilk, beaten eggs, mashed banana and vanilla. Fold in nuts if desired. Grease a 10 inch tube pan and fill with batter. Bake at 325 for 1 hour or until done. Cool for 5 minutes in pan then turn out onto wire rack to cool completely.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage and onion until browned. Stir in the salsa and cook for about a minute. Pour into a large casserole dish. Add the cooked white rice and mix well. Combine the light sour cream and egg and pour over the rice mixture. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese and bake for about 20 minutes or until the top is browned and bubbly.

In a medium saucepan combine 1 cup sugar, 2 cups water, 1 cup nutella and 1/4 tsp of salt. Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and cook until a candy thermometer reads 240 degrees F (about 6-10 minutes). Meanwhile beat 1/2 stick of butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Gradually beat in 1 cup of powdered sugar until smooth, then beat in 1/2 cup nutella until smooth. Stir in 1-1/2 tsp of vanilla extract and 1/4 tsp of salt. Remove saucepan from heat, pour the butter mixture into it while stirring constantly. Stir over medium heat until the mixture thickens to the point where it begins to lose its glossy sheen (about 5-10 minutes). Pour into a greased 13x9 inch baking dish or 3-quart glass bowl. Let stand at room temperature until cool enough to handle (about 1 hour). Break up the fudge into small pieces and store in

Spray 8-inch pie pan with cooking spray. Beat together eggs and cheese until blended. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for about 25 minutes or until set. Cut into wedges and serve.

Boil the noodles in salted water until al dente. Scoop out 2 cups of the cooking liquid. Stir the butter and garlic powder together in a medium-sized bowl until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the chicken bouillon powder and oyster sauce and mix well. Remove the cooked noodles from the boiling water and add them to the bowl. Mix well until the noodles are coated in the garlic mixture. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining cooking liquid evenly over the mixture. Place the baking dish in the oven for 20 minutes, or until the top is slightly golden. Sprinkle the cheese evenly on top of the mixture and return the baking dish to the oven for 5 more minutes or until the top is golden. Serve with freshly chopped parsley on top.

Preheat oven to 180C. Cut apples into quarters and remove cores. Place into an ovenproof dish. Mix together the passion fruit pulp and juice. Sprinkle over the apples. Combine the flour and sugar. Use your fingertips to rub in the butter until it resembles breadcrumbs. Spread over the fruit. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice-cream.

Slice the onion into thin slices, then the potatoes into thin slices also. Heat up the pan with the extra virgin olive oil until hot, then add the garlic salt, the onion slices, the potato slices and stir the mixture around the pan until the potatoes are golden brown and the onion is softened. Serve with a side of meat for a delicious meal.

Spray 4 qt. Crock pot with cooking spray. Layer the following in order given in crock pot. Frozen hash brown potatoes, lean ham, onion and green pepper. Sprinkle with grated cheese. In a mixing bowl, beat eggs and skim milk. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour over ham mixture. Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.

Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the cooking oil. Brown the chicken. Drain fat and set aside. In a bowl, mix the egg beaters, skim milk and seasonings. Pour into the skillet. Stir in the green onions and mushrooms. Sprinkle the parsley and cheddar on top. Bake for about 15 minutes in the preheated oven until firm.

To make the sauce: Put the lemon rind and cinnamon in a bowl and add the milk and honey. Beat the eggs with the vegetable oil in a bowl. Dip the bread into the eggs and then into the milk mixture. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the bread on both sides until crisp and golden. Serve the fried bread hot with the lemon sauce. Serve with sour cream and a little clear honey.

In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter, add old bay and minced onion and stir thoroughly. Add the flour and stir continuously. Gradually add the milk and chicken broth and continue to stir. Add the crabmeat and let simmer for about 15 minutes. Do not allow the soup to boil. Serve garnished with a dash of old bay and parsley flakes.

Bring chicken broth to a boil and add couscous and cover and cook for 8 minutes or until tender. Drain and fluff with a fork. In a medium skillet heat the olive oil and saute the onion and garlic until tender. Stir in the soy sauce, ginger and cook for 1 minute. Pour over the couscous and mix well. Add the lemon juice and parsley flakes and toss lightly. Serve hot or cold.

In a large saucepan combine the first 6 ingredients and bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 5 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan and cool. Cut into squares.
Place venison in slow cooker. Combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over meat. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours.

Cut the tuna into small pieces. In a food processor or blender process the tuna with cream cheese until smooth. Add the lemon juice and heavy cream. Season the mixture to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon a small amount of the mixture into the center of each tomato. Top each with a small piece of onion. Serve the appetizers immediately.

Place chips on cookie sheet. Spoon about 1/2 cup of the beans on each chip. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of the cheddar and 1 tablespoon of the sour cream. Top with a jalapeno pepper and a dash of Tabasco sauce. Bake in oven for 10 to 12 minutes until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a small frying pan until hot but not smoking. Add eggs, break the yolk and season with chile flakes and cumin seeds. Fry gently for 5 minutes and then cook until the white is set and the yolk is just firm. Turn the eggs out onto a plate and season with sea salt. Toast the bread lightly, then spread the top half with a little balsamic vinegar and sprinkle with coriander. Place the fried egg on top and serve immediately.

Prepare fruit as directed. Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently until just combined. Divide into four equal portions and shape into rounds. Place one portion of dough in the bottom of a 12 inch skillet. Top with half of the fruit mixture. Repeat layering with remaining dough and fruit. Drizzle with lemon juice. Sprinkle with lemon zest and remaining sugar. Bake at 425 for about 40 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Remove from the oven and serve.
name: banana lemon tea bread
ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, bananas, fresh lemon juice, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, fresh lemon zest
preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Butter a 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan

In a large Dutch oven or saucepan over medium heat, cook the bacon, stirring occasionally, until crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bacon to paper towels to drain. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until it is soft and golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add the potatoes and cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Pour the half-and-half into the pot and bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Add the frozen vegetables, the frozen whole kernel corn and the reserved crispy bacon pieces. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with the black pepper and the salt. Serve hot with a side salad.
Preheat crock pot to high. Place meat in bottom. Add vegetables. Combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over all. Cook on high for 4-5 hours or low for 6-8 hours.

Prepare the pudding according to package directions using the skim milk and adding the lemonade drink. Blend until smooth. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate until set. To serve, put a scoop of the cool whip on each serving just before serving. Top with a sprinkling of the fresh lemon rind.

Add all the ingredients to the breadmaker according to the manufacturer's instructions. Select the basic or basic dough cycle and start the cycle. After 30 minutes, take the dough out of the bread machine and divide it into 2 portions. Shape each portion into a loaf. Place the loaves on a greased baking sheet. Sprinkle each loaf with parmesan cheese. Allow the loaves to rise for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400 f. Bake the loaves for 20 minutes or until they are lightly browned.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the meat and cook until browned. Drain off any fat. Stir in the red bell peppers and cook until tender-crisp. In a small bowl combine the jam, dressing and soy sauce. Stir until smooth. Pour over the meat and bell peppers in the skillet. Stir to combine and heat through. Season with ginger and garlic powder to taste. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, fry the bacon until crisp. Transfer to paper towels to drain. In the same skillet over medium heat, saute the shallots and haricots verts in the bacon drippings until crisp-tender. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the fat. Stir in the vinegar. Season the vinaigrette to taste with the salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl. Add the walnuts and toss to combine. Divide the beans and vinaigrette among four plates. Garnish with the bacon and parsley.

Beat cream cheese and milk in a large bowl with an electric mixer. Add the remaining ingredients. Separate cans of crescent rolls. On a lightly floured surface, lay out one triangle. Spread a thin layer of the filling on the dough and roll up. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling. Place the filled triangles on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 12-15 minutes. Makes 16 servings.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the livers and cook for 2 minutes per side, or until they are browned and cooked through. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato and cook for 1 minute longer. Stir in the green peas and cook for 2 minutes more. Sprinkle with the basil and black pepper. Serve over hot cooked spaghetti.

Heat some olive oil in a skillet. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook until onion is soft. Add the seafood. Cook until seafood is done. Add the tomatoes. Season with oregano, salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over angel hair pasta.
Shake all the ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a muffin tin with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the first 6 ingredients. Press the mixture evenly into the greased muffin cups. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool for about 15 minutes. Add chocolate chips and top each muffin. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Combine first five ingredients in a large bowl. Add the egg and beat until well combined. Pour into the baking dish and sprinkle the top with the almonds. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve hot or cold, with whipped cream or ice cream. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

In a small saucepan, bring whole milk to scalding. Pour in 1/2 cup of the cream and 4 oz white chocolate. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir to melt. Heat on low for 10 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup white sugar. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon of the vanilla. Ladle into mugs and top each with 1/4 cup brandy. Add more brandy if you like it.

Heat the oil in a large pan and saute the apples for a few minutes. Add the pork and brown all over. Add the vinegar and the mustard and pour over the water. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil and simmer for a further 10 minutes. Serve with the apples and the pan juices.

In a large bowl toss potatoes and butternut squash in 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. In a separate bowl toss the peppers and the onions in the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil. Place potatoes and butternut in a single layer in a large rimmed baking sheet and place the pepper and onions in another baking sheet. Sprinkle the potatoes with the salt and pepper. Place the bay leaves and the rosemary on top of the potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes or until tender. Remove the bay leaves and the rosemary and the potatoes and the butternut and the pepper and onions from the baking sheet. Stir together and return to baking sheet. Toss together and bake for another 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Season to taste. Serve warm.

Combine quinoa with water, cover, bring to a boil, reduce heat. Simmer for 15 minutes. Combine all other ingredients except for the yogurt. Cut the cooked quinoa into smaller pieces. Add all the ingredients except for the yogurt. Mix well. Add the yogurt. Serve.

Cook beef in skillet with seasonings. Add water to help cook. Add diced tomatoes. Simmer for 30 minutes. Cook macaroni according to directions. Mix in cheese. Pour over cooked macaroni. Sprinkle with sour cream. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees c. Cream the butter and sugar together in a large bowl then beat in the eggs one at a time. Mix in the mashed bananas and golden syrup then add the dry ingredients in three batches stirring well after each addition. Turn the dough onto a well-floured surface then roll out thinly. Cut into rounds then place on a greased tray. Bake for about 8-10 minutes until golden. Transfer to a wire tray to cool then store in an airtight container.
Banana bread is a type of bread made with ripe bananas that contain large amounts of potassium and vitamin B6. Bananas are known for their high content of antioxidants that are effective at reducing inflammation and the risk of chronic diseases.
Banana bread is a type of bread made from mashed bananas mixed with various other ingredients such as eggs, sugar, butter or margarine, milk or water, flour, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
The bread is usually served warm as a snack or

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons of drippings. Add the potatoes, onion and bell pepper to the skillet and stir fry until potatoes are golden brown and tender. Add the bacon and stir until completely combined and hot. Make six wells in the skillet mixture. Break one egg into each well. Cover and cook on low heat for 8-10 minutes or until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.

Cook the rice as directed. Meanwhile, marinate the chicken in the oil for 1 hour. Grill or bake the chicken. Remove from the marinade and cut into bite sized pieces. Combine the lettuce, rice, chicken and vegetables. Dress with the balsamic vinegar. Season with the freshly ground black pepper.

Heat oil in wok over high heat until hot. Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add meat and stir-fry until brown. Add broccoli and stir-fry until tender. Add sauces and stir-fry until well mixed. Serve immediately.
Hey there! I’m a web developer living in Texas. I am a fan of programming, web development, and coffee. I’m also interested in fitness and video games. You can read my blog with a click on the button above.
© 2019 - The Web Dev Blog

Pierce skin of grapefruit with knife to prevent bursting during broiling. Broil 5 inches from heat for 4 minutes per side (or until fruit is tender). Remove from oven and let stand 2 minutes. Cut open with sharp knife. Combine 1 teaspoon butter, 1 teaspoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Mix well. Spoon mixture into each half of grapefruit. Garnish with cherry.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and saut for a couple of minutes. Add the cream, basil, lemon juice, vinegar and Tabasco sauce and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer. Add the zucchini and tomato halves. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl beat egg and set aside. In another small bowl combine rind, pepper and margarine. In a shallow dish combine flour and parmesan. Dredge each fillet in the flour mixture. Then dip in the egg and then in the orange mixture. In a skillet heat oil and saute the fish for 2 minutes. Turn and saute other side for 1 minute. Place a slice of ham in the center of each fillet. Fold the fish over. Place in a baking dish and cover with foil. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes.

In large saucepan, combine beets with 2 cups cold water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour or until tender. Drain and rinse. In medium mixing bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Whisk well. Add beets and toss well. Serve immediately.

Prepare macaroni & cheese according to package instructions. Brown meat in skillet. Drain meat and add pizza sauce. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Lay out half the pasta in a greased 2 quart casserole dish. Layer with half the meat mixture, sprinkle with half the pepperoni slices and half of the pizza cheese. Repeat layers with remaining pasta, meat mixture, pepperoni slices, and pizza cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serves 6-8.

Heat oven to 500 degrees. In a small bowl combine the buffalo wing sauce with the olive oil. Pat the chicken breasts dry with paper towels and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread half of the buffalo wing sauce mixture over the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan or baking dish. Arrange the chicken breasts in a single layer over the top of the sauce. Spread the remaining buffalo wing sauce mixture evenly over the top of the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese and bake for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with celery and blue cheese dressing. Serve immediately.

In a 2 quart saucepan over medium-low heat, combine broth, beans and artichoke hearts. Cook 5 minutes. Add garbanzo beans, tomatoes and broth. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in garlic and seasonings. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Serve with shaved parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl, beat together milk, cream and sugar until well blended. Stir in dry cake mix until well combined. Stir in vanilla. Cover and freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer s instructions until firm, about 25 to 30 minutes or longer. Remove from machine and fold in sprinkles. Transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze until firm, about 4 hours or overnight. To serve, remove from freezer 15 minutes before scooping to soften slightly.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl combine biscuit mix and eggsbeat with a spoon until dough forms. Add remaining ingredientsmix well. Fill greased muffin cups two thirds full. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream and raspberry sauce if desired.

Bring 4 cups water to boiling in saucepan. Add orzocook 8-10 minutes or until tender but firm to bite. Drain wellstir in 1/4 cup butter, half-and-half, and 1/4 cup of the Parmesan. Set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimpsaute 3-4 minutes or until shrimp are opaque. Stir in garliccook 30 seconds longer. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon Parmesan and the basil. Spoon the shrimp mixture over the orzo mixturetoss to coat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour bundt pan. Mix together cake mix, sour cream and eggs. Mix in poppyseed, then oil and vanilla extract. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 45 minutes to an hour until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes and then invert onto a plate or serving plate. Dust with powdered sugar.

In a bowl combine eggs with milk, margarine and cheese, blend well. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Grease the pan with margarine, then add the egg mixture. Cook until the edges are set and the rest of the mixture is still runny. Sprinkle with chili powder, salt and pepper. Fold in the onions, tomatoes and cilantro. Serve with warm tortillas and salsa.

Cut a thin slice from the bottom of each fennel bulb so it will stand upright. Slice each in half lengthwise and discard the stalk. Cut away the thin outer layer to reveal the white core and cut each half into thin wedges. In a large bowl toss together the fennel wedges and apple. In a small bowl combine the lemon juice, 1 tbsp. sugar, 1 tbsp. olive oil and 1 tbsp. water. Add this to the fennel and apple and toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In another bowl toss together the corn, red onion and 1 tbsp. olive oil. Add this to the fennel and apple and toss to combine. Garnish with the fennel leaves and serve.

Heat the oven to 325 degrees F. Brush the cut sides of the bread with melted butter. Combine the cream cheese and salmon in a small bowl, and spread the mixture onto the toasted side of the bread. Top the spread with a layer of cucumber slices. Arrange the cucumber slices in a decorative pattern. Place the sandwich in the oven for 3 to 5 minutes or until the cucumber slices are warm.
name: eggplant and smoked salmon bruschettaingredients: eggplant, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, lemon zest and juice, rocket leaves, basil, salt and pepper, tomatoes, feta cheese, smoked salmon, toasted ciabatta, extra virgin olive oilpreparation:Slice the eggplant thinly using a mandolin. Place the eggplant slices in a bowl and season lightly with sea salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Toss the eggplant with the lemon zest and juice and olive oil. Place the eggplant slices
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add the noodles and stir for about 2 minutes. Add the sour cream and mix well. Serve hot with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

Heat canola oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add raisins and cook until lightly browned. Add onions and capers and cook until caramelized. Remove from heat. Add hot sauce and dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil and cook the shrimp about 2 minutes per side. Remove from heat and chop. Toast bread slices. Spread raisin mixture on each slice. Top with chopped shrimp and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Makes 12 bruschettas.
Cut french loaf of bread in half lengthwise. Place halves cut side up on baking sheet. Brush halves with melted butter. Sprinkle with garlic and cheese. Bake at 350 for 5-7 minutes.

Heat oil in a skillet. Add onions and saute until golden brown. Add pepper and continue to saute. Add hot dogs. Cook until evenly browned. Add cheese whiz. Turn off heat. Spoon onto bottom half of bun. Add top half of bun and serve.

Boil potatoes until soft. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, melt margarine over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 4 minutes. Remove onion with a slotted spoon. Add the flour to the skillet. Cook for one minute. Gradually add milk while stirring. Cook until thick. Add the potatoes, onion, ham, and cheese. Mix well. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 40 minutes.

Boil pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Rinse in cold water. Combine vegetable oil, vinegar, sugar, mayonnaise, cucumber, red onion, cauliflower, broccoli, black olives, tri-color spiral pasta. Mix well. Refrigerate overnight. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Roll cookie dough out onto a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 9 equal squares. Place 4 squares in a single layer in bottom of prepared pan. Spread lemon curd over squares. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Top with remaining squares, pressing down lightly. In a medium bowl, beat eggs with sugar until foamy. Beat in flour, lemon juice and lemon zest until smooth. Spread over the top of the bars. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow to cool for 2 hours in the pan before cutting into squares to serve.
name: kentucky blueberry coffee cake
ingredients: sugar, butter, egg, milk, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, blueberries, brown sugar, flour
preparation:Cream together sugar, butter and egg. St

Preheat the broiler. Lightly brush the bread with the olive oil and sprinkle with the rosemary. Place the bread on a baking sheet and broil 3 to 4 inches from the heat until the tops are golden brown and crispy. Rub the bell peppers and the tomatoes with the remaining 1 teaspoon of the oil and season with the salt and pepper. Broil the vegetables on the same baking sheet until the bell peppers are lightly charred and the tomatoes are warm, 5 to 10 minutes. Top each slice of the bread with 3 bell pepper slices and 3 cherry tomato halves. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Mix parsley, garlic, shallot, italian seasoning, and rosemary in a large bowl. Combine with chicken breasts and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Heat grill. Brush chicken with some of the marinade, and cook over direct heat 5 minutes on each side or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with more marinade.

Preheat oven to 375f and lightly grease a baking sheet. In a large bowl combine whole wheat and all-purpose flours, sugar, and baking powder and salt and blend well. Stir in shortening, then stir in milk and egg yolks until mixture is smooth. Add enough buttermilk to make a soft dough. Knead dough on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic. Shape dough into a loaf 12 inches long and 4 inches high and place on prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes or until loaf is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on bottom. Remove from pan and place on a wire rack to cool completely. Slice loaf in half horizontally and spread with butter. Stack halves and cut into wedges.

In a large bowl combine 3 cups of the cornmeal with 3 cups of the flour and set aside. In another large bowl whisk together the baking powder and 3 cups of the cornmeal. Make a well in the center of the mixture and add the egg and sour cream. Stir until blended. Add 1 cup of the milk and stir to moisten the mixture. Stir in 1 cup of the flour mixture just until blended. Add the remaining milk and stir until smooth. Stir in the remaining 3 cups of the flour mixture just until blended. Transfer the batter to a large greased 9-inch square baking pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center of the cornbread comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm with honey and/or butter or margarine.

Combine first 8 ingredients in large bowl. Divide into 12 equal portions, about 3 tablespoons each, and shape into balls. Place in ungreased miniature muffin cups, 2/3 full. Combine remaining ingredientsstir well. Spoon evenly over meatballs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until centers are no longer pink and tops are lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes in pan on wire rack before serving.

Line an 8x8 baking dish with aluminium foil, leaving an overhang at two ends for lifting out later. Melt butter in large saucepan over low heat, then stir in chocolate chips until melted. Mix in condensed milk until smooth. Add walnuts and stir until they are well coated in chocolate. Spread mixture into baking dish and refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. Using overhang of foil, lift fudge out of dish by one end and cut into squares. Place on wax paper on a tray. Top each square with a marshmallow. Melt remaining 2 oz. of chocolate in small saucepan over low heat. Drizzle over marshmallows and let set until hard. Serve immediately.

Place chicken in a ziploc bag. Pound to an even thickness. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over the chicken. Marinate for 1 hour. Remove chicken from marinade. Grill over medium-high heat for 8 to 10 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Garnish with parsley. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl, combine the preserve, ginger and lime juicewhisk until smooth. Add the mustard and whisk until blended. Add the lime peel and whisk. Sprinkle the ham steaks with the pepper. Place the ham steaks on the prepared grill. Baste each steak 2 to 3 times and cook until done to your taste (about 5 minutes on each side for medium). Serve immediately with the glaze.

Mix together orange juice, teriyaki sauce, and lime juice and reserve. In a large zip-lock type bag, place the salmon steaks and then pour in marinade. Close bag and marinate for 2 hours. Place salmon steaks on hot, oiled grill and cook for about 4 minutes per side or until done to taste. Serve with slivered green onions.
In a medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, cream, cinnamon and vanillawhisk until smooth and well blended. Refrigerate for up to 2 daysbring to room temperature before serving. Makes about 3/4 cup.

Preheat oven to 425. Cut cream cheese into small cubes. In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese cubes with flour. Add in the baking powder and salt. Mix well. Add the milk and stir until just combined. Drop by spoonfuls onto a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
In a 2 quart saucepan combine 2 cups water with 1/2 cup brown sugar. Add 2 cups apple slices. Simmer for 20 minutes. Cool. Add 1/2 cup vanilla yogurt. Chill.
In a 2 quart saucepan combine 2 cups water with 1/2 cup brown sugar. Add 2 cups apple slices. Simmer for 20 minutes. Cool. Add 1/2 cup vanilla yogurt. Chill.

Wash and pat dry the new potatoes, then rub with oil and sprinkle with a little sea salt. Roast in a hot oven (450F) until they are soft and golden brown all over and can be pierced easily with a skewer. Serve the hot potatoes with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of crumbled blue cheese and a few chives on top.
